sensor.name: Action Statuses
sensor.description: The recorded state of each action a client has taken recently in the form of id:status. Example: 1:Completed

query.script: Reserved

sensor.name: Computer ID
sensor.description: A unique identifier of each computer for internal use. Example: 4202979704

query.script: Reserved

sensor.name: Computer Name
sensor.description: The assigned name of the client machine. Example: workstation-1.company.com

query.script: select CSName from win32_operatingsystem

sensor.name: Download Statuses
sensor.description: The recorded state of each download a client has made recently in the form of hash:completion percentage. Example: 05839407baccdfccfd8e2c1ffc0ff27541cc053d15b52cfd4ed904510e59b428:100

query.script: Reserved

sensor.name: Manual Group Membership
sensor.description: A list of manual group ids for internal use. Example: 72

query.script: Reserved

sensor.name: Tanium Client Version
sensor.description: Version number of the Tanium Client on the client machine. Example: 4.1.314.7020

query.script:
'======================================== ' Tanium Client Version '========================================
Option Explicit
Dim fso, filePath, objFile
Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject")
If GetTaniumDir("") = False Then WScript.Echo "Not installed" WScript.Quit End If
filePath = GetTaniumDir("") & "taniumclient.exe"
If fso.FileExists(filePath) Then Set objFile = fso.GetFile(filePath) WScript.Echo fso.GetFileVersion(objFile) Else WScript.Echo "Not installed" End If
Function GetTaniumDir(strSubDir) 'GetTaniumDir with GeneratePath, works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 End If
If Not strPath = "" Then If strSubDir <> "" Then strSubDir = "\" & strSubDir End If
Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject") If fso.FolderExists(strPath) Then If Not fso.FolderExists(strPath & strSubDir) Then ''Need to loop through strSubDir and create all sub directories GeneratePath strPath & strSubDir, fso End If GetTaniumDir = strPath & strSubDir & "\" Else ' Specified Path doesn't exist on the filesystem WScript.Echo "Error: " & strPath & " does not exist on the filesystem" GetTaniumDir = False End If Else WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot find Tanium Client path in Registry" GetTaniumDir = False End If End Function 'GetTaniumDir
Function GeneratePath(pFolderPath, fso) GeneratePath = False
If Not fso.FolderExists(pFolderPath) Then If GeneratePath(fso.GetParentFolderName(pFolderPath), fso) Then GeneratePath = True Call fso.CreateFolder(pFolderPath) End If Else GeneratePath = True End If End Function 'GeneratePath

sensor.name: Tanium Client Core Health
sensor.description: Determines whether the Tanium Client is able to execute the default content set successfully. Returns any error conditions. Example: Error: Windows Script Host version must be at least 5.6

query.script:
'======================================== ' Tanium Client Core Health '========================================
Option Explicit
On Error Resume Next
' Hold whether to report a final error state Dim bGlobalError : bGlobalError = False
' Global objects the functions may as well use Dim objFSO,objReg
Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject") Set objReg = GetObject("winmgmts:{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\.\root\default:StdRegProv")
' First try the very basic access (FSO and registry access)
If Not TestFSO Then WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot properly access filesystem" WScript.Quit End If
If Not TestRegistry Then WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot properly access registry via WMI" WScript.Quit End If
TestWSHVersionTooLow bGlobalError TestWMI bGlobalError
If bGlobalError Then ' Do not report "Yes" Else WScript.Echo "Healthy" End If
Function TestWMI(ByRef bGlobalError) ' Tests basic WMI Dim locale,objWMIService,colItems,objItem locale = "" On Error Resume Next Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\.\root\cimv2") Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select * from Win32_OperatingSystem",,48)
For Each objItem in colItems locale = objItem.Locale Next On Error Goto 0 If MyIsNumeric(locale) Then ' None Else WScript.Echo "Error: WMI cannot retrieve a basic property" bGlobalError = True End If End Function 'TestWMI
Function TestWSHVersionTooLow(ByRef bGlobalError) ' this function ensures wsh version 5.6 Dim WSHVersion WSHVersion = "" WSHVersion = WScript.Version If Not MyIsNumeric(WSHVersion) Then WScript.Echo "Error: Unknown Windows Script Host version" bGlobalError = True Else WSHVersion = CDbl(WSHVersion) If WSHVersion < 5.6 Then WScript.Echo "Error: Windows Script Host version must be at least 5.6" bGlobalError = True End If End If End Function 'TestWSHVersionTooLow
Function TestRegistry ' this function will return true if a registry access test via WMI succeeds
Const HKLM = &h80000002
Dim aValueNames, aValueTypes On Error Resume Next If objReg.EnumValues(HKLM, "SYSTEM", aValueNames, aValueTypes) = 0 Then TestRegistry = True Else TestRegistry = False End If On Error Goto 0
End Function 'TestRegistry
Function TestFSO ' this function will return true if an FSO call succeeds
Dim strWinDir 'Every machine has a windir On Error Resume Next strWinDir = objFSO.GetSpecialFolder(0)
If Not objFSO.FolderExists(strWinDir) Then TestFSO = False Else TestFSO = True End If On Error Goto 0
End Function 'TestFSO
Function MyIsNumeric(strTemp) Dim i,d If IsNull(strTemp) Then MyIsNumeric = False Exit Function End If If strTemp = "" Then MyIsNumeric = False Exit Function End If
MyIsNumeric = True For i = 1 to Len(strTemp) d = Mid(strTemp, i, 1) If Asc(d) < 48 OR Asc(d) > 57 Then isReallyNumeric = False Exit For End If Next End Function

sensor.name: Online
sensor.description: Returns, in all cases, the word True. This sensor is used in many ways, including to find a common target for machines which may have responded to a question with a 'where' clause - get "online from machines where IP address starts with 192.168.10." will allow you to target the respondents with an action or count responses. Example:True

query.script:
#!/bin/bash
echo "True"

#!/bin/bash
echo "True"

sensor.name: Operating System
sensor.description: Returns the name of the Operating System from all machines. This name may be localized. Example: Windows Server 2008 R2 Enterprise

query.script:
'======================================== ' Operating System '========================================
Set oWsh = WScript.CreateObject("WScript.Shell") Set oWshSysEnv = oWsh.Environment("PROCESS") Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\.\root\CIMV2") Set colItems = GetObject("WinMgmts:root/cimv2").ExecQuery("select Caption from win32_operatingsystem") For Each objItem In colItems strStrip1 = Right(ObjItem.Caption, (Len(objItem.Caption) - Instr(objItem.Caption, " "))) 'strStrip2 = Right(strStrip1, (Len(strStrip1) - Instr(strStrip1, " "))) if Instr(strStrip1,"Server" & Unescape("%AE")) <> 0 THEN strOS = Replace(strStrip1,"Server" & Unescape("%AE"),"Server") Else strOS = strStrip1 End IF wscript.echo Trim(strOS) Next

sensor.name: Tanium Client Logging Level
sensor.description: Logging level setting between 1 and 100 of the Tanium Client on the client machine. Example: 41

query.script:
'======================================== ' Tanium Client Logging Level '========================================
Option Explicit
WScript.Echo GetLogLevel
'----------End Main Line-----------'
Function GetLogLevel() ' This function sets maintenance window values passed to it
Const HKLM = &h80000002
Dim strTaniumRegistryKey, strComputer, intLogLevel Dim objReg, bLogLevelResult
' Set up access to registry via WMI strComputer = "."
Set objReg = _ GetObject("winmgmts:{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\" _ & strComputer & "\root\default:StdRegProv")
strTaniumRegistryKey = GetTaniumRegistryPath()
objReg.GetDWORDValue HKLM, strTaniumRegistryKey, "LogVerbosityLevel", intLogLevel
If Not IsNull(intLogLevel) Then GetLogLevel = intLogLevel Else GetLogLevel = "Not Set" End If
' Cleanup Set objReg = Nothing End Function 'GetLogLevel
Function GetTaniumRegistryPath 'GetTaniumRegistryPath works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath, strFoundTaniumRegistryPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 strFoundTaniumRegistryPath = keyNativePath
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 strFoundTaniumRegistryPath = keyWoWPath End If
If Not strPath = "" Then GetTaniumRegistryPath = strFoundTaniumRegistryPath Else GetTaniumRegistryPath = False WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot locate Tanium Registry Path" End If End Function 'GetTaniumRegistryPath
Function RegKeyExists(objRegistry, sHive, sRegKey) Dim aValueNames, aValueTypes If objRegistry.EnumValues(sHive, sRegKey, aValueNames, aValueTypes) = 0 Then RegKeyExists = True Else RegKeyExists = False End If End Function 'RegKeyExists

sensor.name: Tanium Client Action Folder Sizes
sensor.description: Returns the combined size of all Action_XXXX subdirectories in the Tanium Client\Downloads directory. Example: 351 MB

query.script:
'======================================== ' Tanium Client Action Folder Sizes '========================================
Option Explicit
SetLocale(GetTaniumLocale)
Const HKLM = &H80000002 Dim objRegistry,strTaniumClientKey Dim objFSO,objFolder,strTaniumClientPath,strDownloadsDir Dim lngSize,intCount,folder Dim strSize,strSep
strSep = "|"
Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject")
Set objRegistry=GetObject("winmgmts:\\.\root\default:StdRegProv")
strTaniumClientKey = GetTaniumRegistryPath() If Not strTaniumClientKey = "" Then objRegistry.GetStringValue HKLM,strTaniumClientKey,"Path",strTaniumClientPath End If
If ( IsNull(strTaniumClientPath) Or strTaniumClientPath = "") Or ( Not objFSO.FolderExists(strTaniumClientPath)) Then WScript.Echo "Tanium Client Directory Not Found" Else On Error Resume Next strDownloadsDir = strTaniumClientPath&"\Downloads" lngSize = 0 intCount = 0 If objFso.FolderExists(strDownloadsDir) Then Set objFolder = objFso.GetFolder(strDownloadsDir)
For Each folder In objFolder.SubFolders If Left(folder.Name, 7) = "Action_" Then lngSize = lngSize + GetAccessibleFolderSize(folder.Path) intCount = intCount + 1 End If Next On Error Goto 0 If intCount > 0 Then WScript.Echo GetPrettyFileSize(CStr(lngSize)) Else WScript.Echo "No Action Folders Found in Downloads dir" End If
Else WScript.Echo "Tanium Client Downloads Directory Not Found" End If
End If
' --- end main --- '
Function RegKeyExists(objRegistry, sHive, sRegKey) Dim aValueNames, aValueTypes If objRegistry.EnumValues(sHive, sRegKey, aValueNames, aValueTypes) = 0 Then RegKeyExists = True Else RegKeyExists = False End If End Function
Function GetTaniumRegistryPath 'GetTaniumRegistryPath works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath, strFoundTaniumRegistryPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 strFoundTaniumRegistryPath = keyNativePath
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 strFoundTaniumRegistryPath = keyWoWPath End If
If Not strPath = "" Then GetTaniumRegistryPath = strFoundTaniumRegistryPath Else GetTaniumRegistryPath = False WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot locate Tanium Registry Path" End If End Function 'GetTaniumRegistryPath
Function GetPrettyFileSize(strSize) Dim dblSize dblSize = CDbl(strSize)
If dblSize > 1024*1024*1024 Then ''Should be GB strSize = CStr(Round(dblSize / 1024 / 1024 / 1024, 1)) & " GB" ElseIf dblsize > 1024*1024 Then ''Should be MB strSize = CStr(Round(dblSize / 1024 / 1024, 1)) & " MB" ElseIf dblSize > 1024 Then ''Should be kB strSize = CStr(Round(dblSize / 1024)) & " KB" Else strSize = CStr(dblSize) & " B" End If GetPrettyFileSize = strSize End Function 'GetPrettyFileSize
Function GetAccessibleFolderSize(strFolderPath) ' Gets the folder sizes that it is able to ' and skips those it has no rights to see On Error Resume Next ' Permissions Errors potentially
Dim objFSO Dim objFolder,objSubfolder,intSize,bHasSubfolders Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject")
bHasSubfolders = False
Set objFolder = objFSO.GetFolder(strFolderPath) Err.Clear intSize = objFolder.Size If Err.Number <> 0 Then For Each objSubfolder in objFolder.SubFolders intSize = intSize + GetAccessibleFolderSize(objSubfolder.Path) bHasSubfolders = True Next
If Not bHasSubfolders Then intSize = objFolder.Size End If End If
GetAccessibleFolderSize = intSize
On Error Goto 0
End Function 'GetAccessibleFolderSize
Function GetTaniumLocale '' This function will retrieve the locale value ' previously set which governs Tanium content that ' is locale sensitive.
Dim objWshShell Dim intLocaleID
Set objWshShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell") On Error Resume Next intLocaleID = objWshShell.RegRead("HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client\LocaleID") If Err.Number <> 0 Then intLocaleID = objWshShell.RegRead("HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client\LocaleID") End If On Error Goto 0 If intLocaleID = "" Then GetTaniumLocale = 1033 ' default to us/English Else GetTaniumLocale = intLocaleID End If
' Cleanup Set objWshShell = Nothing
End Function 'GetTaniumLocale

sensor.name: Managed Applications Status
sensor.description: Provides an indication of whether the Managed Applications definitions file is up to date or out of date. Example: Up to Date

query.script:
'======================================== ' Managed Applications Status '========================================
Option Explicit Dim hoursThreshold hoursThreshold = 23
' This sensor uses date math which is locale specific SetLocale(GetTaniumLocale) 'us/english by default
Const HKLM = &H80000002 Dim strSep strSep = "|" Dim objFso, strXml, objFile Const ForReading = 1 Set objFso = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject")
Dim strMAPath strMAPath = GetTaniumDir("Tools\Managed Applications")
Dim strDatPath, strScanPath, strCurrentDir, oShell
strDatPath = strMAPath & "tanium.dat" strScanPath = strMAPath & "run-managed-applications-scan.vbs"
Dim isDebug isDebug = False If isDebug Then Set oShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell") strCurrentDir = objFso.GetParentFolderName(Wscript.ScriptFullName) strDatPath = strCurrentDir & "\tanium.dat" WScript.Echo strDatPath End If
'Check if the scanner vbs exists If Not objFso.FileExists(strScanPath) Then WScript.Echo "Cannot find scanner" WScript.Quit End If
'Check if the DAT file exists If Not objFso.FileExists(strDatPath) Then WScript.Echo "Cannot find DAT file" WScript.Quit End If
Dim strAge strAge = GetHoursOld(strDatPath) 'WScript.Echo "Age in hours: " & strAge If strAge > hoursThreshold Then WScript.Echo "Out of Date" Else WScript.Echo "Up to Date" End If WScript.Quit
Function GetHoursOld(strDatPath) Dim objDatFile Set objDatFile = objFso.GetFile(strDatPath) GetHoursOld = DateDiff("h", objDatFile.DateLastModified, Now()) End Function
Function RegKey32Exists(objRegistry, sHive, sRegKey) Dim aValueNames, aValueTypes If objRegistry.EnumValues(sHive, sRegKey, aValueNames, aValueTypes) = 0 Then RegKeyExists = True Else RegKeyExists = False End If End Function
Function GetTaniumDir(strSubDir) 'GetTaniumDir with GeneratePath, works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 End If
If Not strPath = "" Then If strSubDir <> "" Then strSubDir = "\" & strSubDir End If
Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject") If fso.FolderExists(strPath) Then If Not fso.FolderExists(strPath & strSubDir) Then ''Need to loop through strSubDir and create all sub directories GeneratePath strPath & strSubDir, fso End If GetTaniumDir = strPath & strSubDir & "\" Else ' Specified Path doesn't exist on the filesystem WScript.Echo "Error: " & strPath & " does not exist on the filesystem" GetTaniumDir = False End If Else WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot find Tanium Client path in Registry" GetTaniumDir = False End If End Function 'GetTaniumDir
Function GeneratePath(pFolderPath, fso) GeneratePath = False
If Not fso.FolderExists(pFolderPath) Then If GeneratePath(fso.GetParentFolderName(pFolderPath), fso) Then GeneratePath = True Call fso.CreateFolder(pFolderPath) End If Else GeneratePath = True End If End Function 'GeneratePath
Function GetTaniumLocale '' This function will retrieve the locale value ' previously set which governs Tanium content that ' is locale sensitive.
Dim objWshShell Dim intLocaleID
Set objWshShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell") On Error Resume Next intLocaleID = objWshShell.RegRead("HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client\LocaleID") If Err.Number <> 0 Then intLocaleID = objWshShell.RegRead("HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client\LocaleID") End If On Error Goto 0 If intLocaleID = "" Then GetTaniumLocale = 1033 ' default to us/English Else GetTaniumLocale = intLocaleID End If
' Cleanup Set objWshShell = Nothing
End Function 'GetTaniumLocale

sensor.name: Patch Tools Errors
sensor.description: A sensor to return error conditions that would prevent the timely scan and delivery of patches. Example: "Error: WUA Version is less than supported version 6.1.0022.4"

query.script:
'======================================== ' Patch Tools Errors '========================================
' this sensor will return error conditions ' that would prevent the timely scan and delivery of patches
Option Explicit
On Error Resume Next SetLocale(1033) ' this sensor uses date math, setting to us/english
' Hold whether to report a final error state Dim bGlobalError : bGlobalError = False
' Global objects the functions may as well use Dim objFSO,objReg
Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject") Set objReg = GetObject("winmgmts:{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\.\root\default:StdRegProv")
' First try the very basic access (FSO and registry access)
If Not TestFSO Then WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot properly access filesystem" WScript.Quit End If
If Not TestRegistry Then WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot properly access registry" WScript.Quit End If
' Pass the global error flag down each of the functions ' which will flip it and report their own errors
' do not use parentheses or will not pass ByRef. ' could use parentheses and use the Call keyword, however
PatchCabOutOfDateOrNotFound bGlobalError PatchResultsErrors bGlobalError PatchResultsOutOfDate bGlobalError WUAVersionTooLow bGlobalError WSHVersionTooLow bGlobalError
If bGlobalError Then ' Do not report "Yes" Else WScript.Echo "Healthy" End If
' --- Health Check Functions --- '
Function WUAVersionTooLow(ByRef bHasError) Dim strOutput, strSysDir, strWuaDll, i Dim strNeededVersion, arrNeededVersion Dim strVersion, arrVersion, intVersionPiece, bOldVersion
'adjust as required version changes strNeededVersion = "6.1.0022.4" arrNeededVersion = Split(strNeededVersion,".")
strSysDir = GetSystemDir strWuaDll = strSysDir & "\wuaueng.dll" If objFSO.FileExists(strWuaDll) Then strVersion = objFSO.GetFileVersion(strWuaDll) If strVersion <> strNeededVersion Then arrVersion = Split(strVersion, ".") ' We assume there will be 4 fields, if not throw error If UBound(arrVersion) <> 3 Then bHasError = True strOutput = "Error: Cannot determine Windows Update Agent version, does not look like X.X.X.X" Else bOldVersion = False 'assume version is good ' loop through each part ' if any individual part is less than its corresponding required part For i = 0 To UBound(arrVersion) If CInt(arrVersion(i)) < CInt(arrNeededVersion(i)) Then bOldVersion = True Exit For ' No further checking necessary, it's out of date End If Next If bOldVersion Then strOutput = "Error: WUA Version is less than supported version " & strNeededVersion bHasError = True End If End If Else ' versions are the same End If Else strOutput = "Error: WUA DLL ("&strWuaDll&") not found" bHasError = True End If
WScript.Echo strOutput
End Function 'WUAVersionTooLow
Function WSHVersionTooLow(ByRef bGlobalError) ' this function ensures wsh version 5.6 Dim WSHVersion WSHVersion = "" WSHVersion = WScript.Version If Not MyIsNumeric(WSHVersion) Then WScript.Echo "Error: Unknown Windows Script Host version" bGlobalError = True Else WSHVersion = CDbl(WSHVersion) If WSHVersion < 5.6 Then WScript.Echo "Error: Windows Script Host version must be at least 5.6" bGlobalError = True End If End If End Function 'WSHVersionTooLow
Function MyIsNumeric(strTemp) Dim i,d If IsNull(strTemp) Then MyIsNumeric = False Exit Function End If If strTemp = "" Then MyIsNumeric = False Exit Function End If
MyIsNumeric = True For i = 1 to Len(strTemp) d = Mid(strTemp, i, 1) If Asc(d) < 48 OR Asc(d) > 57 Then isReallyNumeric = False Exit For End If Next End Function
Function PatchCabOutOfDateOrNotFound(ByRef bHasError) ' This function will return an error message if the patch cab is ' out of date Dim objCabFile Dim ageThreshold,strToolsDir,strPatchCabPath Dim words,minutesOld
ageThreshold = 60*48 '2 days in minutes
strToolsDir = GetTaniumDir("Tools") strPatchCabPath = strToolsDir & "\wsusscn2.cab"
If objFSO.FileExists(strPatchCabPath) Then Set objCabFile = objFSO.GetFile(strPatchCabPath) words = Split(objCabFile.DateLastModified, " ")
minutesOld = GetMinutesOld(objCabFile.DateLastModified) if cint(minutesOld) >= ageThreshold Then Wscript.echo "Error: Patch definition Cab file hasn't been modified in over 2 days" bHasError = True End If Else Wscript.echo "Error: Patch Cab not found" bHasError = True End If
'Cleanup Set objCabFile = Nothing
End Function 'PatchCabOutOfDateOrNotFound
Function PatchResultsErrors(ByRef bHasError)
Dim fn, objReadFile, contents, path, strSep strSep = "|"
' results should look like: 'title|severity|bulletins|creation date|urls|filenames|etc ..
' first check path = GetTaniumDir("Tools\Scans")
fn = path & "\patchresultsreadable.txt"
If objFSO.FileExists(fn) Then ' If file exists but there's an issue opening it On Error Resume Next Set objReadFile = objFSO.OpenTextFile(fn, 1, False) If Err.Number <> 0 Then WScript.Echo "Error: Patch results file exists but cannot open" bHasError = True Exit Function End If
On Error Goto 0 ' Check on all patch results lines ' If we locate any that do not have the separator value in them, throw an ' invalid line entry and exit the function Dim strLine, words Do While Not objReadFile.AtEndOfStream strLine = objReadFile.ReadLine
'CHECK FOR MULTI-URL PATCHES If Not InStr(strLine,strSep) > 0 Then ' must be an invalid line WScript.Echo "Error: Invalid patch results line says - " & strLine bHasError = True End If Loop
objReadFile.close Else Wscript.echo "Error: Patch results output not found" bHasError = True End If End Function 'PatchResultsErrors
Function PatchResultsOutOfDate(ByRef bHasError) Dim objFile Dim strScansDir, strResultsPath, daysOld, words
' This sensor uses date math which is locale specific SetLocale(1033) 'us/english
strScansDir = GetTaniumDir("Tools\Scans") strResultsPath = strScansDir & "\patchresultsreadable.txt"
If objFso.FileExists(strResultsPath) Then Set objFile = objFso.GetFile(strResultsPath) words = Split(objFile.DateLastModified, " ")
daysOld = GetDaysOld(words(0)) if cint(daysOld) >= 4 Then Wscript.echo "Error: Microsoft patches not scanned in at least 4 days" bHasError = True End If
Else ' Results not found, but would be checked with other function End If
'Cleanup Set objFile = Nothing
End Function 'PatchResultsOutOfDate
' ---- Support Functions ---- ' Function GetTaniumDir(strSubDir) 'GetTaniumDir with GeneratePath, works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 End If
If Not strPath = "" Then If strSubDir <> "" Then strSubDir = "\" & strSubDir End If
Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject") If fso.FolderExists(strPath) Then If Not fso.FolderExists(strPath & strSubDir) Then ''Need to loop through strSubDir and create all sub directories GeneratePath strPath & strSubDir, fso End If GetTaniumDir = strPath & strSubDir & "\" Else ' Specified Path doesn't exist on the filesystem WScript.Echo "Error: " & strPath & " does not exist on the filesystem" GetTaniumDir = False End If Else WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot find Tanium Client path in Registry" GetTaniumDir = False End If End Function 'GetTaniumDir
Function GeneratePath(pFolderPath, fso) GeneratePath = False
If Not fso.FolderExists(pFolderPath) Then If GeneratePath(fso.GetParentFolderName(pFolderPath), fso) Then GeneratePath = True Call fso.CreateFolder(pFolderPath) End If Else GeneratePath = True End If End Function 'GeneratePath
Function GetMinutesOld(strDate) 'date format is MM/DD/YYYY SetLocale(1033) Dim patternDate, today patternDate = CDate( strDate ) today = CDate( now ) GetMinutesOld = DateDiff("n", patternDate, today) End Function 'GetMinutesOld
Function GetDaysOld(strDate) 'date format is MM/DD/YYYY SetLocale(1033) Dim patternDate, today patternDate = CDate( strDate ) today = CDate( now ) GetDaysOld = DateDiff("d", patternDate, today) End Function 'GetDaysOld
Function GetSystemDir Dim strWinDir,strSysDir
'Check for 64-bit sysnative directory to avoid win redirect strWinDir = objFSO.GetSpecialFolder(0) strSysDir = strWinDir & "\sysnative"
If Not objFSO.FolderExists(strSysDir) Then strSysDir = objFSO.GetSpecialFolder(1) End If GetSystemDir = strSysDir End Function ' GetSystemDir
Function TestRegistry ' this function will return true if a registry access test via WMI succeeds
Const HKLM = &h80000002
Dim aValueNames, aValueTypes On Error Resume Next If objReg.EnumValues(HKLM, "SYSTEM", aValueNames, aValueTypes) = 0 Then TestRegistry = True Else TestRegistry = False End If On Error Goto 0
End Function 'TestRegistry
Function TestFSO ' this function will return true if an FSO call succeeds
Dim strWinDir 'Every machine has a windir On Error Resume Next strWinDir = objFSO.GetSpecialFolder(0)
If Not objFSO.FolderExists(strWinDir) Then TestFSO = False Else TestFSO = True End If On Error Goto 0
End Function 'TestFSO

sensor.name: Action Lock Status
sensor.description: Returns whether the client is in a 'locked' state. Use the package "Tanium Client Action Unlock" to unlock the Client and allow actions. Example: Action Lock On

query.script:
'======================================== ' Action Lock Status '========================================
Option Explicit
If ActionLockOn Then WScript.Echo "Action Lock On" Else WScript.Echo "Action Lock Off" End If
Function ActionLockOn ' returns true or false Dim objShell,strRegistryPath,intLockStatus
strRegistryPath = GetTaniumRegistryPath
Set objShell = WScript.CreateObject("WScript.Shell") On Error Resume Next intLockStatus = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&strRegistryPath&"\ActionLockFlag")
If Err.Number <> 0 Then intLockStatus = 0 End If On Error Goto 0
If intLockStatus = 1 Then ActionLockOn = True Else ActionLockOn = False End If
End Function 'ActionLockOn
Function GetTaniumRegistryPath 'GetTaniumRegistryPath works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath, strFoundTaniumRegistryPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 strFoundTaniumRegistryPath = keyNativePath
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 strFoundTaniumRegistryPath = keyWoWPath End If
If Not strPath = "" Then GetTaniumRegistryPath = strFoundTaniumRegistryPath Else GetTaniumRegistryPath = False WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot locate Tanium Registry Path" End If End Function 'GetTaniumRegistryPath

sensor.name: Tanium PowerShell Execution Policy
sensor.description: Retrieves the PowerShell Execution Policy as the Tanium Client sees it

query.script:
'======================================== ' Tanium PowerShell Execution Policy '========================================
' this sensor will retrieve the PowerShell Execution Policy ' of the 32-bit environment
Option Explicit
Dim objShell : Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell") Dim objShellExec Dim objFSO : Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject")
Dim strPSPath,strLine strPSPath = objFSO.GetSpecialFolder(1)&"\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" If objFSO.FileExists(strPSPath) Then Set objShellExec = objShell.Exec(Chr(34)&strPSPath&Chr(34)&" -Command Get-ExecutionPolicy;Exit") Do Until objShellExec.StdOut.AtEndOfStream strLine = objShellExec.StdOut.ReadLine If Not strLine = "" Then WScript.Echo strLine Exit Do End If Loop Else WScript.Echo "Cannot locate PowerShell executable" End If

sensor.name: Tanium Server Version
sensor.description: Version number of Tanium Server installed. Example: 6.2.314.3218

query.script:
'======================================== ' Tanium Server Version '========================================
Option Explicit
Dim fso, filePath, objFile
Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject")
If GetTaniumDir("") = False Then WScript.Echo "Not installed" WScript.Quit End If
filePath = GetTaniumDir("") & "TaniumReceiver.exe"
If fso.FileExists(filePath) Then Set objFile = fso.GetFile(filePath) WScript.Echo fso.GetFileVersion(objFile) Else WScript.Echo "Not installed" End If
Function GetTaniumDir(strSubDir) 'GetTaniumDir with GeneratePath, works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Server" keyWoWPath = "HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Server"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 End If
If Not strPath = "" Then If strSubDir <> "" Then strSubDir = "\" & strSubDir End If
Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject") If fso.FolderExists(strPath) Then If Not fso.FolderExists(strPath & strSubDir) Then ''Need to loop through strSubDir and create all sub directories GeneratePath strPath & strSubDir, fso End If GetTaniumDir = strPath & strSubDir & "\" Else ' Specified Path doesn't exist on the filesystem WScript.Echo "Error: " & strPath & " does not exist on the filesystem" GetTaniumDir = False End If Else GetTaniumDir = False End If End Function 'GetTaniumDir
Function GeneratePath(pFolderPath, fso) GeneratePath = False
If Not fso.FolderExists(pFolderPath) Then If GeneratePath(fso.GetParentFolderName(pFolderPath), fso) Then GeneratePath = True Call fso.CreateFolder(pFolderPath) End If Else GeneratePath = True End If End Function 'GeneratePath

sensor.name: Tanium Zone Server Version
sensor.description: Version number of Tanium Zone Server installed. Example: 6.2.314.3218

query.script:
'======================================== ' Tanium Zone Server Version '========================================
Option Explicit
Const HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE = &H80000002
Const keyNativePath = "Software\Tanium\Tanium ZoneServer" Const keyWoWPath = "Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium ZoneServer"
Dim fso, dirPath, filePath, objFile, objReg
' Zone Server has to be treated differently than client and server ' The latest Zone Server will write the Set objReg = Getx64RegistryProvider()
Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject")
Set objReg = Getx64RegistryProvider()
dirPath = Null
If RegKeyExists(objReg, HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE, keyNativePath) Then objReg.GetStringValue HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE, keyNativePath, "Path", dirPath End If
If IsNull(dirPath) Then If RegKeyExists(objReg, HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE, keyWowPath) Then objReg.GetStringValue HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE, keyWowPath, "Path", dirPath End If End If
filePath = dirPath & "\TaniumZoneServer.exe"
If fso.FileExists(filePath) Then Set objFile = fso.GetFile(filePath) WScript.Echo fso.GetFileVersion(objFile) Else WScript.Echo "Not installed" End If
Function RegKeyExists(objRegistry, sHive, sRegKey) Dim aValueNames, aValueTypes If objRegistry.EnumValues(sHive, sRegKey, aValueNames, aValueTypes) = 0 Then RegKeyExists = True Else RegKeyExists = False End If End Function
Function Getx64RegistryProvider ' Returns the best available registry provider: 32 bit on 32 bit systems, 64 bit on 64 bit systems Dim objWMIService, colItems, objItem, iArchType, objCtx, objLocator, objServices, objRegProv Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\.\root\CIMV2") Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select SystemType from Win32_ComputerSystem") For Each objItem In colItems If InStr(LCase(objItem.SystemType), "x64") > 0 Then iArchType = 64 Else iArchType = 32 End If Next
Set objCtx = CreateObject("WbemScripting.SWbemNamedValueSet") objCtx.Add "__ProviderArchitecture", iArchType Set objLocator = CreateObject("Wbemscripting.SWbemLocator") Set objServices = objLocator.ConnectServer("","root\default","","",,,,objCtx) Set objRegProv = objServices.Get("StdRegProv")
Set Getx64RegistryProvider = objRegProv End Function ' Getx64RegistryProvider

sensor.name: Tanium Client Explicit Setting
sensor.parameter_definition: {"parameters":[{"restrict":null,"validationExpressions":[{"helpString":"Value can not be blank","flags":"","expression":"^\\S","parameterType":"com.tanium.models::ValidationExpression","model":"com.tanium.models::ValidationExpression"}],"helpString":"The Client Setting Name must be typed exactly as it appears in the client registry, including necessary underscores. NOTE: most settings have no spaces (Example: LogVerbosityLevel)","promptText":"Enter the Client Setting Name","defaultValue":"","value":"","label":"Client Setting Name","maxChars":64,"key":"setting","parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::TextInputParameter","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::TextInputParameter"}],"parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray"}
sensor.description: Returns the value of a supplied Tanium Client Setting fom the Tanium Clients registry key. Supply only the client setting name, for instance: ServerName and the output will appear as follows: Example: berkeley.tanium.com

query.script:
'======================================== ' Registry Value Data '========================================
'Columns: ' User | Data | Type | Architecture | KeyPath | Value
' Value is a hidden column for later use in sensor-fed actions (modify, delete)
strKey = "HKLM\"&GetTaniumRegistryPath() strValue = unescape("||setting||")
'strKey = "HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" 'strValue = "Version"
'strKey = "HKEY_USERS\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Internet Settings" 'strValue = "Emailname" strSep = "~~"
'Constants for value types Const REG_SZ = 1 Const REG_EXPAND_SZ = 2 Const REG_BINARY = 3 Const REG_DWORD = 4 Const REG_MULTI_SZ = 7 Const REG_QWORD = 11
'Split up strKey into the hive constant and the registry key words = Split(strKey, "\") strHive = words(0) constHive = GetHiveConst(strHive)
strKey = Right(strKey, Len(strKey) - Len(strHive) -1)
'Global for Username Dim strUserName strUserName = "N/A" ' default value, overridden if HKEY_USERS hive
'Set up registry objects for 32-bit, then check value 'Need to check all values of key in order to get type Set objCtx = GetObjCtx(32) Set objReg = GetObjReg(objCtx)
If strHive = "HKEY_USERS" Then ' go through each User's hive For Each strUserKey In GetSubKeys(objReg, objCtx, constHive, "") If Not InStr(strUserKey,"_Classes") > 0 Then ' ignore _Classes entries strUserName = GetUserForSIDLocal(objReg,strUserKey) If strUserName = False Then strUserName = strUserKey strFullUserKey = strUserKey&"\"&strKey hasValues32 = CheckValues(objReg, objCTX, constHive, strFullUserKey, strValue, 32) If hasValues32 Then hasAnyResult = True End If Next Else ' was another hive hasValues32 = CheckValues(objReg, objCtx, constHive, strKey, strValue, 32) If hasValues32 Then hasAnyResult = True End If
If Is64 Then Set objCtx = GetObjCtx(64) Set objReg = GetObjReg(objCtx) If strHive = "HKEY_USERS" Then ' go through each User's hive in 64-bit context For Each strUserKey In GetSubKeys(objReg, objCtx, constHive, "") If Not InStr(strUserKey,"_Classes") > 0 Then ' ignore _Classes entries strUserName = GetUserForSIDLocal(objReg,strUserKey) If strUserName = False Then strUserName = strUserKey strFullUserKey = strUserKey&"\"&strKey hasValues64 = CheckValues(objReg, objCTX, constHive, strFullUserKey, strValue, 64) If hasValues64 Then hasAnyResult = True End If Next Else ' was another hive hasValues64 = CheckValues(objReg, objCtx, constHive, strKey, strValue, 64) If hasValues64 Then hasAnyResult = True End If End If
If Not (hasAnyResult) Then WScript.Echo "Key/Value not found" End If
Function GetTaniumRegistryPath 'GetTaniumRegistryPath works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath, strFoundTaniumRegistryPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 strFoundTaniumRegistryPath = keyNativePath
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 strFoundTaniumRegistryPath = keyWoWPath End If
If Not strPath = "" Then GetTaniumRegistryPath = strFoundTaniumRegistryPath Else GetTaniumRegistryPath = False WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot locate Tanium Registry Path" End If End Function 'GetTaniumRegistryPath
Function RegKeyExists(objRegistry, sHive, sRegKey) Dim aValueNames, aValueTypes If objRegistry.EnumValues(sHive, sRegKey, aValueNames, aValueTypes) = 0 Then RegKeyExists = True Else RegKeyExists = False End If End Function 'RegKeyExists
'Goes through all values in a key, returns True if strValue is found Function CheckValues(objReg, objCtx, constHive, strKey, strValue, intBit)
Dim Inparams, Outparams Set Inparams = objReg.Methods_("EnumValues").Inparameters Inparams.Hdefkey = constHive Inparams.sSubkeyname = strKey Set Outparams = objReg.ExecMethod_("EnumValues", Inparams,,objCtx)
arrNames = Outparams.sNames arrTypes = Outparams.Types
If Not IsNull(arrNames) Then For i = LBound(arrNames) To UBound(arrNames) strValueName = arrNames(i)
'if strValue is found, echo If LCase(strValueName) = LCase(strValue) Then EchoValue objReg, objCtx, constHive, strKey, strValue, arrTypes(i), intBit CheckValues = True Exit Function End If Next End If CheckValues = False End Function
Function GetDisplayString(strKey, strType, strValue, intBit) If intBit = 64 Then strArch = "64-bit" Else strArch = "32-bit" End If
GetDisplayString = strValue End Function
Function EchoValue(objReg, objCtx, constHive, strKey, strValue, constType, intBit) ' Note the key that was being searched, will be a hidden column strOutputKey = strHive&"\"&strKey
Dim objInParams, objOutParams Select Case constType Case REG_SZ Set objInParams = objReg.Methods_("GetStringValue").InParameters objInParams.hDefKey = constHive objInParams.sSubKeyName = strKey objInParams.sValueName = strValue Set objOutParams = objReg.ExecMethod_("GetStringValue", objInParams, , objCtx)
WScript.Echo GetDisplayString(strKey, "REG_SZ", objOutParams.sValue, intBit) Case REG_EXPAND_SZ Set objInParams = objReg.Methods_("GetExpandedStringValue").InParameters objInParams.hDefKey = constHive objInParams.sSubKeyName = strKey objInParams.sValueName = strValue Set objOutParams = objReg.ExecMethod_("GetExpandedStringValue", objInParams, , objCtx)
WScript.Echo GetDisplayString(strKey, "REG_EXPAND_SZ", objOutParams.sValue, intBit) Case REG_BINARY Set objInParams = objReg.Methods_("GetBinaryValue").InParameters objInParams.hDefKey = constHive objInParams.sSubKeyName = strKey objInParams.sValueName = strValue Set objOutParams = objReg.ExecMethod_("GetBinaryValue", objInParams, , objCtx)
strBytes = "" For Each uByte in objOutParams.uValue strTemp = Hex(uByte) If Len(strTemp) < 2 Then strTemp = "0" & strTemp End If strBytes = strBytes & strTemp & " " Next
WScript.Echo GetDisplayString(strKey, "REG_BINARY", strBytes, intBit) Case REG_DWORD Set objInParams = objReg.Methods_("GetDWordValue").InParameters objInParams.hDefKey = constHive objInParams.sSubKeyName = strKey objInParams.sValueName = strValue Set objOutParams = objReg.ExecMethod_("GetDWordValue", objInParams, , objCtx)
WScript.Echo GetDisplayString(strKey, "REG_DWORD", CStr(objOutParams.uValue), intBit) Case REG_QWORD Set objInParams = objReg.Methods_("GetQWordValue").InParameters objInParams.hDefKey = constHive objInParams.sSubKeyName = strKey objInParams.sValueName = strValue Set objOutParams = objReg.ExecMethod_("GetQWordValue", objInParams, , objCtx)
WScript.Echo GetDisplayString(strKey, "REG_QWORD", CStr(objOutParams.uValue), intBit) Case REG_MULTI_SZ Set objInParams = objReg.Methods_("GetMultiStringValue").InParameters objInParams.hDefKey = constHive objInParams.sSubKeyName = strKey objInParams.sValueName = strValue Set objOutParams = objReg.ExecMethod_("GetMultiStringValue", objInParams, , objCtx)
arrValues = objOutParams.sValue strResponse = ""
For Each strTemp In arrValues If strResponse = "" Then strResponse = strTemp Else strResponse = strResponse & vbCrLf & strTemp End If Next
WScript.Echo GetDisplayString(strKey, "REG_MULTI_SZ", strResponse, intBit) End Select End Function
Function GetObjCtx(intArch) Dim objCtx Set objCtx = CreateObject("WbemScripting.SWbemNamedValueSet") objCtx.Add "__ProviderArchitecture", intArch objCtx.Add "__RequiredArchitecture", TRUE Set GetObjCtx = objCtx End Function
Function GetObjReg(objCtx) Dim objLocator, objServices Set objLocator = CreateObject("Wbemscripting.SWbemLocator") Set objServices = objLocator.ConnectServer("","root\default","","",,,,objCtx) Set GetObjReg = objServices.Get("StdRegProv") End Function
Function GetSubKeys(objReg, objCtx, constHive, strKey) Dim Inparams, Outparams Set Inparams = objReg.Methods_("EnumKey").Inparameters Inparams.Hdefkey = constHive Inparams.sSubkeyname = strKey Set Outparams = objReg.ExecMethod_("EnumKey", Inparams,,objCtx) GetSubKeys = Outparams.sNames End Function
Function Is64 Dim objWMIService, colItems, objItem Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\.\root\CIMV2") Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select SystemType from Win32_ComputerSystem") For Each objItem In colItems If InStr(LCase(objItem.SystemType), "x64") > 0 Then Is64 = True Else Is64 = False End If Next End Function
Function GetHiveConst(hive) Const HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT = &H80000000 Const HKEY_CURRENT_USER = &H80000001 Const HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE = &H80000002 Const HKEY_USERS = &H80000003
Select Case UCase(hive) Case "HKLM" GetHiveConst = HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE Case "HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE" GetHiveConst = HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE Case "HKCR" GetHiveConst = HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT Case "HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT" GetHiveConst = HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT Case "HKEY_CURRENT_USER" GetHiveConst = HKEY_CURRENT_USER Case "HKEY_USERS" GetHiveConst = HKEY_USERS End Select
If IsEmpty(GetHiveConst) Then WScript.Echo "Invalid registry hive: " & hive WScript.Quit End If End Function
Function GetUserForSIDLocal(objReg,strSID) ' This function converts a SID to a user name ' by doing a registry lookup, avoiding an LDAP query ' this will fail in the case where the user's name was changed in AD ' as they will still have their old home directory name
Const HKLM = &h80000002
Dim strHiveListKey,strUserData,intDatPos,intFinalBackslashPos
strHiveListKey = "SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\hivelist" objReg.GetStringValue HKLM,strHiveListKey,"\Registry\User\"&strSID,strUserData If Not IsNull(strUserData) Then ' strUserData would look like ' \Device\HarddiskVolume2\Users\user.name\NTUSER.DAT intDatPos = InStr(UCase(strUserData),"\NTUSER.DAT") ' strip off the dat file If intDatPos > 0 Then ' must be in string strUserData = Left(strUserData,intDatPos - 1) ' find last backslash intFinalBackslashPos = InStrRev(strUserData,"\") ' get right from that pos strUserData = Right(strUserData,Len(strUserData) - intFinalBackslashPos) GetUserForSIDLocal = strUserData Else strUserData = False End If Else GetUserForSIDLocal = False End If End Function 'GetUserForSIDLocal

sensor.name: Is Virtual
sensor.description: Returns Yes or No to indicate whether the hardware is virtual. Echo: Yes

query.script:
'======================================== ' Is Virtual '========================================
' This sensor will determine if a machine is a virtual machine or not ' Comparing values for certain properties against known values. ' It will need to be updated for some current tech and ' as new technologies come to market.
Option Explicit
If IsVM Then WScript.Echo "Yes" Else WScript.Echo "No" End If
Function IsVM Dim sVMPlatform, sMake, sModel, sBIOSVersion,bIsVM
' Check the WMI information against known values
bIsVM = false sVMPlatform = ""
sMake = GetWmiPropertyValue("root\cimv2", "Win32_ComputerSystem", "Manufacturer") sModel = GetWmiPropertyValue("root\cimv2", "Win32_ComputerSystem", "Model") sBIOSVersion = GetWmiPropertyValue("root\cimv2", "Win32_BIOS", "Version")
'WScript.Echo "Manufacturer=" & sMake 'WScript.Echo "Model=" & sModel 'WScript.Echo "BIOSVersion=" & sBIOSVersion
If sModel = "Virtual Machine" Then
' Microsoft virtualization technology detected, assign defaults
sVMPlatform = "Hyper-V" bIsVM = true
' Try to determine more specific values
Select Case sBIOSVersion Case "VRTUAL - 1000831" bIsVM = true sVMPlatform = "Hyper-V 2008 Beta or RC0" Case "VRTUAL - 5000805", "BIOS Date: 05/05/08 20:35:56 Ver: 08.00.02" bIsVM = true sVMPlatform = "Hyper-V 2008 RTM" Case "VRTUAL - 3000919" bIsVM = true sVMPlatform = "Hyper-V 2008 R2" Case "A M I - 2000622" bIsVM = true sVMPlatform = "VS2005R2SP1 or VPC2007" Case "A M I - 9000520" bIsVM = true sVMPlatform = "VS2005R2" Case "A M I - 9000816", "A M I - 6000901" bIsVM = true sVMPlatform = "Windows Virtual PC" Case "A M I - 8000314" bIsVM = true sVMPlatform = "VS2005 or VPC2004" Case "Xen - 0s" bIsVM = True sVMPlatform = "Xen" Case "Xen - 0" bIsVM = True sVMPlatform = "Xen" End Select
ElseIf sMake = "Xen" Then
' Xen detected
sVMPlatform = "Xen" bIsVM = true
ElseIf sModel = "VMware Virtual Platform" then
' VMware detected
sVMPlatform = "VMware" bIsVM = true
ElseIf sModel = "VirtualBox" then
' VirtualBox detected
bIsVM = true sVMPlatform = "VirtualBox"
ElseIf sModel = "HVM domU" then
' Xen detected
bIsVM = true sVMPlatform = "Xen"
Else ' This computer does not appear to be a virtual machine. End if
' Set the return value
If bIsVM Then ' Let's not actually do anything here 'WScript.Echo "IsVirtualMachine=True" 'WScript.Echo "VirtualMachinePlatform=" & sVMPlatform Else 'WScript.Echo "IsVirtualMachine=False" End If
IsVM = bIsVM
End Function
Function GetWmiPropertyValue(strNameSpace, strClassName, strPropertyName) Dim strPropertyValue, oWMIClass, oWMIProperties, objWMIService, colItems Dim objItem, objProperty Dim sLine
On Error Resume Next
strPropertyValue = "" set oWmiClass = getobject("winmgmts:" & strNameSpace).get(strClassName,&h20000) 'amended set oWmiProperties = oWmiClass.Properties_
Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\" & "." & "\" & strNameSpace) Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select * from " & strClassName,,48)
For Each objItem in colItems For Each objProperty in oWmiProperties sLine = "" 'WScript.Echo "- " & objProperty.name & ": " & strPropertyName
If objProperty.Name = strPropertyName Then If objProperty.IsArray = True Then sLine = "str" & objProperty.Name & " = Join(objItem." & objProperty.Name & ", " & Chr(34) & "," & Chr(34) & ")" & vbCrLf sLine = sLine & "strPropertyValue = str" & objProperty.Name 'ElseIf objProperty.CIMTYPE = 101 Then ' bHasDates = True ' sLine = "strPropertyValue = WMIDateStringToDate(objItem." & objProperty.Name & ")" Else sLine = "strPropertyValue = objItem." & objProperty.Name End If
'WScript.Echo sLine Execute sLine End If
Next Next
GetWmiPropertyValue = strPropertyValue
'Cleanup! set oWmiClass = Nothing set oWmiProperties = Nothing
Set objWMIService = Nothing Set colItems = Nothing
End Function

sensor.name: Is Windows
sensor.description: Returns whether the machine runs Windows. True if so, False if not. Example: True

query.script: #!/bin/bash echo False
#!/bin/bash echo False

sensor.name: Local Groups With Members
sensor.description: Returns a group name and a member of that group on each line. For each member in any group, two columns of output will appear. Example: Administrators|user.name

query.script:
'======================================== ' Local Groups With Members '========================================
' output all local groups ' for each member of a group, output the group in the first column ' and the member in the second column.
' Contains hidden columns, full output is: ' Group Name|Member Name|ADSPath|PerfectMatchMember|PerfectMatchGroup ' Final three are hidden. ADSPath is for feeding actions. PerfectMatch columns ' allow for exact beginning to end matches in a column using contains.
Option Explicit
Dim strGroup, dictBlacklist,dictGroups,bShouldWrite Set dictBlacklist = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary")
' Add one line for each user or group that you do not want listed in the sensor output. 'dictBlacklist.Add ("IgnoreMe"), True 'Case insensitive
' Do not run on a Domain Controller, would list all domain groups If IsDC Then WScript.Quit
Set dictGroups = GetLocalGroupsAndMembers For Each strGroup In dictGroups.Keys bShouldWrite = True Dim strItem,strMember For Each strMember In Split(dictGroups.Item(strGroup),",") For Each strItem In dictBlacklist.Keys If ( InStr(1,strGroup, strItem, vbTextCompare) > 0 _ Or InStr(1,strMember,strItem,vbTextCompare) > 0) Then bShouldWrite = False End If Next If bShouldWrite Then WScript.Echo strGroup &"|"& strMember Next Next
Function GetLocalGroupsAndMembers
Dim colGroups,objGroup,dictGroups,strMembers,objMember,i Dim objReg,objCTX,strMember,strDomain,strADSPath,strShortDomain Dim strPostADS,arrDomainSplit,objWshNet,strComputer Dim strPerfectMatchMemberName,strPerfectMatchGroupName
Set objCtx = GetObjCtx(32) Set objReg = GetObjReg(objCtx)
Set colGroups = GetObject("WinNT://.") colGroups.Filter = Array("group") Set dictGroups = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary") Set objWshNet = CreateObject("WScript.Network")
strComputer = objWshNet.ComputerName
For Each objGroup In colGroups ' encapsulate group string in something we can compare against in questions. Hidden column at end strPerfectMatchGroupName = ":G:"&objGroup.Name&":" i = 0 strMembers = "" If Not dictGroups.Exists(objGroup.Name) Then For Each objMember in objGroup.Members If objMember.Name = "" Then strMember = "::Blank/Error::" Else strMember = objMember.Name End If
If InStr(strMember,"S-") > 0 Then ' Possible SID entry, try to resolve strMember = GetUserForSIDLocal(objReg,strMember)&" (unresolvable)" End If strADSPath = objMember.ADSPath strPostADS = Replace(strADSPath,"WinNT://","")
If InStr(strPostADS,"/") > 0 Then 'domain user arrDomainSplit = Split(strPostADS,"/") If UBound(arrDomainSplit) > 0 Then strDomain = arrDomainSplit(0) strMember = arrDomainSplit(1) If InStr(strMember,"S-") > 0 Then ' Possible SID entry, try to resolve strMember = GetUserForSIDLocal(objReg,strMember)&" (unresolvable / cached)" End If Else strDomain = "Unknown" strMember = "Unknown" End If End If
If InStr(1,objMember.ADSPath,strComputer) > 0 Then 'local entry strADSPath = Replace(objMember.ADSPath,strComputer,"::ComputerName::",1,1,vbTextCompare) ' output a perfect match name like "::GroupName::" so you cna do contains "::GroupName::" ' and know you're matching the group name, beginning to end and no other entries strPerfectMatchMemberName=":M:"&strMember&":" strMembers = strMembers&","&strMember&"|"&strADSPath&"|" _ &strPerfectMatchMemberName&"|"&strPerfectMatchGroupName Else strADSPath = objMember.ADSPath strPerfectMatchMemberName=":M:"&strDomain&"\"&strMember&":" strMembers = strMembers&","&strDomain&"\"&strMember&"|"&strADSPath&"|" _ &strPerfectMatchMemberName&"|"&strPerfectMatchGroupName End If i = i + 1 Next If i > 0 Then ' Remove preceeding delimiter strMembers = Right(strMembers,Len(strMembers) - 1) Else strMembers = "::Empty Group::" End If dictGroups.Add objGroup.Name,strMembers End If Next Set GetLocalGroupsAndMembers = dictGroups End Function 'GetLocalGroups
Function IsDC ' This function will return True if the machine is on a domain ' and False if not or if it's a domain controller
Dim objWMIService, colItems, objItem Dim bDomainMember, intDomainRole
Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\.\root\cimv2") Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select * from Win32_ComputerSystem",,48)
For Each objItem in colItems bDomainMember = objItem.PartOfDomain intDomainRole = objItem.DomainRole Next
If bDomainMember = "True" And (intDomainRole = 4 Or intDomainRole = 5) Then ' Skip if on domain and is domain controller IsDC = True Else IsDC = False End If
End Function 'IsDC
Function GetUserForSIDLocal(objReg,strSID) ' This function converts a SID to a user name ' by doing a registry lookup, avoiding an LDAP query ' this will fail in the case where the user's name was changed in AD ' as they will still have their old home directory name
Const HKLM = &h80000002
Dim strHiveListKey,strUserData,intDatPos,intFinalBackslashPos
strHiveListKey = "SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\hivelist" objReg.GetStringValue HKLM,strHiveListKey,"\Registry\User\"&strSID,strUserData If Not IsNull(strUserData) Then ' strUserData would look like ' \Device\HarddiskVolume2\Users\user.name\NTUSER.DAT intDatPos = InStr(UCase(strUserData),"\NTUSER.DAT") ' strip off the dat file If intDatPos > 0 Then ' must be in string strUserData = Left(strUserData,intDatPos - 1) ' find last backslash intFinalBackslashPos = InStrRev(strUserData,"\") ' get right from that pos strUserData = Right(strUserData,Len(strUserData) - intFinalBackslashPos) GetUserForSIDLocal = strUserData Else strUserData = strSID End If Else GetUserForSIDLocal = strSID End If End Function 'GetUserForSIDLocal
Function GetObjCtx(intArch) Dim objCtx Set objCtx = CreateObject("WbemScripting.SWbemNamedValueSet") objCtx.Add "__ProviderArchitecture", intArch objCtx.Add "__RequiredArchitecture", TRUE Set GetObjCtx = objCtx End Function
Function GetObjReg(objCtx) Dim objLocator, objServices Set objLocator = CreateObject("Wbemscripting.SWbemLocator") Set objServices = objLocator.ConnectServer("","root\default","","",,,,objCtx) Set GetObjReg = objServices.Get("StdRegProv") End Function
Function SplitDomain(strEntry) ' examines entry, returns array: ' Domain|Member
Dim arrOut,strDomain,strMember,arrSplit,objWshNet,strComputer Dim arrADSSplit,strRest
Set objWshNet = CreateObject("WScript.Network") strComputer = objWshNet.ComputerName
'' right here we need to return a domain|Member split from the adspath '' if the domain is the computer name, don't output that
If InStr(strEntry,"@") > 0 Then arrSplit = Split(strEntry,"@") If UBound(arrSplit) > 0 Then strMember = arrSplit(0) strDomain = arrSplit(1) End If ElseIf InStr(strEntry,"\") > 0 Then arrSplit = Split(strEntry,"\") If UBound(arrSplit) > 0 Then strDomain = arrSplit(0) strMember = arrSplit(1) End If ElseIf InStr(strEntry,"//") > 0 Then ' is ADSPath arrADSSplit = Split(strEntry,"//") strDomain = Split(arrADSSplit(1),"/")(0) strMember = Split(arrADSSplit(1),"/")(1) Else strDomain = "" strMember = strEntry End If
arrOut = Array(strDomain,strMember)
SplitDomain = arrOut
End Function 'SplitDomain

sensor.name: Local Groups
sensor.description: Returns the names of Local Groups on Windows machines. Example:Administrators

query.script:
'======================================== ' Local Groups '========================================
' output all local groups
Option Explicit
Dim strGroup, dictBlacklist,dictGroups Set dictBlacklist = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary")
' Add one line for each user or group that you do not want listed in the sensor output. 'dictBlacklist.Add LCase("IgnoreMe"), True
' Do not run on a Domain Controller, would list all domain groups If IsDC Then WScript.Quit
Set dictGroups = GetLocalGroups For Each strGroup In dictGroups.Keys Dim bShouldList,strItem bShouldList = True
For Each strItem In dictBlacklist.Keys If InStr(LCase(strGroup), strItem) > 0 Then bShouldList = False End If Next
If bShouldList Then WScript.Echo strGroup End If Next
Function GetLocalGroups
Dim colGroups,objGroup,dictGroups Set colGroups = GetObject("WinNT://.") colGroups.Filter = Array("group") Set dictGroups = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary")
For Each objGroup In colGroups If Not dictGroups.Exists(objGroup.Name) Then dictGroups.Add objGroup.Name, 1 End If Next Set GetLocalGroups = dictGroups End Function 'GetLocalGroups
Function IsDC ' This function will return True if the machine is on a domain ' and is a domain controller
Dim objWMIService, colItems, objItem Dim bDomainMember, intDomainRole
Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\.\root\cimv2") Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select * from Win32_ComputerSystem",,48)
For Each objItem in colItems bDomainMember = objItem.PartOfDomain intDomainRole = objItem.DomainRole Next
If bDomainMember = "True" And (intDomainRole = 4 Or intDomainRole = 5) Then ' on domain and is domain controller IsDC = True Else IsDC = False End If
End Function 'IsDC

sensor.name: Installed Applications
sensor.description: List of the applications and versions of those applications installed on the client machine. Example: Mozilla Firefox | 16.0.1

query.script:
'======================================== ' Installed Applications '======================================== '@INCLUDE=utils/SensorRandomization/SensorRandomizationFunctions.vbs ' This sensor will return information in the uninstall areas of the registry. ' There are two hidden columns which can be filtered on despite the fact that ' they're hidden, and can also feed actions. ' if the uninstallstring is msi based, it is altered to show the ' silent uninstall options and marked as "Is Uninstallable" ' finally, if it's a user installed application, it will note that ' The columns look like: ' Name|Version|Silent Uninstall String|Uninstallable
SensorRandomize()
Set objRegistry = Getx64RegistryProvider()
keyPath = "SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Uninstall" key64Path = "SOFTWARE\WOW6432Node\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Uninstall"
Const HKLM = &H80000002 Const HKEY_USERS = &H80000003
' list out 32-bit applications on a 64-bit system If RegKeyExists(HKLM, key64Path) Then objRegistry.EnumKey HKLM, key64Path, arrSubKeys GetApplications HKLM,key64path,arrSubKeys End If
' list out 32-bit applications on a 32-bit system, or 64-bit applications ' on a 64-bit system. If RegKeyExists(HKLM, keyPath) Then objRegistry.EnumKey HKLM, keypath, arrSubKeys GetApplications HKLM,keypath,arrSubKeys End If
' Also list out applications installed to HKEY_Users areas ' which will be appended to the arrSubKeys objRegistry.EnumKey HKEY_USERS, "", arrUserKeys For Each strSIDkey In arrUserKeys If RegKeyExists(HKEY_USERS, strSIDKEY&"\"&keyPath) Then objRegistry.EnumKey HKEY_USERS, strSIDkey&"\"&keyPath, arrSubKeys GetApplications HKEY_USERS,strSIDKey&"\"&keyPath,arrSubKeys End If Next
Function GetApplications(HIVE, keypath,arrSubKeys) Set applications = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary") On Error Resume Next For Each key in arrSubKeys objRegistry.GetStringValue HIVE,keyPath & "\" & key,"DisplayName", displayName objRegistry.GetStringValue HIVE,keyPath & "\" & key,"DisplayVersion", version objRegistry.GetDWORDValue HIVE,keyPath & "\" & key,"SystemComponent", systemComponent objRegistry.GetStringValue HIVE,keyPath & "\" & key,"UninstallString", uninstallString objRegistry.GetStringValue HIVE,keyPath & "\" & key,"ParentKeyName", parentKey ' on error goto 0 ' assume it's not uninstallable bUninstallable = "Not Uninstallable"
If displayName <> "" _ And Not IsNull(uninstallString) _ And IsNull(parentKey) _ And InStr(displayName, "Hotfix") = 0 _ And InStr(displayName, "Update for") = 0 _ And InStr(displayName, "Security Update for") = 0 _ Then If InStr(LCase(uninstallString), "msiexec") Then ' replace any /I with /X and add silent flags uninstallString = Replace(uninstallString,"/I","/X") & " /qn /noreboot" bUninstallable = "Is Uninstallable" End If If IsNull(systemComponent) Or systemComponent = 0 Then If IsNull(version) Then version = GetVersionInString(displayName) End If ' This is a multi-column sensor. Last two columns are hidden.
displayString = displayName & "|" & version & "|" & uninstallString & "|" & bUninstallable
' treat displayString as the unique value - cannot be listed twice. If Not applications.Exists(displayString) Then applications.Add displayString, "" End If End If End If Next On Error Goto 0
SortDictionary applications, 1 ' This calls a sorting function specific to dictionaries arrApplicationsKeys = applications.Keys For Each application In arrApplicationsKeys ' final output of the sensor WScript.Echo CleanCharacters(application) Next End Function 'GetApplications
Function RegKeyExists(sHive, sRegKey) Dim aValueNames, aValueTypes If objRegistry.EnumValues(sHive, sRegKey, aValueNames, aValueTypes) = 0 Then RegKeyExists = True Else RegKeyExists = False End If End Function
Function SortDictionary(objDict, intSort) ' objDict - the dictionary to sort ' intSort - the field to sort (1=key, 2=item)
' declare constants Const dictKey = 1 Const dictItem = 2
' declare our variables Dim strDict() Dim objKey Dim strKey,strItem Dim X,Y,Z
' get the dictionary count Z = objDict.Count
' we need more than one item to warrant sorting If Z > 1 Then ' create an array to store dictionary information ReDim strDict(Z,2) X = 0 ' populate the string array For Each objKey In objDict strDict(X,dictKey) = CStr(objKey) strDict(X,dictItem) = CStr(objDict(objKey)) X = X + 1 Next
' perform a a shell sort of the string array For X = 0 To (Z - 2) For Y = X To (Z - 1) If StrComp(strDict(X,intSort),strDict(Y,intSort),vbTextCompare) > 0 Then strKey = strDict(X,dictKey) strItem = strDict(X,dictItem) strDict(X,dictKey) = strDict(Y,dictKey) strDict(X,dictItem) = strDict(Y,dictItem) strDict(Y,dictKey) = strKey strDict(Y,dictItem) = strItem End If Next Next
' erase the contents of the dictionary object objDict.RemoveAll
' repopulate the dictionary with the sorted information For X = 0 To (Z - 1) objDict.Add strDict(X,dictKey), strDict(X,dictItem) Next
End If End Function 'SortDictionary
Function GetVersionInString(ByVal strTemp) ' examines a string and returns a version string at the end of it Dim strOut strOut = "" If Not IsNull(strTemp) Then strTemp = StrReverse(strTemp) Dim strLookAtChar,intCurPos Dim bNumbersStartMarked : bNumbersStartMarked = False
For intCurPos = 1 To Len(strTemp) strLookAtChar = Mid(strTemp,intCurPos,1) If IsNumeric(strLookAtChar) Or strLookAtChar = "." Or strLookAtChar = "-" Then bNumbersStartMarked = True strOut = strOut & strLookAtChar End If If bNumbersStartMarked And ( (Not IsNumeric(strLookAtChar) And strLookAtChar <> "." And strLookAtChar <> "-") ) Then Exit For End If Next strOut = StrReverse(strOut) Else strOut = "" End If
If Len(strOut) = 0 Then strOut = "N/A"
GetVersionInString = strOut
End Function 'GetVersionInString
Function CleanCharacters(strTest) ' String returned will not have characters in the output which ' are not friendly to the console app strPattern = "[^\x20-\x7E]" strReplace = "" Set objRegExp = New RegExp objRegExp.Global = True objRegExp.IgnoreCase = True objRegExp.Pattern = strPattern objRegExp.Global = True CleanCharacters = objRegExp.Replace(strTest, strReplace) End Function
Function Getx64RegistryProvider ' Returns the best available registry provider: 32 bit on 32 bit systems, 64 bit on 64 bit systems Dim objWMIService, colItems, objItem, iArchType, objCtx, objLocator, objServices, objRegProv Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\.\root\CIMV2") Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select SystemType from Win32_ComputerSystem") For Each objItem In colItems If InStr(LCase(objItem.SystemType), "x64") > 0 Then iArchType = 64 Else iArchType = 32 End If Next
Set objCtx = CreateObject("WbemScripting.SWbemNamedValueSet") objCtx.Add "__ProviderArchitecture", iArchType Set objLocator = CreateObject("Wbemscripting.SWbemLocator") Set objServices = objLocator.ConnectServer("","root\default","","",,,,objCtx) Set objRegProv = objServices.Get("StdRegProv")
Set Getx64RegistryProvider = objRegProv End Function ' Getx64RegistryProvider '------------ INCLUDES after this line. Do not edit past this point ----- '- Begin file: utils/SensorRandomization/SensorRandomizationFunctions.vbs '' -- Begin Random Sleep Functions -- ''
Dim bSensorRandomizeDebugOutput : bSensorRandomizeDebugOutput = False
Function SensorRandomizeLow() Dim intSensorRandomizeWaitLow : intSensorRandomizeWaitLow = 10 SensorRandomizeRandomSleep(intSensorRandomizeWaitLow) End Function ' SensorRandomizeLow
Function SensorRandomize() Dim intSensorRandomizeWaitMed : intSensorRandomizeWaitMed = 20 SensorRandomizeRandomSleep(intSensorRandomizeWaitMed) End Function ' SensorRandomize
Function SensorRandomizeHigh() Dim intSensorRandomizeWaitHigh : intSensorRandomizeWaitHigh = 30 SensorRandomizeRandomSleep(intSensorRandomizeWaitHigh) End Function ' SensorRandomize
Function SensorRandomizeRandomSleep(intSleepTime) ' sleeps for a random period of time, intSleepTime is in seconds ' if the sensor randomize flag is on ' RandomizeScalingFactor is a multiplier on the values hardcoded in the sensor ' not typically set but can adjust timings per endpoint, optionally Dim intSensorRandomizeWaitTime Dim objShell,intRandomizeFlag,strRandomizeRegPath,intRandomizeScalingPercentage strRandomizeRegPath = SensorRandomizeGetTaniumRegistryPath&"\Sensor Data\Random Sleep"
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell") On Error Resume Next intRandomizeFlag = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&strRandomizeRegPath&"\SensorRandomizeFlag") intRandomizeScalingPercentage = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&strRandomizeRegPath&"\SensorRandomizeScalingPercentage") On Error Goto 0 If intRandomizeFlag > 0 Then If intRandomizeScalingPercentage > 0 Then intSleepTime = intRandomizeScalingPercentage * .01 * intSleepTime SensorRandomizeEcho "Randomize scaling percentage of " _ & intRandomizeScalingPercentage & " applied, new sleep time is " & intSleepTime End If intSensorRandomizeWaitTime = CLng(intSleepTime) * 1000 ' convert to milliseconds ' wait random interval between 0 and the max Randomize(SensorRandomizeTaniumRandomSeed) ' assign random value to wait time max value intSensorRandomizeWaitTime = Int( ( intSensorRandomizeWaitTime + 1 ) * Rnd ) SensorRandomizeEcho "Sleeping for " & intSensorRandomizeWaitTime & " milliseconds" WScript.Sleep(intSensorRandomizeWaitTime) SensorRandomizeEcho "Done sleeping, continuing ..." Else SensorRandomizeEcho "SensorRandomize Not Enabled - No Op" End If End Function 'SensorRandomizeRandomSleep
Function SensorRandomizeTaniumRandomSeed ' for randomizing sensor code, the default seed is not random enough Dim timerNum timerNum = Timer() If timerNum < 1 Then SensorRandomizeTaniumRandomSeed = (SensorRandomizeGetTaniumComputerID / Timer() * 10 ) Else SensorRandomizeTaniumRandomSeed = SensorRandomizeGetTaniumComputerID / Timer End If End Function 'SensorRandomizeTaniumRandomSeed
Function SensorRandomizeGetTaniumRegistryPath 'SensorRandomizeGetTaniumRegistryPath works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath, strFoundTaniumRegistryPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 strFoundTaniumRegistryPath = keyNativePath
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 strFoundTaniumRegistryPath = keyWoWPath End If
If Not strPath = "" Then SensorRandomizeGetTaniumRegistryPath = strFoundTaniumRegistryPath Else SensorRandomizeGetTaniumRegistryPath = False WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot locate Tanium Registry Path" End If End Function 'SensorRandomizeGetTaniumRegistryPath
Function SensorRandomizeGetTaniumComputerID '' This function gets the Tanium Computer ID Dim objShell Dim intClientID,strID,strKeyPath,strValueName
strKeyPath = SensorRandomizeGetTaniumRegistryPath strValueName = "ComputerID" Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell") On Error Resume Next intClientID = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&strKeyPath&"\"&strValueName) If Err.Number <> 0 Then SensorRandomizeGetTaniumComputerID = 0 Else SensorRandomizeGetTaniumComputerID = SensorRandomizeReinterpretSignedAsUnsigned(intClientID) End If On Error Goto 0 End Function 'SensorRandomizeGetTaniumComputerID
Function SensorRandomizeReinterpretSignedAsUnsigned(ByVal x) If x < 0 Then x = x + 2^32 SensorRandomizeReinterpretSignedAsUnsigned = x End Function 'SensorRandomizeReinterpretSignedAsUnsigned
Sub SensorRandomizeEcho(str) If bSensorRandomizeDebugOutput = true Then WScript.Echo str End Sub 'SensorRandomizeEcho ' -- End Random Sleep Functions --' '- End file: utils/SensorRandomization/SensorRandomizationFunctions.vbs

sensor.name: Kaspersky Client Version
sensor.description: Returns the version of the Kaspersky Antivirus Scanner. Example:5.6

query.script:
'======================================== ' Kaspersky Client Version '========================================
strComputer = "." Set objRegistry = _ GetObject("winmgmts:{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\" _ & strComputer & "\root\default:StdRegProv")
Const HKLM = &H80000002
keyPath = "Software\KasperskyLab" key64Path = "Software\WOW6432Node\KasperskyLab"
If Not RegKeyExists(HKLM, keyPath) Then keyPath = key64Path
If Not RegKeyExists(HKLM, keyPath) Then WScript.Echo "Not installed" WScript.Quit End If End If
'Check for AVP11 If RegKeyExists(HKLM, keyPath & "\protected\AVP11\environment") Then WScript.Echo GetVersion(keyPath & "\protected\AVP11\environment")
'Check for AVP10 ElseIf RegKeyExists(HKLM, keyPath & "\protected\AVP10\environment") Then WScript.Echo GetVersion(keyPath & "\protected\AVP10\environment")
'Check for AVP9 ElseIf RegKeyExists(HKLM, keyPath & "\protected\AVP9\environment") Then WScript.Echo GetVersion(keyPath & "\protected\AVP9\environment")
'Check for AVP8 ElseIf RegKeyExists(HKLM, keyPath & "\protected\AVP8\environment") Then WScript.Echo GetVersion(keyPath & "\protected\AVP8\environment")
Else WScript.Echo "Version not found" End If
Function GetVersion(fullKeyPath) objRegistry.GetStringValue HKLM,fullKeyPath ,"ProductVersion", strVersion If Not IsNull(strVersion) Then GetVersion = strVersion Exit Function End If
GetVersion = "Version not found" End Function
Function RegKeyExists(sHive, sRegKey) Dim aValueNames, aValueTypes If objRegistry.EnumValues(sHive, sRegKey, aValueNames, aValueTypes) = 0 Then RegKeyExists = True Else RegKeyExists = False End If End Function

sensor.name: Kaspersky DAT Days Old
sensor.description: Returns the age, in days, of the the Kaspersky Antivirus DAT file. Example: 5

query.script:
'======================================== ' Kaspersky DAT Days Old '========================================
strComputer = "." Set objRegistry = _ GetObject("winmgmts:{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\" _ & strComputer & "\root\default:StdRegProv")
Const HKLM = &H80000002
'Uses date math - set locale
SetLocale(1033)
keyPath = "Software\KasperskyLab" key64Path = "Software\WOW6432Node\KasperskyLab"
If Not RegKeyExists(HKLM, keyPath) Then keyPath = key64Path
If Not RegKeyExists(HKLM, keyPath) Then WScript.Echo "Not installed" WScript.Quit End If End If
'Check for AVP11 If RegKeyExists(HKLM, keyPath & "\protected\AVP11\environment") Then WScript.Echo GetDatDaysOld(GetDatVersion(keyPath & "\protected\AVP11\environment"))
'Check for AVP10 ElseIf RegKeyExists(HKLM, keyPath & "\protected\AVP10\environment") Then WScript.Echo GetDatDaysOld(GetDatVersion(keyPath & "\protected\AVP10\environment"))
'Check for AVP9 ElseIf RegKeyExists(HKLM, keyPath & "\protected\AVP9\environment") Then WScript.Echo GetDatDaysOld(GetDatVersion(keyPath & "\protected\AVP9\environment"))
'Check for AVP8 ElseIf RegKeyExists(HKLM, keyPath & "\protected\AVP8\environment") Then WScript.Echo GetDatDaysOld(GetDatVersion(keyPath & "\protected\AVP8\environment"))
Else WScript.Echo "DAT version not found" End If
Function GetDatVersion(fullKeyPath) objRegistry.GetStringValue HKLM,fullKeyPath ,"DataRoot", dataRoot objRegistry.GetStringValue HKLM,fullKeyPath ,"UpdateRoot", updateRoot words = Split(updateRoot, "/") updateFile = words(UBound(words)) strFile = dataRoot & "\data\" & updateFile
Set fso = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject") If fso.FileExists(strFile) Then Set objFile = fso.OpenTextFile(strFile, 1) Do Until objFile.AtEndOfStream strLine = objFile.ReadLine If InStr(strLine, "UpdateDate=") Then words = Split(strLine, """") dats = Split(words(UBound(words)-1)) GetDatVersion = dats(0) Exit Function End If Loop End If GetDatVersion = "DAT version not found" End Function
Function RegKeyExists(sHive, sRegKey) Dim aValueNames, aValueTypes If objRegistry.EnumValues(sHive, sRegKey, aValueNames, aValueTypes) = 0 Then RegKeyExists = True Else RegKeyExists = False End If End Function
Function GetDatDaysOld(strValue) datDate = CDate( Mid(strValue, 3, 2) & "/" & Left(strValue, 2) & "/" & Right(strValue, 4) ) today = CDate( Month(Now) & "/" & Day(Now) & "/" & Year(Now)) GetDatDaysOld = DateDiff("d", datDate, today) End Function

sensor.name: Kaspersky DAT Version
sensor.description: Returns the version of the Kaspersky Antivirus DAT file. Example: 5.0.0.3

query.script:
'======================================== ' Kaspersky DAT Version '========================================
strComputer = "." Set objRegistry = _ GetObject("winmgmts:{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\" _ & strComputer & "\root\default:StdRegProv")
Const HKLM = &H80000002
keyPath = "Software\KasperskyLab" key64Path = "Software\WOW6432Node\KasperskyLab"
If Not RegKeyExists(HKLM, keyPath) Then keyPath = key64Path
If Not RegKeyExists(HKLM, keyPath) Then WScript.Echo "Not installed" WScript.Quit End If End If
'Check for AVP11 If RegKeyExists(HKLM, keyPath & "\protected\AVP11\environment") Then WScript.Echo GetDatVersion(keyPath & "\protected\AVP11\environment")
'Check for AVP10 ElseIf RegKeyExists(HKLM, keyPath & "\protected\AVP10\environment") Then WScript.Echo GetDatVersion(keyPath & "\protected\AVP10\environment")
'Check for AVP9 ElseIf RegKeyExists(HKLM, keyPath & "\protected\AVP9\environment") Then WScript.Echo GetDatVersion(keyPath & "\protected\AVP9\environment")
'Check for AVP8 ElseIf RegKeyExists(HKLM, keyPath & "\protected\AVP8\environment") Then WScript.Echo GetDatVersion(keyPath & "\protected\AVP8\environment")
Else WScript.Echo "DAT version not found" End If
Function GetDatVersion(fullKeyPath) objRegistry.GetStringValue HKLM,fullKeyPath ,"DataRoot", dataRoot objRegistry.GetStringValue HKLM,fullKeyPath ,"UpdateRoot", updateRoot words = Split(updateRoot, "/") updateFile = words(UBound(words)) strFile = dataRoot & "\data\" & updateFile
Set fso = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject") If fso.FileExists(strFile) Then Set objFile = fso.OpenTextFile(strFile, 1) Do Until objFile.AtEndOfStream strLine = objFile.ReadLine If InStr(strLine, "UpdateDate=") Then words = Split(strLine, """") dats = Split(words(UBound(words)-1)) GetDatVersion = dats(0) Exit Function End If Loop End If GetDatVersion = "DAT version not found" End Function
Function RegKeyExists(sHive, sRegKey) Dim aValueNames, aValueTypes If objRegistry.EnumValues(sHive, sRegKey, aValueNames, aValueTypes) = 0 Then RegKeyExists = True Else RegKeyExists = False End If End Function

sensor.name: Running Service
sensor.description: Provides a list of currently running services on the client machine. Example: DHCP Client

query.script: select Caption from win32_Service where State='Running'
#!/bin/bash first=true launchctl list | while read line do set -- $line if ( $first ); then first=false else if [ "$2" == "-" ]; then echo $3 fi fi done

sensor.name: VirusScan Enterprise On-Access Scan State
sensor.description: Returns whether on-access scanning is enabled on the machine. Example: Enabled

query.script:
'======================================== ' VirusScan Enterprise On-Access Scan State '========================================
Option Explicit
Dim strServiceState ' First get the state of the service strServiceState = ServiceState("McShield") If strServiceState = "Not Installed" Then 'No further tests are necessary WScript.Echo "VirusScan Enterprise Not Installed" WScript.Quit End If
Const HKLM = &h80000002 Dim objReg
Set objReg = Getx64RegistryProvider()
WScript.Echo GetOASStatus
Function GetOASStatus
Dim intOnAccessScanEnabled Dim strRegPath, strReport
strRegPath = GetMcAfeeProductRegRootKey("DesktopProtection")
