Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("SELECT * FROM Win32_Processor") For Each objItem in colItems Dim intLogicalProcessors intLogicalProcessors = 1
On Error Resume Next intLogicalProcessors = CInt(objItem.NumberOfLogicalProcessors) On Error Goto 0
numLogicalProcessors = numLogicalProcessors + intLogicalProcessors Next
' CounterType - PERF_100NSEC_TIMER ' Formula = ((N2 - N1) / (D2 - D1)) x 100 If ( 0 = (D2-D1) ) Or D1 > D2 then WScript.echo "System Timestamp Error" ElseIf N1 > N2 Then WScript.Echo "Performance Counter Error" Else percentage = Round(100 - ((N2 - N1) / (D2 - D1)) * 100 / numLogicalProcessors, 0) WScript.echo percentage & " %" End if
Set wmi_service = nothing
#!/bin/bash cpu=$(top -o cpu -l1 | awk '{print substr($0,24,5)}' | tail -n +13 | awk '{s+=$1} END {print s}') ; echo ${cpu} %

sensor.name: Disk Drives
sensor.description: Descriptions of any installed disk drives, including external or USB drives. Example: ST3808110AS ATA Device

query.script: select Caption from Win32_DiskDrive

sensor.name: Disk Total Space
sensor.description: The amount of total disk space per drive. Example: C: 100 GB

query.script:
'======================================== ' Disk Total Space '========================================
strComputer = "." Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:" _ & "{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\" _ & strComputer & "\root\cimv2") Set colDisks = objWMIService.ExecQuery _ ("Select * from Win32_LogicalDisk") For Each objDisk in colDisks ' Wscript.Echo "DeviceID: " & objDisk.DeviceID
If Not IsNull(objDisk.Size) Then dblSize = CDbl(objDisk.Size) dblSize = dblSize / 1024 / 1024 / 1024 intSize = CInt(dblSize) WScript.Echo objDisk.DeviceID & " " & intSize & " GB" End If Next
#!/bin/bash df -TPh |grep -vE "Use%|tmpfs" |while read line do set -- $line echo $7: $3 done
#!/bin/bash df -Hl | grep -vE '^Filesystem|tmpfs|cdrom' | awk '/^\// { print $9": " $2 }'

sensor.name: Disk Free Space
sensor.description: The amount of free disk space per drive. Example: C: 40 GB

query.script:
'======================================== ' Disk Free Space '========================================
strComputer = "." Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:" _ & "{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\" _ & strComputer & "\root\cimv2") Set colDisks = objWMIService.ExecQuery _ ("Select * from Win32_LogicalDisk")
For Each objDisk in colDisks If Not IsNull(objDisk.FreeSpace) Then dblFree = CDbl(objDisk.FreeSpace) dblFree = dblFree / 1024 / 1024 / 1024 intFree = CInt(dblFree) Wscript.Echo objDisk.DeviceID & " " & intFree & " GB" END IF Next
#!/bin/bash df -TPh |grep -vE "Use%|tmpfs" |while read line do set -- $line echo $7: $5 done
#!/bin/bash df -Hl | grep -vE '^Filesystem|tmpfs|cdrom' | awk '/^\// { print $9": " $4 }'

sensor.name: Disk Used Percentage
sensor.description: The percentage of used disk space per partition. Example: C: 24%

query.script:
'======================================== ' Disk Used Percentage '========================================
strComputer = "." Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:" _ & "{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\" _ & strComputer & "\root\cimv2") Set colDisks = objWMIService.ExecQuery _ ("Select * from Win32_LogicalDisk") For Each objDisk in colDisks ' Wscript.Echo "DeviceID: " & objDisk.DeviceID
If Not IsNull(objDisk.Size) And Not IsNull(objDisk.FreeSpace) Then dblPercent = ((CDbl(objDisk.Size) - CDbl(objDisk.FreeSpace)) / CDbl(objDisk.Size)) * 100 intPercent = CInt(dblPercent) WScript.Echo objDisk.DeviceID & " " & intPercent & "%" End If Next
#!/bin/bash df -TPh |grep -vE "Use%|tmpfs" |while read line do set -- $line echo $7: $6 done
#!/bin/bash df -Hl | grep -vE '^Filesystem|tmpfs|cdrom' | awk '/^\// { print $9": " $5 }'

sensor.name: Disk Type of C:
sensor.description: File system type of the C drive. Example: NTFS

query.script: Select FileSystem from Win32_LogicalDisk where Caption = 'c:'

sensor.name: RAM
sensor.description: Returns the total amount of installed RAM, in Megabytes. Example: 2048 MB

query.script:
'======================================== ' RAM '========================================
strComputer = "."
Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:" _ & "{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\" _ & strComputer & "\root\cimv2") Set colComputer = objWMIService.ExecQuery _ ("Select * from Win32_ComputerSystem")
For Each objComputer in colComputer intRamMB = int((objComputer.TotalPhysicalMemory) /1048576)+1 Wscript.Echo intRamMB & " MB" Next
WScript.Quit

sensor.name: Memory Consumption
sensor.description: Returns the percentage of used (committed) memory on a system. Example: 27 percent

query.script:
'======================================== ' Memory Consumption '========================================
Option Explicit
Dim objWMIService, colItems, objItem, strLinePercentCommittedBytesInUse
Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\.\root\CIMV2")
'Gets MEMORY Usage Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select * FROM Win32_PerfFormattedData_PerfOS_Memory ") For Each objItem In colItems strLinePercentCommittedBytesInUse = objItem.PercentCommittedBytesInUse wscript.echo strLinePercentCommittedBytesInUse & " %" Next

sensor.name: Network Adapter Details
sensor.description: Returns information on network adapters. Example:Intel(R) Centrino(R) Ultimate-N 6300 AGN|Intel Corporation|Ethernet 802.3|00:24:D7:21:9C:70|65 Mbps|Wi-Fi

query.script:
'======================================== ' Network Adapter Details '========================================
On Error Resume Next strComputer = "." Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\" & strComputer & "\root\cimv2") Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select * from Win32_NetworkAdapter",,48)
Dim arrNdisAdapters Set arrNdisAdapters = GetNdisArray
For Each objItem in colItems If _ InStr(objItem.AdapterType, "Ethernet") > 0 Or _ InStr(objItem.AdapterType, "Wireless") > 0 _ Then
dblSpeed = CDbl(objItem.Speed) / 1000000 If (arrNdisAdapters.count > 0) Then For Each objAdapter in arrNdisAdapters If objAdapter.InstanceName = objItem.Name Then dblSpeed = CDbl(objAdapter.NdisLinkSpeed) / 10000 End If Next End If strSpeed = dblSpeed & " Mbps"
WScript.Echo _ objItem.Name & "|" & _ objItem.Manufacturer & "|" & _ objItem.AdapterType & "|" & _ objItem.MACAddress & "|" & _ strSpeed & "|" & _ objItem.NetConnectionID End If Next
Function GetNdisArray Const cWMINameSpace = "root/wmi" Const cWMIInstance = "MSNdis_LinkSpeed" Const strComputerName = "."
Dim strWinMgmts, objWMI, listAdapters, objAdapter
strWinMgMts = "winmgmts:{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!//" & strComputerName & "/" & cWMINameSpace Set objWMI = GetObject(strWinMgMts)
Set listAdapters = objWMI.InstancesOf(cWMIInstance) Set GetNdisArray = listAdapters End Function

sensor.name: BIOS Name
sensor.description: Name of BIOS. Example: Phoenix ROM BIOS PLUS Version 1.10 A10

query.script: select Caption from win32_BIOS

#!/bin/sh LINUX=`uname -o | grep -c -i linux`
if [ $LINUX -eq 1 ] then dmidecode -s bios-vendor fi

sensor.name: BIOS Release Date
sensor.description: Release date of the BIOS. Example: 20080436.2.314.851300+000

query.script:
' ================= ' BIOS Release Date ' =================
On Error Resume Next strComputer = "." Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\" & strComputer & "\root\cimv2")
Set win32bios = objWMIService.ExecQuery("select * from win32_BIOS")
For Each objItem in win32bios
Dim releaseDate, biosYear, biosMonth, biosDate releaseDate = objItem.ReleaseDate biosYear = Mid(releaseDate, 1, 4) biosMonth = Mid(releaseDate, 5, 2) biosDate = Mid(releaseDate, 7, 2) WScript.Echo biosMonth & "/" & biosDate & "/" & biosYear
Next
#!/bin/bash dmidecode -s bios-release-date

sensor.name: BIOS Version
sensor.description: Version of the BIOS. Example: A11

query.script: select SMBIOSBIOSVersion from win32_BIOS
#!/bin/bash dmidecode -s bios-version

sensor.name: Running Applications
sensor.description: Provides a list of applications that are running at the present time on the client machine. Example: Google Chrome | 23.0.1271.64

query.script:
'======================================== ' Running Applications '========================================
' This sensor will list the pretty names of running applications. ' it is a multiple column sensor, and a hidden column will show the ' process name.
strSep = "|" ' Sensor output looks like: ' Running Application | Version | Process Name
SetLocale(1033)
showDuplicates = False showVersion = True recordUsageStats = True
On Error Resume Next strComputer = "." Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\" & strComputer & "\root\cimv2") Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select Caption, Name, ExecutablePath, CreationDate from Win32_Process",,48)
Dim nameDictionary, processDictionary Set nameDictionary = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary") Set processDictionary = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary")
'ADD PROCESS NAME IN LOWER CASE 'nameDictionary.Add "hppusg.exe", "Some HP Application" 'nameDictionary.Add "taniumclient.exe", "TANIUM CLIENT"
'array used to print output (no dictionary since we need duplicates) Dim arrOutput() intSize = 0 ReDim Preserve arrOutput(intSize)
strComputer = "." Const HKLM = &h80000002 Set reg=GetObject("winmgmts:{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\" & strComputer & "\root\default:StdRegProv")
regPath = GetTaniumRegistryPath() & "\Sensor Data\Applications" If Not RegKeyExists(reg, HKLM, regPath) Then reg.createKey HKLM, regPath End If
' if recording Usage stats, then we need to record when we first started ' recording usage stats If recordUsageStats Then reg.GetStringValue HKLM, regPath, "UsageStatsStart", strUsageStatsStart
If IsNull(strUsageStatsStart) Or IsEmpty(strUsageStatsStart) Then reg.SetStringValue HKLM, regPath, "UsageStatsStart", CStr(Now()) End If End If
'SET UP INSTALLED APPLICATIONS PROCESS DICTIONARY TO FACILITATE ACCESS LATER Dim installedProcs Set installedProcs = CreateObject("scripting.dictionary")
installedRegPath = GetTaniumRegistryPath() & "\Sensor Data\Applications\Installed" If Not RegKeyExists(reg, HKLM, regPath) Then reg.createKey HKLM, installedRegPath Else reg.EnumKey HKLM, installedRegPath, arrAppKeys if not isNull(arrAppKeys) Then For Each appKey In arrAppKeys fullAppKey = installedRegPath & "\" & appKey reg.EnumKey HKLM, fullAppKey, arrProcKeys If Not IsNull(arrProcKeys) Then For Each procKey In arrProcKeys fullProcKey = fullAppKey & "\" & procKey reg.GetStringValue HKLM, fullProcKey, "Path", strPath reg.GetStringValue HKLM, fullProcKey, "Process", strProc If Right(strPath, 1) <> "\" Then strPath = strPath & "\" End If If Not installedProcs.Exists(strPath & strProc) Then installedProcs.Add strPath & strProc, fullAppKey ' WScript.Echo "added: " & installedProcs.Item(strPath & strProc) End If Next End If Next End If End If
For Each objItem in colItems If InStr(LCase(objItem.ExecutablePath), "windows\system32\") = 0 Then Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject") If fso.FileExists(objItem.ExecutablePath) Then Dim strOutput, fileVersion, fileVersionOutput, fullName
Set execFile = fso.GetFile(objItem.ExecutablePath)
fileVersion = fso.GetFileVersion(objItem.ExecutablePath) fileVersionOutput = "N/A" If showVersion Then If fileVersion <> "" Then fileVersionOutput = fileVersion Else fileVersionOutput = "N/A" End If End If
fullName = nameDictionary.Item(LCase(objItem.Name))
If IsEmpty(fullName) Then fullName = GetDescription(execFile.ParentFolder.Path, objItem.Name) End If
If fullName = "" Then fullName = objItem.Name End If ' sensor output looks like: ' Application Name | Version | Process strOutput = fullName & strSep & fileVersionOutput & strSep & objItem.Caption
If not ArrayContains(arrOutput, strOutput) Or showDuplicates Then arrOutput(intSize) = strOutput intSize = intSize + 1 ReDim Preserve arrOutput(intSize) End If
'Process Last Started, First Started, etc. creationDate = objItem.CreationDate strDate = WMIDateStringToDate(creationDate) StoreData execFile.ParentFolder.Path, objItem.Name, fullName, fileVersion, cstr(strDate), reg, HKLM, regPath, false
'Look in installed processes for match, if yes then update data strKey = execFile.ParentFolder.Path & "\" & objItem.Name If installedProcs.Exists(strKey) Then installedAppKey = installedProcs.Item(strKey)
StoreData execFile.ParentFolder.Path, objItem.Name, fullName, fileVersion, cstr(strDate), reg, HKLM, installedAppKey, True
'Also add "Application" value to process key reg.GetStringValue HKLM, installedAppKey, "Description", strApp
reg.SetStringValue HKLM, regPath&"\"&GetKeyName(objItem.Name), "Application", strApp End If End If End If Next
For Each output In arrOutput WScript.Echo output Next
Function GetKeyName(strProcess) words = Split(strProcess, ".") GetKeyName = words(0) End Function
Function StoreData(strPath, strProc, fullName, version, strDate, objReg, hive, baseRegKey, isInstalled) Dim regKey
If isInstalled Then regKey = baseRegKey Else regKey = baseRegKey & "\" & GetKeyName(strProc) End If
If Not RegKeyExists(objReg, hive, regKey) Then objReg.createKey hive, regKey End If
'only update file-specific data if not installed If Not isInstalled Then publisher = GetPublisher(strPath, strProc) objReg.SetStringValue hive, regKey, "Publisher", publisher objReg.SetStringValue hive, regKey, "Version", version objReg.SetStringValue hive, regKey, "Description", fullName objReg.SetStringValue hive, regKey, "Path", strPath objReg.SetStringValue hive, regKey, "Process", strProc End If
'always update first/last data Dim strFirstStart, strLastStart 'Get "First Start", compare value objReg.GetStringValue hive, regKey, "First Start", strFirstStart If IsNull(strFirstStart) Then objReg.SetStringValue hive, regKey, "First Start", strDate Else 'Check if first start value needs to be replaced diff = DateDiff("d", strFirstStart, strDate) If diff < 0 Then objReg.SetStringValue hive, regKey, "First Start", strDate End If End If
'Get "Last Start", compare value objReg.GetStringValue hive, regKey, "Last Start", strLastStart If IsNull(strLastStart) Then objReg.SetStringValue hive, regKey, "Last Start", strDate Else 'Check if first start value needs to be replaced diff = DateDiff("d", strLastStart, strDate) If diff > 0 Then objReg.SetStringValue hive, regKey, "Last Start", strDate End If End If
' record the number of times seen, if enabled If recordUsageStats Then
' Assuming the usual time that this sensor runs is once every 5 minutes, ' never record and increment usage stats more often than once every 4 ' minutes. This stops us from recording an increment more often, in ' the case that someone uses the sensor in some other question objReg.GetStringValue hive, regKey, "LastStatUpdate", strLastUpdate
bRecordUpdate = False If IsNull(strLastUpdate) Or IsEmpty(strLastUpdate) Then bRecordUpdate = True Else intSecondsPast = DateDiff("s", CDate(strLastUpdate), Now())
' allow the update if its very close to 5 minutes If(intSecondsPast >= 270) Then bRecordUpdate = True End If End If
If bRecordUpdate Then ' key for usage stats is month-day-year strUsageKey = Month(Now) & "-" & Year(Now) & "-Usage" objReg.GetDWORDValue hive, regKey, strUsageKey, intNumSeen
If IsNull(intNumSeen) Or IsEmpty(intNumSeen) Then intNumSeen = 0 End If
intNumSeen = intNumSeen + 1
objReg.SetDWORDValue hive, regKey, strUsageKey, intNumSeen objReg.SetStringValue hive, regKey, "LastStatUpdate", CStr(Now()) End If End If
End Function
Function ArrayContains(arr, str) For Each obj In arr If obj = str Then ArrayContains = True Exit Function End If Next ArrayContains = False End Function
Function GetAttributeIndex(folderPath, attrTarget) Set objShell = CreateObject("Shell.Application") Set objFolder = objShell.Namespace(folderPath) For i = 0 to 400 attrName = objFolder.GetDetailsOf(objFolder.Items, i) If LCase(attrName) = LCase(attrTarget) Then GetAttributeIndex = i Exit Function End If Next
End Function
Function GetFileProperty(folderPath, fileName, fileProperty) Set objShell = CreateObject("Shell.Application") Set objFolder = objShell.Namespace(folderPath) GetFileProperty = objFolder.GetDetailsOf(objFolder.Parsename(fileName), fileProperty) End Function
Function GetDescription(folderPath, fileName) descIndex = GetAttributeIndex(folderPath, "File description") If IsEmpty(descIndex) Then descIndex = GetAttributeIndex(folderPath, "Description") End If GetDescription = GetFileProperty(folderPath, fileName, descIndex) End Function
Function GetPublisher(folderPath, fileName) descIndex = GetAttributeIndex(folderPath, "Company") GetPublisher = GetFileProperty(folderPath, fileName, descIndex) End Function
Function WMIDateStringToDate(dtmInstallDate) WMIDateStringToDate = CDate(Mid(dtmInstallDate, 5, 2) & "/" & _ Mid(dtmInstallDate, 7, 2) & "/" & Left(dtmInstallDate, 4)) End Function
'date format is MM/DD/YYYY function GetDaysOld(strDate) patternDate = CDate( strDate ) today = CDate( Month(Now) & "/" & Day(Now) & "/" & Year(Now)) GetDaysOld = DateDiff("d", patternDate, today) End Function
Function GetTaniumRegistryPath 'GetTaniumRegistryPath works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath, strFoundTaniumRegistryPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 strFoundTaniumRegistryPath = keyNativePath
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 strFoundTaniumRegistryPath = keyWoWPath End If
If Not strPath = "" Then GetTaniumRegistryPath = strFoundTaniumRegistryPath Else GetTaniumRegistryPath = False WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot locate Tanium Registry Path" End If End Function 'GetTaniumRegistryPath
Function RegKeyExists(objRegistry, sHive, sRegKey) Dim aValueNames, aValueTypes If objRegistry.EnumValues(sHive, sRegKey, aValueNames, aValueTypes) = 0 Then RegKeyExists = True Else RegKeyExists = False End If End Function

sensor.name: Internet Explorer Version
sensor.description: Returns the version of Internet Explorer installed on a system. Example:8.0.6001.18702

query.script:
'======================================== ' Internet Explorer Version '========================================
Const HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE = &H80000002 strComputer = "." Set oReg=GetObject("winmgmts:{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\" & _ strComputer & "\root\default:StdRegProv") strKeyPath = "SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Internet Explorer" strValueName = "Version" strValueName2 = "svcVersion" On Error Resume Next oReg.GetStringValue HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE,strKeyPath,strValueName2,strValue If strValue <> "" Then WScript.Echo strValue WScript.Quit End If
oReg.GetStringValue HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE,strKeyPath,strValueName,strValue Wscript.Echo strValue

sensor.name: Service Pack
sensor.description: The Service Pack level of the machine if available, and "No Service Pack found" if unavailable. Example: Service Pack 1

query.script:
'======================================== ' Service Pack '========================================
On Error Resume Next
strComputer = "." Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:" _ & "{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\" & strComputer & "\root\cimv2")
Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("select CSDVersion from win32_operatingsystem")
For Each objItem in colItems if not isnull(objItem.CSDVersion) then WScript.Echo objItem.CSDVersion WScript.Quit End if Next
WScript.Echo "No Service Pack found"

sensor.name: Operating System Build Number
sensor.description: Returns the build number of the installed operating system. Example:7601

query.script: select BuildNumber from win32_operatingsystem

sensor.name: Operating System Install Date
sensor.description: Returns the date the OS was installed. Example: 8/24/2012

query.script:
'======================================== ' Operating System Install Date '========================================
' This sensor uses date math which is locale specific SetLocale(GetTaniumLocale)
Set dtmConvertedDate = CreateObject("WbemScripting.SWbemDateTime")
strComputer = "." Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:" _ & "{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\" & strComputer & "\root\cimv2")
Set colOperatingSystems = objWMIService.ExecQuery _ ("Select * from Win32_OperatingSystem")
For Each objOperatingSystem in colOperatingSystems dtmConvertedDate.Value = objOperatingSystem.InstallDate dtmInstallDate = dtmConvertedDate.GetVarDate
words = Split(dtmInstallDate, " ") Wscript.Echo words(0) Next
Function GetTaniumLocale '' This function will retrieve the locale value ' previously set which governs Tanium content that ' is locale sensitive.
Dim objWshShell Dim intLocaleID
Set objWshShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell") On Error Resume Next intLocaleID = objWshShell.RegRead("HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client\LocaleID") If Err.Number <> 0 Then intLocaleID = objWshShell.RegRead("HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client\LocaleID") End If On Error Goto 0 If intLocaleID = "" Then GetTaniumLocale = 1033 ' default to us/English Else GetTaniumLocale = intLocaleID End If
' Cleanup Set objWshShell = Nothing
End Function 'GetTaniumLocale

sensor.name: Installed Java Runtimes
sensor.description: Returns a list of all installed Java runtimes on the client machine. Example: Java(TM) 6 Update 20

query.script:
'======================================== ' Installed Java Runtimes '======================================== '@INCLUDE=utils/SensorRandomization/SensorRandomizationFunctions.vbs ' This sensor will return information in the uninstall areas of the registry. ' There are two hidden columns which can be filtered on despite the fact that ' they're hidden, and can also feed actions. ' if the uninstallstring is msi based, it is altered to show the ' silent uninstall options and marked as "Is Uninstallable" ' finally, if it's a user installed application, it will note that ' The columns look like: ' Name|Version|Silent Uninstall String|Uninstallable
SensorRandomize()
Dim hasJava hasJava = False
' This sensor uses date math which is locale specific SetLocale(GetTaniumLocale) 'us/english
Set objRegistry = Getx64RegistryProvider()
keyPath = "SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Uninstall" key64Path = "SOFTWARE\WOW6432Node\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Uninstall"
Const HKLM = &H80000002 Const HKEY_USERS = &H80000003
' list out 32-bit applications on a 64-bit system If RegKeyExists(HKLM, key64Path) Then objRegistry.EnumKey HKLM, key64Path, arrSubKeys GetApplications HKLM,key64path,arrSubKeys End If
' list out 32-bit applications on a 32-bit system, or 64-bit applications ' on a 64-bit system. If RegKeyExists(HKLM, keyPath) Then objRegistry.EnumKey HKLM, keypath, arrSubKeys GetApplications HKLM,keypath,arrSubKeys End If
' Also list out applications installed to HKEY_Users areas ' which will be appended to the arrSubKeys objRegistry.EnumKey HKEY_USERS, "", arrUserKeys For Each strSIDkey In arrUserKeys If RegKeyExists(HKEY_USERS, strSIDKEY&"\"&keyPath) Then objRegistry.EnumKey HKEY_USERS, strSIDkey&"\"&keyPath, arrSubKeys GetApplications HKEY_USERS,strSIDKey&"\"&keyPath,arrSubKeys End If Next
If Not(hasJava) Then WScript.Echo "Java not installed" End If
Function IsJava(strName) If ContainsString(strName, "(^Java\(TM\) \d Update)|(^Java \d Update)|(^Java 2 Runtime Environment)|(^Java Runtime Environment)") Then IsJava = True Exit Function Else IsJava = False End If End Function
Function GetApplications(HIVE, keypath,arrSubKeys) Set applications = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary")
If Not IsNull(arrSubKeys) Then For Each key in arrSubKeys objRegistry.GetStringValue HIVE,keyPath & "\" & key,"DisplayName", displayName objRegistry.GetStringValue HIVE,keyPath & "\" & key,"DisplayVersion", version objRegistry.GetDWORDValue HIVE,keyPath & "\" & key,"SystemComponent", systemComponent objRegistry.GetStringValue HIVE,keyPath & "\" & key,"UninstallString", uninstallString objRegistry.GetStringValue HIVE,keyPath & "\" & key,"ParentKeyName", parentKey ' on error goto 0 ' assume it's not uninstallable bUninstallable = "Not Uninstallable"
If displayName <> "" _ And Not IsNull(uninstallString) _ And IsNull(parentKey) _ And InStr(displayName, "Hotfix") = 0 _ And InStr(displayName, "Update for") = 0 _ And InStr(displayName, "Security Update for") = 0 _ Then If InStr(LCase(uninstallString), "msiexec") Then ' replace any /I with /X and add silent flags uninstallString = Replace(uninstallString,"/I","/X") & " /qn /noreboot" bUninstallable = "Is Uninstallable" End If If IsNull(systemComponent) Or systemComponent = 0 Then If IsNull(version) Then version = "" End If ' This is a multi-column sensor. Last two columns are hidden.
displayString = displayName & "|" & version & "|" & uninstallString & "|" & bUninstallable
' treat displayString as the unique value - cannot be listed twice. If Not applications.Exists(displayName) Then 'Check for various Java Installation patterns If IsJava(displayName) Then applications.Add displayName, displayString hasJava = True End If End If End If End If Next End If
SortDictionary applications, 1 ' This calls a sorting function specific to dictionaries arrApplicationsKeys = applications.Keys For Each strKey In arrApplicationsKeys ' final output of the sensor WScript.Echo applications.Item(strKey) Next End Function 'GetApplications
Function RegKeyExists(sHive, sRegKey) Dim aValueNames, aValueTypes If objRegistry.EnumValues(sHive, sRegKey, aValueNames, aValueTypes) = 0 Then RegKeyExists = True Else RegKeyExists = False End If End Function
Function SortDictionary(objDict, intSort) ' objDict - the dictionary to sort ' intSort - the field to sort (1=key, 2=item)
' declare constants Const dictKey = 1 Const dictItem = 2
' declare our variables Dim strDict() Dim objKey Dim strKey,strItem Dim X,Y,Z
' get the dictionary count Z = objDict.Count
' we need more than one item to warrant sorting If Z > 1 Then ' create an array to store dictionary information ReDim strDict(Z,2) X = 0 ' populate the string array For Each objKey In objDict strDict(X,dictKey) = CStr(objKey) strDict(X,dictItem) = CStr(objDict(objKey)) X = X + 1 Next
' perform a a shell sort of the string array For X = 0 To (Z - 2) For Y = X To (Z - 1) If StrComp(strDict(X,intSort),strDict(Y,intSort),vbTextCompare) > 0 Then strKey = strDict(X,dictKey) strItem = strDict(X,dictItem) strDict(X,dictKey) = strDict(Y,dictKey) strDict(X,dictItem) = strDict(Y,dictItem) strDict(Y,dictKey) = strKey strDict(Y,dictItem) = strItem End If Next Next
' erase the contents of the dictionary object objDict.RemoveAll
' repopulate the dictionary with the sorted information For X = 0 To (Z - 1) objDict.Add strDict(X,dictKey), strDict(X,dictItem) Next
End If End Function 'SortDictionary
Function ContainsString(strToCheck, strRegex) ' If isDebug Then WScript.Echo "About to check: " & strToCheck
If IsNull(strToCheck) Or IsEmpty(strToCheck) Then ContainsString = False Exit Function End If
Dim re, matches Set re = New RegExp re.Pattern = strRegex Set matches = re.Execute(strToCheck) If matches.Count > 0 Then If isDebug Then WScript.Echo " match: " & matches(0) & ", strRegex: " & strRegex ContainsString = True Exit Function End If ContainsString = False End Function
Function Getx64RegistryProvider ' Returns the best available registry provider: 32 bit on 32 bit systems, 64 bit on 64 bit systems Dim objWMIService, colItems, objItem, iArchType, objCtx, objLocator, objServices, objRegProv Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\.\root\CIMV2") Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select SystemType from Win32_ComputerSystem") For Each objItem In colItems If InStr(LCase(objItem.SystemType), "x64") > 0 Then iArchType = 64 Else iArchType = 32 End If Next
Set objCtx = CreateObject("WbemScripting.SWbemNamedValueSet") objCtx.Add "__ProviderArchitecture", iArchType Set objLocator = CreateObject("Wbemscripting.SWbemLocator") Set objServices = objLocator.ConnectServer("","root\default","","",,,,objCtx) Set objRegProv = objServices.Get("StdRegProv")
Set Getx64RegistryProvider = objRegProv End Function ' Getx64RegistryProvider '------------ INCLUDES after this line. Do not edit past this point ----- '- Begin file: utils/SensorRandomization/SensorRandomizationFunctions.vbs '' -- Begin Random Sleep Functions -- ''
Dim bSensorRandomizeDebugOutput : bSensorRandomizeDebugOutput = False
Function SensorRandomizeLow() Dim intSensorRandomizeWaitLow : intSensorRandomizeWaitLow = 10 SensorRandomizeRandomSleep(intSensorRandomizeWaitLow) End Function ' SensorRandomizeLow
Function SensorRandomize() Dim intSensorRandomizeWaitMed : intSensorRandomizeWaitMed = 20 SensorRandomizeRandomSleep(intSensorRandomizeWaitMed) End Function ' SensorRandomize
Function SensorRandomizeHigh() Dim intSensorRandomizeWaitHigh : intSensorRandomizeWaitHigh = 30 SensorRandomizeRandomSleep(intSensorRandomizeWaitHigh) End Function ' SensorRandomize
Function SensorRandomizeRandomSleep(intSleepTime) ' sleeps for a random period of time, intSleepTime is in seconds ' if the sensor randomize flag is on ' RandomizeScalingFactor is a multiplier on the values hardcoded in the sensor ' not typically set but can adjust timings per endpoint, optionally Dim intSensorRandomizeWaitTime Dim objShell,intRandomizeFlag,strRandomizeRegPath,intRandomizeScalingPercentage strRandomizeRegPath = SensorRandomizeGetTaniumRegistryPath&"\Sensor Data\Random Sleep"
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell") On Error Resume Next intRandomizeFlag = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&strRandomizeRegPath&"\SensorRandomizeFlag") intRandomizeScalingPercentage = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&strRandomizeRegPath&"\SensorRandomizeScalingPercentage") On Error Goto 0 If intRandomizeFlag > 0 Then If intRandomizeScalingPercentage > 0 Then intSleepTime = intRandomizeScalingPercentage * .01 * intSleepTime SensorRandomizeEcho "Randomize scaling percentage of " _ & intRandomizeScalingPercentage & " applied, new sleep time is " & intSleepTime End If intSensorRandomizeWaitTime = CLng(intSleepTime) * 1000 ' convert to milliseconds ' wait random interval between 0 and the max Randomize(SensorRandomizeTaniumRandomSeed) ' assign random value to wait time max value intSensorRandomizeWaitTime = Int( ( intSensorRandomizeWaitTime + 1 ) * Rnd ) SensorRandomizeEcho "Sleeping for " & intSensorRandomizeWaitTime & " milliseconds" WScript.Sleep(intSensorRandomizeWaitTime) SensorRandomizeEcho "Done sleeping, continuing ..." Else SensorRandomizeEcho "SensorRandomize Not Enabled - No Op" End If End Function 'SensorRandomizeRandomSleep
Function SensorRandomizeTaniumRandomSeed ' for randomizing sensor code, the default seed is not random enough Dim timerNum timerNum = Timer() If timerNum < 1 Then SensorRandomizeTaniumRandomSeed = (SensorRandomizeGetTaniumComputerID / Timer() * 10 ) Else SensorRandomizeTaniumRandomSeed = SensorRandomizeGetTaniumComputerID / Timer End If End Function 'SensorRandomizeTaniumRandomSeed
Function SensorRandomizeGetTaniumRegistryPath 'SensorRandomizeGetTaniumRegistryPath works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath, strFoundTaniumRegistryPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 strFoundTaniumRegistryPath = keyNativePath
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 strFoundTaniumRegistryPath = keyWoWPath End If
If Not strPath = "" Then SensorRandomizeGetTaniumRegistryPath = strFoundTaniumRegistryPath Else SensorRandomizeGetTaniumRegistryPath = False WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot locate Tanium Registry Path" End If End Function 'SensorRandomizeGetTaniumRegistryPath
Function SensorRandomizeGetTaniumComputerID '' This function gets the Tanium Computer ID Dim objShell Dim intClientID,strID,strKeyPath,strValueName
strKeyPath = SensorRandomizeGetTaniumRegistryPath strValueName = "ComputerID" Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell") On Error Resume Next intClientID = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&strKeyPath&"\"&strValueName) If Err.Number <> 0 Then SensorRandomizeGetTaniumComputerID = 0 Else SensorRandomizeGetTaniumComputerID = SensorRandomizeReinterpretSignedAsUnsigned(intClientID) End If On Error Goto 0 End Function 'SensorRandomizeGetTaniumComputerID
Function SensorRandomizeReinterpretSignedAsUnsigned(ByVal x) If x < 0 Then x = x + 2^32 SensorRandomizeReinterpretSignedAsUnsigned = x End Function 'SensorRandomizeReinterpretSignedAsUnsigned
Sub SensorRandomizeEcho(str) If bSensorRandomizeDebugOutput = true Then WScript.Echo str End Sub 'SensorRandomizeEcho ' -- End Random Sleep Functions --' '- End file: utils/SensorRandomization/SensorRandomizationFunctions.vbs

sensor.name: Java Auto Update
sensor.description: Returns the state of the Java Auto Update service, per architecture. Example: Enabled 32-bit

query.script:
'======================================== ' Java Auto Update '========================================
Option Explicit
Const HKLM = &H80000002
Dim b32BitJavaFound, b64BitJavaFound b32BitJavaFound = False b64BitJavaFound = False
b32BitJavaFound = CheckForJavaAndUpdatePolicy(32) If Is64 Then b64BitJavaFound = CheckForJavaAndUpdatePolicy(64) End If
If Not b32BitJavaFound And Not b64BitJavaFound Then ' Only print this if neither bit of java was found WScript.Echo "Java Not Found" End If
Function CheckForJavaAndUpdatePolicy(intBit) Dim strRuntimeInstalledKey, strUpdatePolicyKey, intRegToUse, strArch, strValue Dim objCtx, objReg, bJavaFound
bJavaFound = False
strRuntimeInstalledKey = "SOFTWARE\Javasoft\Java Runtime Environment" strUpdatePolicyKey = "SOFTWARE\JavaSoft\Java Update\Policy"
intRegToUse = 32 If Is64 Then intRegToUse = 64 ' always use highest available registry End if
Set objCtx = GetObjCtx(intRegToUse) Set objReg = GetObjReg(objCtx)
strArch = "32-bit" If intBit = 64 Then strArch = "64-bit" End If
If Is64 And intBit = 32 Then ' special case of looking for 32 bit jvms on 64 bit machines strRuntimeInstalledKey = "SOFTWARE\WOW6432Node\Javasoft\Java Runtime Environment" strUpdatePolicyKey = "SOFTWARE\WOW6432Node\JavaSoft\Java Update\Policy" End If
If RegKeyExists(objReg, objCtx, HKLM, strRuntimeInstalledKey) Then bJavaFound = True If RegKeyExists(objReg, objCtx, HKLM, strUpdatePolicyKey) Then strValue = GetDWordValue(objReg, objCtx, HKLM, strUpdatePolicyKey, "EnableJavaUpdate")
If Not IsNull(strValue) Then If strValue = 1 Then WScript.Echo "Enabled|" & strArch Else WScript.Echo "Disabled|" & strArch End If End If Else ' case where jvm installed, but no Java Update reg branch available WScript.Echo "Disabled|" & strArch End If End If
CheckForJavaAndUpdatePolicy = bJavaFound End Function
Function GetDWordValue(objReg, objCtx, constHive, strKey, strValue) Dim objInParams, objOutParams, objValue Set objInParams = objReg.Methods_("GetDWordValue").InParameters objInParams.hDefKey = constHive objInParams.sSubKeyName = strKey objInParams.sValueName = strValue Set objOutParams = objReg.ExecMethod_("GetDWordValue", objInParams, , objCtx) objValue = objOutParams.uValue If IsNull(objOutParams.uValue) Then GetDWordValue = Null Else GetDWordValue = CStr(objOutParams.uValue) End If End Function
Function RegKeyExists(objReg, objCtx, constHive, strKey) Dim objNames, objTypes, objValues, Inparams, Outparams Set Inparams = objReg.Methods_("EnumValues").Inparameters Inparams.Hdefkey = constHive Inparams.sSubkeyname = strKey Set Outparams = objReg.ExecMethod_("EnumValues", Inparams,,objCtx)
If Outparams.ReturnValue = 0 Then RegKeyExists = True Else RegKeyExists = False End If End Function
Function Is64 Dim objWMIService, colItems, objItem Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\.\root\CIMV2") Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select SystemType from Win32_ComputerSystem") For Each objItem In colItems If InStr(LCase(objItem.SystemType), "x64") > 0 Then Is64 = True Else Is64 = False End If Next End Function
Function GetObjCtx(intArch) Dim objCtx Set objCtx = CreateObject("WbemScripting.SWbemNamedValueSet") objCtx.Add "__ProviderArchitecture", intArch objCtx.Add "__RequiredArchitecture", TRUE Set GetObjCtx = objCtx End Function
Function GetObjReg(objCtx) Dim objLocator, objServices Set objLocator = CreateObject("Wbemscripting.SWbemLocator") Set objServices = objLocator.ConnectServer("","root\default","","",,,,objCtx) Set GetObjReg = objServices.Get("StdRegProv") End Function

sensor.name: Available Patches
sensor.description: Multi-column Sensor that shows operating system patches that can be installed to this computer. The title, severity, bulletin, date, total package size, and KB article for the patch are displayed. Example: Security Update for Windows Server 2003 (KB2510531) | Critical | MS11-031 | 2011-04 | 947 kB | KB2510531|CVE-2011-0663

query.script:
'======================================== ' Available Patches '========================================
Option Explicit
Dim objFSO, fn, objReadFile, contents, path, strSep, hasOutput, bAirgapped, strAirgapUrl Dim dictScanResultFiles,strCustomCabSupportVal,bCustomCabSupport Dim strScansPath, strToolsPath
strSep = "|"
'title|severity|bulletins|date|download|filename|status|guid|package size|kb|cve|Unique ID|Reboot Required|Revision|Endpoint Impact
bAirgapped = False strAirgapUrl = "AIRGAP_LOCAL_SERVER_URL/Dropoff/" If( Not(Left(strAirgapUrl, 19) = "AIRGAP_LOCAL_SERVER")) Then bAirgapped = True ' the AIRGAP url is rewritten by the install process, so this ' set to true will mean we need to airgap the urls End If
strToolsPath = GetTaniumDir("Tools") strScansPath = GetTaniumDir("Tools\Scans") strCustomCabSupportVal = LCase(GetPatchManagementValueFromRegistry("CustomCabSupport")) If strCustomCabSupportVal = "true" Or strCustomCabSupportVal = "yes" Then Set dictScanResultFiles = GetValidScanFiles ' retrieves all bCustomCabSupport = True
' True if you need to support custom support cabs ' Typically set with the Distribute Custom Patch Scan Cabs job ' If above is true: ' Use the Distribute Custom Patch Scan Cabs package /CustomDownloadURLFolder flag to set a value such as ' http://myserver.com/folder ' ensure that if the url is retrieved via https that all Tanium servers will trust the certificate presented ' The server chosen to host the patch files must have enough space for all patch files ' (typically XP Custom Support Patches) ' Note that the URL will be lowercase but Microsoft will provide updates in Mixed-Case ' so be sure to place on a web server which ignores case sensitivity when URLs/Files ' are accessed - no case sensitive web servers, please
Dim strCustomDownloadURLFolder ' Set this value using the /CustomDownloadURLFolder flag when you distribute a custom ' cab file using Distribute Custom Patch Scan Cabs package. The same folder must be used with all custom cab files strCustomDownloadURLFolder = _ EnsureSuffix(GetPatchManagementValueFromRegistry("CustomDownloadURLFolder"),"/") If strCustomDownloadURLFolder = "" Then ' value was not appropriately set ' this will appear as the download URL instead strCustomDownloadURLFolder = "http://Set.This.Value.When.Distributing.Custom.Cab/see_available_patches_sensor/" End If Else bCustomCabSupport = False ' standard scan file support Set dictScanResultFiles = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary") dictScanResultFiles.Add strScansPath&"patchresultsreadable.txt","wsusscn2.cab" End If
'-------------
Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject") Set dictScanResultFiles = GetValidScanFiles
For Each fn In dictScanResultFiles.Keys EchoScanResults(fn) Next
Function EchoScanResults(strScanFile) 'Set up exclusions list Dim excludeFile excludeFile = strToolsPath & "\patch-exclude.txt"
Dim objExclusions Set objExclusions = GetPatchExclusions(excludeFile)
If objFSO.FileExists(fn) Then Set objReadFile = objFSO.OpenTextFile(fn, 1, False)
Dim strLine, words, strFilename, strPatchDir, arrFilenames, isComplete
hasOutput = False
Do While Not objReadFile.AtEndOfStream strLine = objReadFile.ReadLine
'CHECK FOR MULTI-URL PATCHES words = Split(strLine, strSep)
'Ignore old Patch Results format without separator If UBound(words) < 4 Then If left(words(0), 4) = "Scan" Then hasOutput = True WScript.Echo words(0) 'Else ' WScript.Echo "Run upgraded Patch Scan" ' WScript.Quit End If ' ElseIf InStr(strDownload, ",") = 0 And InStr(strDownload, " ") = 0 Then Else arrFilenames = Split(words(5), ",") 'patch filename must be in Tools\Patch directory for queue Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject")
strPatchDir = GetTaniumDir("Tools\Patches")
isComplete = True For Each strFilename In arrFilenames If Not fso.FileExists(strPatchDir & "\" & strFilename) Then isComplete = False End If Next
If Not isComplete Then hasOutput = True If InStr(strLine, "Already Installed") Then 'if InStr(strLine, "(KB") Then ' strLine = Replace(strLine, "Already Installed", "KB Already Installed") 'End If 'Do not echo since we only want to output "Installed" patches Else 'Check to see if KB article should be excluded If Not IsExclusion(strLine, objExclusions) Then WScript.Echo RewriteLine(strLine) End If End If Else 'If we're here, update has been queued 'Do not echo since we only want to output "Installed" patches 'If InStr(strLine, "Not Installed") Then ' strLine = Replace(strLine, "Not Installed", "Queued") ' WScript.Echo strLine 'End If End If End If Loop
If Not hasOutput Then WScript.Echo "All available patches queued for installation" End If
objReadFile.close Else ' Wscript.echo "Patch results output not found" End if
End Function 'EchoScanResults
Function RewriteLine(strLine) Dim strResult, arrTokens, strDownloads, strFilenames, i, x strResult = strLine If bAirgapped Then ' if the system is running airgapped, then we need to rewrite ' all of the patch location URLs to have the internal url ' we have to pull out the url and file name values, then recreate the ' line arrTokens = Split(strLine, "|") strFilenames = Split(arrTokens(5), ",")
strDownloads = strAirgapUrl & strFilenames(0) For i=1 To UBound(strFilenames) strDownloads = strDownloads & "," & strAirgapUrl & strFilenames(i) Next
strResult = arrTokens(0) For i=1 To Ubound(arrTokens) If i=4 Then strResult = strResult & "|" & strDownloads Else strResult = strResult & "|" & arrTokens(i) End If Next End If ' Consider also XP Custom Support Downloads ' which may be at a different URL If bCustomCabSupport Then strResult = ReplaceCustomXPURL(strResult,strCustomDownloadURLFolder) End If RewriteLine = strResult End Function
Function RegKeyExists(reg, sHive, sRegKey) Dim aValueNames, aValueTypes If reg.EnumValues(sHive, sRegKey, aValueNames, aValueTypes) = 0 Then RegKeyExists = True Else RegKeyExists = False End If End Function
Function GetTaniumDir(strSubDir) 'GetTaniumDir with GeneratePath, works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 End If
If Not strPath = "" Then If strSubDir <> "" Then strSubDir = "\" & strSubDir End If
Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject") If fso.FolderExists(strPath) Then If Not fso.FolderExists(strPath & strSubDir) Then ''Need to loop through strSubDir and create all sub directories GeneratePath strPath & strSubDir, fso End If GetTaniumDir = strPath & strSubDir & "\" Else ' Specified Path doesn't exist on the filesystem WScript.Echo "Error: " & strPath & " does not exist on the filesystem" GetTaniumDir = False End If Else WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot find Tanium Client path in Registry" GetTaniumDir = False End If End Function 'GetTaniumDir
Function GeneratePath(pFolderPath, fso) GeneratePath = False
If Not fso.FolderExists(pFolderPath) Then If GeneratePath(fso.GetParentFolderName(pFolderPath), fso) Then GeneratePath = True Call fso.CreateFolder(pFolderPath) End If Else GeneratePath = True End If End Function 'GeneratePath
Function IsExclusion(strLine, objDic) Dim colKeys, strKey colKeys = objDic.Keys For Each strKey in colKeys If InStr(strLine, strSep & strKey & strSep) <> 0 Then IsExclusion = True Exit Function End If Next
IsExclusion = False End Function
Function GetPatchExclusions(strFile) Dim oDic Set oDic = CreateObject("scripting.dictionary")
Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject")
Const ForReading = 1 If fso.FileExists(strFile) Then Dim objFile Set objFile = fso.OpenTextFile(strFile, ForReading)
Dim strLine Do While objFile.AtEndOfStream <> True strLine = Trim(objFile.ReadLine)
'Ignore lines that start with # If Left(strLine, 1) <> "#" Then oDic.Item(strLine) = "placeholder" End If Loop End If
Set GetPatchExclusions = oDic End Function
Function GetValidScanFiles ' if global constant bCustomCabSupport is True ' Returns a dictionary of valid scan results files ' which are those that are based on cab files which exist Dim dictScanResultFiles,objFSO,objCabFolder,objFile,strToolsDir Dim strExtraCabDir,strResultsReadablePath,strScanDir,strCabPath Set dictScanResultFiles = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary") Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject") strToolsDir = GetTaniumDir("Tools") strScanDir = GetTaniumDir("Tools\Scans") If bCustomCabSupport Then strExtraCabDir = strToolsDir&"ExtraPatchCabs" If objFSO.FolderExists(strExtraCabDir) Then Set objCabFolder = objFSO.GetFolder(strExtraCabDir) For Each objFile In objCabFolder.Files If LCase(Right(objFile.Name,4)) = ".cab" Then strResultsReadablePath = strScanDir&"patchresultsreadable-"&objFile.Name&".txt" If Not dictScanResultFiles.Exists(strResultsReadablePath) Then dictScanResultFiles.Add strResultsReadablePath,objFile.Name End If End If Next End If End If
' always add the default distributed wsusscn2.cab strCabPath = strToolsDir & "wsusscn2.cab" If objFSO.FileExists(strCabPath) And Not dictScanResultFiles.Exists(strCabPath) Then dictScanResultFiles.Add strScanDir&"patchresultsreadable.txt","wsusscn2.cab" End If
Set GetValidScanFiles = dictScanResultFiles End Function 'GetValidScanFiles
Function EnsureSuffix(strIn,strSuffix)
If Not Right(strIn,Len(strSuffix)) = strSuffix Then EnsureSuffix = strIn&strSuffix Else EnsureSuffix = strIn End If
End Function 'EnsureSuffix
Function ReplaceCustomXPURL(strLine,strCustomDownloadURLFolder) ' a line may look like ' strLine = "Security Update for Internet Explorer 6 for Windows XP Service Pack 3 (KB2953522) Custom Support|Critical|MS14-030|2014-05|http://download.windowsupdate.com/msdownload/update/csa/secu/2014/05/windowsxp-kb2953522-x86-custom-enu_c6820e06d430fa90266689e71652327c057737ea.exe,http://download.windowsupdate.com/msdownload/update/csa/secu/2014/05/windowscrapola-kb2453252-x86-custom-enu_hohogreedo.exe|windowsxp-kb2953522-x86-custom-enu_c6820e06d430fa90266689e71652327c057737ea.exe,windowsxp-kb2453252-x86-custom-enu_abacab.exe|Not Installed|1c5202d5-2f75-4f1a-a97e-506891aa31a1|0 B|KB2953522|None|fc73bc9ddef26aea82a337dff0897c13|Maybe|11|Normal" ' For each mention of the file (in the downloadURL and the file name) there is ' a data string which does not appear in the actual name of the file made available ' from Microsoft. This function finds and removes that text.
Dim strBytesVal,strDownloadURLsField,arrLine arrLine = Split(strLine,strSep) If UBound(arrLine) > 7 Then ' likely valid strDownloadURLsField = arrLine(4) ' LCase(strBytesVal) seems to be "0 b" but unsure if reliable strBytesVal = arrline(8) ' also the phrase "custom support" seems to follow the KB indicator in title but unsure if reliable ' so use either If LCase(strBytesVal) = "0 b" Or InStr(LCase(strLine),") custom support"&strSep) > 0 Then ' seems to indicate Custom XP Patches ' manipulate the downloadURLs to remove everything between the last _ and the last . Dim arrDownloadURLs,strDownloadURL,dictUselessData arrDownloadURLs = Split(strDownloadURLsField,",") Set dictUselessData = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary") ' hold the bits we strip away from filenames Dim intLastDotPos,intLastUnderscorePos,strUselessData,intLastForwardSlashPos Dim strOriginalDownloadPrefix,strNewDownloadURL,strCommaSepDownloadURLs For Each strDownloadURL In arrDownloadURLs intLastDotPos = InStrRev(strDownloadURL,".") intLastUnderscorePos = InStrRev(strDownloadURL,"_") ' will also replace the URL prefix (up to the file) intLastForwardSlashPos = InStrRev(strDownloadURL,"/") strOriginalDownloadPrefix = Left(strDownloadURL,intLastForwardSlashPos) strUselessData = Mid(strDownloadURL,intLastUnderscorePos,intLastDotPos-intLastUnderscorePos) If Not dictUselessData.Exists(strUselessData) Then dictUselessData.Add strUselessData,1 ' save for later replacement strNewDownloadURL = Replace(Replace(strDownloadURL,strUselessData,""),strOriginalDownloadPrefix,strCustomDownloadURLFolder) strCommaSepDownloadURLs = strCommaSepDownloadURLs&" "&strNewDownloadURL Next strCommaSepDownloadURLs = Replace(Trim(strCommaSepDownloadURLs)," ",",") ' Replace the Download URLs field from original line with the new comma separated value strLine = Replace(strLine,strDownloadURLsField,strCommaSepDownloadURLs,1,-1,vbTextCompare) ' remove this unnecessary data anywhere it might exist in the files column Dim strNewFilesField strNewFilesField = arrLine(5) For Each strUselessData In dictUselessData.Keys strNewFilesField = Replace(strNewFilesField,strUselessData,"",1,-1,vbTextCompare) Next strLine = Replace(strLine,arrLine(5),strNewFilesField) End If End If ReplaceCustomXPURL = strLine End Function 'ReplaceCustomXPURL
Function GetPatchManagementValueFromRegistry(strPatchManagementValue)
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPatchManagementValueData, strFoundTaniumRegistryPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "Software\Tanium\Tanium Client\PatchManagement" keyWoWPath = "Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client\PatchManagement"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPatchManagementValueData = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&keyNativePath&"\"&strPatchManagementValue) On Error Goto 0 strFoundTaniumRegistryPath = keyNativePath
If strPatchManagementValueData = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPatchManagementValueData = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&keyWoWPath&"\"&strPatchManagementValue) On Error Goto 0 strFoundTaniumRegistryPath = keyWoWPath End If
If Not strPatchManagementValueData = "" Then GetPatchManagementValueFromRegistry = strPatchManagementValueData Else GetPatchManagementValueFromRegistry = "" End If End Function 'GetPatchManagementValueFromRegistry

sensor.name: Installed Patches
sensor.description: Multi-column Sensor that shows operating system patches that are installed to this computer. The title, severity, bulletin, date, total package size, and KB article for the patch are displayed. Example: Security Update for Windows Server 2003 (KB2510531) | Critical | MS11-031 | 2011-04 | 947 kB | KB2510531|CVE-2011-0663

query.script:
'======================================== ' Installed Patches '========================================
Option Explicit
Dim objFSO, fn, objReadFile, contents, path, strSep, hasOutput strSep = "|"
'title|severity|bulletins|date|download|filename|status|guid|package size|kb|cve
path = GetTaniumDir("Tools\Scans") Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject") fn = path & "\patchresultsreadable.txt"
If objFSO.FileExists(fn) Then Set objReadFile = objFSO.OpenTextFile(fn, 1, False)
Dim strLine, words, strFilename, strPatchDir, arrFilenames, isComplete
hasOutput = False
Do While Not objReadFile.AtEndOfStream strLine = objReadFile.ReadLine
'CHECK FOR MULTI-URL PATCHES words = Split(strLine, strSep)
'Ignore old Patch Results format without separator If UBound(words) < 4 Then If left(words(0), 4) = "Scan" Then hasOutput = True WScript.Echo words(0) 'Else ' WScript.Echo "Run upgraded Patch Scan" ' WScript.Quit End If ' ElseIf InStr(strDownload, ",") = 0 And InStr(strDownload, " ") = 0 Then Else arrFilenames = Split(words(5), ",") 'patch filename must be in Tools\Patch directory for queue Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject")
strPatchDir = GetTaniumDir("Tools\Patches")
isComplete = True For Each strFilename In arrFilenames If Not fso.FileExists(strPatchDir & "\" & strFilename) Then isComplete = False End If Next
If Not isComplete Then hasOutput = True If InStr(strLine, "Already Installed") Then if InStr(strLine, "(KB") Then strLine = Replace(strLine, "Already Installed", "KB Already Installed") End If WScript.Echo strLine Else 'Do not echo since we only want to output "Installed" patches End If Else 'If we're here, update has been queued 'Do not echo since we only want to output "Installed" patches 'If InStr(strLine, "Not Installed") Then ' strLine = Replace(strLine, "Not Installed", "Queued") ' WScript.Echo strLine 'End If End If End If Loop
If Not hasOutput Then WScript.Echo "All available patches queued for installation" End If
objReadFile.close Else Wscript.echo "Patch results output not found" End if WScript.Quit()
Function GetTaniumDir(strSubDir) 'GetTaniumDir with GeneratePath, works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 End If
If Not strPath = "" Then If strSubDir <> "" Then strSubDir = "\" & strSubDir End If
Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject") If fso.FolderExists(strPath) Then If Not fso.FolderExists(strPath & strSubDir) Then ''Need to loop through strSubDir and create all sub directories GeneratePath strPath & strSubDir, fso End If GetTaniumDir = strPath & strSubDir & "\" Else ' Specified Path doesn't exist on the filesystem WScript.Echo "Error: " & strPath & " does not exist on the filesystem" GetTaniumDir = False End If Else WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot find Tanium Client path in Registry" GetTaniumDir = False End If End Function 'GetTaniumDir
Function GeneratePath(pFolderPath, fso) GeneratePath = False
If Not fso.FolderExists(pFolderPath) Then If GeneratePath(fso.GetParentFolderName(pFolderPath), fso) Then GeneratePath = True Call fso.CreateFolder(pFolderPath) End If Else GeneratePath = True End If End Function 'GeneratePath

sensor.name: Patches Currently Installing
sensor.description: Shows information about patches that are installing on endpoints when the question is asked. Example: Title | Severity | KB Article

query.script:
'======================================== ' Patches Currently Installing '========================================
' sensor - patches currently installing ' This sensor will report the patches currently installing ' the columns look like ' title|severity|KB Article
Option Explicit
Const FORREADING = 1
Dim objFSO,objTextFile,strInstallingCurrentlyTextFilePath Dim strScanDir
Dim strSep : strSep = "|" Dim strLine,arrLine,strGUID,strCVE
Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject")
strScanDir = GetTaniumDir("Tools\Scans") strInstallingCurrentlyTextFilePath = strScanDir & "\installingcurrently.txt"
If Not objFSO.FileExists(strInstallingCurrentlyTextFilePath) Then Set objFSO = Nothing WScript.Quit End If
' read contents of file Set objTextFile = objFSO.OpenTextFile(strInstallingCurrentlyTextFilePath,FORREADING)
While objTextFile.AtEndOfStream = False strLine = objTextFile.ReadLine arrLine = Split(strLine,strSep) If IsArray(arrLine) Then If UBound(arrLine) > 1 Then WScript.Echo strLine Else ' WScript.Echo "Error parsing results file" End If Else ' WScript.Echo "Error parsing results file" End If Wend
objTextFile.Close Set objTextFile = Nothing Set objFSO = Nothing
Function GetTaniumDir(strSubDir) 'GetTaniumDir with GeneratePath, works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 End If
If Not strPath = "" Then If strSubDir <> "" Then strSubDir = "\" & strSubDir End If
Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject") If fso.FolderExists(strPath) Then If Not fso.FolderExists(strPath & strSubDir) Then ''Need to loop through strSubDir and create all sub directories GeneratePath strPath & strSubDir, fso End If GetTaniumDir = strPath & strSubDir & "\" Else ' Specified Path doesn't exist on the filesystem WScript.Echo "Error: " & strPath & " does not exist on the filesystem" GetTaniumDir = False End If Else WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot find Tanium Client path in Registry" GetTaniumDir = False End If End Function 'GetTaniumDir
Function GeneratePath(pFolderPath, fso) GeneratePath = False
If Not fso.FolderExists(pFolderPath) Then If GeneratePath(fso.GetParentFolderName(pFolderPath), fso) Then GeneratePath = True Call fso.CreateFolder(pFolderPath) End If Else GeneratePath = True End If End Function 'GeneratePath

sensor.name: Currently Running Patch Installer
sensor.description: Returns Yes or No depending on whether the patch installer script is running. This differs from the sensor "Patches Currently Installing" which returns the patches that are installing on endpoints. Example: Yes

query.script:
'======================================== ' Currently Running Patch Installer '========================================
'' sensor to report on if a machine has been running a command and command line passed in ' for longer than a time threshold - modified for patch install
Option Explicit
Dim intSecondsOldThreshold,strExecutableName,strCommandLinePartial Dim strSep
intSecondsOldThreshold = 30 strExecutableName = "cscript.exe" strCommandLinePartial = "install-patches.vbs"
ExecutionStartTimeSecondsOld strExecutableName,strCommandLinePartial
Sub ExecutionStartTimeSecondsOld(strExecutable, strCommandLineMatch) ' This function will return the execution start time of exectuable / command line ' instances running. if the executable ' passed in is running with a command line that matches part of what ' the CommandLineMatch parameter, it will be added to the count. If the count is greater ' than one, we can assume this process is already running, so don't run the scan.
Const HKLM = &h80000002
Dim objWMIService,colItems Dim objItem,strCmd,intRunningCount,intSecondsOld
strCommandLineMatch = LCase(strCommandLineMatch) intRunningCount = 0 On Error Resume Next
SetLocale(1033) ' Uses Date Math which requires us/english to work correctly
Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\.\root\cimv2")
Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select CreationDate,CommandLine from Win32_Process where Name = '"&strExecutable&"'",,48) For Each objItem in colItems strCmd = LCase(objItem.CommandLine) If InStr(strCmd,strCommandLineMatch) > 0 Then intRunningCount = intRunningCount + 1 End If If intRunningCount > 0 Then intSecondsOld = GetSecondsOld(ConvertDate(objItem.CreationDate)) If IsNumeric(intSecondsOld) Then If intSecondsOld > intSecondsOldThreshold Then WScript.Echo "Yes" WScript.Quit Else WScript.Echo "No" WScript.Quit End If End If Else WScript.Echo "No" WScript.Quit End If Next On Error Goto 0
End Sub 'ExecutionStartTimeSecondsOld
Function ConvertDate(dtString) 'SetLocale outside of function in global scope If Not GetLocale = 1033 Then WScript.Echo "Locale Code must be 1033, use SetLocale" WScript.Quit End If
Dim dtDate dtDate = left(dtString,InStr(dtString,".")-1)
dtDate = CDate(Mid(dtDate, 5, 2) & "/" & _ Mid(dtDate, 7, 2) & "/" & Left(dtDate, 4) _ & " " & Mid (dtDate, 9, 2) & ":" & _ Mid(dtDate, 11, 2) & ":" & Mid(dtDate, _ 13, 2)) ConvertDate = dtDate End Function 'ConvertDate
Function GetSecondsOld(strDate) Dim objDate If IsDate(strDate) Then objDate = FormatDateTime(strDate, 0) Else GetSecondsOld = "Bad Date Value to GetSecondsOld" End If GetSecondsOld = DateDiff("s", objDate, Now()) End Function 'GetSecondsOld

sensor.name: Patch Exclusions
sensor.description: Multi-column Sensor that shows operating system patches that have been excluded on this computer. The title, severity, bulletin, date, total package size, and KB article for the patch are displayed. Example: Security Update for Windows Server 2003 (KB2510531) | Critical | MS11-031 | 2011-04 | 947 kB | KB2510531|CVE-2011-0663

query.script:
'======================================== ' Patch Exclusions '========================================
Option Explicit
Dim objFSO, fn, objReadFile, contents, path, strSep, hasOutput strSep = "|"
'title|severity|bulletins|date|download|filename|status|guid|package size|kb|cve
Dim strScansPath, strToolsPath strToolsPath = GetTaniumDir("Tools") strScansPath = GetTaniumDir("Tools\Scans") Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject") fn = strScansPath & "\patchresultsreadable.txt"
'Set up exclusions list Dim excludeFile excludeFile = strToolsPath & "\patch-exclude.txt"
Dim objExclusions Set objExclusions = GetPatchExclusions(excludeFile)
If objFSO.FileExists(fn) Then Set objReadFile = objFSO.OpenTextFile(fn, 1, False)
Dim strLine, words, strFilename, strPatchDir, arrFilenames, isComplete
hasOutput = False
Do While Not objReadFile.AtEndOfStream strLine = objReadFile.ReadLine
'CHECK FOR MULTI-URL PATCHES words = Split(strLine, strSep)
'Ignore old Patch Results format without separator If UBound(words) < 4 Then If left(words(0), 4) = "Scan" Then hasOutput = True WScript.Echo words(0) 'Else ' WScript.Echo "Run upgraded Patch Scan" ' WScript.Quit End If ' ElseIf InStr(strDownload, ",") = 0 And InStr(strDownload, " ") = 0 Then Else arrFilenames = Split(words(5), ",") 'patch filename must be in Tools\Patch directory for queue Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject")
strPatchDir = GetTaniumDir("Tools\Patches")
isComplete = True For Each strFilename In arrFilenames If Not fso.FileExists(strPatchDir & "\" & strFilename) Then isComplete = False End If Next
If Not isComplete Then hasOutput = True If InStr(strLine, "Already Installed") Then 'if InStr(strLine, "(KB") Then ' strLine = Replace(strLine, "Already Installed", "KB Already Installed") 'End If 'Do not echo since we only want to output "Installed" patches Else 'Check to see if KB article should be excluded If IsExclusion(strLine, objExclusions) Then WScript.Echo strLine End If End If Else 'If we're here, update has been queued 'Do not echo since we only want to output "Installed" patches 'If InStr(strLine, "Not Installed") Then ' strLine = Replace(strLine, "Not Installed", "Queued") ' WScript.Echo strLine 'End If End If End If Loop
If Not hasOutput Then WScript.Echo "All available patches queued for installation" End If
objReadFile.close Else Wscript.echo "Patch results output not found" End if WScript.Quit()
Function RegKeyExists(reg, sHive, sRegKey) Dim aValueNames, aValueTypes If reg.EnumValues(sHive, sRegKey, aValueNames, aValueTypes) = 0 Then RegKeyExists = True Else RegKeyExists = False End If End Function
Function GetTaniumDir(strSubDir) 'GetTaniumDir with GeneratePath, works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 End If
If Not strPath = "" Then If strSubDir <> "" Then strSubDir = "\" & strSubDir End If
Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject") If fso.FolderExists(strPath) Then If Not fso.FolderExists(strPath & strSubDir) Then ''Need to loop through strSubDir and create all sub directories GeneratePath strPath & strSubDir, fso End If GetTaniumDir = strPath & strSubDir & "\" Else ' Specified Path doesn't exist on the filesystem WScript.Echo "Error: " & strPath & " does not exist on the filesystem" GetTaniumDir = False End If Else WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot find Tanium Client path in Registry" GetTaniumDir = False End If End Function 'GetTaniumDir
Function GeneratePath(pFolderPath, fso) GeneratePath = False
If Not fso.FolderExists(pFolderPath) Then If GeneratePath(fso.GetParentFolderName(pFolderPath), fso) Then GeneratePath = True Call fso.CreateFolder(pFolderPath) End If Else GeneratePath = True End If End Function 'GeneratePath
Function IsExclusion(strLine, objDic) Dim colKeys, strKey colKeys = objDic.Keys For Each strKey in colKeys If InStr(strLine, strSep & strKey & strSep) <> 0 Then IsExclusion = True Exit Function End If Next
IsExclusion = False End Function
Function GetPatchExclusions(strFile) Dim oDic Set oDic = CreateObject("scripting.dictionary")
Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject")
Const ForReading = 1 If fso.FileExists(strFile) Then Dim objFile Set objFile = fso.OpenTextFile(strFile, ForReading)
Dim strLine Do While objFile.AtEndOfStream <> True strLine = Trim(objFile.ReadLine)
'Ignore lines that start with # If Left(strLine, 1) <> "#" Then oDic.Item(strLine) = "placeholder" End If Loop End If
Set GetPatchExclusions = oDic End Function

sensor.name: Available Patch Status
sensor.description: Provides a high level snapshot view of the patch application status of the environment. Example: More than 5 Critical Patches Required

query.script:
'======================================== ' Available Patch Status '========================================
Option Explicit
Dim objFSO, fn, objReadFile, contents, path, strSep, hasOutput, intCriticalThreshold strSep = "|" intCriticalThreshold = 5
Dim showSingleStatus showSingleStatus = True
'title|severity|bulletins|date|download|filename|status|package size|kb
path = GetTaniumDir("Tools\Scans") Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject") fn = path & "\patchresultsreadable.txt"
If objFSO.FileExists(fn) Then Set objReadFile = objFSO.OpenTextFile(fn, 1, False)
Dim strLine, words, strFilename, strPatchDir, arrFilenames, isComplete
hasOutput = False
'note: intNone refers to patches with severity=none Dim intCritical, intImportant, intModerate, intLow, intNone
intCritical = 0 intImportant = 0 intModerate = 0 intLow = 0 intNone = 0
Do While Not objReadFile.AtEndOfStream strLine = objReadFile.ReadLine
'CHECK FOR MULTI-URL PATCHES words = Split(strLine, strSep)
'Ignore old Patch Results format without separator If UBound(words) < 4 Then If left(words(0), 4) = "Scan" Then hasOutput = True WScript.Echo words(0) Else WScript.Echo "Run upgraded Patch Scan" WScript.Quit End If Else arrFilenames = Split(words(5), ",") 'patch filename must be in Tools\Patch directory for queue Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject")
strPatchDir = GetTaniumDir("Tools\Patches")
isComplete = True For Each strFilename In arrFilenames If Not fso.FileExists(strPatchDir & "\" & strFilename) Then isComplete = False End If Next
If Not isComplete Then If InStr(strLine, "Already Installed") Then 'Do not echo since we only want to output "Available" patches Else hasOutput = True Select Case words(1) Case "Critical" intCritical = intCritical + 1 Case "Important" intImportant = intImportant + 1 Case "Moderate" intModerate = intModerate + 1 Case "Low" intLow = intLow + 1 Case "None" intNone = intNone + 1 End Select
End If Else 'If we're here, update has been queued 'Do not echo since we only want to output "Installed" patches 'If InStr(strLine, "Not Installed") Then ' strLine = Replace(strLine, "Not Installed", "Queued") ' WScript.Echo strLine 'End If End If End If Loop
objReadFile.close
If hasOutput Then If intCritical > 5 Then WScript.Echo "More than 5 Critical Patches Required" If showSingleStatus Then WScript.Quit End If If intCritical > 0 Then WScript.Echo "Critical Patches Required" If showSingleStatus Then WScript.Quit End If If intImportant > 0 Then WScript.Echo "Important Patches Required" If showSingleStatus Then WScript.Quit End If If intModerate > 0 Then WScript.Echo "Moderate Patches Required" If showSingleStatus Then WScript.Quit End If If intLow > 0 Then WScript.Echo "Low Patches Required" If showSingleStatus Then WScript.Quit End If If intNone > 0 Then WScript.Echo "Non-Severe Patches Required" If showSingleStatus Then WScript.Quit End If Else WScript.Echo "No Security Patches Required" End If
Else Wscript.echo "Patch results output not found" End if
Function GetTaniumDir(strSubDir) 'GetTaniumDir with GeneratePath, works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 End If
If Not strPath = "" Then If strSubDir <> "" Then strSubDir = "\" & strSubDir End If
Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject") If fso.FolderExists(strPath) Then If Not fso.FolderExists(strPath & strSubDir) Then ''Need to loop through strSubDir and create all sub directories GeneratePath strPath & strSubDir, fso End If GetTaniumDir = strPath & strSubDir & "\" Else ' Specified Path doesn't exist on the filesystem WScript.Echo "Error: " & strPath & " does not exist on the filesystem" GetTaniumDir = False End If Else WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot find Tanium Client path in Registry" GetTaniumDir = False End If End Function 'GetTaniumDir
Function GeneratePath(pFolderPath, fso) GeneratePath = False
If Not fso.FolderExists(pFolderPath) Then If GeneratePath(fso.GetParentFolderName(pFolderPath), fso) Then GeneratePath = True Call fso.CreateFolder(pFolderPath) End If Else GeneratePath = True End If End Function 'GeneratePath

sensor.name: Patch Failures
sensor.parameter_definition: {"parameters":[{"values":["Yes","No"],"helpString":"Enter Yes, or No, to return failures for applicable patches only","requireSelection":true,"promptText":"Yes/No","defaultValue":"","value":"","label":"Show failures only for needed patches","key":"ShowOnlyIfApplicable","parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::DropDownParameter","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::DropDownParameter"}],"parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray"}
sensor.description: Pulls patches which have failed to install out of a client's patch history. Example: title | error | date

query.script:
'======================================== ' Patch Failures '========================================
' sensor: patch failures ' paramterized sensor which can show failures for all patches ' or only for patches which are failed but necessary
Option Explicit
Const FORREADING = 1
Dim objFSO,objTextFile Dim dictHistory Dim strScanDir Dim strHistoryTextReadableFilePath Dim strSep : strSep = "|" Dim strLine,arrLine,strGUID,strCVE Dim strTitle,strKB,strBulletin,strDate,strException,strSeverity Dim dictResults,bShowOnlyIfApplicable,strShowOnlyIfApplicable Dim strResultsReadableFilePath,strInstallStatus,strTaniumPatchID
' take parameter strShowOnlyIfApplicable=Trim(Unescape("||ShowOnlyIfApplicable||"))
Select Case LCase(strShowOnlyIfApplicable) Case "yes" bShowOnlyIfApplicable = True Case "true" bShowOnlyIfApplicable = True Case "no" bShowOnlyIfApplicable = False Case "false" bShowOnlyIfApplicable = False Case "" bShowOnlyIfApplicable = True Case Else WScript.Echo "Parameter must be Yes or No, Quitting" WScript.Quit End Select
Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject") strScanDir = GetTaniumDir("Tools\Scans")
strHistoryTextReadableFilePath = strScanDir&"patchhistoryreadable.txt" strResultsReadableFilePath = strScanDir&"patchresultsreadable.txt"
If Not objFSO.FileExists(strHistoryTextReadableFilePath) Then WScript.Echo "Cannot find History file" Set objFSO = Nothing WScript.Quit End If
'uses date math, may need locale set SetLocale(GetTaniumLocale)
Set dictHistory = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary")
' read History into dictionary Set objTextFile = objFSO.OpenTextFile(strHistoryTextReadableFilePath,FORREADING) While objTextFile.AtEndOfStream = False strLine = objTextFile.ReadLine arrLine = Split(strLine,strSep) If IsArray(arrLine) Then If UBound(arrLine) > 0 Then If Not dictHistory.Exists(strLine) Then dictHistory.Add strLine,1 End If Else ' WScript.Echo "Error parsing results file" End If Else ' WScript.Echo "Error parsing results file" End If Wend objTextFile.Close
Set dictResults = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary") If bShowOnlyIfApplicable Then ' We will tie the GUID in history to the GUID here - if it exists in patch results and if it says ' not installed, only then will we write it ' Read results into dictionary Set objTextFile = objFSO.OpenTextFile(strResultsReadableFilePath,FORREADING) While objTextFile.AtEndOfStream = False strLine = objTextFile.ReadLine ' WScript.Echo strLIne 'element 5 must be not installed arrLine = Split(strLine,strSep) If IsArray(arrLine) Then If UBound(arrLine) > 0 Then ' pull GUID to use as key strGUID = arrLine(7) If Not (UBound(arrLine) > 4 And dictResults.Exists(strGUID)) Then dictResults.Add strGUID,strLine End If Else ' WScript.Echo "Error parsing results file" End If Else ' WScript.Echo "Error parsing results file" End If Wend objTextFile.Close End If
Dim strkey
For Each strkey In dictHistory.Keys ' WScript.Echo dictHistory.Item(strkey) strLine = strkey ' 13 History Columns ' GUID|Operation|Result|Exception|Install Date|Publish Date|Title|FirstNeededDate|Severity|MS ID|KB|CVE ID|Size|PatchID arrLine = Split(strLine,strSep) If IsArray(arrLine) Then If UBound(arrLine) > 11 Then If LCase(arrLine(1)) = "installation" And LCase(arrLine(2)) = "failed" Then ' install failure ' report title, kb, bulletin, date, and exception strGUID = arrLine(0) strTitle=arrLine(6) strKB=arrLine(10) strBulletin=arrLine(9) strCVE = arrLine(11) On Error Resume Next ' Convert from UTC to Local and show only the date strDate = FormatDateTime(DateAdd("n",GetTZBias,CDate(arrLine(4))),vbShortDate) If Err.Number <> 0 Then strDate = "Unknown" Err.Clear End If On Error Goto 0 strException=arrLine(3) strSeverity=arrLine(8) If UBound(arrLine) > 12 Then strTaniumPatchID=arrLine(13) Else strTaniumPatchID="Unknown" End If If bShowOnlyIfApplicable Then If dictResults.Exists(strGUID) Then strInstallStatus = Split(dictResults.Item(strGUID),"|")(6) If LCase(strInstallStatus) = "not installed" Then WScript.Echo strTitle&strSep&strException&strSep&strDate _ &strSep&strKB&strSep&strBulletin&strSep&strSeverity&strSep&strCVE _ &strSep&strTaniumPatchID End If End If Else WScript.Echo strTitle&strSep&strException&strSep&strDate _ &strSep&strKB&strSep&strBulletin&strSep&strSeverity&strSep&strCVE _ &strSep&strTaniumPatchID End If End If Else ' WScript.Echo "History Line malformed - needs 11 fields" End If Else 'WScript.Echo "History Line Malformed" ' not pipe splittable End If Next
Function GetTaniumDir(strSubDir) 'GetTaniumDir with GeneratePath, works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 End If
If Not strPath = "" Then If strSubDir <> "" Then strSubDir = "\" & strSubDir End If
Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject") If fso.FolderExists(strPath) Then If Not fso.FolderExists(strPath & strSubDir) Then ''Need to loop through strSubDir and create all sub directories GeneratePath strPath & strSubDir, fso End If GetTaniumDir = strPath & strSubDir & "\" Else ' Specified Path doesn't exist on the filesystem WScript.Echo "Error: " & strPath & " does not exist on the filesystem" GetTaniumDir = False End If Else WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot find Tanium Client path in Registry" GetTaniumDir = False End If End Function 'GetTaniumDir
Function GeneratePath(pFolderPath, fso) GeneratePath = False
If Not fso.FolderExists(pFolderPath) Then If GeneratePath(fso.GetParentFolderName(pFolderPath), fso) Then GeneratePath = True Call fso.CreateFolder(pFolderPath) End If Else GeneratePath = True End If End Function 'GeneratePath
Function GetTaniumLocale '' This function will retrieve the locale value ' previously set which governs Tanium content that ' is locale sensitive.
Dim objWshShell Dim intLocaleID
Set objWshShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell") On Error Resume Next intLocaleID = objWshShell.RegRead("HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client\LocaleID") If Err.Number <> 0 Then intLocaleID = objWshShell.RegRead("HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client\LocaleID") End If On Error Goto 0 If intLocaleID = "" Then GetTaniumLocale = 1033 ' default to us/English Else GetTaniumLocale = intLocaleID End If
' Cleanup Set objWshShell = Nothing
End Function 'GetTaniumLocale
Function GetTZBias ' This functiong returns the number of minutes ' (positive or negative) to add to current time to get UTC ' considers daylight savings
Dim objLocalTimeZone, intTZBiasInMinutes
For Each objLocalTimeZone in GetObject("winmgmts:").InstancesOf("Win32_ComputerSystem") intTZBiasInMinutes = objLocalTimeZone.CurrentTimeZone Next
GetTZBias = intTZBiasInMinutes
End Function 'GetTZBias

sensor.name: Queued Patches
sensor.description: Sensor which shows information about patches queued for install. Example: Security Update for Windows Server 2003 (KB2510531) | Critical | MS11-031 | 2011-04 | 947 kB | KB2510531|CVE-2011-0663

query.script:
