hasResults = False For Each objItem in colItems strType = "Other" Select Case objItem.Type Case 0 strType = "Disk Drive" Case 1 strType = "Print Queue" Case 2 strType = "Device" Case 3 strType = "IPC" Case else End Select strShareName = objItem.Name 'strPerms = GetPerms(strShareName) strResult = strShareName & strSep & objItem.Path & strSep & objItem.Status & strSep & strType & strSep & strPerms & GetPerms(strShareName)
bShouldList = True For Each strItem In dictBlacklist.Keys If InStr(LCase(strResult), strItem) > 0 Then bShouldList = False End If Next
If bShouldList Then WScript.Echo strResult hasResults = True End If Next
If Not hasResults Then WScript.Echo "No shares" End If
Function GetPerms(strShareName) Dim ArrResult() intSize= 0 ReDim Preserve ArrResult(intSize) 'wscript.echo strShareName Dim objWMIService : Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\.\root\cimv2")
Dim colItems : Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("SELECT * FROM Win32_LogicalShareSecuritySetting where NAME=" & "'" & strShareName & "'") For Each objItem In colItems
intRtn = objItem.GetSecurityDescriptor(wmiSecurityDescriptor)
colDACLs = wmiSecurityDescriptor.DACL
For Each objACE In colDACLs
Set objUserGroup = objACE.Trustee
Select Case objACE.AccessMask Case 1179817 strPermission = "READ" Case 1245631 strPermission = "CHANGE" Case 2032127 strPermission = "FULL CONTROL" End Select ReDim Preserve ArrResult(intSize) 'wscript.echo (Ucase(objUserGroup.Name)) & " | " & strPermission
ArrResult(intSize) = (Ucase(objUserGroup.Name)) & "-" & strPermission 'wscript.echo intSize intSize = intSize + 1 Next Next GetPerms = Join(ArrResult, "\") End Function

sensor.name: Password Policy Details
sensor.description: Returns various data about a machines externally or locally defined Password Policy. Example: maximum age | minimum age | enforced history | minimum length | lockout duration | lockout threshold | lockout observation window

query.script:
'======================================== ' Password Policy Details '========================================
On Error Resume Next
Dim objRoot, objDomain, strSep 'Maximum Password Age | Minimum Password Age | Enforced Password History | Minimum Password Length | Lockout Duration| Lockout Threshold |Lockout Observation Window strSep = "|"
Set objRoot = GETOBJECT("LDAP://RootDSE") Set objDomain = GETOBJECT("LDAP://" & objRoot.GET("defaultNamingContext"))
If IsEmpty(objDomain) Then GetSecPolDetails strSep Else
maximumPasswordAge = int(Int8ToSec(objDomain.GET("maxPwdAge")) / 86400) 'convert to days minimumPasswordAge = Int8ToSec(objDomain.GET("minPwdAge")) / 86400 'convert to days minimumPasswordLength = objDomain.GET("minPwdLength") accountLockoutDuration = Int8ToSec(objDomain.GET("lockoutDuration")) / 60 'convert to minutes lockoutThreshold = objDomain.GET("lockoutThreshold") lockoutObservationWindow = Int8ToSec(objDomain.GET("lockoutObservationWindow")) / 60 'convert to minutes passwordHistory = objDomain.GET("pwdHistoryLength")
wscript.echo maximumPasswordAge & " days" & strSep & _ minimumPasswordAge & " days" & strSep & _ passwordHistory & " passwords remembered" & strSep & _ minimumPasswordLength & " characters" & strSep & _ accountLockoutDuration & " minutes" & strSep & _ lockoutThreshold & " invalid logon attempts" & strSep & _ lockoutObservationWindow & " minutes"
End If
FUNCTION GetSecPolDetails(strSep)
Dim objShell,objScriptExec Dim strCommand, arrNetAccResults, strNetAccResults Dim strNetAccLine, strMinAge, strMaxAge, strPWDHist, strMinLength Dim strLockDur, strLockThresh, strLockWindow Dim bPrintLine, bNewInterface
strCommand = "net accounts"
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell") Set objScriptExec = objShell.Exec (strCommand)
strNetAccResults = LCase(objScriptExec.StdOut.ReadAll) arrNetAccResults = Split(LCase(strNetAccResults),vbCrLf)
For Each strNetAccLine In arrNetAccResults If InStr(strNetAccLine,"minimum password age") > 0 Then strMinAge = Trim(Split(strNetAccLine,":")(1)) End If If InStr(strNetAccLine, "maximum password") > 0 Then strMaxAge = Trim(Split(strNetAccLine,": ")(1)) End If If InStr(strNetAccLine, "minimum password length") > 0 Then strMinLength = Trim(Split(strNetAccLine,":")(1)) End If If InStr(strNetAccLine, "password history") > 0 Then strPWDHist = Trim(Split(strNetAccLine,":")(1)) End If If InStr(strNetAccLine, "password history") & InStr(strNetAccLine, "none") Then strPWDHist = "0" End If If InStr(strNetAccLine, "lockout threshold") > 0 Then strLockThresh = Trim(Split(strNetAccLine,":")(1)) End If If InStr(strNetAccLine, "lockout threshold") & InStr(strNetAccLine, "never") Then strLockThresh = "0" End If If InStr(strNetAccLine,"lockout duration") > 0 Then strLockDur = Trim(Split(strNetAccLine,":")(1)) End If If InStr(strNetAccLine,"lockout observation") > 0 Then strLockWindow = Trim(Split(strNetAccLine,":")(1)) End If
Next 'WScript.Echo strMaxAge & " days" & strSep & strMinAge & " days" & strSep & strPWDHist & " passwords remembered" & strSep & strMinLength & " characters" & strSep & strLockDur & " minutes" & strSep & strLockThresh & " invalid logon attempts" & strSep & strLockWindow & " minutes"
WScript.Echo strPWDHist & " passwords remembered" '& strSep & strMinLength & " characters" & strSep & strLockDur & " minutes" & strSep & strLockThresh & " invalid logon attempts" & strSep & strLockWindow & " minutes"
'Cleanup Set objScriptExec = Nothing Set objShell = Nothing END FUNCTION 'GetSecPolDetails
FUNCTION Int8ToSec(BYVAL objInt8) ' Function to convert Integer8 attributes from ' 64-bit numbers to seconds. DIM lngHigh, lngLow lngHigh = objInt8.HighPart ' Account for error in IADsLargeInteger property methods. lngLow = objInt8.LowPart IF lngLow < 0 THEN lngHigh = lngHigh + 1 END IF Int8ToSec = -(lngHigh * (2 ^ 32) + lngLow) / (10000000) END FUNCTION

sensor.name: Unmanaged Assets
sensor.description: IP addresses of machines in the network that do not have the Tanium Client running. When possible, unmanaged assets will return the IP address, the machine name, and the MAC address Example: 192.168.1.2 | my-machine-name | 00-22-9a-3e-91-5f

query.script:
'======================================== ' Unmanaged Applications '========================================
Option Explicit
'' ---- Begin Customer Modifiable ---- ' This minutes old threshold will determine how new a file must be ' in order to have results reported by the sensor. Ideally this would ' match the reissuance frequency of the scan Dim intMinutesOldThreshold intMinutesOldThreshold = 60 ' ---- End Customer Modifiable ---'
Dim objFSO, fn, objReadFile, contents, path, strSep, hasOutput 'ip address|name|mac address
path = GetTaniumDir("Tools\Scans") Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject") fn = path & "uaresultsreadable.txt"
If objFSO.FileExists(fn) Then Dim dtmModified,minutesOld dtmModified = objFSO.GetFile(fn).DateLastModified If IsDate(dtmModified) Then minutesOld = GetMinutesOld(dtmModified) If CDbl(minutesOld) >= intMinutesOldThreshold Then WScript.Echo "Results older than " & intMinutesOldThreshold & " - waiting to rescan" WScript.Quit(0) End If End If
Set objReadFile = objFSO.OpenTextFile(fn, 1, False)
Dim strLine, words, strFilename, strPatchDir, arrFilenames, isComplete
hasOutput = False
Do While Not objReadFile.AtEndOfStream hasOutput = True strLine = objReadFile.ReadLine
WScript.Echo strLine Loop objReadFile.Close
If Not hasOutput Then WScript.Echo "Unmanaged assets not found" End If Else Wscript.echo "Unmanaged Asset scan results not found" End if WScript.Quit()
Function GetMinutesOld(strDate) Dim patternDate,today patternDate = CDate( strDate ) today = CDate( now ) GetMinutesOld = DateDiff("n", patternDate, today) End Function
Function RegKeyExists(reg, sHive, sRegKey) Dim aValueNames, aValueTypes If reg.EnumValues(sHive, sRegKey, aValueNames, aValueTypes) = 0 Then RegKeyExists = True Else RegKeyExists = False End If End Function
Function GetTaniumDir(strSubDir) 'GetTaniumDir with GeneratePath, works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 End If
If Not strPath = "" Then If strSubDir <> "" Then strSubDir = "\" & strSubDir End If
Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject") If fso.FolderExists(strPath) Then If Not fso.FolderExists(strPath & strSubDir) Then ''Need to loop through strSubDir and create all sub directories GeneratePath strPath & strSubDir, fso End If GetTaniumDir = strPath & strSubDir & "\" Else ' Specified Path doesn't exist on the filesystem WScript.Echo "Error: " & strPath & " does not exist on the filesystem" GetTaniumDir = False End If Else WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot find Tanium Client path in Registry" GetTaniumDir = False End If End Function 'GetTaniumDir
Function GeneratePath(pFolderPath, fso) GeneratePath = False
If Not fso.FolderExists(pFolderPath) Then If GeneratePath(fso.GetParentFolderName(pFolderPath), fso) Then GeneratePath = True Call fso.CreateFolder(pFolderPath) End If Else GeneratePath = True End If End Function 'GeneratePath

sensor.name: USB Storage Devices
sensor.description: Returns a list of USB storage devices currently plugged in to the client machine. Example: USB Mass Storage Device

query.script:
'======================================== ' USB Storage Devices '========================================
On Error Resume Next strComputer = "." Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\" & strComputer & "\root\cimv2") Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select * from Win32_PnPEntity where (Status='OK' and Service='USBSTOR')",,48)
hasResults = False
For Each objItem in colItems hasResults = True Wscript.Echo objItem.Caption Next
If Not hasResults Then WScript.Echo "No devices" End If

#!/bin/bash for udi in $(/usr/bin/hal-find-by-capability --capability storage) do device=$(hal-get-property --udi $udi --key block.device) vendor=$(hal-get-property --udi $udi --key storage.vendor) model=$(hal-get-property --udi $udi --key storage.model) if [[ $(hal-get-property --udi $udi --key storage.bus) = "usb" ]] then parent_udi=$(hal-find-by-property --key block.storage_device --string $udi) mount=$(hal-get-property --udi $parent_udi --key volume.mount_point) label=$(hal-get-property --udi $parent_udi --key volume.label) media_size=$(hal-get-property --udi $udi --key storage.removable.media_size) size=$(( $media_size / ( 1000 * 1000 * 1000 ) )) # printf "$vendor $model $device $mount $label "${size}GB" \n" printf "$vendor $model "${size}GB" \n" fi done

sensor.name: No Screen Saver Password
sensor.description: Returns the users which have no screen saver password set. Example: Domain\John.Doe

query.script:
'======================================== ' No Screen Saver Password '========================================
strComputer = "." Set objWMIService = GetObject(_ "winmgmts:\\" & strComputer & "\root\cimv2") Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery(_ "Select * from Win32_Desktop") For Each objItem in colItems If objItem.ScreenSaverSecure = False Then If InStr(LCase(objItem.Name), "nt authority") = 0 Then WScript.Echo objItem.Name End If End If Next

sensor.name: USB Write Protected
sensor.description: Outputs True if USB storage devices connected to the client machine are set to write protected mode and false if not. Example: False

query.script:
'======================================== ' USB Write Protected '========================================
' This sensor will output True if USB storage devices are ' set to write protect mode and false if not
Option Explicit
If USBWriteProtected Then WScript.Echo "True" Else WScript.Echo "False" End If
Function USBWriteProtected ' This function will look into the registry to determine if USB storage devices ' are write protected
Const HKLM = &H80000002
Dim objRegistry, objWMIService Dim strComputer Dim strUSBWriteProtectKey Dim strUSBWriteProtectValueName, dwordWriteProtectValue
strComputer = "." Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:" _ & "{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\" & strComputer & "\root\cimv2")
Set objRegistry = _ GetObject("winmgmts:{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\" _ & strComputer & "\root\default:StdRegProv")
strUSBWriteProtectKey = "SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\StorageDevicePolicies" strUSBWriteProtectValueName = "WriteProtect" ' This is a DWORD value
If Not RegKeyExists(objRegistry, HKLM, strUSBWriteProtectKey) Then USBWriteProtected = False End If
objRegistry.GetDWORDValue HKLM, strUSBWriteProtectKey, strUSBWriteProtectValueName, dwordWriteProtectValue
If IsNull(dwordWriteProtectValue) Then USBWriteProtected = False Else If dwordWriteProtectValue = 1 Then USBWriteProtected = True End IF End If
'Cleanup Set objWMIService = Nothing Set objRegistry = Nothing
End Function 'USBWriteProtected
Function RegKeyExists(objRegistry, sHive, sRegKey) Dim aValueNames, aValueTypes If objRegistry.EnumValues(sHive, sRegKey, aValueNames, aValueTypes) = 0 Then RegKeyExists = True Else RegKeyExists = False End If End Function

sensor.name: Non-Approved Established Connections
sensor.description: Any established connections currently being made from a process that is not allowed or to a destination that is not allowed. This multi-column Sensor displays the process responsible for the connection, the display name of the process (if available), and the target IP Address and port. Processes and IP ranges can be excluded in the Sensor definition. Example: chrome.exe | Google Chrome | 173.194.79.99:80

query.script:
'======================================== ' Non-Approved Established Connections '========================================
showProcess = True showPort = True showDNSName = False
Dim strcommand, results, excludeProcesses, excludeSubnets, taniumDebug, excludeProcessesFilePath, excludeSubnetsFilePath Dim strSep : strSep = "|" excludeProcessesFilePath = GetTaniumDir("Tools\IR") & "excluded-processes.dat" excludeSubnetsFilePath = GetTaniumDir("Tools\IR") & "excluded-subnets.dat"
' This is a multi-column sensor that looks like: 'Process|Name|Target IP
Dim objFSO : Set objFSO = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject") If objFSO.FileExists(excludeProcessesFilePath) Then 'exclude processes file exists - read from file excludeProcesses = LoadDATFileAsArray(excludeProcessesFilePath) Else 'exclude processes file doesn't exist - specify processes below excludeProcesses = "TaniumClient.exe,TaniumReceiver.exe" 'excludeProcesses = "chrome.exe" 'excludeProcesses = "iexplore.exe" 'excludeProcesses = "chrome.exe, iexplore.exe" 'excludeProcesses = "trillian.exe" excludeProcesses = Split(LCase(excludeProcesses), ",") End If
If objFSO.FileExists(excludeSubnetsFilePath) Then 'exclude subnets file exists - read from file excludeSubnets = LoadDATFileAsArray(excludeSubnetsFilePath) Else 'exclude subnets file doesn't exist - specify subnets below excludeSubnets = "127.0.0.0:255.255.255.0" 'excludeSubnets = "72.14.213.0:255.255.255.0, 74.125.223.0:255.255.255.0-74.125.225.0:255.255.255.0" excludeSubnets = Split(excludeSubnets, ",") End If
taniumDebug = False
strComputer = "." Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:" & "{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\" & strComputer & "\root\cimv2") query = "select name, executablepath, processId from win32_process" Set colResults = objWMIService.ExecQuery(query)
'dictionary for process-app pairs Set processes = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary")
For Each result In colResults processId = CStr(result.ProcessId) processPath = result.ExecutablePath processes.Add processId, result.Name & "," & processPath ' tie IDs to exes,path - split later Next
strcommand = "cmd /c netstat -aon -p TCP | find " & Chr(34) & "TCP" & Chr(34) & " | find " & Chr(34) & "ESTABLISHED" & Chr(34)
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell") Set objScriptExec = objShell.Exec (strCommand) strPingResults = LCase(objScriptExec.StdOut.ReadAll)
results = Split(strPingResults, vbCrLf) j = 0
For Each line In results line = cleanWhitespace(Trim(line))
If line <> "" Then lineResults = Split(line) i = 0 Dim strPort, strPid, strConnectionType, strForeignIp, strApp For Each word In lineResults If i = 1 Then strPort = word ElseIf i = 2 Then strForeignIp = word ElseIf i = 3 Then strConnectionType = word ElseIf i = 4 Then strPid = word End If
i = i + 1 Next
'DO NOT INCLUDE EXCLUDED APPS strAppEntry = processes.Item(strPid) ' looks like process.exe, Process Path arrAppEntry = Split(strAppEntry,",") strAppExe = arrAppEntry(0) strAppPath = arrAppEntry(1)
isNotExcludedApp = Not(ContainedInArray(LCase(strAppExe), excludeProcesses))
'DO NOT INCLUDE EXCLUDED SUBNETS isNotExcludedSubnet = Not(ContainedInSubnet(strForeignIp, excludeSubnets))
If Not(IsEmpty(strAppExe)) _ And isNotExcludedApp _ And isNotExcludedSubnet Then
If Not showPort Then arrTemp = Split(strForeignIp, ":") strForeignIp = arrTemp(0) End If
If showDNSName Then arrTemp = Split(strForeignIp, ":") strForeignIp = ReverseDNSLookup(arrTemp(0)) If UBound(arrTemp) >=1 Then strForeignIp = strForeignIp & ":" & arrTemp(1) End If End If
If showProcess Then results(j) = strAppExe & strSep & ProcessNameToApplicationName(strAppPath,strAppExe) & strSep & strForeignIp Else results(j) = strSep & strSep & strForeignIp End If Else If taniumDebug Then WScript.Echo " excluded: " & strApp & " " & strForeignIp results(j) = "" End If
j = j + 1 End If Next
results = RemDups(results)
If UBound(results) < 1 Then If GetLocale() <> 1033 Then WScript.Echo "English Language OS Required" End If End If
For Each result In results WScript.Echo result Next
WScript.Quit
Function ReverseDNSLookup(strIPAddress) ReverseDNSLookup = strIPAddress Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell") Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject")
Set objExecCommand = objShell.Exec("%comspec% /c nslookup " & strIPAddress)
strResults = objExecCommand.StdOut.ReadAll
If InStr(strResults, "Name:") Then arrNameTemp = Split(strResults, "Name:") arrName = Split(Trim(arrNameTemp(1)), Chr(13))
ReverseDNSLookup = arrName(0) End If End Function
Function LoadDATFileAsArray(strFilePath) Dim objFSO : Set objFSO = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject") Dim responseDict : Set responseDict = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary")
If objFSO.FileExists(strFilePath) Then Dim objDatFile, strLine Set objDatFile = objFso.OpenTextFile(strFilePath, 1)
'read in all entries, one per line Do While objDatFile.AtEndOfStream <> True strLine = LCase(Trim(objDatFile.ReadLine)) If strLine <> "" And Left(strLine, 1) <> "'" And Not responseDict.Exists(strLine) Then responseDict.Add strLine, True End If Loop End If LoadDATFileAsArray = responseDict.Keys End Function
Function GetTaniumDir(strSubDir) 'GetTaniumDir with GeneratePath, works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 End If
If Not strPath = "" Then If strSubDir <> "" Then strSubDir = "\" & strSubDir End If
Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject") If fso.FolderExists(strPath) Then If Not fso.FolderExists(strPath & strSubDir) Then ''Need to loop through strSubDir and create all sub directories GeneratePath strPath & strSubDir, fso End If GetTaniumDir = strPath & strSubDir & "\" Else ' Specified Path doesn't exist on the filesystem WScript.Echo "Error: " & strPath & " does not exist on the filesystem" GetTaniumDir = False End If Else WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot find Tanium Client path in Registry" GetTaniumDir = False End If End Function 'GetTaniumDir
Function GeneratePath(pFolderPath, fso) GeneratePath = False
If Not fso.FolderExists(pFolderPath) Then If GeneratePath(fso.GetParentFolderName(pFolderPath), fso) Then GeneratePath = True Call fso.CreateFolder(pFolderPath) End If Else GeneratePath = True End If End Function 'GeneratePath
Function ContainedInSubnet(str, arr) Dim strIp, strSubnet, strMask temp = Split(str, ":") strIp = temp(0)
For Each item In arr If InStr(item, "-") Then 'Subnet range temp = Split(item, "-") lower = Split(temp(0), ":") upper = Split(temp(1), ":") lowerSubnet = Trim(lower(0)) lowerMask = Trim(lower(1)) upperSubnet = Trim(upper(0)) upperMask = Trim(upper(1))
If StringToBinary(strIp) > StringToBinary(Subnet(lowerSubnet, lowerMask)) _ And StringToBinary(strIp) < StringToBinary(Subnet(upperSubnet, upperMask)) Then ContainedInSubnet = True Exit Function End If Else 'Single subnet parts = Split(item, ":") strSubnet = Trim(parts(0)) strMask = Trim(parts(1)) If Subnet(strIp, strMask) = Subnet(strSubnet, strMask) Then ContainedInSubnet = True Exit Function End If End If Next ContainedInSubnet = False End Function
Function ContainedInArray(str, arr) For Each item In arr If str = Trim(item) Then ContainedInArray = True Exit Function End If Next ContainedInArray = False End Function
Function cleanWhitespace(strStarter) intStarter = Len(strStarter) For i = intStarter To 2 Step -1 strChars = Space(i) strStarter = Replace(strStarter, strChars, " ") Next cleanWhitespace = strStarter End Function
Function RemDups(ByVal anArray) Dim d, item, thekeys Set d = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary") d.removeall d.CompareMode = 0 For Each item In anArray If Len(item) > 0 Then If Not d.Exists(item) Then d.Add item, item End If Next thekeys = d.keys Set d = Nothing RemDups = thekeys End Function
Function Subnet(strAddress, strMask) intSubnetLength = SubnetLength(strMask) Subnet = BinaryToString(Left(StringToBinary(strAddress), intSubnetLength) & String(32 - intSubnetLength, "0")) End Function
Function SubnetLength(strMask) strMaskBinary = StringToBinary(strMask) SubnetLength = Len(Left(strMaskBinary, InStr(strMaskBinary, "0") - 1)) End Function
Function BinaryToString(strBinary) For intOctetPos = 1 To 4 strOctetBinary = Right(Left(strBinary, intOctetPos * 8), 8) intOctet = 0 intValue = 1 For intBinaryPos = 1 To Len(strOctetBinary) If Left(Right(strOctetBinary, intBinaryPos), 1) = "1" Then intOctet = intOctet + intValue intValue = intValue * 2 Next If BinaryToString = Empty Then BinaryToString = CStr(intOctet) Else BinaryToString = BinaryToString & "." & CStr(intOctet) Next End Function
Function StringToBinary(strAddress) objAddress = Split(strAddress, ".", -1) For Each strOctet In objAddress intOctet = CInt(strOctet) strOctetBinary = "" For x = 1 To 8 If intOctet Mod 2 > 0 Then strOctetBinary = "1" & strOctetBinary Else strOctetBinary = "0" & strOctetBinary End If intOctet = Int(intOctet / 2) Next StringToBinary = StringToBinary & strOctetBinary Next End Function
Function ProcessNameToApplicationName(strExecutablePath, strExecutableName) ' This function will return the full application name of a running executable
Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject")
arrPathParts = Split(strExecutablePath,"\")
If UBound(arrPathParts) < 0 Then 'can be -1 for no split, such as the System process ProcessNameToApplicationName = strExecutableName Set fso = Nothing Exit Function End If strExecutable = arrPathParts(UBound(arrPathParts))
If fso.FileExists(strExecutablePath) Then Dim strOutput, fileVersion, fileVersionOutput, fullName
Set execFile = fso.GetFile(strExecutablePath) fullName = GetDescription(execFile.ParentFolder.Path, strExecutable) If Not fullName = "" Then ProcessNameToApplicationName = fullName Else ProcessNameToApplicationName = strExecutableName End If Else ' file doesn't exist or inaccessible ProcessNameToApplicationName = strExecutableName End If
End Function 'ProcessNameToApplicationName
Function GetDescription(folderPath, fileName) descIndex = GetAttributeIndex(folderPath, "File description") If IsEmpty(descIndex) Then descIndex = GetAttributeIndex(folderPath, "Description") End If GetDescription = GetFileProperty(folderPath, fileName, descIndex) End Function
Function GetFileProperty(folderPath, fileName, fileProperty) Set objShell = CreateObject("Shell.Application") Set objFolder = objShell.Namespace(folderPath) GetFileProperty = objFolder.GetDetailsOf(objFolder.Parsename(fileName), fileProperty) End Function
Function GetAttributeIndex(folderPath, attrTarget) Set objShell = CreateObject("Shell.Application") Set objFolder = objShell.Namespace(folderPath) For i = 0 To 50 attrName = objFolder.GetDetailsOf(objFolder.Items, i) If LCase(attrName) = LCase(attrTarget) Then GetAttributeIndex = i Exit Function End If Next
End Function

#!/bin/bash
lsof -iTCP -sTCP:ESTABLISHED -P +c 15 -n|grep -v "COMMAND" |while read line do set -- $line second=`echo $9|cut -d'>' -f 2` echo $1\|\|$second done

sensor.name: Hosted Wireless Ad-Hoc Networks
sensor.description: Returns details of ad-hoc wireless networks are hosted in your environment. Details include SSID, Mode, Max Clients, Auth, Status, BSSID, Radio Type, Channel, and Connections. Example: personalwifi | ad-hoc | 1 | Open | active | xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx | 802.11g | 11 | 1

query.script:
'======================================== ' Hosted Wireless Ad-Hoc Networks '========================================
' This sensor uses netsh output to display details about wireless LAN
Option Explicit
Dim strSep
strSep = "|"
' This is a multi-column sensor whose output looks like ' SSID|Mode|Max Clients|Auth|Status|BSSID|Radio Type|Channel|Connections
GetHostedAdHocDetails strSep
Function GetHostedAdHocDetails(strSep)
Dim objShell,objScriptExec Dim strCommand, arrNetshResults, strNetshResults Dim strNetshLine Dim strMode,strHostedSSID,strMaxClients,strAuth Dim strStatus,strBSSID,strRadioType,strChannel,strConnectedClients Dim bPrintLine, bNewHostedNetwork
strCommand = "netsh wlan show hostednetwork"
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell") Set objScriptExec = objShell.Exec (strCommand)
strNetshResults = LCase(objScriptExec.StdOut.ReadAll) arrNetshResults = Split(LCase(strNetshResults),vbCrLf)
For Each strNetshLine In arrNetshResults strNetshLine = Trim(strNetshLine) If InStr(strNetshLine,"hosted network settings") = 1 Then bNewHostedNetwork = True ' if there's a new hosted network settings entry, it's time to note a new group End If If InStr(strNetshLine, "mode") = 1 Then strMode = Trim(Split(strNetshLine,": ")(1)) End If If InStr(strNetshLine, "ssid name") = 1 Then strHostedSSID = Trim(Split(strNetshLine,":")(1)) ' ssid is presented in quotes, remove strHostedSSID = RemoveOuterCharacters(strHostedSSID,Chr(34)) End If If InStr(strNetshLine, "max number of clients") = 1 Then strMaxClients = Trim(Split(strNetshLine,":")(1)) End If If InStr(strNetshLine, "authentication") = 1 Then strAuth = Trim(Split(strNetshLine,":")(1)) End If If InStr(strNetshLine, "status") = 1 Then strStatus = Trim(Split(strNetshLine,":")(1)) End If If InStr(strNetshLine,"bssid") = 1 Then strBSSID = Trim(Split(strNetshLine,":")(1)) End If If InStr(strNetshLine,"radio type") = 1 Then strRadioType = Trim(Split(strNetshLine,":")(1)) End If If InStr(strNetshLine,"channel") = 1 Then strChannel = Trim(Split(strNetshLine,":")(1)) End If If InStr(strNetshLine,"number of clients") = 1 Then ' last entry strConnectedClients = Trim(Split(strNetshLine,":")(1)) bPrintLine = True ' If we've found an Signal Value, it's time to print the line. End If If bNewHostedNetwork And bPrintLine Then ' if it's a new group, and at last line in the new group, print If strStatus = "started" Then WScript.Echo strHostedSSID & strSep & strMode & strSep & strMaxClients & strSep & strAuth _ & strSep & strStatus & strSep & strBSSID & strSep & strRadioType & strSep _ & strChannel & strSep & strConnectedClients End If bNewHostedNetwork = False bPrintLine = False End If Next
'Cleanup Set objScriptExec = Nothing Set objShell = Nothing End Function 'GetHostedAdHocDetails
Function RemoveOuterCharacters(strTemp,strChar) Dim intStrLen
intStrLen = Len(strTemp) If InStr(strTemp,strChar) = 1 Then strTemp = Right(strTemp,intStrLen - 1) End If intStrLen = Len(strTemp) ' has new length If InStr(strTemp,strChar) = intStrLen Then strTemp = Left(strTemp,intStrLen - 1) End If
RemoveOuterCharacters = strTemp
End Function 'RemoveOuterCharacters

sensor.name: Wireless Networks Using WEP
sensor.description: Details of currently active wireless network connection using WEP authentication by client machine. Details include SSID, MAC address, connection state, network type, radio type, authentication, receive rate, transmit rate, and signal strength. Example: hotspotwifi | xx-xx-xx-xx-xx-xx | connected | Infrastructure | 802.11g | WEP | 54 | 54 | 99%

query.script:
'======================================== ' Wireless Networks Using WEP '========================================
' This sensor uses netsh output to display details about wireless LAN ' returns details of those which have 'wep' as the encryption type
Option Explicit
Dim strSep
strSep = "|"
' This is a multi-column sensor whose output looks like ' SSID|MAC|State|Network Type|Radio|Authentication|Receive|Transmit|Signal 0-5
GetWepEncryptedWirelessNetworkDetails strSep
Function GetWepEncryptedWirelessNetworkDetails(strSep)
Dim objShell,objScriptExec Dim strCommand, arrNetshResults, strNetshResults Dim strNetshLine, strName, strMAC, strState, strSSID Dim strNetworkType, strRadioType, strAuthentication Dim strReceiveRate, strTransmitRate, strSignal, intSignal Dim bPrintLine, bNewInterface
strCommand = "netsh wlan show interfaces"
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell") Set objScriptExec = objShell.Exec (strCommand)
strNetshResults = LCase(objScriptExec.StdOut.ReadAll) arrNetshResults = Split(LCase(strNetshResults),vbCrLf)
For Each strNetshLine In arrNetshResults If InStr(strNetshLine,"name") > 0 Then bNewInterface = True ' if there's a new Name, it's time to note a new group strName = Trim(Split(strNetshLine,":")(1)) End If If InStr(strNetshLine, "physical address") > 0 Then strMAC = Trim(Split(strNetshLine,": ")(1)) End If If InStr(strNetshLine, "state") > 0 Then strState = Trim(Split(strNetshLine,":")(1)) End If If InStr(strNetshLine, "ssid") > 0 And Not InStr(strNetshLine, "bssid") > 0 Then strSSID = Trim(Split(strNetshLine,":")(1)) End If If InStr(strNetshLine, "network type") > 0 Then strNetworkType = Trim(Split(strNetshLine,":")(1)) End If If InStr(strNetshLine, "radio type") > 0 Then strRadioType = Trim(Split(strNetshLine,":")(1)) End If If InStr(strNetshLine,"authentication") > 0 Then strAuthentication = Trim(Split(strNetshLine,":")(1)) End If If InStr(strNetshLine,"receive rate") > 0 Then strReceiveRate = Trim(Split(strNetshLine,":")(1)) & " Mbps" End If If InStr(strNetshLine,"transmit rate") > 0 Then strTransmitRate = Trim(Split(strNetshLine,":")(1)) & " Mbps" End If If InStr(strNetshLine,"signal") > 0 Then strSignal = Replace(Trim(Split(strNetshLine,":")(1)),"%","") ' remove % intSignal = CInt(CInt(strSignal) / 20) bPrintLine = True ' If we've found an Signal Value, it's time to print the line. End If If bNewInterface And bPrintLine Then ' if it's a new group, and at last line in the new group, print If InStr(LCase(strAuthentication),"wep") > 0 Then WScript.Echo strSSID & strSep & strMAC & strSep & strState & strSep & strNetworkType _ & strSep & strRadioType & strSep & strAuthentication & strSep & strReceiveRate & strSep _ & strTransmitRate & strSep & intSignal End If bNewInterface = False bPrintLine = False End If Next
'Cleanup Set objScriptExec = Nothing Set objShell = Nothing End Function 'GetWepEncryptedWirelessNetworkDetails

sensor.name: Unencrypted Wireless Networks
sensor.description: Details of wireless networks that are currently open and unencrypted. Details include SSID, MAC address, connection state, network type, radio type, authentication, receive rate, transmit rate, and signal strength. Example: hotspotwifi | xx-xx-xx-xx-xx-xx | connected | Infrastructure | 802.11g | WEP | 54 | 54 | 99%

query.script:
'======================================== ' Unencrypted Wireless Networks '========================================
' This sensor uses netsh output to display details about wireless LAN ' returns details of those which have 'open' as the encryption type
Option Explicit
Dim strSep
strSep = "|"
' This is a multi-column sensor whose output looks like ' SSID|MAC|State|Network Type|Radio|Authentication|Receive|Transmit|Signal 0-5
GetUnencryptedWirelessNetworkDetails strSep
Function GetUnencryptedWirelessNetworkDetails(strSep)
Dim objShell,objScriptExec Dim strCommand, arrNetshResults, strNetshResults Dim strNetshLine, strName, strMAC, strState, strSSID Dim strNetworkType, strRadioType, strAuthentication Dim strReceiveRate, strTransmitRate, strSignal, intSignal Dim bPrintLine, bNewInterface
strCommand = "netsh wlan show interfaces"
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell") Set objScriptExec = objShell.Exec (strCommand)
strNetshResults = LCase(objScriptExec.StdOut.ReadAll) arrNetshResults = Split(LCase(strNetshResults),vbCrLf)
For Each strNetshLine In arrNetshResults If InStr(strNetshLine,"name") > 0 Then bNewInterface = True ' if there's a new Name, it's time to note a new group strName = Trim(Split(strNetshLine,":")(1)) End If If InStr(strNetshLine, "physical address") > 0 Then strMAC = Trim(Split(strNetshLine,": ")(1)) End If If InStr(strNetshLine, "state") > 0 Then strState = Trim(Split(strNetshLine,":")(1)) End If If InStr(strNetshLine, "ssid") > 0 And Not InStr(strNetshLine, "bssid") > 0 Then strSSID = Trim(Split(strNetshLine,":")(1)) End If If InStr(strNetshLine, "network type") > 0 Then strNetworkType = Trim(Split(strNetshLine,":")(1)) End If If InStr(strNetshLine, "radio type") > 0 Then strRadioType = Trim(Split(strNetshLine,":")(1)) End If If InStr(strNetshLine,"authentication") > 0 Then strAuthentication = Trim(Split(strNetshLine,":")(1)) End If If InStr(strNetshLine,"receive rate") > 0 Then strReceiveRate = Trim(Split(strNetshLine,":")(1)) & " Mbps" End If If InStr(strNetshLine,"transmit rate") > 0 Then strTransmitRate = Trim(Split(strNetshLine,":")(1)) & " Mbps" End If If InStr(strNetshLine,"signal") > 0 Then strSignal = Replace(Trim(Split(strNetshLine,":")(1)),"%","") ' remove % intSignal = CInt(CInt(strSignal) / 20) bPrintLine = True ' If we've found an Signal Value, it's time to print the line. End If If bNewInterface And bPrintLine Then ' if it's a new group, and at last line in the new group, print If LCase(strAuthentication) = "open" Then WScript.Echo strSSID & strSep & strMAC & strSep & strState & strSep & strNetworkType _ & strSep & strRadioType & strSep & strAuthentication & strSep & strReceiveRate & strSep _ & strTransmitRate & strSep & intSignal End If bNewInterface = False bPrintLine = False End If Next
'Cleanup Set objScriptExec = Nothing Set objShell = Nothing End Function 'GetUnencryptedWirelessNetworkDetails

sensor.name: User Sessions
sensor.description: Provides the terminal services session information, similar to what is available from the "query session" command. Example:console|Administrator|1|Active||

query.script:
'======================================== ' User Sessions '========================================
' Returns information about the current sessions on the local machine '
Option Explicit
On error resume next Dim strValue, myRegExp, objShell, objExec, strLine, objSplit
Set myRegExp = New RegExp myRegExp.IgnoreCase = True myRegExp.Global = True myRegExp.Pattern = "\s{2,}"
Set objShell = WScript.CreateObject("WScript.Shell") If Is64() Then Set objExec = objshell.exec("cmd /c c:\windows\sysnative\qwinsta") Else Set objExec = objshell.exec("cmd /c qwinsta") End If
objExec.StdOut.ReadLine() Do While Not objExec.Stdout.AtEndOfStream strLine = myRegExp.Replace(objExec.StdOut.ReadLine(),"|")
If InStr(strLine,"rdp") or InStr(strLine,"console") then If InStr(strLine,"disc") then strLine = "|" & strLine End If If InStr(strLine, "console")>0 And InStr(strLine, "Conn")>0 Then ' If console line, but no user logged in, add column strLine = Replace(strLine, "console|", "console||") End If strLine = replace(strLine,">","") strLine = replace(strLine," ","") strLine = replace(strLine,"rdp-tcp|","rdp-tcp||")
objSplit = Split(strLine, "|") If ojbSplit.Count = 4 Then strLine = strLine + "|" End If
WScript.echo strLine End if Loop
Function Is64 Dim objWMIService, colItems, objItem Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\.\root\CIMV2") Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select SystemType from Win32_ComputerSystem") For Each objItem In colItems If InStr(LCase(objItem.SystemType), "x64") > 0 Then Is64 = True Else Is64 = False End If Next End Function

sensor.name: Has Application Management Tools
sensor.description: Returns whether a machine has the application management tools which may be necessary for parameterized actions or sensor-fed actions. Example: Yes

query.script:
'======================================== ' Has Application Management Tools '========================================
Option Explicit
'-------------------- ' Set These Variables Dim strDesiredVersion ' a string value which is a verison like ' 4.1.314.7060 ' which is used to determine whether the files are the correct version
strDesiredVersion = "6.2.314.8513" '---------------------- Dim objFSO Dim strToolsDir Dim bHasAllLatestFiles, arrApplicationManagementToolsFiles, strFile Dim objTextFile, strVersionLine, strFileVersion
Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject")
strToolsDir = GetTaniumDir("Tools")
' This array holds the files to check for arrApplicationManagementToolsFiles = Array("taskkill.vbs","startservice.vbs","stopservice.vbs")
bHasAllLatestFiles = True ' assume OK until checks fail
For Each strFile In arrApplicationManagementToolsFiles If Not objFSO.FileExists(strToolsDir&strFile) Then WScript.Echo "Missing " & strFile bHasAllLatestFiles = False End If If objFSO.FileExists(strToolsDir&strFile) Then Set objTextFile = objFSO.OpenTextFile(strToolsDir&strFile) strVersionLine = LCase(objTextFile.ReadLine()) ' version is at top of line If Not InStr(strVersionLine,"tanium file version:") > 0 Then ' must have a version number in top line WScript.Echo strFile&" is not versioned on line 1" bHasAllLatestFiles = False Else ' we have a version number, not split to check strFileVersion = Trim(Split(strVersionLine,"tanium file version:")(1)) If strFileVersion <> strDesiredVersion Then WScript.Echo strFile&" version: "&strFileVersion&", needs: "&strDesiredVersion bHasAllLatestFiles = False End If End If objTextFile.Close End If Next
If bHasAllLatestFiles Then WScript.Echo "Yes" Else WScript.Echo "No" End If
'Cleanup Set objTextFile = Nothing Set objFSO = Nothing
Function GetTaniumDir(strSubDir) 'GetTaniumDir with GeneratePath, works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 End If
If Not strPath = "" Then If strSubDir <> "" Then strSubDir = "\" & strSubDir End If
Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject") If fso.FolderExists(strPath) Then If Not fso.FolderExists(strPath & strSubDir) Then ''Need to loop through strSubDir and create all sub directories GeneratePath strPath & strSubDir, fso End If GetTaniumDir = strPath & strSubDir & "\" Else ' Specified Path doesn't exist on the filesystem WScript.Echo "Error: " & strPath & " does not exist on the filesystem" GetTaniumDir = False End If Else WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot find Tanium Client path in Registry" GetTaniumDir = False End If End Function 'GetTaniumDir
Function GeneratePath(pFolderPath, fso) GeneratePath = False
If Not fso.FolderExists(pFolderPath) Then If GeneratePath(fso.GetParentFolderName(pFolderPath), fso) Then GeneratePath = True Call fso.CreateFolder(pFolderPath) End If Else GeneratePath = True End If End Function 'GeneratePath
Function RegKeyExists(objRegistry, sHive, sRegKey) Dim aValueNames, aValueTypes If objRegistry.EnumValues(sHive, sRegKey, aValueNames, aValueTypes) = 0 Then RegKeyExists = True Else RegKeyExists = False End If End Function

sensor.name: Has Hardware Tools
sensor.description: Returns whether a machine has the hardware tools, which are used to identify specific types of hardware. Example: Yes

query.script:
'Tanium File Version:6.2.314.8513 ' sensor - Has Hardware Tools
Option Explicit '-------------------- ' Set These Variables Dim strDesiredVersion ' a string value which is a version like ' 4.1.314.7060 ' which is used to determine whether the files are the correct version
strDesiredVersion = "6.2.314.8513" '---------------------- Dim objFSO Dim strToolsDir Dim bHasAllLatestFiles, arrHardwareToolsTextFiles, arrHardwareToolsBinFiles, strFile Dim objTextFile, strVersionLine, strFileVersion
Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject")
strToolsDir = GetTaniumDir("Tools\Hardware")
' This array holds the text files to check for arrHardwareToolsTextFiles = Array()
' This array holds the binary files to check for arrHardwareToolsBinFiles = Array("usb.ids")
bHasAllLatestFiles = True ' assume OK until checks fail
For Each strFile In arrHardwareToolsTextFiles If Not objFSO.FileExists(strToolsDir&strFile) Then WScript.Echo "Missing " & strFile bHasAllLatestFiles = False End If If objFSO.FileExists(strToolsDir&strFile) Then Set objTextFile = objFSO.OpenTextFile(strToolsDir&strFile) strVersionLine = LCase(objTextFile.ReadLine()) ' version is at top of line If Not InStr(strVersionLine,"tanium file version:") > 0 Then ' must have a version number in top line WScript.Echo strFile&" is not versioned on line 1" bHasAllLatestFiles = False Else ' we have a version number, not split to check strFileVersion = Trim(Split(strVersionLine,"tanium file version:")(1)) If strFileVersion <> strDesiredVersion Then WScript.Echo strFile&" version: "&strFileVersion&", needs: "&strDesiredVersion bHasAllLatestFiles = False End If End If objTextFile.Close End If Next
For Each strFile In arrHardwareToolsBinFiles If Not objFSO.FileExists(strToolsDir&strFile) Then WScript.Echo "Missing " & strFile bHasAllLatestFiles = False End If Next
If bHasAllLatestFiles Then WScript.Echo "Yes" Else WScript.Echo "No" End If
'Cleanup Set objTextFile = Nothing Set objFSO = Nothing
Function GetTaniumDir(strSubDir) 'GetTaniumDir with GeneratePath, works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 End If
If Not strPath = "" Then If strSubDir <> "" Then strSubDir = "\" & strSubDir End If
Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject") If fso.FolderExists(strPath) Then If Not fso.FolderExists(strPath & strSubDir) Then ''Need to loop through strSubDir and create all sub directories GeneratePath strPath & strSubDir, fso End If GetTaniumDir = strPath & strSubDir & "\" Else ' Specified Path doesn't exist on the filesystem WScript.Echo "Error: " & strPath & " does not exist on the filesystem" GetTaniumDir = False End If Else WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot find Tanium Client path in Registry" GetTaniumDir = False End If End Function 'GetTaniumDir
Function GeneratePath(pFolderPath, fso) GeneratePath = False
If Not fso.FolderExists(pFolderPath) Then If GeneratePath(fso.GetParentFolderName(pFolderPath), fso) Then GeneratePath = True Call fso.CreateFolder(pFolderPath) End If Else GeneratePath = True End If End Function 'GeneratePath
Function RegKeyExists(objRegistry, sHive, sRegKey) Dim aValueNames, aValueTypes If objRegistry.EnumValues(sHive, sRegKey, aValueNames, aValueTypes) = 0 Then RegKeyExists = True Else RegKeyExists = False End If End Function

sensor.name: Has Tanium Standard Utilities
sensor.description: Returns whether a machine has the Tanium Standard Utilities Example: Yes

query.script:
'======================================== ' Has Tanium Standard Utilities '========================================
' this action will look to see if the client has ' all necessary standard utilities files
Option Explicit '-------------------- ' Set These Variables Dim strDesiredVersion,strDesiredFCIVVersion,strDesiredGrepBinaryVersion Dim strDesiredGrepDepVersion,strGrepDepFileVersion,strGrepBinaryFileVersion
' a string value which is a version like ' 4.2.314.7111 ' which is used to determine whether the bundle has the correct version ' updating the content will cause the bundle number to change and all files will ' be sent to the endpoint again. This is to handle the case where ' binary files are not versioned, such as with Yara
' The top line of the version file 'Tanium File Version: <version string below> strDesiredVersion = "6.2.314.8513"
' ------------------- ' Binaries we can version strDesiredGrepBinaryVersion = "2.5.4.3331" strDesiredGrepDepVersion = "1.12.2872.39125"
Dim objFSO Dim strDirToCheck,objTextFile Dim bHasAllLatestFiles,arrTextFilesToCheck,strFile,strVersionLine,strFileVersion Dim strFCIVFile,strFCIVFileVersion,strGrepBinary,strGrepDep,strHandleTool,strListDLLs2 Dim strListDLLs,strStreamsTool,strAutorunsTool Dim strYara,strYarac
Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject")
strDirToCheck = GetTaniumDir("Tools\StdUtils")
arrTextFilesToCheck = Array("copy-to-tanium-dir-predist.vbs","runas-allusers-wrapper.vbs","ver\bundle.cfg")
' Grep is required strGrepBinary=strDirToCheck&"grep\bin\grep.exe" strGrepDep=strDirToCheck&"grep\bin\libiconv2.dll"
'Yara binaries are required strYara=strDirToCheck&"yara\yara"&GetBitness&".exe" strYarac=strDirToCheck&"yara\yarac"&GetBitness&".exe"
bHasAllLatestFiles = True For Each strFile In arrTextFilesToCheck If Not objFSO.FileExists(strDirToCheck&strFile) Then WScript.Echo "Missing " & strFile bHasAllLatestFiles = False End If If objFSO.FileExists(strDirToCheck&strFile) Then Set objTextFile = objFSO.OpenTextFile(strDirToCheck&strFile) strVersionLine = LCase(objTextFile.ReadLine()) ' version is at top of line If Not InStr(strVersionLine,"tanium file version:") > 0 Then ' must have a version number in top line WScript.Echo strFile&" is not versioned on line 1" bHasAllLatestFiles = False Else ' we have a version number, not split to check strFileVersion = Split(strVersionLine,"tanium file version:")(1) If Trim(strFileVersion) <> Trim(strDesiredVersion) Then WScript.Echo strFile&" version: "&strFileVersion&", needs: "&strDesiredVersion bHasAllLatestFiles = False End If End If objTextFile.Close End If Next
' check a Grep dependency If Not objFSO.FileExists(strGrepDep) Then WScript.Echo "Missing " & strGrepDep bHasAllLatestFiles = False End If If objFSO.FileExists(strGrepDep) Then
strGrepDepFileVersion = objFSO.GetFileVersion(strGrepDep) If Not strGrepDepFileVersion = strDesiredGrepDepVersion Then bHasAllLatestFiles = False WScript.Echo strGrepDep &" version: "&strGrepDepFileVersion&", needs: "&strDesiredGrepDepVersion End If End If
' check Grep binary If Not objFSO.FileExists(strGrepBinary) Then WScript.Echo "Missing " & strGrepBinary bHasAllLatestFiles = False End If If objFSO.FileExists(strGrepBinary) Then strGrepBinaryFileVersion = GetFileVersion(strGrepBinary) If Not strGrepBinaryFileVersion = strDesiredGrepBinaryVersion Then bHasAllLatestFiles = False WScript.Echo strGrepBinary &" version: "&strGrepBinaryFileVersion&", needs: "&strDesiredGrepBinaryVersion End If End If
If Not objFSO.FileExists(strYara) Then bHasAllLatestFiles = False WScript.Echo "Missing " & strYara End If
If Not objFSO.FileExists(strYarac) Then bHasAllLatestFiles = False WScript.Echo "Missing " & strYarac End If
If bHasAllLatestFiles Then WScript.Echo "Yes" Else WScript.Echo "No" End If
Function GetFileVersion(strPath) Dim objFSO Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject") If objFSO.FileExists(strPath) Then GetFileVersion = objFSO.GetFileVersion(strPath) Else GetFileVerison = -1 End If End Function 'GetFileVersion
Function GetTaniumDir(strSubDir) Dim strComputer, key32path, key64path, keyPath, reg Dim strPath strComputer = "." Const HKLM = &h80000002
key32Path = "Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" key64Path = "Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
Set reg=GetObject("winmgmts:{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\" & strComputer & "\root\default:StdRegProv")
If RegKeyExists(reg, HKLM, key64Path) Then keyPath = key64Path ElseIf RegKeyExists(reg, HKLM, key32Path) Then keyPath = key32Path End If
reg.GetStringValue HKLM,keyPath,"Path", strPath
If strSubDir <> "" Then strSubDir = "\" & strSubDir End If
Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject") If fso.FolderExists(strPath) Then If Not fso.FolderExists(strPath & strSubDir) Then fso.CreateFolder(strPath & strSubDir) End If GetTaniumDir = strPath & strSubDir & "\" End If End Function
Function RegKeyExists(objRegistry, sHive, sRegKey) Dim aValueNames, aValueTypes If objRegistry.EnumValues(sHive, sRegKey, aValueNames, aValueTypes) = 0 Then RegKeyExists = True Else RegKeyExists = False End If End Function
Function GetBitness If Not Is64 Then GetBitness = "32" Else GetBitness = "64" End If End Function 'GetBitness
Function Is64 Dim objWMIService, colItems, objItem Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\.\root\CIMV2") Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select SystemType from Win32_ComputerSystem") For Each objItem In colItems If InStr(LCase(objItem.SystemType), "x64") > 0 Then Is64 = True Else Is64 = False End If Next End Function ' Is64

sensor.name: Patch Cab Out of Date
sensor.description: Determines when the patch cab file is to be considered out of date and, therefore, a machine receives a new copy via the "Patch Management - Deploy Patch Scan Files" Scheduled Action. By default, a machine will get a refreshed copy of the cab file from the ring every 24 hours. Example: Yes

query.script:
'======================================== ' Patch Cab Out of Date '========================================
Option Explicit
Dim intAgeThreshold,fso,objFile,minutesOld,strToolsDir,strCabPath intAgeThreshold = 60*24 'in minutes
strToolsDir = GetTaniumDir("Tools") strCabPath = strToolsDir & "\wsusscn2.cab"
Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject")
'Uses date math - set locale
SetLocale(1033)
If fso.FileExists(strCabPath) Then Set objFile = fso.GetFile(strCabPath) minutesOld = GetMinutesOld(objFile.DateLastModified) if cdbl(minutesOld) >= intAgeThreshold Then Wscript.echo "Yes" Else Wscript.echo "No" End If Else WScript.Echo "Patch CAB not found" 'WScript.Echo "Yes" End If Function GetTaniumDir(strSubDir) 'GetTaniumDir with GeneratePath, works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 End If
If Not strPath = "" Then If strSubDir <> "" Then strSubDir = "\" & strSubDir End If
Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject") If fso.FolderExists(strPath) Then If Not fso.FolderExists(strPath & strSubDir) Then ''Need to loop through strSubDir and create all sub directories GeneratePath strPath & strSubDir, fso End If GetTaniumDir = strPath & strSubDir & "\" Else ' Specified Path doesn't exist on the filesystem WScript.Echo "Error: " & strPath & " does not exist on the filesystem" GetTaniumDir = False End If Else WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot find Tanium Client path in Registry" GetTaniumDir = False End If End Function 'GetTaniumDir
Function GeneratePath(pFolderPath, fso) GeneratePath = False
If Not fso.FolderExists(pFolderPath) Then If GeneratePath(fso.GetParentFolderName(pFolderPath), fso) Then GeneratePath = True Call fso.CreateFolder(pFolderPath) End If Else GeneratePath = True End If End Function 'GeneratePath
'date format is MM/DD/YYYY function GetMinutesOld(strDate) Dim patternDate,today patternDate = CDate( strDate ) today = CDate( now ) GetMinutesOld = DateDiff("n", patternDate, today) End Function

sensor.name: Has Patch Tools
sensor.description: Whether a machine has all patch tools necessary. Example: Yes

query.script:
'======================================== ' Has Patch Tools '========================================
Option Explicit
' sensor - Has Patch Tools ' this action will look to see if the client has ' various files related to patching ' this checks the version string of all related patch files ' and whether the cab file exists.
'-------------------- ' Set These Variables Dim strDesiredVersion ' an string value which is a verison like ' 4.1.314.7060 ' which is used to determine whether the files are the correct version
strDesiredVersion = "6.2.314.8513" '---------------------- Dim objFSO Dim strPatchToolsDir Dim bHasAllLatestFiles, arrPatchToolsFiles, strFile Dim objTextFile, strVersionLine, strFileVersion Dim strCabFile
Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject")
strPatchToolsDir = GetTaniumDir("Tools")
' This array holds the files to check for arrPatchToolsFiles = Array("run-patch-scan.vbs","install-patches.vbs","uninstall-patch.vbs","add-patch-exclusion.vbs", _ "remove-patch-exclusion.vbs", "delete-queued-patch.vbs", "add-patch-whitelist-entry.vbs", "remove-patch-whitelist-entry.vbs") strCabFile = "Wsusscn2.cab"
bHasAllLatestFiles = True ' assume OK until checks fail
For Each strFile In arrPatchToolsFiles If Not objFSO.FileExists(strPatchToolsDir&strFile) Then WScript.Echo "Missing " & strFile bHasAllLatestFiles = False End If If objFSO.FileExists(strPatchToolsDir&strFile) Then Set objTextFile = objFSO.OpenTextFile(strPatchToolsDir&strFile) strVersionLine = LCase(objTextFile.ReadLine()) ' version is at top of line If Not InStr(strVersionLine,"tanium file version:") > 0 Then ' must have a version number in top line WScript.Echo strFile&" is not versioned on line 1" bHasAllLatestFiles = False Else ' we have a version number, not split to check strFileVersion = Split(strVersionLine,"tanium file version:")(1) If strFileVersion <> strDesiredVersion Then WScript.Echo strFile&" version: "&strFileVersion&", needs: "&strDesiredVersion bHasAllLatestFiles = False End If End If objTextFile.Close End If Next
If Not objFSO.FileExists(strPatchToolsDir&strCabFile) Then ' if the cab file doesn't exist, report WScript.Echo "Missing updates definition file" bHasAllLatestFiles = False End If
If bHasAllLatestFiles Then WScript.Echo "Yes" Else WScript.Echo "No" End If
'Cleanup Set objTextFile = Nothing Set objFSO = Nothing
Function GetTaniumDir(strSubDir) 'GetTaniumDir with GeneratePath, works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 End If
If Not strPath = "" Then If strSubDir <> "" Then strSubDir = "\" & strSubDir End If
Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject") If fso.FolderExists(strPath) Then If Not fso.FolderExists(strPath & strSubDir) Then ''Need to loop through strSubDir and create all sub directories GeneratePath strPath & strSubDir, fso End If GetTaniumDir = strPath & strSubDir & "\" Else ' Specified Path doesn't exist on the filesystem WScript.Echo "Error: " & strPath & " does not exist on the filesystem" GetTaniumDir = False End If Else WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot find Tanium Client path in Registry" GetTaniumDir = False End If End Function 'GetTaniumDir
Function GeneratePath(pFolderPath, fso) GeneratePath = False
If Not fso.FolderExists(pFolderPath) Then If GeneratePath(fso.GetParentFolderName(pFolderPath), fso) Then GeneratePath = True Call fso.CreateFolder(pFolderPath) End If Else GeneratePath = True End If End Function 'GeneratePath

sensor.name: Is Patch Scan Force Time
sensor.description: Sensor that determines if the machine has not been scanned for patches in over 2 days. If so, scan immediately. Do not scan if the WUA Agent version is less than the supported version (6.1.0022.4). Example: Yes

query.script:
'======================================== ' Is Patch Scan Force Time '========================================
Option Explicit
Dim objFSO,bIsScanForceTime Dim intDaysThreshold,strScansDir,strResultsPath,objFile,words,daysOld
intDaysThreshold = 2 ' If the patch scan hasn't occurred on the ' in the last 2 days, this sensor will be used to ' force a patch scan in conjunction with a ' scheduled action
strScansDir = GetTaniumDir("Tools\Scans") strResultsPath = strScansDir & "\patchresultsreadable.txt"
bIsScanForceTime = False
Set objFSO = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject")
If objFSO.FileExists(strResultsPath) Then Set objFile = objFSO.GetFile(strResultsPath) words = Split(objFile.DateLastModified, " ") daysOld = GetDaysOld(words(0)) Else WScript.Echo "Cannot Find Patch Results" bIsScanForceTime = True End If
If CInt(daysOld) >= intDaysThreshold Then WScript.Echo "Patch Results Too Old" bIsScanForceTime = True End If
' finally, do not force the scan if the WUA version is too low WUAVersionTooLowForScanForceTime bIsScanForceTime
If bIsScanForceTime Then Wscript.echo "Yes" Else Wscript.echo "No" End If
'' --- '' Function WUAVersionTooLowForScanForceTime(ByRef bIsScanForceTime) Dim strOutput, strSysDir, strWuaDll, i Dim strNeededVersion, arrNeededVersion Dim strVersion, arrVersion, intVersionPiece, bOldVersion
'adjust as required version changes strNeededVersion = "6.1.0022.4" arrNeededVersion = Split(strNeededVersion,".")
strSysDir = GetSystemDir strWuaDll = strSysDir & "\wuaueng.dll" If objFSO.FileExists(strWuaDll) Then strVersion = objFSO.GetFileVersion(strWuaDll) ' WScript.Echo "Current Version is " & strVersion ' WScript.Echo "Required Version is " & strNeededVersion If strVersion <> strNeededVersion Then arrVersion = Split(strVersion, ".") ' We assume there will be 4 fields, if not throw error If UBound(arrVersion) <> 3 Then bIsScanForceTime = False strOutput = "Error: Cannot determine Windows Update Agent version, does not look like X.X.X.X" Else bOldVersion = False 'assume version is good ' loop through each part ' if any individual part is less than its corresponding required part For i = 0 To UBound(arrVersion) If CInt(arrVersion(i)) < CInt(arrNeededVersion(i)) Then ' WScript.Echo arrVersion(i) & " < " & arrNeededVersion(i) bOldVersion = True Exit For ' No further checking necessary, it's out of date End If Next If bOldVersion Then strOutput = "Error: WUA Version is less than supported version " & strNeededVersion bIsScanForceTime = False End If End If Else ' versions are the same End If Else strOutput = "Error - WUA DLL ("&strWuaDll&") not found" bIsScanForceTime = False End If
End Function 'WUAVersionTooLowForScanForceTime
Function GetSystemDir Dim strWinDir,strSysDir
'Check for 64-bit sysnative directory to avoid win redirect strWinDir = objFSO.GetSpecialFolder(0) strSysDir = strWinDir & "\sysnative"
If Not objFSO.FolderExists(strSysDir) Then strSysDir = objFSO.GetSpecialFolder(1) End If GetSystemDir = strSysDir End Function ' GetSystemDir
'date format is MM/DD/YYYY function GetDaysOld(strDate) Dim patternDate,today patternDate = CDate( strDate ) today = CDate(FormatDateTime(Date(), 2)) GetDaysOld = DateDiff("d", patternDate, today) End Function
Function GetTaniumDir(strSubDir) 'GetTaniumDir with GeneratePath, works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 End If
If Not strPath = "" Then If strSubDir <> "" Then strSubDir = "\" & strSubDir End If
Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject") If fso.FolderExists(strPath) Then If Not fso.FolderExists(strPath & strSubDir) Then ''Need to loop through strSubDir and create all sub directories GeneratePath strPath & strSubDir, fso End If GetTaniumDir = strPath & strSubDir & "\" Else ' Specified Path doesn't exist on the filesystem WScript.Echo "Error: " & strPath & " does not exist on the filesystem" GetTaniumDir = False End If Else WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot find Tanium Client path in Registry" GetTaniumDir = False End If End Function 'GetTaniumDir
Function GeneratePath(pFolderPath, fso) GeneratePath = False
If Not fso.FolderExists(pFolderPath) Then If GeneratePath(fso.GetParentFolderName(pFolderPath), fso) Then GeneratePath = True Call fso.CreateFolder(pFolderPath) End If Else GeneratePath = True End If End Function 'GeneratePath

sensor.name: Has Patch Files
sensor.description: Whether a machine has any patch files queued for install. Example: Yes

query.script:
'======================================== ' Has Patch Files '========================================
Option Explicit
Dim strPatchesDir,fso,folder,files strPatchesDir = GetTaniumDir("Tools\Patches")
Set fso = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject") Set folder = fso.GetFolder(strPatchesDir) Set files = folder.Files
If files.Count = 0 Then WScript.Echo "No" Else WScript.Echo "Yes" End If
Function GetTaniumDir(strSubDir) 'GetTaniumDir with GeneratePath, works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 End If
If Not strPath = "" Then If strSubDir <> "" Then strSubDir = "\" & strSubDir End If
Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject") If fso.FolderExists(strPath) Then If Not fso.FolderExists(strPath & strSubDir) Then ''Need to loop through strSubDir and create all sub directories GeneratePath strPath & strSubDir, fso End If GetTaniumDir = strPath & strSubDir & "\" Else ' Specified Path doesn't exist on the filesystem WScript.Echo "Error: " & strPath & " does not exist on the filesystem" GetTaniumDir = False End If Else WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot find Tanium Client path in Registry" GetTaniumDir = False End If End Function 'GetTaniumDir
Function GeneratePath(pFolderPath, fso) GeneratePath = False
If Not fso.FolderExists(pFolderPath) Then If GeneratePath(fso.GetParentFolderName(pFolderPath), fso) Then GeneratePath = True Call fso.CreateFolder(pFolderPath) End If Else GeneratePath = True End If End Function 'GeneratePath

sensor.name: Is Patch Scan Time
sensor.description: A sensor which can be edited to perform client side calculations on when it's time to scan for patches. By default, it will always be patch scan time when evaluated as long as the WUA agent version is at least the minimum supported version (6.1.0022.4), and frequency is adjusted via the "Patch Management - Run Patch Scan" Scheduled Action. Example: Yes

query.script:
'======================================== ' Is Patch Scan Time '========================================
' This sensor will do client side work to ' determine when it's time to scan for patches
Option Explicit
Dim bIsScanTime bIsScanTime = True
' Global objects the functions may as well use Dim objFSO,objReg
Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject")
WUAVersionTooLowForScanTime bIsScanTime
If bIsScanTime Then WScript.Echo "Yes" Else WScript.Echo "No" End If
' --- Helper Functions --- '
Function WUAVersionTooLowForScanTime(ByRef bIsScanTime) Dim strOutput, strSysDir, strWuaDll, i Dim strNeededVersion, arrNeededVersion Dim strVersion, arrVersion, intVersionPiece, bOldVersion
'adjust as required version changes strNeededVersion = "6.1.0022.4" arrNeededVersion = Split(strNeededVersion,".")
strSysDir = GetSystemDir strWuaDll = strSysDir & "\wuaueng.dll" If objFSO.FileExists(strWuaDll) Then strVersion = objFSO.GetFileVersion(strWuaDll) ' WScript.Echo "Current Version is " & strVersion ' WScript.Echo "Required Version is " & strNeededVersion If strVersion <> strNeededVersion Then arrVersion = Split(strVersion, ".") ' We assume there will be 4 fields, if not throw error If UBound(arrVersion) <> 3 Then bIsScanTime = False strOutput = "Error: Cannot determine Windows Update Agent version, does not look like X.X.X.X" Else bOldVersion = False 'assume version is good ' loop through each part ' if any individual part is less than its corresponding required part For i = 0 To UBound(arrVersion) If CInt(arrVersion(i)) < CInt(arrNeededVersion(i)) Then bOldVersion = True Exit For ' No further checking necessary, it's out of date End If Next If bOldVersion Then strOutput = "Error: WUA Version is less than supported version " & strNeededVersion bIsScanTime = False End If End If Else ' versions are the same End If Else strOutput = "Error - WUA DLL ("&strWuaDll&") not found" bIsScanTime = False End If
End Function 'WUAVersionTooLowForScanTime Function GetSystemDir Dim strWinDir,strSysDir
'Check for 64-bit sysnative directory to avoid win redirect strWinDir = objFSO.GetSpecialFolder(0) strSysDir = strWinDir & "\sysnative"
If Not objFSO.FolderExists(strSysDir) Then strSysDir = objFSO.GetSpecialFolder(1) End If GetSystemDir = strSysDir End Function ' GetSystemDir

sensor.name: Has Tanium Client Install Files
sensor.description: Indicates whether the client machine has temporary files resulting from the install of the Tanium Client by the Client Deploy Tool Example: yes

query.script:
'======================================== ' Has Tanium Client Install Files '========================================
' This sensor will report on the existence of any file ' in the C:\Tanium directory specified in the array below ' The accompanying action which uses this sensor as a key will ' delete the files it finds within
Option Explicit
Dim objFSO Dim strTaniumDir Dim bHasFilesToDelete,arrFilesToDelete,strFile
Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject")
strTaniumDir = "C:\Tanium\"
arrFilesToDelete = Array("dodeploy.exe", "dodeploy.log", "postdeploy.exe", "postdeploy.log", _ "predeploy.exe", "predeploy.log", "SetupClient.exe", "tanium.pub")
bHasFilesToDelete = False For Each strFile In arrFilesToDelete If objFSO.FileExists(strTaniumDir&strFile) Then 'WScript.Echo "Should Delete " & strFile bHasFilesToDelete = True End If Next
If bHasFilesToDelete Then WScript.Echo "Yes" Else WScript.Echo "No" End If

sensor.name: Has Stale Tanium Client Data
sensor.description: Evaluates whether a machine has stale Tanium Client data - long running processes, old action status/log files, action folders, or sensor output. Example: Yes

query.script:
'======================================== ' Has Stale Tanium Client Data '======================================== ' This sensor will return Yes if a ' machine has processes running from the ' Tanium sensor or action directory that ' have been running longer than a day, ' has stale action status or log files ' older than 4 days, has stale sensor ' output data older than a day, has old ' action folders, has stale string /node data
Option Explicit
Dim intProcessesThreshold,intSensorDataThreshold,intStaleStatusFilesThreshold,dictDumps,bExtraDumpFiles Dim intStaleActionFoldersThreshold,intStaleFilesWantedDownloadThreshold,intStaleQNAThreshold,intMaxClientRAMInMB,MIN_CLIENT_STRING_NODE_THRESHOLD
intProcessesThreshold = 1440 ' one day in minutes intSensorDataThreshold = 1440 ' one day in minutes intStaleStatusFilesThreshold = 5670 ' 4 days in minutes intStaleQNAThreshold = 1440 ' one day in minutes intStaleActionFoldersThreshold = 2880 'two days in minutes intStaleFilesWantedDownloadThreshold = 0 'comment out this line and uncomment next to enable 'intStaleFilesWantedDownloadThreshold = 5670 '4 days in minutes ' report stale string data when Client RAM is above this value intMaxClientRAMInMB = 0 ' comment out this line and uncomment next ' intMaxClientRAMInMB = 200 ' Uncomment to check for client > 200 'set a minimum value which must match the value ' MIN_CLIENT_MEMORY_RESTART_THRESHOLD ' in the corresponding Clean Stale Client Data Action MIN_CLIENT_STRING_NODE_THRESHOLD = 50
SetLocale(1033) ' Uses Date Math which may require us/english to work correctly
' count and remove dump files Set dictDumps = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary") PopulateDumpFilesDict dictDumps bExtraDumpFiles = HasOldDumpFiles(dictDumps)
If HasStaleProcesses(intProcessesThreshold) Or _ HasStaleSensorData(intSensorDataThreshold) Or _ HasStaleActionStatusAndLogFiles(intStaleStatusFilesThreshold) Or _ HasStaleActionFolders(intStaleActionFoldersThreshold) Or _ HasStaleQNAFiles(intStaleQNAThreshold) Or _ HasStaleFilesWantedDownloads(intStaleFilesWantedDownloadThreshold) Or _ ClientRAMThresholdHitNoRestart(intMaxClientRAMInMB) Or _ bExtraDumpFiles Then WScript.Echo "Yes" Else WScript.Echo "No" End If
Sub PopulateDumpFilesDict(ByRef dictDump) ' builds a dictionary of dump files
Dim objFSO,strTaniumDir,objFolder,objFile,strFileName Dim strFilePath,strFileCreated
strTaniumDir = GetTaniumDir("") Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject")
For Each objFile In objFSO.GetFolder(strTaniumDir).Files strFileName = objFile.Name If Mid(strFileName,Len(strFileName) - 3,Len(strFileName)) = ".dmp" Then If Not dictDump.Exists(objFile.Path) Then dictDump.Add objFile.Path,objFile.DateCreated End If End If Next
End Sub 'PopulateDumpFilesDict
Function HasOldDumpFiles(ByRef dictDumps)
' keep last dump file Dim objFSO : Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject") Dim strDumpPath,dtmLatestDate,strLastDumpPath,strDumpDate,intCount
' which dump file was the latest - do not delete dtmLatestDate = CDate("07/06/1978") For Each strDumpPath In dictDumps.Keys strDumpDate = dictDumps.Item(strDumpPath) If IsDate(strDumpDate) Then If CDate(strDumpDate) > dtmLatestDate Then dtmLatestDate = CDate(strDumpDate) strLastDumpPath = strDumpPath End If End If Next
intCount = 0 For Each strDumpPath In dictDumps.Keys If Not strDumpPath = strLastDumpPath Then intCount = intCount + 1 End If Next
If intCount > 0 Then HasOldDumpFiles = True WScript.Echo "Unnecessary Dump Files" Else HasOldDumpFiles = False End If
End Function 'HasOldDumpFiles
Function HasStaleProcesses(intThreshold)
Dim bHasStaleProcesses,objWMIService,strPID,colItems,objItem Dim intAge,strCmd
bHasStaleProcesses = False ' assume false until tested ' We may get errors getting the age of some system processes On Error Resume Next Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\.\root\cimv2")
Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select * from Win32_Process",,48) For Each objItem In colItems strCmd = LCase(objItem.CommandLine) If (InStr(strCmd, "tanium client\vb\") > 0 Or InStr(strCmd, "tanium client\downloads\") > 0) Then intAge = GetAgeInMinutesWMI(objItem.CreationDate) strPid = objItem.ProcessId If intAge >= intThreshold Then bHasStaleProcesses = True Exit For End If End If Next On Error Goto 0
If bHasStaleProcesses Then WScript.Echo "Stale Processes" HasStaleProcesses = bHasStaleProcesses
End Function 'HasStaleProcesses
Function HasStaleSensorData(intThreshold) ' returns true or false
Dim bHasStaleSensorData,fso,strVBDir,intAge,objFolder,file
bHasStaleSensorData = False ' assume false until tested Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject") strVBDir = GetTaniumDir("VB")
If fso.FolderExists(strVBDir) Then Set objFolder = fso.GetFolder(strVBDir)
For Each file In objFolder.Files intAge = GetMinutesOld(file.DateLastModified) If intAge >= intThreshold Then bHasStaleSensorData = True Exit For End If Next End If
If bHasStaleSensorData Then WScript.Echo "Stale Sensor Data" HasStaleSensorData = bHasStaleSensorData
End Function 'HasStaleSensorData
Function HasStaleActionStatusAndLogFiles(intThreshold) ' returns true or false
Dim bHasStaleActionStatusAndLogFiles,fso,strVBDir,intAge,objFolder,file Dim arrWords1,strExt,arrWords2,strDownloadsDir bHasStaleActionStatusAndLogFiles = False 'assume false until tested
Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject")
strDownloadsDir = GetTaniumDir("Downloads")
If fso.FolderExists(strDownloadsDir) Then Set objFolder = fso.GetFolder(strDownloadsDir)
For Each file In objFolder.Files If Left(file.Name, 6) = "Action" Then arrWords1 = Split(file.Name, ".") strExt = arrWords1(UBound(arrWords1)) If LCase(strExt) = "log" Or LCase(strExt) = "status" Then intAge = GetMinutesOld(file.DateLastModified) If intAge >= intThreshold Then bHasStaleActionStatusAndLogFiles = True Exit For End If End If End If Next End If
If bHasStaleActionStatusAndLogFiles Then WScript.Echo "Stale Action Status/Log Files" HasStaleActionStatusAndLogFiles = bHasStaleActionStatusAndLogFiles
End Function 'HasStaleActionStatusAndLogFiles
Function HasStaleFilesWantedDownloads(intThreshold) ' returns true or false
Dim bHasStaleFilesWantedDownloads,fso,strCacheDir,objFolder,objFile Dim strFileName, intAge bHasStaleFilesWantedDownloads = False 'assume false until tested
Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject")
strCacheDir = GetTaniumDir("Downloads\Cache")
If fso.FolderExists(strCacheDir) And intThreshold <> 0 Then Set objFolder = fso.GetFolder(strCacheDir)
For Each objFile In objFolder.Files strFileName = objFile.Name
If strFileName <> "Catalog" And _ strFileName <> "FullCacheFile" And _ strFileName <> "HotCacheFile" And _ InStr(strFileName, "-") > 0 Then intAge = GetMinutesOld(objFile.DateLastModified) If intAge >= intThreshold Then bHasStaleFilesWantedDownloads = True Exit For End If End If Next End If
If bHasStaleFilesWantedDownloads Then WScript.Echo "Stalled Downloads" HasStaleFilesWantedDownloads = bHasStaleFilesWantedDownloads
End Function 'HasStaleFilesWantedDownloads
Function HasStaleActionFolders(intThreshold) ' returns true or false ' threshold value recommended > 2 days for long running actions. Dim intCount,fso,strVBDir,intAge,objFolder,folder Dim arrWords1,strExt,strDownloadsDir,bHasStaleActionStatusAndLogFiles bHasStaleActionStatusAndLogFiles = False 'assume false until tested
Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject")
strDownloadsDir = GetTaniumDir("Downloads")
intCount = 0 If fso.FolderExists(strDownloadsDir) Then Set objFolder = fso.GetFolder(strDownloadsDir) For Each folder In objFolder.Subfolders If Left(folder.Name, 7) = "Action_" Then intAge = GetMinutesOld(folder.DateLastModified) If intAge >= intThreshold Then bHasStaleActionStatusAndLogFiles = True Exit For End If End If Next End If
If bHasStaleActionStatusAndLogFiles Then WScript.Echo "Stale Action Folders" HasStaleActionFolders = bHasStaleActionStatusAndLogFiles
End Function 'HasStaleActionFolders
Function HasStaleQNAFiles(intThreshold) ' returns true or false Dim intCount,fso,strVBDir,intAge,objFolder,file Dim strQNADir,strTaniumDir,bHasStaleQNAFiles bHasStaleQNAFiles = False 'assume false until tested Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject") ' Do not point gettaniumdir at tools\qna directly or it would create the folder strTaniumDir = GetTaniumDir("") strQNADir = strTaniumDir&"QNA"
intCount = 0 If fso.FolderExists(strQNADir) Then Set objFolder = fso.GetFolder(strQNADir) On Error Resume Next For Each file In objFolder.Files If Instr(file.name,".qna") > 0 Then intAge = GetMinutesOld(file.DateLastModified) If intAge >= intThreshold Then bHasStaleQNAFiles = True End If End If Next On Error Goto 0 End If
If bHasStaleQNAFiles Then WScript.Echo "Stale QNA Files" HasStaleQNAFiles = bHasStaleQNAFiles
End Function 'HasStaleQNAFiles
Function GetAgeInMinutesWMI(strWMI) Dim strProcessStart,strYear,strMonth,strDate,strHours,strMin,strSec Dim dtmProcessStart
strYear = Left(strWMI, 4) strMonth = Mid(strWmi, 5, 2) strDate = Mid(strWMI, 7, 2) strHours = Mid(strWMI, 9, 2) strMin = Mid(strWMI, 11, 2) strSec = Mid(strWMI, 13, 2) strProcessStart = strMonth&"/"&strDate&"/"&strYear&" " & _ strhours&":"&strMin&":"&strSec On Error Resume Next dtmProcessStart = FormatDateTime(strProcessStart, 0) If Err.Number <> 0 Then GetAgeInMinutesWMI = False On Error Goto 0 Exit Function End If On Error Goto 0 GetAgeInMinutesWMI = DateDiff("n", dtmProcessStart, Now()) End Function 'GetAgeInMinutesWMI
Function GetOffset Dim objSWbemServices,colTimeZone,objTimeZone
Set objSWbemServices = GetObject("winmgmts:{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\.\root\cimv2") Set colTimeZone = objSWbemServices.ExecQuery("SELECT * FROM Win32_TimeZone") For Each objTimeZone In colTimeZone GetOffset = objTimeZone.Bias Next End Function
Function GetMinutesOld(strDate) Dim patternDate On Error Resume Next patternDate = CDate( strDate ) If Err.Number <> 0 Then GetMinutesOld = False On Error Goto 0 Exit Function End If On Error Goto 0 GetMinutesOld = Abs(DateDiff("n", patternDate, Now())) End Function 'GetMinutesOld
Function GetTaniumDir(strSubDir) 'GetTaniumDir with GeneratePath, works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 End If
