sensor.name: Screen Saver Active
sensor.description: Indicates whether a screen saver is enabled on the client machine. Example: True

query.script:
'======================================== ' Screen Saver Active '========================================
' This sensor will report on whether the screen saver is active
Option Explicit
WScript.Echo GetScreenSaverActive
Function GetScreenSaverActive
Dim objWMIService, colDesktops Dim strComputer, objDesktop, bIsActive
strComputer = "." Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:" _ & "{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\" & strComputer & "\root\cimv2")
Set colDesktops = objWMIService.ExecQuery _ ("Select ScreenSaverActive from Win32_Desktop") If Not IsNull(colDesktops) Then For Each objDesktop In colDesktops bIsActive = objDesktop.ScreenSaverActive Next If bIsActive Then GetScreenSaverActive = "True" Else GetScreenSaverActive = "False" End If Else GetScreenSaverActive = "WMI Error" End If
'Cleanup Set colDesktops = Nothing Set objWMIService = Nothing End Function 'GetScreenSaverActive

sensor.name: Established Connections
sensor.description: Any established connections currently being made. This multi-column Sensor displays the process responsible for the connection, the display name of the process (if available), and the target IP Address and port. Processes and IP ranges can be excluded in the Sensor definition. Example: chrome.exe | Google Chrome | 173.194.79.99:80

query.script:
'======================================== ' Established Connections '========================================
showProcess = True showPort = True showDNSName = False
Dim strcommand, results, excludeProcesses, excludeSubnets, taniumDebug Dim strSep : strSep = "|" ' This is a multi-column sensor that looks like: 'Process|Name|Target IP
excludeProcesses = "TaniumClient.exe,TaniumReceiver.exe" 'excludeProcesses = "chrome.exe" 'excludeProcesses = "iexplore.exe" 'excludeProcesses = "chrome.exe, iexplore.exe" 'excludeProcesses = "trillian.exe"
excludeSubnets = "127.0.0.0:255.255.255.0" 'excludeSubnets = "72.14.213.0:255.255.255.0, 74.125.223.0:255.255.255.0-74.125.225.0:255.255.255.0"
taniumDebug = False
excludeProcesses = Split(LCase(excludeProcesses), ",") excludeSubnets = Split(excludeSubnets, ",")
strComputer = "." Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:" & "{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\" & strComputer & "\root\cimv2") query = "select name, executablepath, processId from win32_process" Set colResults = objWMIService.ExecQuery(query)
'dictionary for process-app pairs Set processes = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary")
For Each result In colResults processId = CStr(result.ProcessId) processPath = result.ExecutablePath processes.Add processId, result.Name & "," & processPath ' tie IDs to exes,path - split later Next
strcommand = "cmd /c netstat -aon -p TCP | find " & Chr(34) & "TCP" & Chr(34) & " | find " & Chr(34) & "ESTABLISHED" & Chr(34)
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell") Set objScriptExec = objShell.Exec (strCommand) strPingResults = LCase(objScriptExec.StdOut.ReadAll)
results = Split(strPingResults, vbCrLf) j = 0
For Each line In results line = cleanWhitespace(Trim(line))
If line <> "" Then lineResults = Split(line) i = 0 Dim strPort, strPid, strConnectionType, strForeignIp, strApp For Each word In lineResults If i = 1 Then strPort = word ElseIf i = 2 Then strForeignIp = word ElseIf i = 3 Then strConnectionType = word ElseIf i = 4 Then strPid = word End If
i = i + 1 Next
'DO NOT INCLUDE EXCLUDED APPS strAppEntry = processes.Item(strPid) ' looks like process.exe, Process Path arrAppEntry = Split(strAppEntry,",") strAppExe = arrAppEntry(0) strAppPath = arrAppEntry(1)
isNotExcludedApp = Not(ContainedInArray(LCase(strAppExe), excludeProcesses))
'DO NOT INCLUDE EXCLUDED SUBNETS isNotExcludedSubnet = Not(ContainedInSubnet(strForeignIp, excludeSubnets))
If Not(IsEmpty(strAppExe)) _ And isNotExcludedApp _ And isNotExcludedSubnet Then
If Not showPort Then arrTemp = Split(strForeignIp, ":") strForeignIp = arrTemp(0) End If
If showDNSName Then arrTemp = Split(strForeignIp, ":") strForeignIp = ReverseDNSLookup(arrTemp(0)) If UBound(arrTemp) >=1 Then strForeignIp = strForeignIp & ":" & arrTemp(1) End If End If
If showProcess Then results(j) = strAppExe & strSep & ProcessNameToApplicationName(strAppPath,strAppExe) & strSep & strForeignIp Else results(j) = strSep & strSep & strForeignIp End If Else If taniumDebug Then WScript.Echo " excluded: " & strApp & " " & strForeignIp results(j) = "" End If
j = j + 1 End If Next
results = RemDups(results)
If UBound(results) < 1 Then If GetLocale() <> 1033 Then WScript.Echo "English Language OS Required" End If End If
For Each result In results WScript.Echo result Next
WScript.Quit
Function ReverseDNSLookup(strIPAddress) ReverseDNSLookup = strIPAddress Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell") Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject")
Set objExecCommand = objShell.Exec("%comspec% /c nslookup " & strIPAddress)
strResults = objExecCommand.StdOut.ReadAll
If InStr(strResults, "Name:") Then arrNameTemp = Split(strResults, "Name:") arrName = Split(Trim(arrNameTemp(1)), Chr(13))
ReverseDNSLookup = arrName(0) End If End Function
Function ContainedInSubnet(str, arr) Dim strIp, strSubnet, strMask temp = Split(str, ":") strIp = temp(0)
For Each item In arr If InStr(item, "-") Then 'Subnet range temp = Split(item, "-") lower = Split(temp(0), ":") upper = Split(temp(1), ":") lowerSubnet = Trim(lower(0)) lowerMask = Trim(lower(1)) upperSubnet = Trim(upper(0)) upperMask = Trim(upper(1))
If StringToBinary(strIp) > StringToBinary(Subnet(lowerSubnet, lowerMask)) _ And StringToBinary(strIp) < StringToBinary(Subnet(upperSubnet, upperMask)) Then ContainedInSubnet = True Exit Function End If Else 'Single subnet parts = Split(item, ":") strSubnet = Trim(parts(0)) strMask = Trim(parts(1)) If Subnet(strIp, strMask) = Subnet(strSubnet, strMask) Then ContainedInSubnet = True Exit Function End If End If Next ContainedInSubnet = False End Function
Function ContainedInArray(str, arr) For Each item In arr If str = Trim(item) Then ContainedInArray = True Exit Function End If Next ContainedInArray = False End Function
Function cleanWhitespace(strStarter) intStarter = Len(strStarter) For i = intStarter To 2 Step -1 strChars = Space(i) strStarter = Replace(strStarter, strChars, " ") Next cleanWhitespace = strStarter End Function
Function RemDups(ByVal anArray) Dim d, item, thekeys Set d = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary") d.removeall d.CompareMode = 0 For Each item In anArray If Len(item) > 0 Then If Not d.Exists(item) Then d.Add item, item End If Next thekeys = d.keys Set d = Nothing RemDups = thekeys End Function
Function Subnet(strAddress, strMask) intSubnetLength = SubnetLength(strMask) Subnet = BinaryToString(Left(StringToBinary(strAddress), intSubnetLength) & String(32 - intSubnetLength, "0")) End Function
Function SubnetLength(strMask) strMaskBinary = StringToBinary(strMask) SubnetLength = Len(Left(strMaskBinary, InStr(strMaskBinary, "0") - 1)) End Function
Function BinaryToString(strBinary) For intOctetPos = 1 To 4 strOctetBinary = Right(Left(strBinary, intOctetPos * 8), 8) intOctet = 0 intValue = 1 For intBinaryPos = 1 To Len(strOctetBinary) If Left(Right(strOctetBinary, intBinaryPos), 1) = "1" Then intOctet = intOctet + intValue intValue = intValue * 2 Next If BinaryToString = Empty Then BinaryToString = CStr(intOctet) Else BinaryToString = BinaryToString & "." & CStr(intOctet) Next End Function
Function StringToBinary(strAddress) objAddress = Split(strAddress, ".", -1) For Each strOctet In objAddress intOctet = CInt(strOctet) strOctetBinary = "" For x = 1 To 8 If intOctet Mod 2 > 0 Then strOctetBinary = "1" & strOctetBinary Else strOctetBinary = "0" & strOctetBinary End If intOctet = Int(intOctet / 2) Next StringToBinary = StringToBinary & strOctetBinary Next End Function
Function ProcessNameToApplicationName(strExecutablePath, strExecutableName) ' This function will return the full application name of a running executable
Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject")
arrPathParts = Split(strExecutablePath,"\")
If UBound(arrPathParts) < 0 Then 'can be -1 for no split, such as the System process ProcessNameToApplicationName = strExecutableName Set fso = Nothing Exit Function End If strExecutable = arrPathParts(UBound(arrPathParts))
If fso.FileExists(strExecutablePath) Then Dim strOutput, fileVersion, fileVersionOutput, fullName
Set execFile = fso.GetFile(strExecutablePath) fullName = GetDescription(execFile.ParentFolder.Path, strExecutable) If Not fullName = "" Then ProcessNameToApplicationName = fullName Else ProcessNameToApplicationName = strExecutableName End If Else ' file doesn't exist or inaccessible ProcessNameToApplicationName = strExecutableName End If
End Function 'ProcessNameToApplicationName
Function GetDescription(folderPath, fileName) descIndex = GetAttributeIndex(folderPath, "File description") If IsEmpty(descIndex) Then descIndex = GetAttributeIndex(folderPath, "Description") End If GetDescription = GetFileProperty(folderPath, fileName, descIndex) End Function
Function GetFileProperty(folderPath, fileName, fileProperty) Set objShell = CreateObject("Shell.Application") Set objFolder = objShell.Namespace(folderPath) GetFileProperty = objFolder.GetDetailsOf(objFolder.Parsename(fileName), fileProperty) End Function
Function GetAttributeIndex(folderPath, attrTarget) Set objShell = CreateObject("Shell.Application") Set objFolder = objShell.Namespace(folderPath) For i = 0 To 50 attrName = objFolder.GetDetailsOf(objFolder.Items, i) If LCase(attrName) = LCase(attrTarget) Then GetAttributeIndex = i Exit Function End If Next
End Function

sensor.name: Operating System Boot Directory
sensor.description: Returns the directory the Operating System boots from. Example:\\Windows

query.script: select BootDirectory from win32_BootConfiguration

sensor.name: USB Device
sensor.description: Returns a list of USB devices currently plugged in to the client machine. Example: HID Keyboard Device

query.script: select Caption from Win32_PnPEntity where (Status='OK' and DeviceID like '%HID%')

sensor.name: Sound Card
sensor.description: Name of sound card in client machine. Example: SoundMAX Integrated Digital HD Audio

query.script: select Name from Win32_SoundDevice

sensor.name: BIOS Vendor
sensor.description: Manufacturer or vendor of the BIOS. Example: Dell, Inc.

query.script: select Manufacturer from win32_BIOS
#!/bin/bash dmidecode -s bios-vendor

sensor.name: Mapped Drives
sensor.description: Returns share names of network shares which are mapped locally. Example: \\\\server\\share

query.script:
'======================================== ' Mapped Drives '======================================== '
Option Explicit
Dim dictBlacklist, objWMIService, colItems, objItem, strProviderName, bShouldList, strItem
Set dictBlacklist = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary")
' Add one line for each file share that you do not want listed in the sensor output. 'dictBlacklist.Add LCase("InsertBlacklistPathHere"), True
Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\.\root\CIMV2") Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("select ProviderName from WIN32_LogicalDisk") For Each objItem In colItems strProviderName = objItem.ProviderName
If Not IsNull(strProviderName) Then bShouldList = True
For Each strItem In dictBlacklist.Keys If InStr(LCase(strProviderName), strItem) < 0 Then bShouldList = False End If Next
If bShouldList Then WScript.Echo strProviderName End If End If Next

sensor.name: System Event Log IDs
sensor.description: Event codes for Windows event logs of type System and Error. Example: 8009

query.script: select EventCode from Win32_NTLogEvent where LogFile = 'System' and Type = 'Error' and TimeWritten > '$$GETUTCDATE$$86000$$'

sensor.name: Registry Value Data
sensor.parameter_definition: {"parameters":[{"restrict":null,"validationExpressions":[{"helpString":"Value must be at least 5 characters","flags":"","expression":"\\S{5}","parameterType":"com.tanium.models::ValidationExpression","model":"com.tanium.models::ValidationExpression"}],"helpString":"Enter the key path to query","promptText":"e.g. HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\\Software\\Microsoft","defaultValue":"","value":"","label":"Registry Key","maxChars":0,"key":"strKey","parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::TextInputParameter","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::TextInputParameter"},{"restrict":null,"validationExpressions":[{"helpString":"Value can not be blank","flags":"","expression":"^\\S","parameterType":"com.tanium.models::ValidationExpression","model":"com.tanium.models::ValidationExpression"}],"helpString":"Enter the key value to query","promptText":"e.g. Version","defaultValue":"","value":"","label":"Registry Value","maxChars":0,"key":"strValue","parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::TextInputParameter","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::TextInputParameter"}],"parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray"}
sensor.description: Returns the data of a supplied value in a supplied registry key. If the hive is HKEY_USERS, it will attempt to output the user name associated with the key. HKEY_CURRENT_USER will only return data for the SYSTEM account which the Tanium Client runs as. Example: John | 4.1.314.7020 | REG_SZ|32-bit

query.script:
'======================================== ' Registry Value Data '========================================
'Columns: ' User | Data | Type | Architecture | KeyPath | Value
' Value is a hidden column for later use in sensor-fed actions (modify, delete)
strKey = unescape("||strKey||") strValue = unescape("||strValue||")
'strKey = "HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client 'strValue = "Version"
'strKey = "HKEY_USERS\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Internet Settings" 'strValue = "Emailname" strSep = "~~"
'Constants for value types Const REG_SZ = 1 Const REG_EXPAND_SZ = 2 Const REG_BINARY = 3 Const REG_DWORD = 4 Const REG_MULTI_SZ = 7 Const REG_QWORD = 11
'Split up strKey into the hive constant and the registry key words = Split(strKey, "\") strHive = words(0) constHive = GetHiveConst(strHive)
strKey = Right(strKey, Len(strKey) - Len(strHive) -1)
'Global for Username Dim strUserName strUserName = "N/A" ' default value, overridden if HKEY_USERS hive
'Set up registry objects for 32-bit, then check value 'Need to check all values of key in order to get type Set objCtx = GetObjCtx(32) Set objReg = GetObjReg(objCtx)
If strHive = "HKEY_USERS" Then ' go through each User's hive For Each strUserKey In GetSubKeys(objReg, objCtx, constHive, "") If Not InStr(strUserKey,"_Classes") > 0 Then ' ignore _Classes entries strUserName = GetUserForSIDLocal(objReg,strUserKey) If strUserName = False Then strUserName = strUserKey strFullUserKey = strUserKey&"\"&strKey hasValues32 = CheckValues(objReg, objCTX, constHive, strFullUserKey, strValue, 32) If hasValues32 Then hasAnyResult = True End If Next Else ' was another hive hasValues32 = CheckValues(objReg, objCtx, constHive, strKey, strValue, 32) If hasValues32 Then hasAnyResult = True End If
' Do not return second value set in different context unnecessarily Dim strKeyPrefix,bSkipSecondContextCheck bSkipSecondContextCheck = False strKeyPrefix = Split(strKey,"\")(0) ' Software, for instance, even for HEKY_USERS
Select Case Ucase(strKeyPrefix) Case "SOFTWARE" bSkipSecondContextCheck = False Case Else bSkipSecondContextCheck = True End Select
If Is64 And Not bSkipSecondContextCheck Then Set objCtx = GetObjCtx(64) Set objReg = GetObjReg(objCtx) If strHive = "HKEY_USERS" Then ' go through each User's hive in 64-bit context For Each strUserKey In GetSubKeys(objReg, objCtx, constHive, "") If Not InStr(strUserKey,"_Classes") > 0 Then ' ignore _Classes entries strUserName = GetUserForSIDLocal(objReg,strUserKey) If strUserName = False Then strUserName = strUserKey strFullUserKey = strUserKey&"\"&strKey hasValues64 = CheckValues(objReg, objCTX, constHive, strFullUserKey, strValue, 64) If hasValues64 Then hasAnyResult = True End If Next Else ' was another hive hasValues64 = CheckValues(objReg, objCtx, constHive, strKey, strValue, 64) If hasValues64 Then hasAnyResult = True End If End If
If Not (hasAnyResult) Then WScript.Echo "Key/Value not found" End If
'Goes through all values in a key, returns True if strValue is found Function CheckValues(objReg, objCtx, constHive, strKey, strValue, intBit)
Dim Inparams, Outparams Set Inparams = objReg.Methods_("EnumValues").Inparameters Inparams.Hdefkey = constHive Inparams.sSubkeyname = strKey Set Outparams = objReg.ExecMethod_("EnumValues", Inparams,,objCtx)
arrNames = Outparams.sNames arrTypes = Outparams.Types
If Not IsNull(arrNames) Then For i = LBound(arrNames) To UBound(arrNames) strValueName = arrNames(i)
'if strValue is found, echo If LCase(strValueName) = LCase(strValue) Then EchoValue objReg, objCtx, constHive, strKey, strValue, arrTypes(i), intBit CheckValues = True Exit Function End If Next End If CheckValues = False End Function
Function GetDisplayString(strKey, strType, strValue, intBit) If intBit = 64 Then strArch = "64-bit" Else strArch = "32-bit" End If
GetDisplayString = _ strValue & strSep & _ strType & strSep & _ strArch End Function
Function EchoValue(objReg, objCtx, constHive, strKey, strValue, constType, intBit) ' Note the key that was being searched, will be a hidden column strOutputKey = strHive&"\"&strKey
Dim objInParams, objOutParams Select Case constType Case REG_SZ Set objInParams = objReg.Methods_("GetStringValue").InParameters objInParams.hDefKey = constHive objInParams.sSubKeyName = strKey objInParams.sValueName = strValue Set objOutParams = objReg.ExecMethod_("GetStringValue", objInParams, , objCtx)
WScript.Echo strUserName & strSep & GetDisplayString(strKey, "REG_SZ", objOutParams.sValue, intBit) _ & strSep & strOutputKey & strSep & strValue Case REG_EXPAND_SZ Set objInParams = objReg.Methods_("GetExpandedStringValue").InParameters objInParams.hDefKey = constHive objInParams.sSubKeyName = strKey objInParams.sValueName = strValue Set objOutParams = objReg.ExecMethod_("GetExpandedStringValue", objInParams, , objCtx)
WScript.Echo strUserName & strSep & GetDisplayString(strKey, "REG_EXPAND_SZ", objOutParams.sValue, intBit) _ & strSep & strOutputKey & strSep & strValue Case REG_BINARY Set objInParams = objReg.Methods_("GetBinaryValue").InParameters objInParams.hDefKey = constHive objInParams.sSubKeyName = strKey objInParams.sValueName = strValue Set objOutParams = objReg.ExecMethod_("GetBinaryValue", objInParams, , objCtx)
strBytes = "" For Each uByte in objOutParams.uValue strTemp = Hex(uByte) If Len(strTemp) < 2 Then strTemp = "0" & strTemp End If strBytes = strBytes & strTemp & " " Next
WScript.Echo strUserName & strSep & GetDisplayString(strKey, "REG_BINARY", strBytes, intBit) _ & strSep & strOutputKey & strSep & strValue Case REG_DWORD Set objInParams = objReg.Methods_("GetDWordValue").InParameters objInParams.hDefKey = constHive objInParams.sSubKeyName = strKey objInParams.sValueName = strValue Set objOutParams = objReg.ExecMethod_("GetDWordValue", objInParams, , objCtx)
WScript.Echo strUserName & strSep & GetDisplayString(strKey, "REG_DWORD", CStr(objOutParams.uValue), intBit) _ & strSep & strOutputKey & strSep & strValue Case REG_QWORD Set objInParams = objReg.Methods_("GetQWordValue").InParameters objInParams.hDefKey = constHive objInParams.sSubKeyName = strKey objInParams.sValueName = strValue Set objOutParams = objReg.ExecMethod_("GetQWordValue", objInParams, , objCtx)
WScript.Echo strUserName & strSep & GetDisplayString(strKey, "REG_QWORD", CStr(objOutParams.uValue), intBit) _ & strSep & strOutputKey & strSep & strValue Case REG_MULTI_SZ Set objInParams = objReg.Methods_("GetMultiStringValue").InParameters objInParams.hDefKey = constHive objInParams.sSubKeyName = strKey objInParams.sValueName = strValue Set objOutParams = objReg.ExecMethod_("GetMultiStringValue", objInParams, , objCtx)
arrValues = objOutParams.sValue strResponse = ""
For Each strTemp In arrValues WScript.Echo strUserName & strSep & GetDisplayString(strKey, "REG_MULTI_SZ", strTemp, intBit) _ & strSep & strOutputKey & strSep & strValue Next
End Select End Function
Function GetObjCtx(intArch) Dim objCtx Set objCtx = CreateObject("WbemScripting.SWbemNamedValueSet") objCtx.Add "__ProviderArchitecture", intArch objCtx.Add "__RequiredArchitecture", TRUE Set GetObjCtx = objCtx End Function
Function GetObjReg(objCtx) Dim objLocator, objServices Set objLocator = CreateObject("Wbemscripting.SWbemLocator") Set objServices = objLocator.ConnectServer("","root\default","","",,,,objCtx) Set GetObjReg = objServices.Get("StdRegProv") End Function
Function GetSubKeys(objReg, objCtx, constHive, strKey) Dim Inparams, Outparams Set Inparams = objReg.Methods_("EnumKey").Inparameters Inparams.Hdefkey = constHive Inparams.sSubkeyname = strKey Set Outparams = objReg.ExecMethod_("EnumKey", Inparams,,objCtx) GetSubKeys = Outparams.sNames End Function
Function Is64 Dim objWMIService, colItems, objItem Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\.\root\CIMV2") Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select SystemType from Win32_ComputerSystem") For Each objItem In colItems If InStr(LCase(objItem.SystemType), "x64") > 0 Then Is64 = True Else Is64 = False End If Next End Function
Function GetHiveConst(hive) Const HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT = &H80000000 Const HKEY_CURRENT_USER = &H80000001 Const HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE = &H80000002 Const HKEY_USERS = &H80000003
Select Case UCase(hive) Case "HKLM" GetHiveConst = HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE Case "HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE" GetHiveConst = HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE Case "HKCR" GetHiveConst = HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT Case "HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT" GetHiveConst = HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT Case "HKEY_CURRENT_USER" GetHiveConst = HKEY_CURRENT_USER Case "HKEY_USERS" GetHiveConst = HKEY_USERS End Select
If IsEmpty(GetHiveConst) Then WScript.Echo "Invalid registry hive: " & hive WScript.Quit End If End Function
Function GetUserForSIDLocal(objReg,strSID) ' This function converts a SID to a user name ' by doing a registry lookup, avoiding an LDAP query ' this will fail in the case where the user's name was changed in AD ' as they will still have their old home directory name
Const HKLM = &h80000002
Dim strHiveListKey,strUserData,intDatPos,intFinalBackslashPos
strHiveListKey = "SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\hivelist" objReg.GetStringValue HKLM,strHiveListKey,"\Registry\User\"&strSID,strUserData If Not IsNull(strUserData) Then ' strUserData would look like ' \Device\HarddiskVolume2\Users\user.name\NTUSER.DAT intDatPos = InStr(UCase(strUserData),"\NTUSER.DAT") ' strip off the dat file If intDatPos > 0 Then ' must be in string strUserData = Left(strUserData,intDatPos - 1) ' find last backslash intFinalBackslashPos = InStrRev(strUserData,"\") ' get right from that pos strUserData = Right(strUserData,Len(strUserData) - intFinalBackslashPos) GetUserForSIDLocal = strUserData Else strUserData = False End If Else GetUserForSIDLocal = False End If End Function 'GetUserForSIDLocal

sensor.name: Disk Drive Details
sensor.description: Multi-column sensor that returns details on the type, size, and free space of all partitions on the machine. Example:ST3808110AS ATA Device|C:|250G|120G

query.script:
' Sensor: Disk Drive Details ' disk-drive-details.vbs ' ' Multicolumn sensor that returns all of the drive details on a single line
Option Explicit
Dim objWMIService, objDiskDrives, objDiskDrive, objDiskPartitions, objDiskPartition Dim objLogicalDisks, objLogicalDisk Dim strEscapedDeviceID
Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:{impersonationLevel=Impersonate}!//.") Set objDiskDrives = objWMIService.ExecQuery("SELECT Caption, DeviceID FROM Win32_DiskDrive")
For Each objDiskDrive In objDiskDrives strEscapedDeviceID = _ Replace(objDiskDrive.DeviceID, "\", "\\", 1, -1, vbTextCompare) Set objDiskPartitions = objWMIService.ExecQuery _ ("ASSOCIATORS OF {Win32_DiskDrive.DeviceID=""" & _ strEscapedDeviceID & """} WHERE " & _ "AssocClass = Win32_DiskDriveToDiskPartition")
For Each objDiskPartition In objDiskPartitions Set objLogicalDisks = objWMIService.ExecQuery _ ("ASSOCIATORS OF {Win32_DiskPartition.DeviceID=""" & _ objDiskPartition.DeviceID & """} WHERE " & _ "AssocClass = Win32_LogicalDiskToPartition")
For Each objLogicalDisk In objLogicalDisks WScript.Echo objDiskDrive.Caption & "|" & objLogicalDisk.DeviceID & "|" & _ SizeInGB(objLogicalDisk.Size) & "|" & SizeInGB(objLogicalDisk.FreeSpace) Next Next Next
Function SizeInGB(orgSize) Dim dblSize, intSize, strResult strResult = "" If Not IsNull(orgSize) Then dblSize = CDbl(orgSize) dblSize = dblSize / 1024 / 1024 / 1024 intSize = CInt(dblSize) strResult = intSize & " GB" End If
SizeInGB = strResult End Function

sensor.name: High CPU Consumption
sensor.description: Indicates whether the client machine is currently experiencing high utilization of its CPU. Example: Under threshold

query.script:
'======================================== ' High CPU Consumption '========================================
Const HKLM = &H80000002 strComputer = "."
Set objWMIService = _ GetObject("Winmgmts:{impersonationlevel=impersonate}!\Root\Cimv2")
Set colProcItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select * from Win32_PerfRawData_PerfProc_Process where Name = 'Idle'") For Each objItem in colProcItems N1 = objItem.PercentProcessorTime D1 = objItem.TimeStamp_Sys100NS Next
WScript.sleep(3000)
Set colProcItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select * from Win32_PerfRawData_PerfProc_Process where Name = 'Idle'") For Each objItem in colProcItems N2 = objItem.PercentProcessorTime D2 = objItem.TimeStamp_Sys100NS Next
numLogicalProcessors = 0
Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("SELECT * FROM Win32_Processor") For Each objItem in colItems Dim intLogicalProcessors intLogicalProcessors = 1
On Error Resume Next intLogicalProcessors = CInt(objItem.NumberOfLogicalProcessors) On Error Goto 0
numLogicalProcessors = numLogicalProcessors + intLogicalProcessors Next
' CounterType - PERF_100NSEC_TIMER ' Formula = ((N2 - N1) / (D2 - D1)) x 100 If ( 0 = (D2-D1) ) Or D1 > D2 then WScript.echo "System Timestamp Error" ElseIf N1 > N2 Then WScript.Echo "Performance Counter Error" Else percentage = Round(100 - ((N2 - N1) / (D2 - D1)) * 100 / numLogicalProcessors, 0) If percentage > 80 Then WScript.echo percentage & " %" Else WScript.echo "Under 80% threshold" End if End if
Set wmi_service = nothing

sensor.name: Recently Uninstalled Patches
sensor.description: This sensor will return all patches uninstalled in the last 7 days

query.script:
'============================== ' Tanium Community Content ' Script ID: 1380 ' Last Modified: Fri Mar 7, 2014 9:51 PM '==============================
'======================================== 'Recently Uninstalled Patches '========================================
' This sensor will return all patches uninstalled in the last 7 days
Option Explicit Dim strSep : strSep = "|" Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject") Dim strScanDir,strUninstallLog,strLogLine,strUninstallDate,strSplitLine,strDateOnly,strSplitDate strScanDir = GetTaniumDir("Tools") & "Scans\" strUninstallLog = strScanDir & "uninstalledresultsreadable.txt" Dim objReadLog : Set objReadLog = fso.OpenTextFile (strUninstallLog,1)
Do While Not objReadLog.AtEndOfStream strLogLine = objReadLog.ReadLine strSplitLine = Split(strLogLine,strSep) strUninstallDate = strSplitLine(2) strSplitDate = Split(strUninstallDate," ") strDateOnly = strSplitDate(0) If DateDiff("d",strUninstallDate,Now) < 8 Then If UBound(strSplitLine) > 3 Then WScript.Echo strSplitLine(0) & strSep & strSplitLine(1) & strSep & strDateOnly & strSep & strSplitLine(3) & strSep & strSplitLine(4) Else WScript.Echo strSplitLine(0) & strSep & strSplitLine(1) & strSep & strDateOnly & strSep & strSplitLine(3) End If End If Loop
'_____________________________________ Function GetTaniumDir(strSubDir) 'GetTaniumDir with GeneratePath, works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 End If
If Not strPath = "" Then If strSubDir <> "" Then strSubDir = "\" & strSubDir End If
Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject") If fso.FolderExists(strPath) Then If Not fso.FolderExists(strPath & strSubDir) Then ''Need to loop through strSubDir and create all sub directories GeneratePath strPath & strSubDir, fso End If GetTaniumDir = strPath & strSubDir & "\" Else ' Specified Path doesn't exist on the filesystem WScript.Echo "Error: " & strPath & " does not exist on the filesystem" GetTaniumDir = False End If Else WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot find Tanium Client path in Registry" GetTaniumDir = False End If End Function 'GetTaniumDir '________________________________________________ Function GeneratePath(pFolderPath, fso) GeneratePath = False
If Not fso.FolderExists(pFolderPath) Then If GeneratePath(fso.GetParentFolderName(pFolderPath), fso) Then GeneratePath = True Call fso.CreateFolder(pFolderPath) End If Else GeneratePath = True End If End Function 'GeneratePath

sensor.name: System Drive
sensor.description: Hard drive location hosting system directory on Windows machines. Example: C:

query.script: select SystemDrive from win32_operatingsystem

sensor.name: High Memory Consumption
sensor.description: Indicates whether the machine is above an acceptable threshold for memory utilization. Example: Under threshold

query.script:
'======================================== ' High Memory Consumption '========================================
Set oWsh = WScript.CreateObject("WScript.Shell") Set oWshSysEnv = oWsh.Environment("PROCESS") Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\.\root\CIMV2") 'Gets MEMORY Usage Set colItems = GetObject("WinMgmts:root/cimv2").ExecQuery("Select * FROM Win32_PerfFormattedData_PerfOS_Memory ") For Each objItem In colItems strLinePercentCommittedBytesInUse = strLinePercentCommittedBytesInUse & " " & objItem.PercentCommittedBytesInUse Next If strLinePercentCommittedBytesInUse > 60 THEN wscript.echo strLinePercentCommittedBytesInUse & " percent" Else wscript.echo "Under Threshold" End If

sensor.name: Local User Password Change Dates
sensor.description: Returns the last time the password was set for each user account. Example: taniumuser|2013-10-31

query.script: Set objNetwork = CreateObject("Wscript.Network") strComputer = objNetwork.ComputerName Set colAccounts = GetObject("WinNT://" & strComputer & "") colAccounts.Filter = Array("user") For Each objUser In colAccounts intPasswordAge = objUser.PasswordAge intPasswordAge = intPasswordAge * -1 dtmChangeDate = DateAdd("s", intPasswordAge, Now) strChangeDate = Year(dtmChangeDate) strChangeDate = strChangeDate & "-" & Right("0" & Month(dtmChangeDate), 2) strChangeDate = strChangeDate & "-" & Right("0" & Day(dtmChangeDate), 2) Wscript.Echo objUser.Name & "|" & strChangeDate Next

sensor.name: Network Throughput Outbound
sensor.description: Returns the current output throughput, in KB/Sec, of the network interface used to connect to the tanium server. Example: 1024 KB/S

query.script:
'======================================== ' Network Throughput Outbound '========================================
' This sensor will use windows performance counters ' and attempt to retrieve network traffic information ' only for the interface being used to connect to the tanium server ' results are in kilobytes per second
Option Explicit
Dim strTaniumIPAddress: strTaniumIPAddress = GetTaniumIPAddress Dim strComputer: strComputer = "."
Dim strDescriptionToMatch, strNameToMatch, strIPAddress, strFinalOutputString Dim objWMIService, colItems, objItem
' First we get the "Name" property of the adapter with our target IP address ' out of WMI. Because Name is the closest thing to match the Description ' field in the performance counter, but it's not exact due to how some ' characters are displayed, we will remove troublesome characters ' and attempt to match on that
' Since the entire sensor's output depends on if the two strings match, we ' can set the one string to something it won't match on (because _) to be safe strDescriptionToMatch = "_ImpossibleToMatch"
Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\" & strComputer & "\root\cimv2") Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select * from Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration where IPEnabled = True",,48) For Each objItem In colItems For Each strIPAddress In objItem.IPAddress If strIPAddress = strTaniumIPAddress Then ' WScript.Echo "IP Address Tanium is using: " & strIPAddress strDescriptionToMatch = CleanString(objItem.Description) ' WScript.Echo "Description to be matched: " & strDescriptionToMatch End If Next Next
Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select * from Win32_PerfFormattedData_Tcpip_NetworkInterface",,48)
For Each objItem in colItems strNameToMatch = CleanString(objItem.Name) ' WScript.Echo "Name: " & strNameToMatch If LCase(strNameToMatch) = LCase(strDescriptionToMatch) Then ' WScript.Echo "I have matched " & strNameToMatch & " and " & strDescriptionToMatch ' We can now report bandwidth strFinalOutputString = FormatNumber(objItem.BytesSentPersec / 1024,0,-1) & " KB/S" End If Next
If strFinalOutputString = "" Then ' The two names are too dissimilar, or can't get IP address for tanium client WScript.Echo "Cannot determine which adapter to measure" Else WScript.Echo strFinalOutputString End If
' Cleanup Set objWMIService = Nothing Set colItems = Nothing Set objItem = Nothing
'' End Main Line
'' Helper Functions Function CleanString(strInput) ' This function will remove non-alphanumeric characters Dim objRegEx
Set objRegEx = CreateObject("VBScript.RegExp")
objRegEx.Global = True objRegEx.Pattern = "[^A-Za-z0-9]" CleanString = objRegEx.Replace(strInput, "")
Set objRegEx = Nothing End Function 'CleanString
Function GetTaniumIPAddress ' Modified from the ua-scan code to remove the subnet and last octet calculations ' which are irrelevant for these purposes. ' Returns the IP address that the client uses for Tanium activity ' (talking to server and other clients)
Dim strComputer, objReg, strCommand, objShell, objScriptExec Dim strResults, arrPathPingLines, strPathPingLine, arrPathPingWords Dim strIPAddress, strTaniumPath, strClientAddress Dim strServerName
strComputer = "." Set objReg = GetObject("winmgmts:{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\" & strComputer & "\root\default:StdRegProv") Const HKLM = &h80000002
''###########Get Tanium Key on 64/32bit computers##########
strTaniumPath = GetTaniumRegistryPath()
' if we can pull this from the registry (newer client version), just use that objReg.GetStringValue HKLM, strTaniumPath & "\Status", "ClientAddress", strClientAddress If strClientAddress <> "" Then strClientAddress = Left(strClientAddress,InStr(strClientAddress,"_")-1) strClientAddress = Right(strClientAddress,len(strClientAddress)-InStrRev(strClientAddress,":")) ' WScript.Echo "Found " & strClientAddress & " in Registry" GetTaniumIPAddress = strClientAddress 'Cleanup Set objReg = Nothing Exit Function End If
'Otherwise use PathPing to determine client IP used by Tanium
''# Read the ServerName value
objReg.GetStringValue HKLM, strTaniumPath, "ServerName", strServerName
strCommand = "pathping -4 -q 1 -w 1 -n " & strServerName Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell") Set objScriptExec = objShell.Exec (strCommand) strResults = objScriptExec.StdOut.ReadAll
arrPathPingLines = Split(strResults, vbCrLf) For Each strPathPingLine In arrPathPingLines arrPathPingWords = Split(CleanWhitespace(Trim(strPathPingLine)), " ") If UBound(arrPathPingWords) > 0 Then If arrPathPingWords(0) = "0" Then strIPAddress = arrPathPingWords(1) Exit For End If End If Next
Set objShell = Nothing Set objScriptExec = Nothing Set objReg = Nothing
If Not IsNull(strIPAddress) Then GetTaniumIPAddress = strIPAddress Else GetTaniumIPAddress = False End If End Function 'GetTaniumIPAddress
Function RegKeyExists(objRegistry, sHive, sRegKey) Dim aValueNames, aValueTypes If objRegistry.EnumValues(sHive, sRegKey, aValueNames, aValueTypes) = 0 Then RegKeyExists = True Else RegKeyExists = False End If End Function 'RegKeyExists
Function GetTaniumRegistryPath 'GetTaniumRegistryPath works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath, strFoundTaniumRegistryPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 strFoundTaniumRegistryPath = keyNativePath
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 strFoundTaniumRegistryPath = keyWoWPath End If
If Not strPath = "" Then GetTaniumRegistryPath = strFoundTaniumRegistryPath Else GetTaniumRegistryPath = False WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot locate Tanium Registry Path" End If End Function 'GetTaniumRegistryPath
Function CleanWhitespace(strStarter) Dim intStarter, i, strChars intStarter = Len(strStarter) For i = intStarter to 2 Step -1 strChars = Space(i) strStarter = Replace(strStarter, strChars, " ") Next CleanWhitespace = strStarter End Function 'CleanWhiteSpace

sensor.name: Ram Slots Unused
sensor.description: Returns the number of empty, unused RAM slots. Example:2

query.script:
'======================================== ' RAM Slots Unused '========================================
' This sensor will return the number of free RAM slots
Option Explicit
FreeRAMSlots
Function FreeRAMSlots ' This function returns the number of free RAM slots Dim strComputer Dim objWMIService, colPMAs, objPMA Dim colPMs, objPM
' How many slots exist Dim intSlots: intSlots = 0 ' How many MemoryDevices are present Dim intMemorySticks: intMemorySticks = 0
strComputer = "." Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\" & strComputer & "\root\cimv2") 'Use = 3 is system RAM ' This is the number of slots in the system. Set colPMAs = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select MemoryDevices from Win32_PhysicalMemoryArray where use='3'",,48)
For Each objPMA In colPMAs ' There should be only one ' but just in case intSlots = intSlots + objPMA.MemoryDevices ' WScript.Echo "objPMA.MemoryDevices is total slots: " & objPMA.MemoryDevices Next
' Cleanup Set colPMAs = Nothing
' A new query - asking for DeviceLocator where memory type does not ' equal 11 (Flash RAM) ' DeviceLocator is the label of the socket that holds the memory ' So this is the number of sockets in the system Set colPMs = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select DeviceLocator from Win32_PhysicalMemory where MemoryType!='11'")
For Each objPM In colPMs 'Each loop through indicates another slot intMemorySticks = intMemorySticks + 1 Next
' output is total slots minus memory sticks in use WScript.Echo intSlots - intMemorySticks
'Cleanup Set colPMs = Nothing Set objWMIService = Nothing End Function 'FreeRAMSlots

sensor.name: Network Printers
sensor.description: Returns printers which are connected via Network Example: HP LaserJet 4400c

query.script: Select DriverName from Win32_Printer where Network = True

sensor.name: Established Ports by Application
sensor.parameter_definition: {"parameters":[{"restrict":null,"validationExpressions":[{"helpString":"Value must be at least 2 characters","flags":"","expression":"\\S{2}","parameterType":"com.tanium.models::ValidationExpression","model":"com.tanium.models::ValidationExpression"}],"helpString":"Enter the process name to query","promptText":"e.g. svchost.exe","defaultValue":"","value":"","label":"Process Name to examine","maxChars":0,"key":"app","parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::TextInputParameter","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::TextInputParameter"}],"parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray"}
sensor.description: Parameterized Sensor that shows which addresses the process is connecting to and over what local port. Example: 0.0.0.0:17500

query.script:
'======================================== ' Established Ports by Application '========================================
Dim strcommand,bHasOutput
check = Trim(Unescape("||app||"))
strComputer = "." Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:" & "{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\" & strComputer & "\root\cimv2") query = "select name, processId from win32_process where name = '" & check & "'" Set colResults = objWMIService.ExecQuery(query)
Set processes = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary")
For Each result In colResults processId = CStr(result.ProcessId) processes.Add processId, result.Name Next
strcommand = "cmd /c netstat -aon -p TCP | find " & chr(34) & "TCP" & Chr(34)
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell") Set objScriptExec = objShell.Exec (strCommand) strPingResults = LCase(objScriptExec.StdOut.ReadAll)
results = Split(strPingResults, vbCrLf) bHasOutput = False for Each line in results line = cleanWhitespace(Trim(line)) lineResults = Split(line) i = 0 Dim strPort, strPid, strConnectionType For Each word In lineResults If i = 1 Then strPort = word ElseIf i = 3 Then strConnectionType = word ElseIf i = 4 Then strPid = word End If
i = i + 1 Next If processes.Exists(strPid) And (strConnectionType = "listening" Or strConnectionType = "established") Then WScript.echo strPort & " " & processes.Item(strPid) bHasOutput = True End If Next
If Not bHasOutput Then If GetLocale() <> 1033 Then WScript.Echo "English Language OS Required" End If End If
Function cleanWhitespace(strStarter) intStarter = Len(strStarter) For i = intStarter to 2 Step -1 strChars = Space(i) strStarter = Replace(strStarter, strChars, " ") Next cleanWhitespace = strStarter End Function

sensor.name: McAfee Agent Version
sensor.description: Returns the McAfee Agent Version Example: 4.6.0.2292

query.script:
' sensor - McAfee Agent Version
Option Explicit
Dim strMcAfeeFrameworkServiceState ' First get the state of the service strMcAfeeFrameworkServiceState = ServiceState("McAfeeFramework") If strMcAfeeFrameworkServiceState = "Not Installed" Then 'No further tests are necessary WScript.Echo "McAfee Agent Not Installed" WScript.Quit End If
Const HKLM = &h80000002 Dim objReg Set objReg = Getx64RegistryProvider()
WScript.Echo GetMcAfeeAgentVersion
Function GetMcAfeeAgentVersion
Dim intIPSState,intMajorVersion Dim strRegPath,strVersion
strRegPath = GetMcAfeeProductRegRootKey("NAITVD") If Not (IsNull(strRegPath) Or strRegPath = "" ) Then objReg.GetStringValue HKLM,strRegPath&"\Shared Components\Framework","Version",strVersion If Not (IsNull(strVersion) Or strVersion = "" ) Then GetMcAfeeAgentVersion = strVersion Else ' no version WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot determine McAfee Agent version" End If Else ' no way to get to root registry key WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot determine McAfee Agent version" End If
End Function 'GetMcAfeeAgentVersion
Function GetMcAfeeProductRegRootKey(strProductString) ' Retrieves McAfee key for a product ' products are passed in and defined in the function
Dim strRootSoftwareKeyNative,strRootSoftwareKeyWow64,strProductSubKey Dim strProductKeyPath
' select on input strProductString = UCase(strProductString) Select Case strProductString Case "AGENT" strProductSubKey = "McAfee\Agent" Case "AVENGINE" strProductSubKey = "McAfee\AVEngine" Case "DESKTOPPROTECTION" strProductSubKey = "McAfee\DesktopProtection" Case "EPO" strProductSubKey = "McAfee\ePolicy Orchestrator" Case "HIPS" strProductSubKey = "McAfee\HIP" Case "HIPSCORE" strProductSubKey = "McAfee\HIPSCore" Case "MCTRAY" strProductSubKey = "McAfee\McTray" Case "SITEADVISOR" strProductSubKey = "McAfee\SiteAdvisor Enterprise Plus" Case "SYSTEMCORE" strProductSubKey = "McAfee\SystemCore" Case "VSCORE" strProductSubKey = "McAfee\VSCore" Case "NAIEPO" strProductSubKey = "Network Associates\ePolicy Orchestrator" Case "NAITVD" strProductSubKey = "Network Associates\TVD" Case Else strProductSubKey = False End Select
Const HKLM = &h80000002
strRootSoftwareKeyNative = "Software" strRootSoftwareKeyWow64 = "Software\Wow6432Node" If Not strProductSubKey = False Then ' Assume not in both places on a 64-bit machine If RegKeyExists(HKLM, strRootSoftwareKeyWow64&"\"&strProductSubKey) Then strProductKeyPath = strRootSoftwareKeyWow64&"\"&strProductSubKey ElseIf RegKeyExists(HKLM, strRootSoftwareKeyNative&"\"&strProductSubKey) Then strProductKeyPath = strRootSoftwareKeyNative&"\"&strProductSubKey End If Else strProductKeyPath = False End If
GetMcAfeeProductRegRootKey = strProductKeyPath
End Function 'GetMcAfeeProductRegRootKey
Function RegKeyExists(sHive, sRegKey) Dim aValueNames, aValueTypes If objReg.EnumValues(sHive, sRegKey, aValueNames, aValueTypes) = 0 Then RegKeyExists = True Else RegKeyExists = False End If End Function 'RegKeyExists
Function ServiceState(strServiceName) ' This function determines if a service is in a bad state and returns ' values indicating the state. Examples: ' "Stopped" ' "Stopped Manual" ' "Running Disabled" ' "Not Installed"
Dim objWMIService,strWMIQuery,colItems,objItem,strStartMode,strState
strWMIQuery = "Select * from Win32_Service Where Name = '" & strServiceName & "'"
strState = "" strStartMode = "" Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:" _ & "{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\.\root\cimv2") Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery(strWMIQuery)
If colItems.Count = 0 Then ServiceState = "Not Installed" Else For Each objItem In colItems If objItem.State = "Stopped" Or objItem.State = "Paused" Then strState = objItem.State End If If objItem.StartMode = "Manual" Or objItem.StartMode = "Disabled" Then strStartMode = objItem.StartMode End If ServiceState = Trim(strState&" "&strStartMode) Next End If
End Function 'ServiceState
Function Getx64RegistryProvider ' Returns the best available registry provider: 32 bit on 32 bit systems, 64 bit on 64 bit systems Dim objWMIService, colItems, objItem, iArchType, objCtx, objLocator, objServices, objRegProv Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\.\root\CIMV2") Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select SystemType from Win32_ComputerSystem") For Each objItem In colItems If InStr(LCase(objItem.SystemType), "x64") > 0 Then iArchType = 64 Else iArchType = 32 End If Next
Set objCtx = CreateObject("WbemScripting.SWbemNamedValueSet") objCtx.Add "__ProviderArchitecture", iArchType Set objLocator = CreateObject("Wbemscripting.SWbemLocator") Set objServices = objLocator.ConnectServer("","root\default","","",,,,objCtx) Set objRegProv = objServices.Get("StdRegProv")
Set Getx64RegistryProvider = objRegProv End Function ' Getx64RegistryProvider

sensor.name: Network Throughput Percentage
sensor.description: Returns the current throughput, as a percentage of total possible, of the network interface used to connect to the tanium server. Example: 50%

query.script:
'======================================== ' Network Throughput Percentage '========================================
' This sensor will use windows performance counters ' and attempt to retrieve network traffic information ' only for the interface being used to connect to the tanium server ' to show the total througput (in and out) as a percentage of capability
Option Explicit
Dim strTaniumIPAddress: strTaniumIPAddress = GetTaniumIPAddress Dim strComputer: strComputer = "."
Dim strDescriptionToMatch, strNameToMatch, strIPAddress, strFinalOutputString Dim objWMIService, colItems, objItem, colNAItems, objNAItem, strMaxSpeed Dim strRawDescription
' First we get the "Name" property of the adapter with our target IP address ' out of WMI. Because Name is the closest thing to match the Description ' field in the performance counter, but it's not exact due to how some ' characters are displayed, we will remove troublesome characters ' and attempt to match on that
' Since the entire sensor's output depends on if the two strings match, we ' can set the one string to something it won't match on (because _) to be safe strDescriptionToMatch = "_ImpossibleToMatch"
Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\" & strComputer & "\root\cimv2") Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select * from Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration where IPEnabled = True",,48) For Each objItem In colItems For Each strIPAddress In objItem.IPAddress If strIPAddress = strTaniumIPAddress Then ' WScript.Echo "IP Address Tanium is using: " & strIPAddress strDescriptionToMatch = CleanString(objItem.Description) strRawDescription = objItem.Description ' WScript.Echo "Description to be matched: " & strDescriptionToMatch End If Next Next
Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select * from Win32_PerfFormattedData_Tcpip_NetworkInterface",,48)
For Each objItem in colItems strNameToMatch = CleanString(objItem.Name) ' WScript.Echo "Name: " & strNameToMatch If LCase(strNameToMatch) = LCase(strDescriptionToMatch) Then ' WScript.Echo "I have matched " & strNameToMatch & " and " & strDescriptionToMatch
If Not IsNull(strMaxSpeed) Then ' must have this value strFinalOutputString = FormatNumber(objItem.BytesTotalPersec / objItem.CurrentBandwidth * 100,0,-1) & "%" End If End If Next
If strFinalOutputString = "" Then ' The two names are too dissimilar, or can't get IP address for tanium client WScript.Echo "Cannot determine which adapter to measure" Else WScript.Echo strFinalOutputString End If
' Cleanup Set objWMIService = Nothing Set colItems = Nothing Set objItem = Nothing
'' End Main Line
'' Helper Functions Function CleanString(strInput) ' This function will remove non-alphanumeric characters Dim objRegEx
Set objRegEx = CreateObject("VBScript.RegExp")
objRegEx.Global = True objRegEx.Pattern = "[^A-Za-z0-9]" CleanString = objRegEx.Replace(strInput, "")
Set objRegEx = Nothing End Function 'CleanString
Function GetTaniumIPAddress ' Modified from the ua-scan code to remove the subnet and last octet calculations ' which are irrelevant for these purposes. ' Returns the IP address that the client uses for Tanium activity ' (talking to server and other clients)
Dim strComputer, objReg, strCommand, objShell, objScriptExec Dim strResults, arrPathPingLines, strPathPingLine, arrPathPingWords Dim strIPAddress, strTaniumPath, strClientAddress Dim strServerName
strComputer = "." Set objReg = GetObject("winmgmts:{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\" & strComputer & "\root\default:StdRegProv") Const HKLM = &h80000002
''###########Get Tanium Key on 64/32bit computers##########
strTaniumPath = GetTaniumRegistryPath()
' if we can pull this from the registry (newer client version), just use that objReg.GetStringValue HKLM, strTaniumPath & "\Status", "ClientAddress", strClientAddress If strClientAddress <> "" Then strClientAddress = Left(strClientAddress,InStr(strClientAddress,"_")-1) strClientAddress = Right(strClientAddress,len(strClientAddress)-InStrRev(strClientAddress,":")) ' WScript.Echo "Found " & strClientAddress & " in Registry" GetTaniumIPAddress = strClientAddress 'Cleanup Set objReg = Nothing Exit Function End If
'Otherwise use PathPing to determine client IP used by Tanium
''# Read the ServerName value
objReg.GetStringValue HKLM, strTaniumPath, "ServerName", strServerName
strCommand = "pathping -4 -q 1 -w 1 -n " & strServerName Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell") Set objScriptExec = objShell.Exec (strCommand) strResults = objScriptExec.StdOut.ReadAll
arrPathPingLines = Split(strResults, vbCrLf) For Each strPathPingLine In arrPathPingLines arrPathPingWords = Split(CleanWhitespace(Trim(strPathPingLine)), " ") If UBound(arrPathPingWords) > 0 Then If arrPathPingWords(0) = "0" Then strIPAddress = arrPathPingWords(1) Exit For End If End If Next
Set objShell = Nothing Set objScriptExec = Nothing Set objReg = Nothing
If Not IsNull(strIPAddress) Then GetTaniumIPAddress = strIPAddress Else GetTaniumIPAddress = False End If End Function 'GetTaniumIPAddress
Function RegKeyExists(objRegistry, sHive, sRegKey) Dim aValueNames, aValueTypes If objRegistry.EnumValues(sHive, sRegKey, aValueNames, aValueTypes) = 0 Then RegKeyExists = True Else RegKeyExists = False End If End Function 'RegKeyExists
Function GetTaniumRegistryPath 'GetTaniumRegistryPath works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath, strFoundTaniumRegistryPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 strFoundTaniumRegistryPath = keyNativePath
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 strFoundTaniumRegistryPath = keyWoWPath End If
If Not strPath = "" Then GetTaniumRegistryPath = strFoundTaniumRegistryPath Else GetTaniumRegistryPath = False WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot locate Tanium Registry Path" End If End Function 'GetTaniumRegistryPath
Function CleanWhitespace(strStarter) Dim intStarter, i, strChars intStarter = Len(strStarter) For i = intStarter to 2 Step -1 strChars = Space(i) strStarter = Replace(strStarter, strChars, " ") Next CleanWhitespace = strStarter End Function 'CleanWhiteSpace

sensor.name: Local User Login Dates
sensor.description: Returns the names and dates of the last users to log in. Example: John.Doe 7/25/2012

query.script:
'======================================== ' Local User Login Dates '========================================
Option Explicit
'Uses date math - set locale
SetLocale(GetTaniumLocale) Dim strSep: strSep = "|" Dim objNetwork : Set objNetwork = CreateObject("WScript.Network") Dim objGroup : Set objGroup = GetObject("WinNT://.") objGroup.Filter = Array("user") Dim objUser For Each objUser In objGroup On Error Resume Next WScript.Echo objUser.name & strSep & left(GetObject(objUser.adsPath).LastLogin,Instr(GetObject(objUser.adsPath).LastLogin," ")) On Error GoTo 0 Next
Function GetTaniumLocale '' This function will retrieve the locale value ' previously set which governs Tanium content that ' is locale sensitive.
Dim objWshShell Dim intLocaleID
Set objWshShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell") On Error Resume Next intLocaleID = objWshShell.RegRead("HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client\LocaleID") If Err.Number <> 0 Then intLocaleID = objWshShell.RegRead("HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client\LocaleID") End If On Error Goto 0 If intLocaleID = "" Then GetTaniumLocale = 1033 ' default to us/English Else GetTaniumLocale = intLocaleID End If
' Cleanup Set objWshShell = Nothing
End Function 'GetTaniumLocale

sensor.name: Run Once Keys
sensor.description: Returns the run once keys that define which programs will be started when a user logs in. Example: System|GlobalProtect|"C:\Program Files\Palo Alto Networks\GlobalProtect\PanGPA.exe"

query.script:
'======================================== ' Run Once Keys '========================================
' returns the system and user keys for a given key
Option Explicit
Const strSep = "|"
Dim strKeyPath, strKeyPath32, dictResults, strValue
strKeyPath = "Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\RunOnce" strKeyPath32 = "Software\Wow6432Node\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\RunOnce"
Set dictResults = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary")
AddValuesForKey dictResults, strKeyPath AddValuesForKey dictResults, strKeyPath32
For Each strValue In dictResults.Keys WScript.Echo strValue Next
Sub AddValuesForKey(dictResults, strKey) ' This function will output the two values
Const HKLM = &h80000002 Const HKEY_USERS = &H80000003
Dim objRegistry Dim arrUserKeys,strUserKey, strUserKeyPath
' get System Keys Set objRegistry = Getx64RegistryProvider() If RegKeyExists(HKLM, strKey, objRegistry) Then GetValues objRegistry, HKLM, strKey, dictResults, "System" End If
' get User Keys objRegistry.EnumKey HKEY_USERS, "",arrUserKeys For Each strUserKey In arrUserKeys If Not InStr(strUserKey,"_Classes") > 0 Then ' ignore _Classes entries strUserKeyPath = strUserKey & "\" & strKey If RegKeyExists(HKEY_USERS,strUserKeyPath, objRegistry) Then GetValues objRegistry, HKEY_USERS, strUserKeyPath, dictResults, "User" End If End If Next End Sub 'AddValuesForKey
Sub GetValues(objRegistry, hiveConst, keyPath, dictValues, strPrefix) Dim arrKeyNames, arrTypes, arrValueNames, strValueName Dim strValueData, i, strEntry
objRegistry.EnumValues hiveConst, keyPath, arrValueNames, arrTypes
If Not IsArray(arrValueNames) Then arrValueNames = Array("") arrTypes = Array(1) End If
For i = LBound(arrValueNames) To UBound(arrValueNames) strValueName = arrValueNames(i) strValueData = GetRegValue(objRegistry, hiveConst, keyPath, strValueName, arrTypes(i)) If Not ( IsNull(strValueName) Or IsNull(strValueData) ) Then strEntry = strPrefix & strSep & strValueName & strSep & strValueData If Not dictValues.Exists(strEntry) Then dictValues.Add strEntry, True End If End If Next End Sub 'GetValues
Function GetRegValue(objRegistry, hiveConst, keyPath, strValueName, constType)
Const REG_SZ = 1 Const REG_EXPAND_SZ = 2 Const REG_BINARY = 3 Const REG_DWORD = 4 Const REG_MULTI_SZ = 7 Const REG_QWORD = 11
Dim strValue, arrBytes, uValue, arrValues
Select Case constType Case REG_SZ objRegistry.GetStringValue hiveConst, keyPath, strValueName, strValue GetRegValue = strValue Exit Function Case REG_EXPAND_SZ objRegistry.GetExpandedStringValue hiveConst, keyPath, strValueName, strValue GetRegValue = strValue Exit Function Case REG_BINARY objRegistry.GetBinaryValue hiveConst, keyPath, strValueName, arrBytes strBytes = "" For Each uByte in arrBytes strBytes = strBytes & Hex(uByte) & " " Next GetRegValue = strBytes Exit Function Case REG_DWORD objRegistry.GetDWORDValue hiveConst, keyPath, strValueName, uValue GetRegValue = CStr(uValue) Exit Function Case REG_QWORD objRegistry.GetQWORDValue hiveConst, keyPath, strValueName, uValue GetRegValue = CStr(uValue) Exit Function Case REG_MULTI_SZ objRegistry.GetMultiStringValue hiveConst, keyPath, strValueName, arrValues For Each strValue in arrValues GetRegValue = strValue Next Exit Function End Select End Function 'GetRegValue
Function RegKeyExists(sHive, sRegKey, objReg) Dim aValueNames, aValueTypes If objReg.EnumValues(sHive, sRegKey, aValueNames, aValueTypes) = 0 Then RegKeyExists = True Else RegKeyExists = False End If End Function ' RegKeyExists
Function Getx64RegistryProvider ' Returns the best available registry provider: 32 bit on 32 bit systems, 64 bit on 64 bit systems Dim objWMIService, colItems, objItem, iArchType, objCtx, objLocator, objServices, objRegProv Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\.\root\CIMV2") Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select SystemType from Win32_ComputerSystem") For Each objItem In colItems If InStr(LCase(objItem.SystemType), "x64") > 0 Then iArchType = 64 Else iArchType = 32 End If Next
Set objCtx = CreateObject("WbemScripting.SWbemNamedValueSet") objCtx.Add "__ProviderArchitecture", iArchType Set objLocator = CreateObject("Wbemscripting.SWbemLocator") Set objServices = objLocator.ConnectServer("","root\default","","",,,,objCtx) Set objRegProv = objServices.Get("StdRegProv")
Set Getx64RegistryProvider = objRegProv End Function ' Getx64RegistryProvider

sensor.name: SQL Server CPU Consumption
sensor.description: Current CPU utilization percentage by SQL Server process on client machine. Example: 8%

query.script:
'======================================== ' SQL Server CPU Consumption '======================================== '@INCLUDE=sql/mssql_connection_utils.vbs
Option Explicit
Dim dictInstances, strInstance, Process
Set dictInstances = GetMSSQLInstances()
If dictInstances.Count > 0 Then For Each Process In GetObject("winmgmts:").ExecQuery("Select * from Win32_Process where Name = 'sqlservr.exe'") WScript.echo CPUUSage(Process.Handle) & "%" Next End If
Function CPUUSage( ProcID ) Dim objService, objInstance1, objInstance2, N1, N2, D1, D2, Nd, Dd, PercentProcessorTime On Error Resume Next Set objService = GetObject("Winmgmts:{impersonationlevel=impersonate}!\Root\Cimv2") For Each objInstance1 In objService.ExecQuery("Select * from Win32_PerfRawData_PerfProc_Process where Name = 'sqlservr'") N1 = objInstance1.PercentProcessorTime D1 = objInstance1.TimeStamp_Sys100NS Exit For Next WScript.Sleep(2000) For Each objInstance2 In objService.ExecQuery("Select * from Win32_PerfRawData_PerfProc_Process where Name = 'sqlservr'") N2 = objInstance2.PercentProcessorTime D2 = objInstance2.TimeStamp_Sys100NS Exit For Next On Error Goto 0
' CounterType - PERF_100NSEC_TIMER_INV ' Formula - (1- ((N2 - N1) / (D2 - D1))) x 100 Nd = (N2 - N1) Dd = (D2 - D1) PercentProcessorTime = ( (Nd/Dd)) * 100 CPUUSage = Round(PercentProcessorTime, 0) End Function
'------------ INCLUDES after this line. Do not edit past this point ----- '- Begin file: sql/mssql_connection_utils.vbs
' Common constants for MSSQL lookups Const AD_OPEN_STATIC = 3 Const AD_LOCK_OPTIMISTIC = 3
Function GetMSSQLInstances() Dim dictResult, objWMIService, colServices, objService Dim strCaption, strInstance, intStartIndex, intStopIndex Set dictResult = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary")
Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:" & "{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\.\root\cimv2") Set colServices = objWMIService.ExecQuery ("select * from win32_Service") For Each objService In colServices strCaption = objService.Caption
If (InStr(strCaption,"SQL Server") <> 0 And ObjService.State = "Running") Then ' OK -- found SQL Server on this machien, now we need to find the instance name ' if this is the correct service strInstance = "." intStartIndex = InStr(strCaption, "(") intStopIndex = InStr(strCaption, ")")
If(intStartIndex <> 0) And (intStopIndex <> 0) Then strInstance = Mid(strCaption, intStartIndex + 1, intStopIndex - intStartIndex - 1)
If strInstance = "MSSQLSERVER" Then strInstance = "." End If
If Not dictResult.Exists(strInstance) Then dictResult.Add strInstance, True End if End If End If Next
Set GetMSSQLInstances = dictResult
End Function ' GetMSSQLInstances
Function GenMSSQLConnectionStr(strInstance, strCatalog) Dim strDataSource, strConnection
If strInstance = "." Then strDataSource = strInstance Else strDataSource = ".\" & strInstance End If
strConnection = "Provider=SQLOLEDB;Data Source=" & strDataSource & ";Trusted_Connection=Yes;Initial Catalog=" & strCatalog & ";"
GenMSSQLConnectionStr = strConnection End Function ' OpenMSSQLConnection
Function GetMSSQLSensorInstanceStr(strInstance) If strInstance = "." Then GetMSSQLSensorInstanceStr = "" Else GetMSSQLSensorInstanceStr = " (" & strInstance & ")" End If End Function ' GetMSSQLSensorInstanceStr '- End file: sql/mssql_connection_utils.vbs

sensor.name: McAfee Endpoint Encryption Status
sensor.description: This sensor will return the encryption status of volumes encrypted with McAfee Endpoint Encryption Example: C:|Encrypted

query.script:
'======================================== ' McAfee Endpoint Encryption Status '========================================
' This sensor will return the encryption status ' of volumes encrypted with McAfee Endpoint Encryption
Option Explicit
Dim objRegistry,keyPath,key64Path,strSep strSep = "|" ' column delimiter
Set objRegistry = Getx64RegistryProvider()
Const HKLM = &H80000002
keyPath = "SOFTWARE\McAfee Endpoint Encryption\MfeEpePC\Status" key64Path = "SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\McAfee Endpoint Encryption\MfeEpePC\Status"
If Not RegKeyExists(HKLM, keyPath) Then keyPath = key64Path
If Not RegKeyExists(HKLM, keyPath) Then WScript.Echo "Not installed" WScript.Quit End If End If
If RegKeyExists(HKLM, keyPath) Then Dim strReturn strReturn = ReturnStringValueOrEchoError _ (objRegistry,HKLM,keyPath,"CryptState","McAfee Endpoint Encryption State Not Found") If VarType(strReturn) = 8 Then 'string value 8 indicates success, integer is error ReturnEEPCEncryptionStatus strReturn Else WScript.Quit End If Else WScript.Echo "McAfee Endpoint Encryption Not Found" WScript.Quit End If
Function RegKeyExists(sHive, sRegKey) Dim aValueNames, aValueTypes If objRegistry.EnumValues(sHive, sRegKey, aValueNames, aValueTypes) = 0 Then RegKeyExists = True Else RegKeyExists = False End If End Function
Function ReturnEEPCEncryptionStatus(strStatus) ' output looks like Volume=C:,State=Encrypted;Volume=D:,State=Encrypted; Dim arrInput,strVolumes,strWord,strVolume,strVolumeName,strVolumeState Dim bBadVolume
arrInput = Split(strStatus,";")
For Each strVolume In arrInput bBadVolume = False If InStr(1,strVolume,"volume=",1) > 0 And InStr(1,strVolume,"state=",1) > 0 Then On Error Resume Next strVolumeName = Split(Split(strVolume,"volume=",-1,1)(1),",")(0) strVolumeState = Split(Split(strVolume,"state=",-1,1)(1),",")(0) On Error Goto 0 If strVolumeName = "" Or strVolumeState = "" Then bBadVolume = True Else WScript.Echo strVolumeName&strSep&strVolumeState End If End If If bBadVolume Then WScript.Echo "Invalid Volume Information: " & strVolume Next End Function 'ReturnEEPCEncryptionStatus
Function ReturnStringValueOrEchoError(objRegistry,HIVE,strKeyName,strValueName,strErrorMessage) ' Return a value or fatal error message and error result Dim intReturn,strValueData intReturn = objRegistry.GetStringValue(HIVE, strKeyname, strValueName, strValueData) If intReturn = 0 Then ReturnStringValueOrEchoError = strValueData Else ReturnStringValueOrEchoError = -1 WScript.Echo strErrorMessage End If End Function
Function Getx64RegistryProvider ' Returns the best available registry provider: 32 bit on 32 bit systems, 64 bit on 64 bit systems Dim objWMIService, colItems, objItem, iArchType, objCtx, objLocator, objServices, objRegProv Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\.\root\CIMV2") Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select SystemType from Win32_ComputerSystem") For Each objItem In colItems If InStr(LCase(objItem.SystemType), "x64") > 0 Then iArchType = 64 Else iArchType = 32 End If Next
Set objCtx = CreateObject("WbemScripting.SWbemNamedValueSet") objCtx.Add "__ProviderArchitecture", iArchType Set objLocator = CreateObject("Wbemscripting.SWbemLocator") Set objServices = objLocator.ConnectServer("","root\default","","",,,,objCtx) Set objRegProv = objServices.Get("StdRegProv")
Set Getx64RegistryProvider = objRegProv End Function ' Getx64RegistryProvider

sensor.name: Tanium Server Name List
sensor.description: Retrieves the Tanium Server Name List from the Client's Registry Example: server.domain.com,server1.domain.com

query.script:
'======================================== ' Tanium Server Name List '========================================
Option Explicit
Const HKLM = &h80000002
Dim objReg Dim strTaniumRegPath, strCurrentTaniumServerNameListValue Dim strComputer
strComputer = "."
Set objReg = _ GetObject("winmgmts:{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\" _ & strComputer & "\root\default:StdRegProv")
strTaniumRegPath = GetTaniumRegistryPath() 'retrieve current server name value objReg.GetStringValue HKLM, strTaniumRegPath, "ServerNameList", strCurrentTaniumServerNameListValue
If Not IsNull(strCurrentTaniumServerNameListValue) Then WScript.Echo strCurrentTaniumServerNameListValue Else WScript.Echo "Not Set" End If
'Cleanup Set objReg = Nothing
Function GetTaniumRegistryPath 'GetTaniumRegistryPath works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath, strFoundTaniumRegistryPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 strFoundTaniumRegistryPath = keyNativePath
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 strFoundTaniumRegistryPath = keyWoWPath End If
If Not strPath = "" Then GetTaniumRegistryPath = strFoundTaniumRegistryPath Else GetTaniumRegistryPath = False WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot locate Tanium Registry Path" End If End Function 'GetTaniumRegistryPath
Function RegKeyExists(objRegistry, sHive, sRegKey) Dim aValueNames, aValueTypes If objRegistry.EnumValues(sHive, sRegKey, aValueNames, aValueTypes) = 0 Then RegKeyExists = True Else RegKeyExists = False End If End Function 'RegKeyExists

Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\" & strComputer & "\root\cimv2") Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select * from Win32_PnPEntity where status = 'OK' and service is not null and service <> 'pci'",,48) For Each objItem in colItems If Not Left(objItem.PNPDeviceId, Len("ROOT")) = "ROOT" Then Wscript.Echo objItem.Caption End If Next

sensor.name: Last Application Launch Date
sensor.description: Returns the date that each application was last launched on. Example: Notepad | 9/18/2012

query.script:
'======================================== ' Last Application Launch Date '========================================
strComputer = "." Const HKLM = &h80000002 Set reg=GetObject("winmgmts:{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\" & strComputer & "\root\default:StdRegProv")
strKeyPath = GetTaniumRegistryPath() & "\Sensor Data\Applications"
If RegKeyExists(reg, HKLM, strKeyPath) Then reg.EnumKey HKLM, strKeyPath, arrSubKeys If IsArray(arrSubKeys) Then For Each Subkey In arrSubKeys 'Wscript.Echo Subkey newKeyPath = strKeyPath & "\" & Subkey
reg.GetStringValue HKLM, newKeyPath, "Last Start", strLastStart reg.GetStringValue HKLM, newKeyPath, "Description", strDescription WScript.Echo strDescription & "|" & strLastStart Next Else WScript.Echo "Application data not initialized" End If Else WScript.Echo "Application data not initialized" End If
Function GetTaniumRegistryPath 'GetTaniumRegistryPath works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath, strFoundTaniumRegistryPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 strFoundTaniumRegistryPath = keyNativePath
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 strFoundTaniumRegistryPath = keyWoWPath End If
If Not strPath = "" Then GetTaniumRegistryPath = strFoundTaniumRegistryPath Else GetTaniumRegistryPath = False WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot locate Tanium Registry Path" End If End Function 'GetTaniumRegistryPath
Function RegKeyExists(objRegistry, sHive, sRegKey) Dim aValueNames, aValueTypes If objRegistry.EnumValues(sHive, sRegKey, aValueNames, aValueTypes) = 0 Then RegKeyExists = True Else RegKeyExists = False End If End Function

sensor.name: System Environment Variables
sensor.description: Returns the currently defined system variables Example: windir=c:\Windows

query.script:
'======================================== ' System Environment Variables '========================================
Option Explicit
Const EXPAND_VARS = False
Dim wshShell, wshSysEnv, strItem
Set wshShell = CreateObject( "WScript.Shell" ) Set wshSysEnv = wshShell.Environment( "SYSTEM" ) For Each strItem In wshSysEnv If EXPAND_VARS Then WScript.Echo wshShell.ExpandEnvironmentStrings( strItem ) Else WScript.Echo strItem End If Next Set wshSysEnv = Nothing Set wshShell = Nothing

sensor.name: User Accounts
