#!/bin/bash dmidecode -s baseboard-product-name

sensor.name: Forefront Client Signatures Last Checked Days Old
sensor.description: Indicates the time in days since the last time the Forefront client signatures were checked by Forefront. Example: 2

query.script:
'======================================== ' Forefront Client Signatures Last Checked Days Old '========================================
Const HKLM = &h80000002 Set reg=Getx64RegistryProvider()
'Uses date math - set locale
SetLocale(1033)
strKey = "Software\Microsoft\Microsoft Antimalware\Signature Updates" If Not RegKeyExists(reg, HKLM, strKey) Then strKey = "Software\Wow6432Node\Microsoft\Microsoft Antimalware\Signature Updates" End If
If RegKeyExists(reg, HKLM, strKey) Then reg.GetBinaryValue HKLM, strKey, "SignaturesLastChecked", binValue
If Not IsNull(binValue) Then words = Split(BinaryToDate(binValue)) WScript.Echo GetDaysOld(words(0)) Else WScript.Echo "Date not found" End If End If
'date format is MM/DD/YYYY function GetDaysOld(strDate) patternDate = CDate( strDate ) today = CDate( Month(Now) & "/" & Day(Now) & "/" & Year(Now)) GetDaysOld = DateDiff("d", patternDate, today) End Function
Function BinaryToDate(Binary) Err.Clear
'Define Variants Dim lngHigh Dim lngLow Dim dtmDate Dim i
'Populate Variants lngHigh = 0 lngLow = 0
'NOTE: Portions of this code taken from: ' http://www.visualbasicscript.com/m30907.aspx
for i=7 to 4 step -1 lngHigh = lngHigh * 256 + Binary(i) next for i=3 to 0 step -1 lngLow = lngLow * 256 + Binary(i) next
if err.number<>0 then dtmDate = #1/1/1601# Err.Clear else If lngLow < 0 Then lngHigh = lngHigh + 1 End If If (lngHigh = 0) And (lngLow = 0 ) Then dtmDate = #1/1/1601# Else dtmDate = #1/1/1601# + (((lngHigh * (2 ^ 32)) _ + lngLow)/600000000 - GetTimeBias())/1440 End If End If BinaryToDate = dtmDate End Function
Function GetTimeBias() 'Define Variants Dim lngBiasKey Dim lngBias
' Obtain local Time Zone bias from machine registry. reg.GetDWORDValue HKLM, "System\CurrentControlSet\Control\TimeZoneInformation", "ActiveTimeBias", lngBiasKey If UCase(TypeName(lngBiasKey)) = "LONG" Then lngBias = lngBiasKey ElseIf UCase(TypeName(lngBiasKey)) = "VARIANT()" Then lngBias = 0 For k = 0 To UBound(lngBiasKey) lngBias = lngBias + (lngBiasKey(k) * 256^k) Next End If 'wscript.echo "lngBias = " & lngBias GetTimeBias = lngBias End Function
Function RegKeyExists(objRegistry, sHive, sRegKey) Dim aValueNames, aValueTypes If objRegistry.EnumValues(sHive, sRegKey, aValueNames, aValueTypes) = 0 Then RegKeyExists = True Else RegKeyExists = False End If End Function
Function Getx64RegistryProvider ' Returns the best available registry provider: 32 bit on 32 bit systems, 64 bit on 64 bit systems Dim objWMIService, colItems, objItem, iArchType, objCtx, objLocator, objServices, objRegProv Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\.\root\CIMV2") Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select SystemType from Win32_ComputerSystem") For Each objItem In colItems If InStr(LCase(objItem.SystemType), "x64") > 0 Then iArchType = 64 Else iArchType = 32 End If Next
Set objCtx = CreateObject("WbemScripting.SWbemNamedValueSet") objCtx.Add "__ProviderArchitecture", iArchType Set objLocator = CreateObject("Wbemscripting.SWbemLocator") Set objServices = objLocator.ConnectServer("","root\default","","",,,,objCtx) Set objRegProv = objServices.Get("StdRegProv")
Set Getx64RegistryProvider = objRegProv End Function ' Getx64RegistryProvider

sensor.name: Video Graphics Card RAM
sensor.description: Amount of RAM in the video card in the client machine. Example: 256MB

query.script:
'======================================== ' Video Graphics Card RAM '========================================
' This sensor will return the amount of video RAM a machine ' has in each card, in Megabytes
strComputer = "." Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\" & strComputer & "\root\cimv2") Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select * from Win32_VideoController",,48)
For Each objItem in colItems If Not isNull(objItem.AdapterRAM) Then WScript.Echo CLng((objItem.AdapterRAM /1024)/1024) & "MB" End If Next

sensor.name: UAC Status
sensor.description: Returns Enabled or Disabled based on the status of Windows User Access Control on the client machine. Example: Enabled

query.script:
'======================================== ' UAC Status '======================================== ' This will determine whether UAC is on or off
Option Explicit
WScript.Echo GetUACStatus
Function GetUACStatus ' This function uses the correct way to access 64-bit registry ' in a 32-bit context to query a single registry value and ' Determine if UAC is on
Dim objReg, objCtx Dim strUACRegKey, strUACRegVal, strUACStatus
Const HKLM = &H80000002
If Is64 Then Set objCtx = GetObjCtx(64) Set objReg = GetObjReg(objCtx) Else Set objCtx = GetObjCtx(32) Set objReg = GetObjReg(objCtx) End If
strUACRegKey = "SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System\" strUACRegVal = "EnableLua"
'RegKeyExists Example If RegKeyExists(objReg, HKLM, strUACRegKey) Then strUACStatus = CStr(GetDwordValue(objReg, HKLM, strUACRegKey, strUACRegVal))
If strUACStatus = "1" Then GetUACStatus = "Enabled" ElseIf strUACStatus = "0" Then GetUACStatus = "Disabled" Else GetUACStatus = "UAC Not Applicable to this OS" End If Else GetUACStatus = "Pre-UAC OS" End If
' Cleanup Set objReg = Nothing Set objCtx = Nothing End Function 'GetUACStatus
Function Is64 Dim objWMIService, colItems, objItem Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\.\root\CIMV2") Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select SystemType from Win32_ComputerSystem") For Each objItem In colItems If InStr(LCase(objItem.SystemType), "x64") > 0 Then Is64 = True Else Is64 = False End If Next ' Cleanup Set objWMIService = Nothing Set colItems = Nothing End Function 'Is64
Function GetObjCtx(intArch) Dim objCtx Set objCtx = CreateObject("WbemScripting.SWbemNamedValueSet") objCtx.Add "__ProviderArchitecture", intArch objCtx.Add "__RequiredArchitecture", TRUE Set GetObjCtx = objCtx End Function 'GetObjCtx
Function GetObjReg(objCtx) Dim objLocator, objServices Set objLocator = CreateObject("Wbemscripting.SWbemLocator") Set objServices = objLocator.ConnectServer("","root\default","","",,,,objCtx) Set GetObjReg = objServices.Get("StdRegProv") End Function 'GetObjReg
Function RegKeyExists(objReg, constHive, strKey) Dim objNames, objTypes, objValues, Inparams, Outparams Set Inparams = objReg.Methods_("EnumValues").Inparameters Inparams.Hdefkey = constHive Inparams.sSubkeyname = strKey Set Outparams = objReg.ExecMethod_("EnumValues", Inparams)
If Outparams.ReturnValue = 0 Then RegKeyExists = True Else RegKeyExists = False End If ' Cleanup Set Inparams = Nothing Set Outparams = Nothing End Function 'RegKeyExists
Function GetDWordValue(objReg, constHive, strKey, strValue) Dim objInParams, objOutParams Set objInParams = objReg.Methods_("GetDWordValue").InParameters objInParams.hDefKey = constHive objInParams.sSubKeyName = strKey objInParams.sValueName = strValue Set objOutParams = objReg.ExecMethod_("GetDWordValue", objInParams) If Not IsNull(objOutParams) Then If Not IsNull(objOutParams.uValue) Then GetDWordValue = CStr(objOutParams.uValue) End If End If ' Cleanup Set objInParams = Nothing Set objOutParams = Nothing End Function 'GetDWordValue

sensor.name: Domain Member
sensor.description: Returns true if the machine is part of an Active Directory domain. Example: TRUE, FALSE

query.script: select PartofDomain from win32_ComputerSystem

sensor.name: Network Throughput Total
sensor.description: Returns the current total throughput, in KB/Sec, of the network interface used to connect to the tanium server. Example: 2048 KB/S

query.script:
'======================================== ' Network Throughput Total '========================================
' This sensor will use windows performance counters ' and attempt to retrieve network traffic information ' only for the interface being used to connect to the tanium server ' results are in kilobytes per second
Option Explicit
Dim strTaniumIPAddress: strTaniumIPAddress = GetTaniumIPAddress Dim strComputer: strComputer = "."
Dim strDescriptionToMatch, strNameToMatch, strIPAddress, strFinalOutputString Dim objWMIService, colItems, objItem
' First we get the "Name" property of the adapter with our target IP address ' out of WMI. Because Name is the closest thing to match the Description ' field in the performance counter, but it's not exact due to how some ' characters are displayed, we will remove troublesome characters ' and attempt to match on that
' Since the entire sensor's output depends on if the two strings match, we ' can set the one string to something it won't match on (because _) to be safe strDescriptionToMatch = "_ImpossibleToMatch"
Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\" & strComputer & "\root\cimv2") Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select * from Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration where IPEnabled = True",,48) For Each objItem In colItems For Each strIPAddress In objItem.IPAddress If strIPAddress = strTaniumIPAddress Then ' WScript.Echo "IP Address Tanium is using: " & strIPAddress strDescriptionToMatch = CleanString(objItem.Description) ' WScript.Echo "Description to be matched: " & strDescriptionToMatch End If Next Next
Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select * from Win32_PerfFormattedData_Tcpip_NetworkInterface",,48)
For Each objItem in colItems strNameToMatch = CleanString(objItem.Name) ' WScript.Echo "Name: " & strNameToMatch If LCase(strNameToMatch) = LCase(strDescriptionToMatch) Then ' WScript.Echo "I have matched " & strNameToMatch & " and " & strDescriptionToMatch ' We can now report bandwidth strFinalOutputString = FormatNumber(objItem.BytesTotalPersec / 1024,0,-1) & " KB/S" End If Next
If strFinalOutputString = "" Then ' The two names are too dissimilar, or can't get IP address for tanium client WScript.Echo "Cannot determine which adapter to measure" Else WScript.Echo strFinalOutputString End If
' Cleanup Set objWMIService = Nothing Set colItems = Nothing Set objItem = Nothing
'' End Main Line
'' Helper Functions Function CleanString(strInput) ' This function will remove non-alphanumeric characters Dim objRegEx
Set objRegEx = CreateObject("VBScript.RegExp")
objRegEx.Global = True objRegEx.Pattern = "[^A-Za-z0-9]" CleanString = objRegEx.Replace(strInput, "")
Set objRegEx = Nothing End Function 'CleanString
Function GetTaniumIPAddress ' Modified from the ua-scan code to remove the subnet and last octet calculations ' which are irrelevant for these purposes. ' Returns the IP address that the client uses for Tanium activity ' (talking to server and other clients)
Dim strComputer, objReg, strCommand, objShell, objScriptExec Dim strResults, arrPathPingLines, strPathPingLine, arrPathPingWords Dim strIPAddress, strTaniumPath, strClientAddress Dim strServerName
strComputer = "." Set objReg = GetObject("winmgmts:{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\" & strComputer & "\root\default:StdRegProv") Const HKLM = &h80000002
''###########Get Tanium Key on 64/32bit computers##########
strTaniumPath = GetTaniumRegistryPath()
' if we can pull this from the registry (newer client version), just use that objReg.GetStringValue HKLM, strTaniumPath & "\Status", "ClientAddress", strClientAddress If strClientAddress <> "" Then strClientAddress = Left(strClientAddress,InStr(strClientAddress,"_")-1) strClientAddress = Right(strClientAddress,len(strClientAddress)-InStrRev(strClientAddress,":")) ' WScript.Echo "Found " & strClientAddress & " in Registry" GetTaniumIPAddress = strClientAddress 'Cleanup Set objReg = Nothing Exit Function End If
'Otherwise use PathPing to determine client IP used by Tanium
''# Read the ServerName value
objReg.GetStringValue HKLM, strTaniumPath, "ServerName", strServerName
strCommand = "pathping -4 -q 1 -w 1 -n " & strServerName Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell") Set objScriptExec = objShell.Exec (strCommand) strResults = objScriptExec.StdOut.ReadAll
arrPathPingLines = Split(strResults, vbCrLf) For Each strPathPingLine In arrPathPingLines arrPathPingWords = Split(CleanWhitespace(Trim(strPathPingLine)), " ") If UBound(arrPathPingWords) > 0 Then If arrPathPingWords(0) = "0" Then strIPAddress = arrPathPingWords(1) Exit For End If End If Next
Set objShell = Nothing Set objScriptExec = Nothing Set objReg = Nothing
If Not IsNull(strIPAddress) Then GetTaniumIPAddress = strIPAddress Else GetTaniumIPAddress = False End If End Function 'GetTaniumIPAddress
Function RegKeyExists(objRegistry, sHive, sRegKey) Dim aValueNames, aValueTypes If objRegistry.EnumValues(sHive, sRegKey, aValueNames, aValueTypes) = 0 Then RegKeyExists = True Else RegKeyExists = False End If End Function 'RegKeyExists
Function GetTaniumRegistryPath 'GetTaniumRegistryPath works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath, strFoundTaniumRegistryPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 strFoundTaniumRegistryPath = keyNativePath
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 strFoundTaniumRegistryPath = keyWoWPath End If
If Not strPath = "" Then GetTaniumRegistryPath = strFoundTaniumRegistryPath Else GetTaniumRegistryPath = False WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot locate Tanium Registry Path" End If End Function 'GetTaniumRegistryPath
Function CleanWhitespace(strStarter) Dim intStarter, i, strChars intStarter = Len(strStarter) For i = intStarter to 2 Step -1 strChars = Space(i) strStarter = Replace(strStarter, strChars, " ") Next CleanWhitespace = strStarter End Function 'CleanWhiteSpace

sensor.name: Packet Loss
sensor.description: Returns data about percent of packet loss on Windows machines. Example: 5 %

query.script:
'======================================== ' Packet Loss '========================================
' This sensor looks at TCP-level performance counters and ' does some basic math to determine a packet loss percentage
Option Explicit
Dim objWMIService,colItems Dim objItem,strFinalOutputString
Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\.\root\cimv2") Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select * from Win32_PerfFormattedData_Tcpip_TCPv4",,48)
For Each objItem in colItems If (objItem.SegmentsRetransmittedPersec > 0 AND objItem.SegmentsPerSec > 0) Then strFinalOutputString = FormatNumber(objItem.SegmentsRetransmittedPersec / objItem.SegmentsPerSec * 100,0,-1) & " %" WScript.Echo strFinalOutputString Else WScript.Echo "Cannot determine packet loss" End If
Next
' Cleanup Set objWMIService = Nothing Set colItems = Nothing Set objItem = Nothing

sensor.name: Local Account Last Password Change Days Ago
sensor.description: Returns local accounts and number of days ago that the password was changed. Example: user.name|19

query.script:
'======================================== ' Local Account Last Password Change Days Ago '========================================
Option Explicit
Dim objAccounts,objUser,dtmLastPasswordChangeDate,intDaysSince Dim strChangeDate,strSep
strSep = "|" ' Multi-column output ' Account Name|Days Since Last Password Change SetLocale(1033) 'Uses RFC822, requires US/English
On Error Resume Next
Set objAccounts = GetObject("WinNT://.") objAccounts.Filter = Array("User")
For Each objUser In objAccounts On Error Resume Next dtmLastPasswordChangeDate = GetObject("WinNT://./"&objUser.Name).PasswordAge If IsNull(objUser.PasswordAge) Then Wscript.Echo objUser.Name&strSep&"N/A" Else dtmLastPasswordChangeDate = DateAdd("s", -objUser.PasswordAge, Now()) intDaysSince = Abs(DateDiff("d",Now(),dtmLastPasswordChangeDate)) strChangeDate = vbTimeToRFC822(dtmLastPasswordChangeDate,GetRFC822Bias) On Error Resume Next If objUser.PasswordAge = 0 Then intDaysSince = "Never" End If On Error Goto 0 Wscript.Echo objUser.Name&strSep&intDaysSince End If Next
Function vbTimeToRFC822(myDate, offset) 'SetLocale outside of function in global scope ' must be set so that month is displayed with US/English abbreviations ' as per the standard
If Not GetLocale = 1033 Then WScript.Echo "Locale Code must be 1033, use SetLocale" WScript.Quit End If Dim myDay, myDays, myMonth, myYear Dim myHours, myMinutes, myMonths, mySeconds
myDate = CDate(myDate) myDay = WeekdayName(Weekday(myDate),true) myDays = zeroPad(Day(myDate), 2) myMonth = MonthName(Month(myDate), true) myYear = Year(myDate) myHours = zeroPad(Hour(myDate), 2) myMinutes = zeroPad(Minute(myDate), 2) mySeconds = zeroPad(Second(myDate), 2)
vbTimeToRFC822 = myDay&", "& _ myDays&" "& _ myMonth&" "& _ myYear&" "& _ myHours&":"& _ myMinutes&":"& _ mySeconds&" "& _ offset End Function 'vbTimeToRFC822
Function zeroPad(m, t) zeroPad = String(t-Len(m),"0")&m End Function
Function GetRFC822Bias ' This function returns a string which is a ' timezone bias for RFC822 format ' considers daylight savings ' we choose 4 digits and a sign (+ or -)
Dim objWMIService,colTimeZone,objTimeZone
Dim intTZBiasInMinutes,strSign,strReturnString
Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:" _ & "{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\.\root\cimv2") Set colTimeZone = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select * from Win32_ComputerSystem")
For Each objTimeZone in colTimeZone intTZBiasInMinutes = objTimeZone.CurrentTimeZone Next
' The offset is explicitly signed If intTZBiasInMinutes < 0 Then strSign = "-" Else strSign = "+" End If
strReturnString = CStr(Abs(intTZBiasInMinutes)) ' no offset is greater than three digits but RFC822 bias seems to ' usually take the form of 1 alpha / 4 digit as described as ' valid in ANSI X3.51-1975
strReturnString = zeroPad(strReturnString,4)
GetRFC822Bias = strSign&strReturnString
'Cleanup Set colTimeZone = Nothing Set objWMIService = Nothing
End Function 'GetRFC822Bias

sensor.name: PowerShell Version
sensor.description: Returns the version(s) of PowerShell installed on a system Example: 2.0

query.script:
'======================================== ' PowerShell Version '========================================
Option Explicit
Const HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE = &H80000002 Dim objReg Dim strKeyPath,arrValueNames,arrValueTypes,i,strValue,strValue3,strKey3Path Dim bV1orV2NotFound, bV3NotFound
Set objReg=GetObject("winmgmts:{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\" &_ ".\root\default:StdRegProv") strKeyPath = "Software\Microsoft\PowerShell\1\PowerShellEngine" strKey3Path = "Software\Microsoft\PowerShell\3\PowerShellEngine"
' for powershell 1 or 2 objReg.GetStringValue HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE,strKeyPath,"PowerShellVersion",strValue bV1orV2NotFound = False If Not IsNull(strValue) Then Select Case strValue Case "1.0" WScript.Echo strValue Case "2.0" WScript.Echo strValue Case Else bV1orV2NotFound = True End Select End If
bV3NotFound = False ' for powershell 3.0 objReg.GetStringValue HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE,strKey3Path,"PowerShellVersion",strValue3 If Not IsNull(strValue3) Then Select Case strValue3 Case "3.0" WScript.Echo strValue3 Case Else bV3NotFound = True End Select End If
If (bV1orV2NotFound And bV3NotFound) Or ( IsNull(strValue) And IsNull(strValue3) ) Then WScript.Echo "PowerShell Not Installed" End If

sensor.name: Local Printers
sensor.description: Returns printers which are not connected via Network Example: HP LaserJet 4400c

query.script: Select DriverName from Win32_Printer where Network = False

sensor.name: Tanium Client Neighborhood
sensor.description: Returns the Forward Peers and Backwards Peers returned by the server with which the client should communicate. Example: 10.0.0.1:17472, 10.0.02:17472 | 10.0.0.10:17472

query.script:
'======================================== ' Tanium Client Neighborhood List '========================================
Option Explicit
Const INCLUDE_PORTS = False
Dim strClientIPAddress, strNeighborhoodList Dim arrIPs, strIP, strPort, bReachedMe, strBackwards, strForwards
strClientIPAddress = Trim(GetClientIPAddress()) strNeighborhoodList = Trim(GetNeighborhoodList())
If(strClientIPAddress = "") Then WScript.Echo "Error: Client IP Address Not Found" WScript.Quit End If
If(strNeighborhoodList = "") Then WScript.Echo "Error: Neighborhood List Not Found" WScript.Quit End If
arrIPs = Split(strNeighborhoodList, ",") strBackwards = "" strForwards = "" bReachedMe = False For Each strIP In arrIPs strIP = Trim(strIP) strPort = GetIPPort(strIP) If strIP = strClientIPAddress Then bReachedMe = True ElseIf strPort <> "0" Then If Not bReachedMe Then strBackwards = strBackwards & GetReadableIPs(strIP) & " " ElseIf bReachedMe Then strForwards = strForwards & GetReadableIPs(strIP) & " " End If End If Next
strBackwards = Replace(Trim(strBackwards), " ", ",") strForwards = Replace(Trim(strForwards), " " , ",")
WScript.Echo strBackwards & "|" & strForwards
'----------End Main Line-----------'
Function GetReadableIPs(strIPs) Dim arrFront, arrIPInfo, strPort, strResult arrFront = Split(strIPs,"_") arrIPInfo = Split(arrFront(0), ":") strPort = arrIPInfo(1)
If INCLUDE_PORTS Then strResult = arrIPInfo(2) & ":" & strPort Else strResult = arrIPInfo(2) End If
GetReadableIPs = strResult End Function ' GetReadableIPs
Function GetIPPort(strIPs) Dim arrFront, arrIPInfo, strPort arrFront = Split(strIPs,"_") arrIPInfo = Split(arrFront(0), ":") strPort = arrIPInfo(1)
GetIPPort = strPort End Function ' GetIPPort
Function GetClientIPAddress() Const HKLM = &h80000002
Dim strTaniumRegistryKey, strComputer, strClientIPAddress Dim objReg
' Set up access to registry via WMI strComputer = "."
Set objReg = _ GetObject("winmgmts:{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\" _ & strComputer & "\root\default:StdRegProv")
strTaniumRegistryKey = GetTaniumRegistryPath() & "\Status"
objReg.GetStringValue HKLM, strTaniumRegistryKey, "ClientAddress", strClientIPAddress
If Not IsNull(strClientIPAddress) Then GetClientIPAddress = strClientIPAddress Else GetClientIPAddress = "" End If
' Cleanup Set objReg = Nothing
End Function ' GetClientIPAddress
Function GetNeighborhoodList() Const HKLM = &h80000002
Dim strTaniumRegistryKey, strComputer, strNeighborhoodList Dim objReg
' Set up access to registry via WMI strComputer = "."
Set objReg = _ GetObject("winmgmts:{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\" _ & strComputer & "\root\default:StdRegProv")
strTaniumRegistryKey = GetTaniumRegistryPath() & "\Status"
objReg.GetStringValue HKLM, strTaniumRegistryKey, "NeighborhoodList", strNeighborhoodList
If Not IsNull(strNeighborhoodList) Then GetNeighborhoodList = strNeighborhoodList Else GetNeighborhoodList = "" End If
' Cleanup Set objReg = Nothing End Function 'GetLogLevel
Function GetTaniumRegistryPath 'GetTaniumRegistryPath works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath, strFoundTaniumRegistryPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 strFoundTaniumRegistryPath = keyNativePath
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 strFoundTaniumRegistryPath = keyWoWPath End If
If Not strPath = "" Then GetTaniumRegistryPath = strFoundTaniumRegistryPath Else GetTaniumRegistryPath = False WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot locate Tanium Registry Path" End If End Function 'GetTaniumRegistryPath
Function RegKeyExists(objRegistry, sHive, sRegKey) Dim aValueNames, aValueTypes If objRegistry.EnumValues(sHive, sRegKey, aValueNames, aValueTypes) = 0 Then RegKeyExists = True Else RegKeyExists = False End If End Function 'RegKeyExists

sensor.name: Primary Owner Name
sensor.description: Returns the name of the Primary System Owner on Windows. This is set at OS install time. Example: John Doe

query.script: select PrimaryOwnerName from win32_ComputerSystem

sensor.name: BIOS Current Language
sensor.description: Currently configured language for the BIOS. Example: en|US|iso8859-1

query.script: select CurrentLanguage from win32_BIOS

sensor.name: Maximum Process Memory Size
sensor.description: Returns the maximum amount of memory, in Kilobytes, that a process can use. This may be free physical RAM and virtual RAM combined, or may be an arbitrary upper ceiling. Example: 2097024

query.script: select MaxProcessMemorySize from win32_operatingsystem

sensor.name: Tanium Client Action Timing
sensor.parameter_definition: {"parameters":[{"restrict":null,"validationExpressions":[{"helpString":"Numbers only","flags":"","expression":"\\d+","parameterType":"com.tanium.models::ValidationExpression","model":"com.tanium.models::ValidationExpression"}],"helpString":"Enter the Action ID number as seen in the Action History","promptText":"e.g. 1234","defaultValue":"","value":"","label":"Action ID number","maxChars":0,"key":"strId","parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::TextInputParameter","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::TextInputParameter"}],"parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray"}
sensor.description: The number of seconds it took to download and complete the Action once a Client first sees the Action. Example: 300 seconds

query.script:
'======================================== ' Tanium Action Timing '========================================
strId = unescape("||strId||")
strDownloadPath = GetTaniumDir("Downloads")
Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject")
strActionLog = strDownloadPath & "action_" & strId & ".log"
Const ForReading = 1
If fso.FileExists(strActionLog) Then Set objReadLog = fso.OpenTextFile(strActionLog, ForReading)
dim strLine
Do Until objReadLog.AtEndOfStream strLine = objReadLog.ReadLine Loop
objReadLog.Close
if instr(strLine, "Command Completed") > 0 Then Set objLog = fso.GetFile(strActionLog) dCreated = objLog.DateCreated dModified = objLog.DateLastModified Wscript.echo DateDiff("s", dCreated, dModified) & " seconds" else Wscript.echo "Action in process" End if Else Wscript.echo "Action does not exist" End If
Function GetTaniumDir(strSubDir) 'GetTaniumDir with GeneratePath, works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 End If
If Not strPath = "" Then If strSubDir <> "" Then strSubDir = "\" & strSubDir End If
Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject") If fso.FolderExists(strPath) Then If Not fso.FolderExists(strPath & strSubDir) Then ''Need to loop through strSubDir and create all sub directories GeneratePath strPath & strSubDir, fso End If GetTaniumDir = strPath & strSubDir & "\" Else ' Specified Path doesn't exist on the filesystem WScript.Echo "Error: " & strPath & " does not exist on the filesystem" GetTaniumDir = False End If Else WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot find Tanium Client path in Registry" GetTaniumDir = False End If End Function 'GetTaniumDir
Function GeneratePath(pFolderPath, fso) GeneratePath = False
If Not fso.FolderExists(pFolderPath) Then If GeneratePath(fso.GetParentFolderName(pFolderPath), fso) Then GeneratePath = True Call fso.CreateFolder(pFolderPath) End If Else GeneratePath = True End If End Function 'GeneratePath
Function RegKeyExists(objRegistry, sHive, sRegKey) Dim aValueNames, aValueTypes If objRegistry.EnumValues(sHive, sRegKey, aValueNames, aValueTypes) = 0 Then RegKeyExists = True Else RegKeyExists = False End If End Function

sensor.name: Patch History Details
sensor.parameter_definition: {"parameters":[{"stepSize":1,"maximum":365,"helpString":"Enter the number of days to show patch history for.","snapInterval":1,"minimum":1,"defaultValue":"7","value":"7","label":"Show past days","key":"DaysOldLimit","parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::NumericParameter","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::NumericParameter"},{"values":["Yes","No"],"helpString":"Choose whether to show the patch history in local time or not (UTC time)","requireSelection":true,"promptText":"","defaultValue":"","value":"","label":"Show Local Install Time (not UTC)","key":"ShowInLocalTime","parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::DropDownParameter","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::DropDownParameter"}],"parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray"}
sensor.description: A sensor to return patch history for a certain number of days prior. Example: GUID|Operation|Result|Exception|Install Date|Publish Date|Title|First Needed Date|Severity|MS ID|KB|CVE ID|Size

query.script:
'======================================== ' Patch History Details '========================================
' sensor: patch history details ' this will show the full patch history of a machine ' This is a multi-column sensor whose output looks like: ' GUID|Operation|Result|Exception|Install Date|Publish Date|Title|FirstNeededDate|Severity|MS ID|KB|CVE ID|Size|Tanium Unique ID|Patched By
Option Explicit
Const FORREADING = 1
Dim objFSO,objTextFile Dim strToolsDir,strScanDir,intDaysOldLimit,strDaysOldLimit Dim strHistoryTextReadableFilePath,strShowInLocalTime Dim strSep : strSep = "|" Dim strSep2 : strSep2 = "&&" Dim strLine,arrLine,strColumn2,dtmInstallDateLocal,intDaysOld Dim bShowInLocalTime,bUTCDateTime,bMalformedLines,intLineCount Dim dictInstalledResultsData,intHoursThresholdToConsiderMatched
SetLocale(GetTaniumLocale) ' uses date math
' This value is used to determine whether an entry in the API history matches ' a similar entry in the tanium installed by. If the times are within this range ' we consider the update performed by tanium in this history printout. intHoursThresholdToConsiderMatched = 2 ' days old parameter strDaysOldLimit=Trim(Unescape("||DaysOldLimit||"))
If IsNumeric(strDaysOldLimit) Then intDaysOldLimit = CInt(strDaysOldLimit) Else WScript.Echo "Error: Days Old Limit parameter must be a number" WScript.Quit End If
' show local time parameter ' a customer may want UTC display strShowInLocalTime=Trim(Unescape("||ShowInLocalTime||"))
Select Case LCase(strShowInLocalTime) Case "yes" bShowInLocalTime = True Case "true" bShowInLocalTime = True Case "no" bShowInLocalTime = False Case "false" bShowInLocalTime = False Case "" bShowInLocalTime = True Case Else WScript.Echo "Error: Show Local Time Parameter must be Yes or No" WScript.Quit End Select
bMalformedLines = False Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject") strToolsDir = GetTaniumDir("Tools") strScanDir = GetTaniumDir("Tools\Scans")
strHistoryTextReadableFilePath = strScanDir&"patchhistoryreadable.txt"
If Not objFSO.FileExists(strHistoryTextReadableFilePath) Then WScript.Echo "Cannot find History file" Set objFSO = Nothing WScript.Quit End If
Set dictInstalledResultsData = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary")
GetInstalledResultsData dictInstalledResultsData
intLineCount = 0 ' read History into dictionary Set objTextFile = objFSO.OpenTextFile(strHistoryTextReadableFilePath,FORREADING) While objTextFile.AtEndOfStream = False strLine = objTextFile.ReadLine arrLine = Split(strLine,strSep) If IsArray(arrLine) Then ' 15 History Columns ' GUID|Operation|Result|Exception|Install Date|Publish Date|Title|FirstNeededDate|Severity|MS ID|KB|CVE ID|Size|Tanium Unique ID|Applied By arrLine = Split(strLine,strSep) If IsArray(arrLine) Then If UBound(arrLine) > 10 Then On Error Resume Next bUTCDateTime = arrLine(4) dtmInstallDateLocal = FormatDateTime(DateAdd("n",GetTZBias,CDate(arrLine(4))),vbShortDate) If bShowInLocalTime Then ' Convert from UTC to Local replace the line strLine = Replace(strLine,arrLine(4),dtmInstallDateLocal) On Error Goto 0 End If ' Ignore first needed and superseded lines strColumn2 = Trim(LCase(arrLine(1))) If Not (strColumn2 = "firstneeded" Or strColumn2 = "superseded") Then intLineCount = intLineCount + 1 ' do not echo if the days old is older than the max days on input intDaysOld = Abs(DateDiff("d",Now(),dtmInstallDateLocal)) If intDaysOld < intDaysOldLimit Then Dim strInstallResultsTime ' we have a value to write, check if it was our update If dictInstalledResultsData.Exists(arrLine(0)) Then ' GUID on history line matched an install result ' each guid in the install result may not be unique, so lines ' are concatenated into the single dictionary entry Dim strInstallHistoryEntry,arrInstallHistoryLine For Each strInstallHistoryEntry In Split(dictInstalledResultsData.Item(arrLine(0)),strSep2) arrInstallHistoryLine = Split(strInstallHistoryEntry,strSep) If arrLine(1) = "Installation" Then Dim strDateFromInstallHistory strDateFromInstallHistory = arrInstallHistoryLine(1) If IsDate(strDateFromInstallHistory) And IsDate(arrLine(4)) Then If Abs(DateDiff("h",strDateFromInstallHistory,arrLine(4))) <= intHoursThresholdToConsiderMatched Then bTanium = True End If Else ' WScript.Echo "No possible date match - " & strDateFromInstallHistory &" - " & arrLine(4) End If End If Next WScript.Echo strLine&strSep&"Tanium" bTanium = False Else WScript.Echo strLine&strSep&"Unsure" End If End If End If Else bMalformedLines = True 'WScript.Echo "History Line malformed - needs 11 fields" End If Else bMalformedLines = True 'WScript.Echo "History Line Malformed" ' not pipe splittable End If End If Wend If intLineCount = 0 Then WScript.Echo "No patch actions in history"
' If bMalformedLines Then WScript.Echo "History file had malformed line(s)"
objTextFile.Close
Function GetTaniumDir(strSubDir) 'GetTaniumDir with GeneratePath, works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 End If
If Not strPath = "" Then If strSubDir <> "" Then strSubDir = "\" & strSubDir End If
Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject") If fso.FolderExists(strPath) Then If Not fso.FolderExists(strPath & strSubDir) Then ''Need to loop through strSubDir and create all sub directories GeneratePath strPath & strSubDir, fso End If GetTaniumDir = strPath & strSubDir & "\" Else ' Specified Path doesn't exist on the filesystem WScript.Echo "Error: " & strPath & " does not exist on the filesystem" GetTaniumDir = False End If Else WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot find Tanium Client path in Registry" GetTaniumDir = False End If End Function 'GetTaniumDir
Function GeneratePath(pFolderPath, fso) GeneratePath = False
If Not fso.FolderExists(pFolderPath) Then If GeneratePath(fso.GetParentFolderName(pFolderPath), fso) Then GeneratePath = True Call fso.CreateFolder(pFolderPath) End If Else GeneratePath = True End If End Function 'GeneratePath
Function GetTaniumLocale '' This function will retrieve the locale value ' previously set which governs Tanium content that ' is locale sensitive.
Dim objWshShell Dim intLocaleID
Set objWshShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell") On Error Resume Next intLocaleID = objWshShell.RegRead("HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client\LocaleID") If Err.Number <> 0 Then intLocaleID = objWshShell.RegRead("HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client\LocaleID") End If On Error Goto 0 If intLocaleID = "" Then GetTaniumLocale = 1033 ' default to us/English Else GetTaniumLocale = intLocaleID End If
' Cleanup Set objWshShell = Nothing
End Function 'GetTaniumLocale
Function GetTZBias ' This functiong returns the number of minutes ' (positive or negative) to add to current time to get UTC ' considers daylight savings
Dim objLocalTimeZone, intTZBiasInMinutes
For Each objLocalTimeZone in GetObject("winmgmts:").InstancesOf("Win32_ComputerSystem") intTZBiasInMinutes = objLocalTimeZone.CurrentTimeZone Next
GetTZBias = intTZBiasInMinutes
End Function 'GetTZBias
Sub GetInstalledResultsData(ByRef dictInstalledResultsData) ' build patch install results, by GUID Dim strInstalledResultsTextReadablePath,objResultsFile Dim strLine,arrLine,objFSO Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject")
strInstalledResultsTextReadablePath = strScanDir&"installedresultsreadable.txt" If objFSO.FileExists(strInstalledResultsTextReadablePath) Then Set objResultsFile = objFSO.OpenTextFile(strInstalledResultsTextReadablePath,1,False) ' do not create Do Until objResultsFile.AtEndOfStream = True strLine = objResultsFile.ReadLine arrLine = Split(strLine,strSep) If IsArray(arrLine) Then If UBound(arrLine) > 0 Then ' GUID is first entry, result is final entry If Not dictInstalledResultsData.Exists(arrLine(0)) Then dictInstalledResultsData.Add arrLine(0),Replace(strLine,arrLine(0)&strSep,"") Else ' duplicate entry strLine = strLine&strSep2&dictInstalledResultsData.Item(arrLine(0)) End If End If End If Loop End If objResultsFile.Close
End Sub 'GetInstalledResultsData

sensor.description: Returns whether the machine is a Mac. True if so, False if not. Example: True

sensor.name: Last Reboot
sensor.description: Returns the time the last reboot occurred. Example: 2012-12-11 09:01

query.script:
'======================================== ' Last Reboot ' (See also OS Boot Time) '========================================
' This sensor will return the time the OS booted up
Option Explicit
Dim dateBootTime, strFinalOutputString, strSep ' Force output in a specific time format SetLocale(1033)
strSep = "|" dateBootTime = GetBootTime
WScript.Echo Year(dateBootTime) & "-" & zeroPad(Month(dateBootTime),2) & "-" & zeroPad(Day(dateBootTime),2) & " " & FormatDateTime(dateBootTime,vbShortTime)
'-----------End Main-------------'
Function zeroPad(m, t) zeroPad = String(t-Len(m),"0")&m End Function 'zeroPad
Function GetBootTime ' Retrieves a nicely formatted bootup time Dim objSWbemDateTime Dim objWMIService Dim colOperatingSystems Dim objOperatingSystem Dim strComputer Dim colTimeZone Dim objTimeZone Dim intTZBiasInMinutes Dim dateBootTime
strComputer = "."
Set objSWbemDateTime = CreateObject("WbemScripting.SWbemDateTime") Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\" & strComputer & "\root\cimv2") Set colOperatingSystems = objWMIService.ExecQuery ("Select * from Win32_OperatingSystem")
For Each objOperatingSystem in colOperatingSystems objSWbemDateTime.Value = objOperatingSystem.LastBootUpTime dateBootTime = CDate(objSWbemDateTime.GetVarDate(False)) Next
' Now to correct for time zones Set colTimeZone = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select * from Win32_ComputerSystem")
For Each objTimeZone in colTimeZone intTZBiasInMinutes = objTimeZone.CurrentTimeZone dateBootTime = DateAdd("n", intTZBiasInMinutes, dateBootTime) Next
'return result GetBootTime = dateBootTime
'Cleanup Set objSWbemDateTime = Nothing Set objWMIService = Nothing Set colOperatingSystems = Nothing Set colTimeZone = Nothing
End Function 'GetBootTime

sensor.name: Time Zone Offset
sensor.description: Returns the time offset in minutes. Example: -0700

query.script:
'======================================== ' Time Zone Offset '========================================
Option Explicit
WScript.Echo GetRFC822Bias
Function GetRFC822Bias ' This function returns a string which is a ' timezone bias for RFC822 format ' considers daylight savings ' we choose 4 digits and a sign (+ or -)
Dim objWMIService,colTimeZone,objTimeZone
Dim intTZBiasInMinutes,strSign,strReturnString
Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:" _ & "{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\.\root\cimv2") Set colTimeZone = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select * from Win32_ComputerSystem")
For Each objTimeZone in colTimeZone intTZBiasInMinutes = objTimeZone.CurrentTimeZone Next
' The offset is explicitly signed If intTZBiasInMinutes < 0 Then strSign = "-" Else strSign = "+" End If
strReturnString = CStr(Abs(intTZBiasInMinutes)) ' no offset is greater than three digits but RFC822 bias seems to ' usually take the form of 1 alpha / 4 digit as described as ' valid in ANSI X3.51-1975
strReturnString = zeroPad(strReturnString,4)
GetRFC822Bias = strSign&strReturnString
'Cleanup Set colTimeZone = Nothing Set objWMIService = Nothing
End Function 'GetRFC822Bias
Function zeroPad(m, t) zeroPad = String(t-Len(m),"0")&m End Function
#!/bin/bash echo `date +%z`
#!/bin/bash echo `date +%z`

sensor.name: File Creation Date
sensor.parameter_definition: {"parameters":[{"restrict":null,"validationExpressions":[{"helpString":"Value can not be blank","flags":"","expression":"^\\S","parameterType":"com.tanium.models::ValidationExpression","model":"com.tanium.models::ValidationExpression"}],"helpString":"Enter the file path and name to search for.","promptText":"e.g. c:\\windows\\test.txt","defaultValue":"","value":"","label":"File path and name to search for","maxChars":0,"key":"filename","parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::TextInputParameter","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::TextInputParameter"}],"parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray"}
sensor.description: Returns the creation date of the file specified by the parameter. Example: 12-12-2014 18:00

query.script:
'======================================== ' File Creation Date '========================================
Option Explicit
SetLocale(1033)
Dim filesys, filename, file, createdate
filename = unescape("||filename||") 'filename = "c:\windows\regedit.exe"
filename = FixFileSystemRedirectionForPath(filename)
Set filesys = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject")
If filesys.FileExists(filename) Then Set file = filesys.GetFile(filename) createdate = file.DateCreated WScript.Echo FormatDateTime(createdate, vbShortDate) & " " & FormatDateTime(createdate, vbShortTime) Else WScript.Echo "File " & filename & " not found." End If
Function FixFileSystemRedirectionForPath(strFilePath) ' This function will fix a folder location so that ' a 32-bit program can be passed the windows\system32 directory ' as a parameter. ' Even if the sensor or action runs in 64-bit mode, a 32-bit ' program called in a 64-bit environment cannot access ' the system32 directory - it would be redirected to syswow64. ' you would not want to do this for 64-bit programs.
Dim objFSO, strSystem32Location,objShell Dim strProgramFilesx86,strNewSystem32Location,strRestOfPath Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject") Set objShell = CreateObject("Wscript.Shell")
strProgramFilesx86=objShell.ExpandEnvironmentStrings("%ProgramFiles%")
strFilePath = LCase(strFilePath) strSystem32Location = LCase(objFSO.GetSpecialFolder(1)) strProgramFilesx86=objShell.ExpandEnvironmentStrings("%ProgramFiles(x86)%")
If objFSO.FolderExists(strProgramFilesx86) Then ' quick check for x64 If InStr(strFilePath,strSystem32Location) = 1 Then strRestOfPath = Replace(strFilePath,strSystem32Location,"") strNewSystem32Location = Replace(strSystem32Location,"system32","sysnative") strFilePath = strNewSystem32Location&strRestOfPath End If End If FixFileSystemRedirectionForPath = strFilePath
'Cleanup Set objFSO = Nothing End Function 'FixFileSystemRedirectionForPath
Function UnFixFileSystemRedirectionForPath(strFilePath) ' This function will undo the changes made to a path by the ' FixFileSystemRedirectionForPath function ' if a path is passed in with the sysnative string in it ' it will simply change it to system32, regardless of whether ' the OS is 64-bit. A path will only be changed when it's ' necessary, so this has no effect when it's not changed.
Dim objFSO,strSystem32Location,strNewSystem32Location
Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject")
strFilePath = LCase(strFilePath) strSystem32Location = LCase(objFSO.GetSpecialFolder(1)) strNewSystem32Location = Replace(strSystem32Location,"system32","sysnative")
UnFixFileSystemRedirectionForPath = Replace(strFilePath,strNewSystem32Location,strSystem32Location)
'Cleanup Set objFSO = Nothing End Function 'UnFixFileSystemRedirectionForPath

sensor.name: IP Connections
sensor.description: Returns the protocol, local address / port, process name, application name, remote port, and connection state for all active IP connections on an endpoint. Example: tcp|192.168.95.186:51866|explorer.exe|Windows Explorer|165.254.58.66:80|established

query.script:
'======================================== ' IP Connections '========================================
'Option Explicit
Dim showProcess, showPort, showRemoteConnection
showProcess = True showPort = True showRemoteConnection = True
Dim strcommand, results, excludeProcesses, excludeSubnets, excludeListenPorts, excludeRemotePorts, taniumDebug Dim strSep : strSep = "|" ' This is a multi-column sensor that looks like: 'Process|Name|Target IP
excludeProcesses = "TaniumClient.exe,TaniumReceiver.exe" 'excludeProcesses = "chrome.exe" 'excludeProcesses = "iexplore.exe" 'excludeProcesses = "chrome.exe, iexplore.exe" 'excludeProcesses = "trillian.exe"
excludeSubnets = "127.0.0.0:255.255.255.0" 'excludeSubnets = "72.14.213.0:255.255.255.0, 74.125.223.0:255.255.255.0-74.125.225.0:255.255.255.0"
excludeListenPorts = "17472" ' excludeListenPorts = "17472,80,443"
excludeRemotePorts = "17472" ' excludeRemotePorts = "17472,80,443"
taniumDebug = False
excludeProcesses = Split(LCase(excludeProcesses), ",") excludeSubnets = Split(excludeSubnets, ",") excludeListenPorts = Split(excludeListenPorts, ",") excludeRemotePorts = Split(excludeRemotePorts, ",")
strComputer = "." Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:" & "{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\" & strComputer & "\root\cimv2") query = "select name, executablepath, processId from win32_process" Set colResults = objWMIService.ExecQuery(query)
'dictionary for process-app pairs Set processes = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary")
For Each result In colResults processId = CStr(result.ProcessId) processPath = result.ExecutablePath processes.Add processId, result.Name & "," & processPath ' tie IDs to exes,path - split later Next
' unlike established connections, shows connections in all states strcommand = "cmd /c netstat -aon -p TCP | find " & chr(34) & "TCP" & Chr(34)
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell") Set objScriptExec = objShell.Exec (strCommand) strNSResults = LCase(objScriptExec.StdOut.ReadAll)
results = Split(strNSResults, vbCrLf) j = 0
For Each line in results line = cleanWhitespace(Trim(line))
lineResults = Split(line) i = 0 Dim strPort, strPid, strConnectionState, strForeignIP, strApp For Each word In lineResults If i = 0 Then strProtocol = word ElseIf i = 1 Then strLocalIP = word ElseIf i = 2 Then strForeignIP = word ElseIf i = 3 Then strConnectionState = word ElseIf i = 4 Then strPid = word End If
i = i + 1 Next
'DO NOT INCLUDE EXCLUDED APPS strAppEntry = processes.Item(strPid) ' looks like process.exe, Process Path arrAppEntry = Split(strAppEntry,",") strAppExe = arrAppEntry(0) strAppPath = arrAppEntry(1)
isNotExcludedApp = Not(ContainedInArray(LCase(strAppExe), excludeProcesses))
'DO NOT INCLUDE EXCLUDED SUBNETS isNotExcludedSubnet = Not(ContainedInSubnet(strForeignIP, excludeSubnets))
'DO NOT INCLUDE EXCLUDED LISTEN PORTS isNotExcludedListenPort = Not(ContainedInArray(Split(strLocalIP, ":")(1), excludeListenPorts))
'DO NOT INCLUDE EXCLUDED REMOTE PORTS isNotExcludedRemotePort = Not(ContainedInArray(Split(strForeignIP, ":")(1), excludeRemotePorts))
If Not(IsEmpty(strAppExe)) _ And isNotExcludedApp _ And isNotExcludedSubnet _ And isNotExcludedListenPort _ And IsNotExcludedRemotePort Then
If Not showPort Then arrTemp = Split(strForeignIP, ":") strForeignIP = arrTemp(0) End If
If showProcess Then results(j) = strProtocol & strSep & strLocalIP & strSep & strAppExe & strSep & ProcessNameToApplicationName(strAppPath,strAppExe) & strSep & strForeignIP & strSep & strConnectionState Else results(j) = strProtocol & strSep & strLocalIP & strSep & strSep & strForeignIP & strSep & strConnectionState End If Else If taniumDebug Then WScript.Echo " excluded: " & strApp & " " & strForeignIP results(j) = "" End If
j = j + 1 Next
results = RemDups(results)
If UBound(results) < 1 Then If GetLocale() <> 1033 Then WScript.Echo "English Language OS Required" End If End If
For Each result In results WScript.Echo result Next
WScript.Quit
Function ContainedInSubnet(str, arr) Dim strIp, strSubnet, strMask temp = Split(str, ":") strIp = temp(0)
For Each item In arr If InStr(item, "-") Then 'Subnet range temp = Split(item, "-") lower = Split(temp(0), ":") upper = Split(temp(1), ":") lowerSubnet = Trim(lower(0)) lowerMask = Trim(lower(1)) upperSubnet = Trim(upper(0)) upperMask = Trim(upper(1))
If StringToBinary(strIp) > StringToBinary(Subnet(lowerSubnet, lowerMask)) _ And StringToBinary(strIp) < StringToBinary(Subnet(upperSubnet, upperMask)) Then ContainedInSubnet = True Exit Function End If Else 'Single subnet parts = Split(item, ":") strSubnet = Trim(parts(0)) strMask = Trim(parts(1)) If Subnet(strIp, strMask) = Subnet(strSubnet, strMask) Then ContainedInSubnet = True Exit Function End If End If Next ContainedInSubnet = False End Function
Function ContainedInArray(str, arr) For Each item In arr If str = Trim(item) Then ContainedInArray = True Exit Function End If Next ContainedInArray = False End Function
Function cleanWhitespace(strStarter) intStarter = Len(strStarter) For i = intStarter to 2 Step -1 strChars = Space(i) strStarter = Replace(strStarter, strChars, " ") Next cleanWhitespace = strStarter End Function
Function RemDups(ByVal anArray) Dim d, item, thekeys Set d = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary") d.removeall d.CompareMode = 0 For Each item In anArray If Len(item) > 0 Then If Not d.Exists(item) Then d.Add item, item End If Next thekeys = d.keys Set d = Nothing RemDups = thekeys End Function
Function Subnet(strAddress, strMask) intSubnetLength = SubnetLength(strMask) Subnet = BinaryToString(Left(StringToBinary(strAddress), intSubnetLength) & String(32 - intSubnetLength, "0")) End Function
Function SubnetLength(strMask) strMaskBinary = StringToBinary(strMask) SubnetLength = Len(Left(strMaskBinary, InStr(strMaskBinary, "0") - 1)) End Function
Function BinaryToString(strBinary) For intOctetPos = 1 To 4 strOctetBinary = Right(Left(strBinary, intOctetPos * 8), 8) intOctet = 0 intValue = 1 For intBinaryPos = 1 To Len(strOctetBinary) If Left(Right(strOctetBinary, intBinaryPos), 1) = "1" Then intOctet = intOctet + intValue intValue = intValue * 2 Next If BinaryToString = Empty Then BinaryToString = CStr(intOctet) Else BinaryToString = BinaryToString & "." & CStr(intOctet) Next End Function
Function StringToBinary(strAddress) objAddress = Split(strAddress, ".", -1) For Each strOctet In objAddress intOctet = CInt(strOctet) strOctetBinary = "" For x = 1 To 8 If intOctet Mod 2 > 0 Then strOctetBinary = "1" & strOctetBinary Else strOctetBinary = "0" & strOctetBinary End If intOctet = Int(intOctet / 2) Next StringToBinary = StringToBinary & strOctetBinary Next End Function
Function ProcessNameToApplicationName(strExecutablePath, strExecutableName) ' This function will return the full application name of a running executable
Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject")
arrPathParts = Split(strExecutablePath,"\")
If UBound(arrPathParts) < 0 Then 'can be -1 for no split, such as the System process ProcessNameToApplicationName = strExecutableName Set fso = Nothing Exit Function End If strExecutable = arrPathParts(UBound(arrPathParts))
If fso.FileExists(strExecutablePath) Then Dim strOutput, fileVersion, fileVersionOutput, fullName
Set execFile = fso.GetFile(strExecutablePath) fullName = GetDescription(execFile.ParentFolder.Path, strExecutable) If Not fullName = "" Then ProcessNameToApplicationName = fullName Else ProcessNameToApplicationName = strExecutableName End If Else ' file doesn't exist or inaccessible ProcessNameToApplicationName = strExecutableName End If
End Function 'ProcessNameToApplicationName
Function GetDescription(folderPath, fileName) descIndex = GetAttributeIndex(folderPath, "File description") If IsEmpty(descIndex) Then descIndex = GetAttributeIndex(folderPath, "Description") End If GetDescription = GetFileProperty(folderPath, fileName, descIndex) End Function
Function GetFileProperty(folderPath, fileName, fileProperty) Set objShell = CreateObject("Shell.Application") Set objFolder = objShell.Namespace(folderPath) GetFileProperty = objFolder.GetDetailsOf(objFolder.Parsename(fileName), fileProperty) End Function
Function GetAttributeIndex(folderPath, attrTarget) Set objShell = CreateObject("Shell.Application") Set objFolder = objShell.Namespace(folderPath) For i = 0 to 50 attrName = objFolder.GetDetailsOf(objFolder.Items, i) If LCase(attrName) = LCase(attrTarget) Then GetAttributeIndex = i Exit Function End If Next
End Function

sensor.name: VMware Guest
sensor.description: Returns True if client machine is a guest VM in VMware. Example: True

query.script:
'======================================== ' WMware Guest '======================================== On Error Resume Next strComputer = "." Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\" & strComputer & "\root\cimv2") Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select * from Win32_ComputerSystem",,48) For Each objItem in colItems If objItem.Model = "VMware Virtual Platform" Then WScript.Echo "True" WScript.Quit Next
Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery _ ("Select * From Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration Where IPEnabled = True") For Each objItem in colItems If Left(objItem.MACAddress, 8) = "00:0C:29" Then WScript.Echo "True" WScript.Quit Next

sensor.name: Network Throughput Inbound
sensor.description: Returns the current inbound throughput, in KB/Sec, of the network interface used to connect to the tanium server. Example: 1024 KB/S

query.script:
'======================================== ' Network Throughput Inbound '========================================
' This sensor will use windows performance counters ' and attempt to retrieve network traffic information ' only for the interface being used to connect to the tanium server ' results are in kilobytes per second
Option Explicit
Dim strTaniumIPAddress: strTaniumIPAddress = GetTaniumIPAddress Dim strComputer: strComputer = "."
Dim strDescriptionToMatch, strNameToMatch, strIPAddress, strFinalOutputString Dim objWMIService, colItems, objItem
' First we get the "Name" property of the adapter with our target IP address ' out of WMI. Because Name is the closest thing to match the Description ' field in the performance counter, but it's not exact due to how some ' characters are displayed, we will remove troublesome characters ' and attempt to match on that
' Since the entire sensor's output depends on if the two strings match, we ' can set the one string to something it won't match on (because _) to be safe strDescriptionToMatch = "_ImpossibleToMatch"
Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\" & strComputer & "\root\cimv2") Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select * from Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration where IPEnabled = True",,48) For Each objItem In colItems For Each strIPAddress In objItem.IPAddress If strIPAddress = strTaniumIPAddress Then ' WScript.Echo "IP Address Tanium is using: " & strIPAddress strDescriptionToMatch = CleanString(objItem.Description) ' WScript.Echo "Description to be matched: " & strDescriptionToMatch End If Next Next
Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select * from Win32_PerfFormattedData_Tcpip_NetworkInterface",,48)
For Each objItem in colItems strNameToMatch = CleanString(objItem.Name) ' WScript.Echo "Name: " & strNameToMatch If LCase(strNameToMatch) = LCase(strDescriptionToMatch) Then ' WScript.Echo "I have matched " & strNameToMatch & " and " & strDescriptionToMatch ' We can now report bandwidth strFinalOutputString = FormatNumber(objItem.BytesReceivedPersec / 1024,0,-1) & " KB/S" End If Next
If strFinalOutputString = "" Then ' The two names are too dissimilar, or can't get IP address for tanium client WScript.Echo "Cannot determine which adapter to measure" Else WScript.Echo strFinalOutputString End If
' Cleanup Set objWMIService = Nothing Set colItems = Nothing Set objItem = Nothing
'' End Main Line
'' Helper Functions Function CleanString(strInput) ' This function will remove non-alphanumeric characters Dim objRegEx
Set objRegEx = CreateObject("VBScript.RegExp")
objRegEx.Global = True objRegEx.Pattern = "[^A-Za-z0-9]" CleanString = objRegEx.Replace(strInput, "")
Set objRegEx = Nothing End Function 'CleanString
Function GetTaniumIPAddress ' Modified from the ua-scan code to remove the subnet and last octet calculations ' which are irrelevant for these purposes. ' Returns the IP address that the client uses for Tanium activity ' (talking to server and other clients)
Dim strComputer, objReg, strCommand, objShell, objScriptExec Dim strResults, arrPathPingLines, strPathPingLine, arrPathPingWords Dim strIPAddress, strTaniumPath, strClientAddress Dim strServerName
strComputer = "." Set objReg = GetObject("winmgmts:{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\" & strComputer & "\root\default:StdRegProv") Const HKLM = &h80000002
''###########Get Tanium Key on 64/32bit computers##########
strTaniumPath = GetTaniumRegistryPath()
' if we can pull this from the registry (newer client version), just use that objReg.GetStringValue HKLM, strTaniumPath & "\Status", "ClientAddress", strClientAddress If strClientAddress <> "" Then strClientAddress = Left(strClientAddress,InStr(strClientAddress,"_")-1) strClientAddress = Right(strClientAddress,len(strClientAddress)-InStrRev(strClientAddress,":")) ' WScript.Echo "Found " & strClientAddress & " in Registry" GetTaniumIPAddress = strClientAddress 'Cleanup Set objReg = Nothing Exit Function End If
'Otherwise use PathPing to determine client IP used by Tanium
''# Read the ServerName value
objReg.GetStringValue HKLM, strTaniumPath, "ServerName", strServerName
strCommand = "pathping -4 -q 1 -w 1 -n " & strServerName Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell") Set objScriptExec = objShell.Exec (strCommand) strResults = objScriptExec.StdOut.ReadAll
arrPathPingLines = Split(strResults, vbCrLf) For Each strPathPingLine In arrPathPingLines arrPathPingWords = Split(CleanWhitespace(Trim(strPathPingLine)), " ") If UBound(arrPathPingWords) > 0 Then If arrPathPingWords(0) = "0" Then strIPAddress = arrPathPingWords(1) Exit For End If End If Next
Set objShell = Nothing Set objScriptExec = Nothing Set objReg = Nothing
If Not IsNull(strIPAddress) Then GetTaniumIPAddress = strIPAddress Else GetTaniumIPAddress = False End If End Function 'GetTaniumIPAddress
Function RegKeyExists(objRegistry, sHive, sRegKey) Dim aValueNames, aValueTypes If objRegistry.EnumValues(sHive, sRegKey, aValueNames, aValueTypes) = 0 Then RegKeyExists = True Else RegKeyExists = False End If End Function 'RegKeyExists
Function GetTaniumRegistryPath 'GetTaniumRegistryPath works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath, strFoundTaniumRegistryPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 strFoundTaniumRegistryPath = keyNativePath
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 strFoundTaniumRegistryPath = keyWoWPath End If
If Not strPath = "" Then GetTaniumRegistryPath = strFoundTaniumRegistryPath Else GetTaniumRegistryPath = False WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot locate Tanium Registry Path" End If End Function 'GetTaniumRegistryPath
Function CleanWhitespace(strStarter) Dim intStarter, i, strChars intStarter = Len(strStarter) For i = intStarter to 2 Step -1 strChars = Space(i) strStarter = Replace(strStarter, strChars, " ") Next CleanWhitespace = strStarter End Function 'CleanWhiteSpace

sensor.name: CPU
sensor.description: Description of the CPU. Example: Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-2500 CPU @ 3.30GHz

query.script:
'======================================== ' CPU '========================================
Option Explicit
Dim objWMIService, colProcessors, objProcessor Dim strProcessorName, intProcessorSpeed
Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\.\root\cimv2") Set colProcessors = objWMIService.ExecQuery("select Name,MaxClockSpeed from win32_processor")
For Each objProcessor in colProcessors strProcessorName = objProcessor.Name intProcessorSpeed = CInt(objProcessor.MaxClockSpeed) If InStr(strProcessorName, "Intel Pentium III") >0 And _ Left(GetOSMajorVersion(), 1) = "5" And _ intProcessorSpeed > 1000 Then ' Work around for this problem on Windows XP / Windows 2003 machines, where ' wrong value is reported for the processor type: ' http://support.microsoft.com/kb/953955
strProcessorName = "Intel(R) Core(TM)2 Duo CPU" End If WScript.Echo Trim(strProcessorName) Next
Function GetOSMajorVersion ' Returns the OS Major Version ' A different way to examine the OS instead of by name
Dim objWMIService,colItems,objItem Dim strVersion
Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\.\root\CIMV2") Set colItems = GetObject("WinMgmts:root/cimv2").ExecQuery("select Version from win32_operatingsystem") For Each objItem In colItems strVersion = objItem.Version ' like 6.2.9200 strVersion = Left(strVersion,Len(strVersion) - 5) Next
GetOSMajorVersion = strVersion
End Function 'GetOSMajorVersion

#!/bin/bash name=$( system_profiler SPHardwareDataType | awk -F': ' ' /Processor Name:/ { print $2 } ' ) speed=$( system_profiler SPHardwareDataType | awk -F': ' ' /Processor Speed:/ { print $2 } ' )
echo $name $speed

sensor.name: File Name Search with RegEx Match
sensor.parameter_definition: {"parameters":[{"restrict":null,"validationExpressions":[{"helpString":"Value must be at least 3 characters","flags":"","expression":"\\S{3}","parameterType":"com.tanium.models::ValidationExpression","model":"com.tanium.models::ValidationExpression"}],"helpString":"Enter the file name only to search for","promptText":"e.g test.txt","defaultValue":"","value":"","label":"File Name","maxChars":0,"key":"filename","parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::TextInputParameter","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::TextInputParameter"},{"restrict":null,"validationExpressions":[],"helpString":"Enter the regular expression to search for.","promptText":"e.g. test*.exe","defaultValue":"","value":"","label":"Regular Expression","maxChars":0,"key":"regexp","parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::TextInputParameter","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::TextInputParameter"},{"values":["No","Yes"],"helpString":"Enter Yes/No for case sensitivity of search.","requireSelection":true,"promptText":"","defaultValue":"","value":"","label":"Case sensitive?","key":"casesensitive","parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::DropDownParameter","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::DropDownParameter"},{"values":["No","Yes"],"helpString":"Enter Yes/No whether the search is global.","requireSelection":true,"promptText":"","defaultValue":"","value":"","label":"Global","key":"global","parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::DropDownParameter","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::DropDownParameter"}],"parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray"}
sensor.description: Finds the specified file and provides the full path if the file exists on the client machine. Takes regular expression to match. Example: C:\WINDOWS\System32\Notepad.exe

query.script:
'======================================== ' File Name Search with RegEx Match '======================================== '@INCLUDE=utils/SensorRandomization/SensorRandomizationFunctions.vbs Option Explicit
SensorRandomize()
Dim Pattern,strRegExp,strGlobalArg,strCaseSensitiveArg Dim bGlobal,bCaseSensitive
Pattern = unescape("||filename||") strRegExp = Trim(Unescape("||regexp||")) strGlobalArg = Trim(Unescape("||global||")) strCaseSensitiveArg = Trim(Unescape("||casesensitive||"))
bGlobal = GetTrueFalseArg("global",strGlobalArg) bCaseSensitive = GetTrueFalseArg("casesensitive",strCaseSensitiveArg)
Const SYSTEM_FOLDER = 1, TEMP_FOLDER = 2, FOR_READING = 1
Dim FSO, WshShell, Drives, Drive, TextStream, OutputFilename, strLine
Set FSO = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject") Set WshShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
OutputFilename = TempName() ' a temporary file in system's temp dir
' Go through file system, refresh output file for filename If Not FSO.FileExists(OutputFilename) Then
If FSO.FileExists(OutputFilename) Then FSO.DeleteFile OutputFilename
' Get the collection of local drives. Set Drives = FSO.Drives For Each Drive in Drives If Drive.DriveType = 2 Then ' 2 = Fixed drive ' Run the Dir command that looks for the filename pattern. RunCommand "dir " &Chr(34)& Drive.DriveLetter & ":\" & Pattern & Chr(34)&" /a:-d /b /s", OutputFilename, true End If Next End If
' Open the output file, echo each line, and then close and delete it. Set TextStream = FSO.OpenTextFile(OutputFileName, FOR_READING) Do While Not TextStream.AtEndOfStream strLine = TextStream.ReadLine() If RegExpMatch(strRegExp,strLine,bGlobal,bCaseSensitive) Then WScript.Echo strLine End If Loop
TextStream.Close()
If FSO.FileExists(OutputFileName) Then On Error Resume Next FSO.DeleteFile OutputFileName, True On Error Goto 0 End If
Function RegExpMatch(strPattern,strToMatch,bGlobal,bIsCaseSensitive)
Dim re Set re = New RegExp With re .Pattern = strPattern .Global = bGlobal .IgnoreCase = Not bIsCaseSensitive End With
RegExpMatch = re.Test(strToMatch)
End Function 'RegExpMatch
Function GetTrueFalseArg(strArgName,strArgValue) ' Checks for valid values, will fail with error message
Dim bArgVal bArgVal = False Select Case LCase(strArgValue) Case "true" bArgVal = True Case "yes" bArgVal = True Case "false" bArgVal = False Case "no" bArgVal = False Case Else WScript.Echo "Error: Argument '"&strArgName&"' must be True or False, quitting" PrintUsage End Select GetTrueFalseArg = bArgVal
End Function 'GetTrueFalseArg
' Returns the name of a temporary file in the Temp directory. Function TempName() Dim Result Do Result = FSO.BuildPath(FSO.GetSpecialFolder(TEMP_FOLDER), FSO.GetTempName()) WScript.Sleep 200 'avoid potential busy loop Loop While FSO.FileExists(Result)
TempName = Result End Function 'TempName
' Runs a command with Cmd.exe and redirects its output to a temporary ' file. The function returns the name of the temporary file that holds ' the command's output. Function RunCommand(Command, OutputFilename, b64BitNecessary) ' 64BitNecessary true when you need to examine the 64-bit areas like system32 Dim CommandLine,WshShell,strPRogramFilesx86,strDOSCall,objFSO Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject") Set WshShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
strDOSCall = "%ComSpec% /C "
' if 64-bit OS *and* we must examine in 64-bit mode to avoid FS Redirection strProgramFilesx86=WshShell.ExpandEnvironmentStrings("%ProgramFiles%") If objFSO.FolderExists(strProgramFilesx86) And b64BitNecessary Then ' quick check for x64 strDOSCall = FixFileSystemRedirectionForPath(WshShell.ExpandEnvironmentStrings(strDOSCall)) End If
CommandLine = WshShell.ExpandEnvironmentStrings(strDOSCall & Command & " >> """ & OutputFileName & """") WshShell.Run CommandLine, 0, True End Function 'RunCommand
Function FixFileSystemRedirectionForPath(strFilePath) ' This function will fix a folder location so that ' a 32-bit program can be passed the windows\system32 directory ' as a parameter. ' Even if the sensor or action runs in 64-bit mode, a 32-bit ' program called in a 64-bit environment cannot access ' the system32 directory - it would be redirected to syswow64. ' you would not want to do this for 64-bit programs.
Dim objFSO, strSystem32Location,objShell Dim strProgramFilesx86,strNewSystem32Location,strRestOfPath Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject") Set objShell = CreateObject("Wscript.Shell")
strProgramFilesx86=objShell.ExpandEnvironmentStrings("%ProgramFiles%")
strFilePath = LCase(strFilePath) strSystem32Location = LCase(objFSO.GetSpecialFolder(1)) strProgramFilesx86=objShell.ExpandEnvironmentStrings("%ProgramFiles(x86)%")
If objFSO.FolderExists(strProgramFilesx86) Then ' quick check for x64 If InStr(strFilePath,strSystem32Location) = 1 Then strRestOfPath = Replace(strFilePath,strSystem32Location,"") strNewSystem32Location = Replace(strSystem32Location,"system32","sysnative") strFilePath = strNewSystem32Location&strRestOfPath End If End If FixFileSystemRedirectionForPath = strFilePath
'Cleanup Set objFSO = Nothing End Function 'FixFileSystemRedirectionForPath '------------ INCLUDES after this line. Do not edit past this point ----- '- Begin file: utils/SensorRandomization/SensorRandomizationFunctions.vbs '' -- Begin Random Sleep Functions -- ''
Dim bSensorRandomizeDebugOutput : bSensorRandomizeDebugOutput = False
Function SensorRandomizeLow() Dim intSensorRandomizeWaitLow : intSensorRandomizeWaitLow = 10 SensorRandomizeRandomSleep(intSensorRandomizeWaitLow) End Function ' SensorRandomizeLow
Function SensorRandomize() Dim intSensorRandomizeWaitMed : intSensorRandomizeWaitMed = 20 SensorRandomizeRandomSleep(intSensorRandomizeWaitMed) End Function ' SensorRandomize
Function SensorRandomizeHigh() Dim intSensorRandomizeWaitHigh : intSensorRandomizeWaitHigh = 30 SensorRandomizeRandomSleep(intSensorRandomizeWaitHigh) End Function ' SensorRandomize
Function SensorRandomizeRandomSleep(intSleepTime) ' sleeps for a random period of time, intSleepTime is in seconds ' if the sensor randomize flag is on ' RandomizeScalingFactor is a multiplier on the values hardcoded in the sensor ' not typically set but can adjust timings per endpoint, optionally Dim intSensorRandomizeWaitTime Dim objShell,intRandomizeFlag,strRandomizeRegPath,intRandomizeScalingPercentage strRandomizeRegPath = SensorRandomizeGetTaniumRegistryPath&"\Sensor Data\Random Sleep"
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell") On Error Resume Next intRandomizeFlag = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&strRandomizeRegPath&"\SensorRandomizeFlag") intRandomizeScalingPercentage = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&strRandomizeRegPath&"\SensorRandomizeScalingPercentage") On Error Goto 0 If intRandomizeFlag > 0 Then If intRandomizeScalingPercentage > 0 Then intSleepTime = intRandomizeScalingPercentage * .01 * intSleepTime SensorRandomizeEcho "Randomize scaling percentage of " _ & intRandomizeScalingPercentage & " applied, new sleep time is " & intSleepTime End If intSensorRandomizeWaitTime = CLng(intSleepTime) * 1000 ' convert to milliseconds ' wait random interval between 0 and the max Randomize(SensorRandomizeTaniumRandomSeed) ' assign random value to wait time max value intSensorRandomizeWaitTime = Int( ( intSensorRandomizeWaitTime + 1 ) * Rnd ) SensorRandomizeEcho "Sleeping for " & intSensorRandomizeWaitTime & " milliseconds" WScript.Sleep(intSensorRandomizeWaitTime) SensorRandomizeEcho "Done sleeping, continuing ..." Else SensorRandomizeEcho "SensorRandomize Not Enabled - No Op" End If End Function 'SensorRandomizeRandomSleep
Function SensorRandomizeTaniumRandomSeed ' for randomizing sensor code, the default seed is not random enough Dim timerNum timerNum = Timer() If timerNum < 1 Then SensorRandomizeTaniumRandomSeed = (SensorRandomizeGetTaniumComputerID / Timer() * 10 ) Else SensorRandomizeTaniumRandomSeed = SensorRandomizeGetTaniumComputerID / Timer End If End Function 'SensorRandomizeTaniumRandomSeed
Function SensorRandomizeGetTaniumRegistryPath 'SensorRandomizeGetTaniumRegistryPath works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath, strFoundTaniumRegistryPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 strFoundTaniumRegistryPath = keyNativePath
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 strFoundTaniumRegistryPath = keyWoWPath End If
If Not strPath = "" Then SensorRandomizeGetTaniumRegistryPath = strFoundTaniumRegistryPath Else SensorRandomizeGetTaniumRegistryPath = False WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot locate Tanium Registry Path" End If End Function 'SensorRandomizeGetTaniumRegistryPath
Function SensorRandomizeGetTaniumComputerID '' This function gets the Tanium Computer ID Dim objShell Dim intClientID,strID,strKeyPath,strValueName
strKeyPath = SensorRandomizeGetTaniumRegistryPath strValueName = "ComputerID" Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell") On Error Resume Next intClientID = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&strKeyPath&"\"&strValueName) If Err.Number <> 0 Then SensorRandomizeGetTaniumComputerID = 0 Else SensorRandomizeGetTaniumComputerID = SensorRandomizeReinterpretSignedAsUnsigned(intClientID) End If On Error Goto 0 End Function 'SensorRandomizeGetTaniumComputerID
Function SensorRandomizeReinterpretSignedAsUnsigned(ByVal x) If x < 0 Then x = x + 2^32 SensorRandomizeReinterpretSignedAsUnsigned = x End Function 'SensorRandomizeReinterpretSignedAsUnsigned
Sub SensorRandomizeEcho(str) If bSensorRandomizeDebugOutput = true Then WScript.Echo str End Sub 'SensorRandomizeEcho ' -- End Random Sleep Functions --' '- End file: utils/SensorRandomization/SensorRandomizationFunctions.vbs

sensor.name: Default Web Browser
sensor.description: Default web browser for new users. Note that this can be changed per user. Example: Internet Explorer

query.script:
'======================================== ' Default Web Browser '========================================
' This sensor will return the name and version of the default web browser ' This is a multi-column sensor that looks like: ' Browser|Version Option Explicit
' TAG: REDIRECTION
Dim strSep strSep = "|"
GetDefaultWebBrowser strSep
Function GetDefaultWebBrowser(strSep)
Dim objShell, objRE, objFSO Dim strComputer, strDefaultBrowserDetectionPath Dim strBrowserFolder, strDefaultBrowserExecutable, objMatch Dim strPrunedDefaultBrowserExecutable, strBrowserFileName Dim strDescription, strVersion, strCleanDefaultBrowserExecutable Dim arrBrowserCommand
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell") Set objRE = New RegExp
With objRE .Pattern = Chr(34)&"([^"&Chr(34)&"\r\n]*)"&Chr(34) ' matches anything between first set of quotes .Global = False End With ' The default browser executable is stored in this location in the registry ' Note that this location is the same in 32 and 64 bit registry providers strDefaultBrowserExecutable = objShell.RegRead("HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\http\shell\open\command\")
Set objMatch = objRE.Execute(strDefaultBrowserExecutable) If objMatch.Count = 1 Then strPrunedDefaultBrowserExecutable = objMatch.Item(0) End If ' Catch case where the browser is specified without quotes and with progra~1 ' notation ' The regex would have failed to produce a valid file. Check file exists ' and if not, assume it's the progra~1 notation without quotes 'strDefaultBrowserExecutable = "C:\PROGRA~1\MOZILL~1\FIREFOX.EXE -requestPending -osint -url " & Chr(34) & "%1" & Chr(34) If Not Left(strDefaultBrowserExecutable,1) = Chr(34) Then ' if it doesn't start with a quote ' WScript.Echo "Found an ugly Command: " & strCleanDefaultBrowserExecutable arrBrowserCommand = Split(strDefaultBrowserExecutable, " " ) strCleanDefaultBrowserExecutable = arrBrowserCommand(0) ' WScript.Echo strCleanDefaultBrowserExecutable & " after split" Else strCleanDefaultBrowserExecutable = objRE.Replace(strPrunedDefaultBrowserExecutable, "$1") End If
Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject")
' Pass the folder and file name into GetFileDetails to find description and version strBrowserFolder = objFSO.GetParentFolderName(strCleanDefaultBrowserExecutable) strBrowserFileName = objFSO.GetFileName(strCleanDefaultBrowserExecutable) ' WScript.Echo strBrowserFolder & " Is folder" ' WScript.Echo strBrowserFileName & " Is File Name" strDescription = GetFileDescription(strBrowserFolder, strBrowserFileName) strVersion = GetFileVersion(strBrowserFolder, strBrowserFileName)
WScript.Echo strDescription & strSep & strVersion
End Function 'GetDefaultWebBrowser
Function GetFileVersion(folderName,fileName) On Error Resume Next Dim objShell Dim objFolder Dim HeaderInfoArray(250), i
Set objShell = CreateObject("Shell.Application") Set objFolder = objShell.NameSpace(folderName)
If (not objFolder is nothing) Then For i = 0 to 250 HeaderInfoArray(i) = objFolder.GetDetailsOf(objFolder.Items, i) Next Dim objFolderItem
Set objFolderItem = objFolder.ParseName(fileName)
If (not objFolderItem Is Nothing) then Dim objInfo For i = 0 To 250 objInfo = objFolder.GetDetailsOf(objFolderItem, i) ' WScript.Echo HeaderInfoArray(i) & " " & objFolder.GetDetailsOf(objFolderItem, i) If LCase(HeaderInfoArray(i)) = "file version" Then GetFileVersion = objFolder.GetDetailsOf(objFolderItem, i) Exit Function End If Next End If
Set objFolderItem = Nothing End If
Set objFolder = Nothing Set objShell = Nothing On Error Goto 0 End Function 'GetFileVersion
Function GetFileDescription(folderName,fileName) On Error Resume Next Dim objShell Dim objFolder Dim HeaderInfoArray(250), i
Set objShell = CreateObject("Shell.Application") Set objFolder = objShell.NameSpace(folderName)
If (not objFolder is nothing) Then For i = 0 to 250 HeaderInfoArray(i) = objFolder.GetDetailsOf(objFolder.Items, i) Next Dim objFolderItem
Set objFolderItem = objFolder.ParseName(fileName)
If (not objFolderItem Is Nothing) then Dim objInfo For i = 0 To 250 objInfo = objFolder.GetDetailsOf(objFolderItem, i) ' WScript.Echo HeaderInfoArray(i) & " " & objFolder.GetDetailsOf(objFolderItem, i) If LCase(HeaderInfoArray(i)) = "description" Or LCase(HeaderInfoArray(i)) = "file description" Then GetFileDescription = objFolder.GetDetailsOf(objFolderItem, i) Exit Function End If Next End If
Set objFolderItem = Nothing End If
Set objFolder = Nothing Set objShell = Nothing On Error Goto 0 End Function 'GetFileDescription
Function Getx64RegistryProvider ' Returns the best available registry provider: 32 bit on 32 bit systems, 64 bit on 64 bit systems Dim objWMIService, colItems, objItem, iArchType, objCtx, objLocator, objServices, objRegProv Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\.\root\CIMV2") Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select SystemType from Win32_ComputerSystem") For Each objItem In colItems If InStr(LCase(objItem.SystemType), "x64") > 0 Then iArchType = 64 Else iArchType = 32 End If Next
