sensor.name: SQL Buffer Hit Ratio
sensor.description: Returns the buffer cache hit ratio from SQL Server on the client machine. Example: .5

query.script:
'======================================== ' SQL Buffer Hit Ratio '======================================== '@INCLUDE=sql/mssql_connection_utils.vbs
Option Explicit
Dim dictInstances, strInstance, objConnection
Set dictInstances = GetMSSQLInstances()
For Each strInstance In dictInstances.Keys
Dim objRecordSet, objRecordSet2, strNumerator, strDenominator, intNum, intDen, result Set objConnection = CreateObject("ADODB.Connection") Set objRecordSet = CreateObject("ADODB.Recordset") Set objRecordSet2 = CreateObject("ADODB.Recordset")
On Error Resume Next objConnection.Open GenMSSQLConnectionStr(strInstance, "master")
If objConnection.Errors.Count > 0 Then WScript.Echo "Access Error (" & strInstance & ")" Exit For End If
objRecordSet.Open "select cntr_value from master..sysperfinfo where (counter_name='Buffer cache hit ratio')", objConnection, AD_OPEN_STATIC, AD_LOCK_OPTIMISTIC objRecordSet2.Open "select cntr_value from master..sysperfinfo where (counter_name='Buffer cache hit ratio base')", objConnection, AD_OPEN_STATIC, AD_LOCK_OPTIMISTIC strNumerator = objRecordSet("cntr_value") strDenominator = objRecordSet2("cntr_value")
If objConnection.Errors.Count > 0 Then WScript.Echo "SQL Error (" & strInstance & ")" Exit For End If
On Error Goto 0
intNum = CInt(strNumerator) intDen = CInt(StrDenominator) result = intNum/IntDen if result > 1 then result = 1 End If WScript.echo result & GetMSSQLSensorInstanceStr(strInstance) Next
'------------ INCLUDES after this line. Do not edit past this point ----- '- Begin file: sql/mssql_connection_utils.vbs
' Common constants for MSSQL lookups Const AD_OPEN_STATIC = 3 Const AD_LOCK_OPTIMISTIC = 3
Function GetMSSQLInstances() Dim dictResult, objWMIService, colServices, objService Dim strCaption, strInstance, intStartIndex, intStopIndex Set dictResult = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary")
Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:" & "{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\.\root\cimv2") Set colServices = objWMIService.ExecQuery ("select * from win32_Service") For Each objService In colServices strCaption = objService.Caption
If (InStr(strCaption,"SQL Server") <> 0 And ObjService.State = "Running") Then ' OK -- found SQL Server on this machien, now we need to find the instance name ' if this is the correct service strInstance = "." intStartIndex = InStr(strCaption, "(") intStopIndex = InStr(strCaption, ")")
If(intStartIndex <> 0) And (intStopIndex <> 0) Then strInstance = Mid(strCaption, intStartIndex + 1, intStopIndex - intStartIndex - 1)
If strInstance = "MSSQLSERVER" Then strInstance = "." End If
If Not dictResult.Exists(strInstance) Then dictResult.Add strInstance, True End if End If End If Next
Set GetMSSQLInstances = dictResult
End Function ' GetMSSQLInstances
Function GenMSSQLConnectionStr(strInstance, strCatalog) Dim strDataSource, strConnection
If strInstance = "." Then strDataSource = strInstance Else strDataSource = ".\" & strInstance End If
strConnection = "Provider=SQLOLEDB;Data Source=" & strDataSource & ";Trusted_Connection=Yes;Initial Catalog=" & strCatalog & ";"
GenMSSQLConnectionStr = strConnection End Function ' OpenMSSQLConnection
Function GetMSSQLSensorInstanceStr(strInstance) If strInstance = "." Then GetMSSQLSensorInstanceStr = "" Else GetMSSQLSensorInstanceStr = " (" & strInstance & ")" End If End Function ' GetMSSQLSensorInstanceStr '- End file: sql/mssql_connection_utils.vbs

sensor.name: IP Route Details
sensor.description: Returns IPv4 network routes, filtered to exclude noise. With Flags, Metric, Interface columns. Example: 172.16.0.0|192.168.1.1|255.255.0.0|UG|100|eth0

query.script:
strComputer = "." Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:" _ & "{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\" & strComputer & "\root\cimv2")
Set collip = objWMIService.ExecQuery("select * from win32_networkadapterconfiguration where IPEnabled='True'") dim ipaddrs() ipcount = 0 for each ipItem in collip for each ipaddr in ipItem.IPAddress ipcount = ipcount + 1 next next redim ipaddrs(ipcount) ipcount = 0 for each ipItem in collip for each ipaddr in ipItem.IPAddress ipcount = ipcount + 1 ipaddrs(ipcount) = ipaddr next next localhost = "127.0.0.1"
Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select * from Win32_IP4RouteTable")
For Each objItem in colItems dest = objItem.Destination gw = objItem.NextHop mask = objItem.Mask metric = objItem.Metric1 flags = objItem.Type intf = objItem.InterfaceIndex For i = 0 to ipcount if gw = ipaddrs(i) and gw <> localhost then gw = "0.0.0.0" end if Next if gw <> localhost and dest <> "224.0.0.0" and right(dest,3) <> "255" then Wscript.Echo dest & "|" & gw & "|" & mask & "|" & "-" & "|" & metric & "|" & "-" end if Next
route -n | grep -v Kernel | grep -v Destination | awk '{ print $1 "|" $2 "|" $3 "|" $4 "|" $5 "|" $8 }' | grep -v "|127.0.0.1|"
netstat -rn | grep -v ":" | grep -v Destination | grep -v Routing | grep -v -e "^$" | awk '{ print $1 "|" $2 "||" $3 "||" $6 }' | grep -v "|127.0.0.1|"

sensor.name: AD Domain
sensor.description: The Active Directory domain name (if any) that the computer is joined to. Example: intra.company.com

query.script: select Domain from win32_ComputerSystem

sensor.name: IP Routes
sensor.description: Returns IPv4 network routes, filtered to exclude noise. Example: 172.16.0.0|192.168.1.1|255.255.0.0

query.script:
strComputer = "." Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:" _ & "{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\" & strComputer & "\root\cimv2")
'Build list of local IP addresses 'For identifying locally connected networks '(which show local IP address as gateway) Set collip = objWMIService.ExecQuery("select * from win32_networkadapterconfiguration where IPEnabled='True'") dim ipaddrs() ipcount = 0 for each ipItem in collip for each ipaddr in ipItem.IPAddress ipcount = ipcount + 1 next next redim ipaddrs(ipcount) ipcount = 0 for each ipItem in collip for each ipaddr in ipItem.IPAddress ipcount = ipcount + 1 ipaddrs(ipcount) = ipaddr next next localhost = "127.0.0.1"
Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select * from Win32_IP4RouteTable")
For Each objItem in colItems dest = objItem.Destination gw = objItem.NextHop mask = objItem.Mask For i = 0 to ipcount if gw = ipaddrs(i) and gw <> localhost then 'Show single gateway for local networks 'to allow proper clustering gw = "0.0.0.0" end if Next if gw <> localhost and dest <> "224.0.0.0" and right(dest,3) <> "255" then 'Exclude local, multicast and broadcast Wscript.Echo dest & "|" & gw & "|" & mask end if Next
route -n | grep -v Kernel | grep -v Destination | awk '{ print $1 "|" $2 "|" $3 }' | grep -v "|127.0.0.1|"
netstat -rn | grep -v ":" | grep -v Destination | grep -v Routing | grep -v -e "^$" | awk '{ print $1 "|" $2 "|" "-" }' | grep -v "|127.0.0.1|"

sensor.name: Application Event Log IDs
sensor.description: Recent event codes from the application event logs in Windows. Example: 1001

query.script: select EventCode from Win32_NTLogEvent where LogFile = 'Application' and TimeWritten > '$$GETUTCDATE$$86000$$'

sensor.name: Disk Used Space
sensor.description: The amount of used disk space per partition. Example: C: 40 GB

query.script:
'======================================== ' Disk Used Space '========================================
strComputer = "." Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:" _ & "{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\" _ & strComputer & "\root\cimv2") Set colDisks = objWMIService.ExecQuery _ ("Select * from Win32_LogicalDisk") For Each objDisk in colDisks ' Wscript.Echo "DeviceID: " & objDisk.DeviceID
If Not IsNull(objDisk.Size) And Not IsNull(objDisk.FreeSpace) Then dblSize = CDbl(objDisk.Size) - CDbl(objDisk.FreeSpace) dblSize = dblSize / 1024 / 1024 / 1024 intSize = CInt(dblSize) WScript.Echo objDisk.DeviceID & " " & intSize & " GB" End If Next
#!/bin/bash df -TPh |grep -vE "Use%|tmpfs" |while read line do set -- $line echo $7: $4 done
#!/bin/bash df -Hl | grep -vE '^Filesystem|tmpfs|cdrom' | awk '/^\// { print $9": " $3 }'

sensor.name: Share Folder Permissions
sensor.description: A list of all shared folders and the permissions currently enabled for those folders. Example: Downloads, BUILTIN\Administrators-FULL | \CREATOR OWNER-FULL | NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM-FULL

query.script:
'======================================== ' Share Folder Permissions '========================================
'Script will return permissions on each enabled share
strComputer = "." Set objWMI = GetObject("winmgmts:\\" & strComputer & "\root\cimv2") Set colItems = objWMI.ExecQuery("Select * from win32_share")
For Each i In colItems strDir = i.path strName = i.name result = Trim (Replace(CollectAceInfo(strDir),"|","", 1 , 1)) wscript.echo strName & "," & result Next
Function CollectAceInfo(strDir) Dim ArrayStrAce() i=0 strDir = Replace(strDir,"\","\\") Set colItems = objWMI.ExecQuery("Select * from win32_logicalFileSecuritySetting WHERE Path='" & strDir & "'",,48) for each objItem in colItems If objItem.GetSecurityDescriptor(wmiSecurityDescriptor) Then CollectAceInfo = "GetSecurityDescriptor failed" DisplayFileSecurity = False Exit Function End if
For each wmiAce in wmiSecurityDescriptor.DACL strACE = wmiAce.Trustee.Domain & "\" & wmiAce.Trustee.Name strAceMask = wmiAce.AccessMask
strMask = GetMaskValue(strAceMask) If strMask <> "1" then i = i + 1 ReDim Preserve ArrayStrAce(i) ArrayStrAce(i) = strAce & "-" & strMask CollectAceInfo = Join(ArrayStrAce," | ") end if next next End Function
Function GetMaskValue(StrAceMask) 'Dim MaskArray() Select Case StrAceMask Case "1179817" GetMaskValue = "READ" Case "1245631" GetMaskValue = "CHANGE" Case "2032127" GetMaskValue = "FULL" Case Else GetMaskValue = "1" End Select
'i=0 'If StrAceMask AND 16 Then ' i=i + 1 ' ReDim Preserve MaskArray(i) ' MaskArray(i) = "Write extended attributes" 'End If 'if StrAceMask AND 1048576 Then ' i=i + 1 ' ReDim Preserve MaskArray(i) ' MaskArray(i) = "Synchronize" 'End If 'If StrAceMask AND 524288 Then ' i=i + 1 ' ReDim Preserve MaskArray(i) ' MaskArray(i) = "Write owner" 'End If 'If StrAceMask AND 262144 Then ' i=i + 1 ' ReDim Preserve MaskArray(i) ' MaskArray(i) = "Write ACL" 'End If 'If StrAceMask AND 131072 Then ' i=i + 1 ' ReDim Preserve MaskArray(i) ' MaskArray(i) = "Read security" 'End If 'If StrAceMask AND 65536 Then ' i=i + 1 ' ReDim Preserve MaskArray(i) ' MaskArray(i) = "Delete" 'End If 'If StrAceMask AND 256 Then ' i=i + 1 ' ReDim Preserve MaskArray(i) ' MaskArray(i) = "Write attributes" 'End If 'If StrAceMask AND 128 Then ' i=i + 1 ' ReDim Preserve MaskArray(i) ' MaskArray(i) = "Read attributes" 'End If 'If StrAceMask AND 64 Then ' i=i + 1 ' ReDim Preserve MaskArray(i) ' MaskArray(i) = "Delete dir" 'End If 'If StrAceMask AND 32 Then ' i=i + 1 ' ReDim Preserve MaskArray(i) ' MaskArray(i) = "Execute" 'End If 'If StrAceMask AND 16 Then ' i=i + 1 ' ReDim Preserve MaskArray(i) ' MaskArray(i) = "Write extended attributes" 'End If 'If StrAceMask AND 8 Then ' i=i + 1 ' ReDim Preserve MaskArray(i) ' MaskArray(i) = "Read extended attributes" 'End If 'If StrAceMask AND 4 Then ' i=i + 1 ' ReDim Preserve MaskArray(i) ' MaskArray(i) = "Append" 'End If 'If StrAceMask AND 2 Then ' i=i + 1 ' ReDim Preserve MaskArray(i) ' MaskArray(i) = "Write" 'End If 'If StrAceMask AND 1 Then ' i=i + 1 ' ReDim Preserve MaskArray(i) ' MaskArray(i) = "Read" 'End If 'GetMaskValue = Join(MaskArray," : ") End Function

sensor.name: Operating System Language
sensor.description: Returns the OS language along with any Language Packs installed. Example: English-United States en-US

query.script:
'======================================== ' Operating System Language '========================================
' This sensor will output the language of the installed OS along with ' any language packs installed. ' it is a multi-column sensor that looks like: ' OS Language | Language Packs Installed
Option Explicit
Dim strSep strSep = "|"
WScript.Echo GetOSLanguage(strSep)
'-----------End Main-------------' Function GetOSLanguage(strSep) ' Retrieves the OS language and whether there are any MUI packs installed. ' Will only retrieve MUI packs on Vista+
Const HKLM = &H80000002
Dim strComputer Dim strWMILanguageCode, arrLangKeys, strLangKey Dim strLanguagesRegPath1, strLanguagesRegPath2 Dim strLanguagePacksInstalled Dim objRegistry, objWMIService, objOperatingSystem Dim colOperatingSystems
strComputer = "."
Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:" _ & "{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\" & strComputer & "\root\cimv2") Set colOperatingSystems = objWMIService.ExecQuery _ ("Select * from Win32_OperatingSystem") For Each objOperatingSystem in colOperatingSystems strWMILanguageCode = objOperatingSystem.OSLanguage Next
Set objRegistry = _ GetObject("winmgmts:{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\" _ & strComputer & "\root\default:StdRegProv")
strLanguagePacksInstalled = "" strLanguagesRegPath1 = "SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\MUI\UILanguages" strLanguagesRegPath2 = "SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Nls\MUILanguages"
' This works on newer OS's objRegistry.EnumKey HKLM, strLanguagesRegPath1, arrLangKeys If Not IsNull(arrLangKeys) Then For Each strLangKey In arrLangKeys If strLanguagePacksInstalled = "" Then strLanguagePacksInstalled = strLangKey Else strLanguagePacksInstalled = strLanguagePacksInstalled & "," & strLangKey End If Next End If
If strLanguagePacksInstalled = "" Then strLanguagePacksInstalled = "XP or Earlier OS"
GetOSLanguage = LocaleCodeToLanguage(strWMILanguageCode) & strSep & strLanguagePacksInstalled
' need to : cleanup ' map language codes to readable english 'Cleanup
Set objRegistry = Nothing End Function 'GetOSLanguage
Function LocaleCodeToLanguage(strCode) ' This function takes an numeric locale code and returns ' a readable language mapping
Dim arrLangCodes, i
arrLangCodes = array("1078","Afrikaans","1052","Albanian","14337","Arabic - United Arab Emirates","15361","Arabic - Bahrain","5121","Arabic - Algeria","3073",_ "Arabic - Egypt","2049","Arabic - Iraq","11265","Arabic - China","3076","Chinese - Hong Kong S.A.R.","5124","Chinese - Macau S.A.R","4100","Chinese - Singapore","1028","Chinese - Taiwan","1050","Croatian","1029",_ "Czech","1030","Danish","1043","Dutch - The Netherlands","2067","Dutch - Belgium","3081","English - Australia","10249","English - Belize","4105","English - Canada","9225",_ "English - Carribbean","6153","English - Ireland","8201","English - Jamaica","5129","English - New Zealand","13321","English - Phillippines","7177",_ "English - South Africa","11273","English - Trinidad","2057","English - United Kingdom","1033","English - United States","1061","Estonian","1065","Farsi","1035",_ "Finnish","1080","Faroese","1036","French - France","2060","French - Belgium","3084","French - Canada","5132","French - Luxembourg","4108","French - Switzerland","2108",_ "Gaelic - Ireland","1084","Gaelic - Scotland","1031","German - Germany","3079","German - Austria","5127","German - Liechtenstein","4103","German - Luxembourg","2055",_ "German - Switzerland","1032","Greek","1037","Hebrew","1081","Hindi","1038","Hungarian","1039","Icelandic","1057","Indonesian","1040","Italian - Italy","2064",_ "Italian - Switzerland","1041","Japanese","1042","Korean","1062","Latvian","1063","Lithuanian","1071","FYRO Macedonian","1086","Malay - Malaysia","2110",_ "Malay - Brunei","1082","Maltese","1102","Marathi","1044","Norwegian - Bokm-l","2068","Norwegian - Nynorsk","1045","Polish","2070","Portuguese - Portugal","1046",_ "Portuguese - Brazil","1047","Raeto-Romance","1048","Romanian - Romania","2072","Romanian - Moldova","1049","Russian","2073","Russian - Moldova","1103","Sanskrit","3098",_ "Serbian - Cyrillic","2074","Serbian - Latin","1074","Setsuana","1060","Slovenian","1051","Slovak","1070","Sorbian","1034","Spanish - Spain","11274",_ "Spanish - Argentina","16394","Spanish - Bolivia","13322","Spanish - Chile","9226","Spanish - Colombia","5130","Spanish - Costa Rica","7178",_ "Spanish - Dominican Republic","12298","Spanish - Ecuador","4106","Spanish - Guatemala","18442","Spanish - Honduras","2058","Spanish - Mexico","19466",_ "Spanish - Nicaragua","6154","Spanish - Panama","10250","Spanish - Peru","20490","Spanish - Puerto Rico","15370","Spanish - Paraguay","17418","Spanish - El Salvador","14346",_ "Spanish - Uruguay","8202","Spanish - Venezuela","1072","Sutu","1089","Swahili","1053","Swedish - Sweden","2077","Swedish - Finland","1097","Tamil","1092","Tatar","1054",_ "Thai","1055","Turkish","1073","Tsonga","1058","Ukrainian","1056","Urdu","2115","Uzbek - Cyrillic","1091","Uzbek - Latin","1066","Vietnamese","1076","Xhosa","1085","Yiddish","1077","Zulu")
For i = 0 To UBound(arrLangCodes) If CStr(arrLangCodes(i)) = CStr(strCode) Then 'Return the value immediately after the found code LocaleCodeToLanguage = arrLangCodes(i+1) End If Next End Function 'LocaleCodeToLanguage

sensor.name: Number of Fixed Drives
sensor.description: Returns the number of fixed drives installed in the system. Example:4

query.script:
'======================================== ' Number of Fixed Drives '========================================
' This sensor will output the number of fixed disk drives
Option Explicit
WScript.Echo GetNumberOfFixedDrives
Function GetNumberOfFixedDrives
Dim objWMIService, colDiskDrives Dim strComputer, objDiskDrive, intDriveCount
strComputer = "." Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:" _ & "{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\" & strComputer & "\root\cimv2")
'SlotDesignation is like "PCI-I" and CurrentUsage=4 means occupied Set colDiskDrives = objWMIService.ExecQuery _ ("Select MediaType from Win32_DiskDrive") If Not IsNull(colDiskDrives) Then intDriveCount = 0 For Each objDiskDrive In colDiskDrives If InStr(LCase(objDiskDrive.MediaType), "fixed" ) > 0 Then intDriveCount = intDriveCount + 1 End If Next GetNumberOfFixedDrives = intDriveCount Else GetNumberOfFixedDrives = "WMI Error" End If
'Cleanup Set colDiskDrives = Nothing Set objWMIService = Nothing End Function 'GetNumberOfFixedDrives

sensor.name: CPU by Process
sensor.description: A multi-column sensor that lists every running process and the amount of CPU usage they are taking up. Example: svchost | 15

query.script:
'======================================== ' CPU by Process '========================================
' a multi-column sensor whose output looks like: ' Process Name | Percentage
Option Explicit
Dim objWMIService,colItems Dim objItem,strSep,strName,intPoundPos
Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\.\root\cimv2") Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select * from Win32_PerfFormattedData_PerfProc_Process",,48)
strSep = "|"
For Each objItem in colItems
strName = LCase(objItem.Name) intPoundPos = InStr(strName,"#") If intPoundPos > 0 Then ' if it's a duplicate process, the name may put a #x after it ' as in ' chome#9 ' Remove everything after a # strName = Left(strName,intPoundPos - 1) End If ' ignore _Total Entry or Idle Entry If Not (strName = "_total" Or strName = "idle" Or strName = "taniumclient") Then WScript.Echo strName & strSep & objItem.PercentProcessorTime End If Next
'Cleanup Set objWMIService = Nothing Set colItems = Nothing

sensor.name: Open Port
sensor.description: Returns the ports which are listening on a local machine and the IP address the port is bound to. 0.0.0.0 indicates that the port is bound to all IP addresses. Example: 0.0.0.0:80

query.script:
'======================================== ' Open Port '========================================
port = "*"
If port = "*" Then strcommand = "cmd /c netstat -an | find " & chr(34) & "LISTENING" & Chr(34) Else strcommand = "cmd /c netstat -an | find " & chr(34) & "LISTENING" & Chr(34) & _ "| find " & chr(34) & ":" & port & " " & Chr(34) End If
Dim bHasOutput : bHasOutput = False
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell") Set objScriptExec = objShell.Exec (strCommand) strPingResults = LCase(objScriptExec.StdOut.ReadAll)
results = Split(strPingResults, vbCrLf) for Each line in results 'WScript.Echo "parsing line: " & line
line = cleanWhitespace(Trim(line))
lineResults = Split(line) i = 0 For Each word In lineResults ' WScript.Echo " word "&i& ": " & word If i = 1 Then WScript.Echo word bHasOutput = True End If i = i + 1 Next next
If Not bHasOutput Then If GetLocale() <> 1033 Then WScript.Echo "English Language OS Required" End If End If
'if len (strPingResults) > 0 then ' WScript.Echo strPingResults 'WScript.Echo "results: " & strPingResults 'End If
Function cleanWhitespace(strStarter) intStarter = Len(strStarter) For i = intStarter to 2 Step -1 strChars = Space(i) strStarter = Replace(strStarter, strChars, " ") Next cleanWhitespace = strStarter End Function
#!/bin/bash netstat -tulpn | grep "LISTEN" | grep "0.0.0.0" | grep "tcp" |while read line do set -- $line echo $4 done
#!/bin/bash netstat -a | grep tcp4 | grep LISTEN |while read line do set -- $line echo $4 done

sensor.name: File Size
sensor.parameter_definition: {"parameters":[{"restrict":null,"validationExpressions":[{"helpString":"Value can not be blank","flags":"","expression":"^\\S","parameterType":"com.tanium.models::ValidationExpression","model":"com.tanium.models::ValidationExpression"}],"helpString":"Enter the full drive letter, folder path and file name of the file.","promptText":"e.g. c:\\windows\\test.txt","defaultValue":"","value":"","label":"File name to search for","maxChars":0,"key":"filename","parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::TextInputParameter","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::TextInputParameter"}],"parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray"}
sensor.description: Returns the size of the file specified by the parameter. Example: 69120

query.script:
'======================================== ' File Size '========================================
Dim filesys, filename, file, createdate
filename = unescape("||filename||")
filename = FixFileSystemRedirectionForPath(filename)
Set filesys = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject")
If filesys.FileExists(filename) Then Set file = filesys.GetFile(filename) WScript.Echo file.Size Else WScript.Echo "File " & filename & " not found." End If
Function FixFileSystemRedirectionForPath(strFilePath) ' This function will fix a folder location so that ' a 32-bit program can be passed the windows\system32 directory ' as a parameter. ' Even if the sensor or action runs in 64-bit mode, a 32-bit ' program called in a 64-bit environment cannot access ' the system32 directory - it would be redirected to syswow64. ' you would not want to do this for 64-bit programs.
Dim objFSO, strSystem32Location,objShell Dim strProgramFilesx86,strNewSystem32Location,strRestOfPath Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject") Set objShell = CreateObject("Wscript.Shell")
strProgramFilesx86=objShell.ExpandEnvironmentStrings("%ProgramFiles%")
strFilePath = LCase(strFilePath) strSystem32Location = LCase(objFSO.GetSpecialFolder(1)) strProgramFilesx86=objShell.ExpandEnvironmentStrings("%ProgramFiles(x86)%")
If objFSO.FolderExists(strProgramFilesx86) Then ' quick check for x64 If InStr(strFilePath,strSystem32Location) = 1 Then strRestOfPath = Replace(strFilePath,strSystem32Location,"") strNewSystem32Location = Replace(strSystem32Location,"system32","sysnative") strFilePath = strNewSystem32Location&strRestOfPath End If End If FixFileSystemRedirectionForPath = strFilePath
'Cleanup Set objFSO = Nothing End Function 'FixFileSystemRedirectionForPath
Function UnFixFileSystemRedirectionForPath(strFilePath) ' This function will undo the changes made to a path by the ' FixFileSystemRedirectionForPath function ' if a path is passed in with the sysnative string in it ' it will simply change it to system32, regardless of whether ' the OS is 64-bit. A path will only be changed when it's ' necessary, so this has no effect when it's not changed.
Dim objFSO,strSystem32Location,strNewSystem32Location
Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject")
strFilePath = LCase(strFilePath) strSystem32Location = LCase(objFSO.GetSpecialFolder(1)) strNewSystem32Location = Replace(strSystem32Location,"system32","sysnative")
UnFixFileSystemRedirectionForPath = Replace(strFilePath,strNewSystem32Location,strSystem32Location)
'Cleanup Set objFSO = Nothing End Function 'UnFixFileSystemRedirectionForPath

sensor.name: Folder Size
sensor.parameter_definition: {"parameters":[{"restrict":null,"validationExpressions":[{"helpString":"Value can not be blank","flags":"","expression":"^\\S","parameterType":"com.tanium.models::ValidationExpression","model":"com.tanium.models::ValidationExpression"}],"helpString":"Enter the full drive letter and folder path of the folder","promptText":"e.g. c:\\Program Files\\MyApp","defaultValue":"","value":"","label":"Folder path to search for","maxChars":0,"key":"strFolder","parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::TextInputParameter","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::TextInputParameter"}],"parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray"}
sensor.description: Folder size (in GB, MB, KB, or B) Example: 62 GB

query.script:
'======================================== ' Folder Size '========================================
' TAG: REDIRECTION
Dim strFolder strFolder = unescape("||strFolder||")
strFolder = FixFileSystemRedirectionForPath(strFolder)
Dim intRound intRound = 0
Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject")
Dim objFolder
If fso.FolderExists(strFolder) Then intSize = GetFolderSize(strFolder)
intKB = 1024 intMB = 1024*1024 intGB = 1024*1024*1024
If intSize > intGB Then WScript.Echo Int(intSize / intGB) & " GB" ElseIf intSize > intMB Then WScript.Echo Int(intSize / intMB) & " MB" ElseIf intSize > intKB Then WScript.Echo Int(intSize / intKB) & " KB" Else WScript.Echo intSize & " B" End If Else WScript.Echo "Folder not found" End If
Function GetFolderSize(folderName) ' Some directories have files which are never accessible. ' This allows retrieving the values for those type of directories On Error Resume Next
Dim fso, folder, subfolder, size, hasSubfolders
Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject")
size = 0 hasSubfolders = False
Set folder = fso.GetFolder(folderName) ' Try the non-recursive way first (potentially faster?) Err.Clear size = folder.Size If Err.Number <> 0 then ' Did not work; do recursive way: For Each subfolder in folder.SubFolders size = size + getFolderSize(subfolder.Path) hasSubfolders = True Next
If not hasSubfolders then size = folder.Size End If End If
On Error Goto 0 GetFolderSize = size End Function
Function FixFileSystemRedirectionForPath(strFilePath) ' This function will fix a folder location so that ' a 32-bit program can be passed the windows\system32 directory ' as a parameter. ' Even if the sensor or action runs in 64-bit mode, a 32-bit ' program called in a 64-bit environment cannot access ' the system32 directory - it would be redirected to syswow64. ' you would not want to do this for 64-bit programs.
Dim objFSO, strSystem32Location,objShell Dim strProgramFilesx86,strNewSystem32Location,strRestOfPath Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject") Set objShell = CreateObject("Wscript.Shell")
strProgramFilesx86=objShell.ExpandEnvironmentStrings("%ProgramFiles%")
strFilePath = LCase(strFilePath) strSystem32Location = LCase(objFSO.GetSpecialFolder(1)) strProgramFilesx86=objShell.ExpandEnvironmentStrings("%ProgramFiles(x86)%")
If objFSO.FolderExists(strProgramFilesx86) Then ' quick check for x64 If InStr(strFilePath,strSystem32Location) = 1 Then strRestOfPath = Replace(strFilePath,strSystem32Location,"") strNewSystem32Location = Replace(strSystem32Location,"system32","sysnative") strFilePath = strNewSystem32Location&strRestOfPath End If End If FixFileSystemRedirectionForPath = strFilePath
'Cleanup Set objFSO = Nothing End Function 'FixFileSystemRedirectionForPath
Function UnFixFileSystemRedirectionForPath(strFilePath) ' This function will undo the changes made to a path by the ' FixFileSystemRedirectionForPath function ' if a path is passed in with the sysnative string in it ' it will simply change it to system32, regardless of whether ' the OS is 64-bit. A path will only be changed when it's ' necessary, so this has no effect when it's not changed.
Dim objFSO,strSystem32Location,strNewSystem32Location
Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject")
strFilePath = LCase(strFilePath) strSystem32Location = LCase(objFSO.GetSpecialFolder(1)) strNewSystem32Location = Replace(strSystem32Location,"system32","sysnative")
UnFixFileSystemRedirectionForPath = Replace(strFilePath,strNewSystem32Location,strSystem32Location)
'Cleanup Set objFSO = Nothing End Function 'UnFixFileSystemRedirectionForPath

sensor.name: Application Run Time
sensor.description: Shows applications that are currently running and how long they have been running for. Example: Dropbox - 3 days

query.script:
'======================================== ' Application Run Time '========================================
'On Error Resume Next strComputer = "." Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\" & strComputer & "\root\cimv2") Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select Name, ExecutablePath, CreationDate from Win32_Process",,48)
'Uses date math - set locale
SetLocale(1033)
Dim nameDictionary, processDictionary Set nameDictionary = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary") Set processDictionary = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary")
'ADD PROCESS NAME IN LOWER CASE nameDictionary.Add "hppusg.exe", "Some HP Application" nameDictionary.Add "taniumclient.exe", "TANIUM CLIENT"
'array used to print output (no dictionary since we need duplicates) Dim arrOutput() intSize = 0 ReDim Preserve arrOutput(intSize)
strComputer = "." Const HKLM = &h80000002 Set reg=GetObject("winmgmts:{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\" & strComputer & "\root\default:StdRegProv")
regPath = GetTaniumRegistryPath() & "\Sensor Data\Applications" If Not RegKeyExists(reg, HKLM, regPath) Then reg.createKey HKLM, regPath End If
For Each objItem in colItems If InStr(LCase(objItem.ExecutablePath), "windows\system32\") = 0 Then Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject") If fso.FileExists(objItem.ExecutablePath) Then Dim strOutput, fullName
Set execFile = fso.GetFile(objItem.ExecutablePath)
fullName = nameDictionary.Item(LCase(objItem.Name))
If IsEmpty(fullName) Then fullName = GetProcName(objItem.Name, reg, HKLM, regPath) End If
If fullName = "" Then fullName = objItem.Name End If
' If InStr(LCase(fullName), LCase(appName)) > 0 Then lastStart = GetLastStart(objItem.Name, reg, HKLM, regPath) If lastStart <> "" Then strOutput = fullName & " - " & GetDaysOld(lastStart) Else strOutput = fullName & " - Launch date unknown" End If
If not ArrayContains(arrOutput, strOutput) Then arrOutput(intSize) = strOutput intSize = intSize + 1 ReDim Preserve arrOutput(intSize) End If End If End If Next
For Each output In arrOutput If Not IsEmpty(output) Then WScript.Echo output End If Next
Function GetLastStart(strProc, objReg, hive, baseRegKey) words = Split(strProc, ".") regKey = baseRegKey & "\" & words(0) If RegKeyExists(objReg, hive, regKey) Then objReg.GetStringValue hive, regKey, "Last Start", GetLastStart End If End Function
Function GetProcName(strProc, objReg, hive, baseRegKey) words = Split(strProc, ".") regKey = baseRegKey & "\" & words(0) If RegKeyExists(objReg, hive, regKey) Then objReg.GetStringValue hive, regKey, "Description", GetProcName End If End Function
Function ArrayContains(arr, str) For Each obj In arr If obj = str Then ArrayContains = True Exit Function End If Next ArrayContains = False End Function
'date format is MM/DD/YYYY function GetDaysOld(strDate) patternDate = CDate( strDate ) today = CDate( Month(Now) & "/" & Day(Now) & "/" & Year(Now)) days = DateDiff("d", patternDate, today)
If days = 1 Then GetDaysOld = "1 day" Else GetDaysOld = days & " days" End If End Function
Function GetTaniumRegistryPath 'GetTaniumRegistryPath works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath, strFoundTaniumRegistryPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 strFoundTaniumRegistryPath = keyNativePath
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 strFoundTaniumRegistryPath = keyWoWPath End If
If Not strPath = "" Then GetTaniumRegistryPath = strFoundTaniumRegistryPath Else GetTaniumRegistryPath = False WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot locate Tanium Registry Path" End If End Function 'GetTaniumRegistryPath
Function RegKeyExists(objRegistry, sHive, sRegKey) Dim aValueNames, aValueTypes If objRegistry.EnumValues(sHive, sRegKey, aValueNames, aValueTypes) = 0 Then RegKeyExists = True Else RegKeyExists = False End If End Function

sensor.name: Installed RPMs
sensor.description: Returns a list of installed RPMs by name on Linux systems. Example: glibc-2.5-12

query.script: WScript.Echo "Not a Windows Sensor"
#!/bin/sh rpm -qa

sensor.name: McAfee Endpoint Encryption Activated
sensor.description: Returns whether McAfee Endpoint Encryption is Activated Example: Yes

query.script:
'======================================== ' McAfee Endpoint Encryption Activated '========================================
' This sensor will return whether McAfee Endpoint Encryption is Activated ' This is a Yes or No Value
Option Explicit
Dim objRegistry,keyPath,key64Path,strSep strSep = "|" ' column delimiter
Set objRegistry = Getx64RegistryProvider()
Const HKLM = &H80000002
keyPath = "SOFTWARE\McAfee Endpoint Encryption\MfeEpePC\Status" key64Path = "SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\McAfee Endpoint Encryption\MfeEpePC\Status"
If Not RegKeyExists(HKLM, keyPath) Then keyPath = key64Path
If Not RegKeyExists(HKLM, keyPath) Then WScript.Echo "Not installed" WScript.Quit End If End If
If RegKeyExists(HKLM, keyPath) Then Dim strReturn strReturn = ReturnStringValueOrEchoError _ (objRegistry,HKLM,keyPath,"Activated","McAfee Endpoint Encryption Activation Status Not Found") If VarType(strReturn) = 8 Then 'string value 8 indicates success, integer is error WScript.Echo strReturn Else WScript.Quit End If Else WScript.Echo "McAfee Endpoint Encryption Not Found" WScript.Quit End If
Function RegKeyExists(sHive, sRegKey) Dim aValueNames, aValueTypes If objRegistry.EnumValues(sHive, sRegKey, aValueNames, aValueTypes) = 0 Then RegKeyExists = True Else RegKeyExists = False End If End Function
Function ReturnStringValueOrEchoError(objRegistry,HIVE,strKeyName,strValueName,strErrorMessage) ' Return a value or fatal error message and error result Dim intReturn,strValueData intReturn = objRegistry.GetStringValue(HIVE, strKeyname, strValueName, strValueData) If intReturn = 0 Then ReturnStringValueOrEchoError = strValueData Else ReturnStringValueOrEchoError = -1 WScript.Echo strErrorMessage End If End Function
Function Getx64RegistryProvider ' Returns the best available registry provider: 32 bit on 32 bit systems, 64 bit on 64 bit systems Dim objWMIService, colItems, objItem, iArchType, objCtx, objLocator, objServices, objRegProv Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\.\root\CIMV2") Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select SystemType from Win32_ComputerSystem") For Each objItem In colItems If InStr(LCase(objItem.SystemType), "x64") > 0 Then iArchType = 64 Else iArchType = 32 End If Next
Set objCtx = CreateObject("WbemScripting.SWbemNamedValueSet") objCtx.Add "__ProviderArchitecture", iArchType Set objLocator = CreateObject("Wbemscripting.SWbemLocator") Set objServices = objLocator.ConnectServer("","root\default","","",,,,objCtx) Set objRegProv = objServices.Get("StdRegProv")
Set Getx64RegistryProvider = objRegProv End Function ' Getx64RegistryProvider

sensor.name: Target
sensor.description: Simple sensor that returns the word "Target" that is used when targeting actions within Tanium. Example: Target

sensor.name: Cached AD Logins
sensor.description: Returns information on AD accounts which are logged in using cached credentials. Example:john.doe Cached - RDP

query.script:
'======================================== ' Cached AD Logins '======================================== ' This sensor will enumerate the Usernames of all accounts which are ' cached
Option Explicit
Dim strSep : strSep = "|" ' This is a multi-column sensor whose output looks like ' Username|Type ' Where account type is Cached - Interactive or Cached - RDP
ListCachedAccounts
Function ListCachedAccounts
Dim objWMI, colSessions, colProcesses, objProcess Dim objSession, colList, objItem, colOwner, strProcessOwner Dim strAccountType, dictProcessOwners, strOwnerUser, strOwnerDomain Dim bDisplay, objReg
Set objWMI = GetObject("winmgmts:" _ & "{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\.\root\cimv2") Set objReg = GetObject("winmgmts:\\.\root\default:StdRegProv")
' Get owner information for running processes to filter out stale user results ' because Win32_LogonSession can have days old logins in there.
' store in dictionary object Set dictProcessOwners = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary")
Set colProcesses = objWMI.ExecQuery("Select * from Win32_Process",,48) On Error Resume Next ' some processes may not have owner and domain properties For Each objProcess in colProcesses colOwner = objProcess.GetOwner(strOwnerUser,strOwnerDomain)
If Not dictProcessOwners.Exists(strOwnerDomain&"\"&strOwnerUser) Then dictProcessOwners.Add strOwnerDomain&"\"&strOwnerUser,1 ' for uniqueness End If Next On Error Goto 0 'back to normal
Set colSessions = objWMI.ExecQuery("Select * from Win32_LogonSession")
If colSessions.Count = 0 Then ' Do Nothing Else For Each objSession in colSessions Set colList = objWMI.ExecQuery("Associators of " _ & "{Win32_LogonSession.LogonId='" & objSession.LogonId & "'} " _ & "Where AssocClass=Win32_LoggedOnUser Role=Dependent" ) For Each objItem in colList Select Case objSession.LogonType Case 11 strAccountType = ":Cached: :Interactive:" bDisplay = True Case 12 strAccountType = ":Cached: :RDP:" bDisplay = True Case Else ' There are more cases that we shouldn't really see strAccountType = objSession.LogonType End Select
For Each strProcessOwner In dictProcessOwners.Keys If bDisplay And InStr(LCase(objItem.Caption),LCase(Split(strProcessOwner,"\")(0))) > 0 And InStr(LCase(objItem.Caption),LCase(Split(strProcessOwner,"\")(1))) > 0 Then WScript.Echo GetUserForSIDLocal(objReg,objItem.SID) & strSep & strAccountType Exit For End If bDisplay = False Next
Next Next End If
End Function 'ListCachedAccounts
Function GetUserForSIDLocal(objReg,strSID) ' This function converts a SID to a user name ' by doing a registry lookup, avoiding an LDAP query ' this will fail in the case where the user's name was changed in AD ' as they will still have their old home directory name
Const HKLM = &h80000002
Dim strHiveListKey,strUserData,intDatPos,intFinalBackslashPos
strHiveListKey = "SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\hivelist" objReg.GetStringValue HKLM,strHiveListKey,"\Registry\User\"&strSID,strUserData If Not IsNull(strUserData) Then ' strUserData would look like ' \Device\HarddiskVolume2\Users\user.name\NTUSER.DAT intDatPos = InStr(UCase(strUserData),"\NTUSER.DAT") ' strip off the dat file strUserData = Left(strUserData,intDatPos - 1) ' find last backslash intFinalBackslashPos = InStrRev(strUserData,"\") ' get right from that pos strUserData = Right(strUserData,Len(strUserData) - intFinalBackslashPos) GetUserForSIDLocal = strUserData Else GetUserForSIDLocal = False End If End Function 'GetUserForSIDLocal

sensor.name: Windows OS Type
sensor.description: Will output "Windows Server" or "Windows Workstation" depending on the OS type. Example: Windows Server

query.script:
'======================================== ' Windows OS Type '========================================
Option Explicit
Select Case (LCase(GetProductType)) ' Workstations will always output WinNT Case "winnt" WScript.Echo "Windows Workstation" Case "servernt" WScript.Echo "Windows Server" Case "lanmannt" WScript.Echo "Windows Server" Case Else WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot determine OS type" End Select
Function GetProductType
Dim objShell Dim keyPath, strPath, strFoundPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyPath = "SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\ProductOptions"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&keyPath&"\ProductType") On Error Goto 0 strFoundPath = strPath
If Not strPath = "" Then GetProductType = strFoundPath Else GetProductType = False WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot determine OS type" WScript.Quit End If End Function 'GetProductType
#!/bin/bash echo Non-Windows
#!/bin/bash echo Non-Windows

sensor.name: System Slots In Use
sensor.description: Returns the number of used slots in the system on Windows client machines. Example: 1

query.script:
'======================================== ' System Slots in Use '========================================
' This sensor will return the number of slots in use
Option Explicit
WScript.Echo GetSystemSlotsInUse
Function GetSystemSlotsInUse
Dim objWMIService, colSystemSlots Dim strComputer, objSystemSlots
strComputer = "." Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:" _ & "{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\" & strComputer & "\root\cimv2")
'SlotDesignation is like "PCI-I" and CurrentUsage=4 means occupied Set colSystemSlots = objWMIService.ExecQuery _ ("Select SlotDesignation from Win32_SystemSlot where CurrentUsage=4") If Not IsNull(colSystemSlots) Then GetSystemSlotsInUse = colSystemSlots.Count Else GetSystemSlotsInUse = "WMI Error" End If
'Cleanup Set colSystemSlots = Nothing Set objWMIService = Nothing End Function 'GetSystemSlotsInUse

sensor.name: RAM Max Capacity
sensor.description: Returns the size of the maximum amount of RAM a machine can carry. Example: 8 GB

query.script:
'======================================== ' RAM Max Capacity '========================================
' This sensor will pull the maximum amount of RAM a machine can carry via WMI
Option Explicit Dim objWMIService, colItems, objItem Dim strWMIQuery, strItem, strComputer, cap
If Left(GetOSMajorVersion(), 1) = "5" Then ' This function does not work on Windows XP or 2003, return Not Available WScript.Echo "Not Available" WScript.Quit End If
Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:" _ & "{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\.\root\cimv2")
' 3 is system memory (not video or flash mem) strWMIQuery = "Select MaxCapacity from Win32_PhysicalMemoryArray where Use='3'"
Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery(strWMIQuery) cap = 0 For Each objItem In colItems cap = CDbl(objItem.MaxCapacity) If cap > 0 Then WScript.Echo PrettyFileSize(cap * 1024) Else WScript.Echo "Error / Unknown" End If Next
Function PrettyFileSize(strBytes)
Dim size,intKB,intMB,intGB
If IsNumeric(strBytes) Then size = CDbl(strBytes)
intKB = 1024 intMB = 1024*1024 intGB = 1024*1024*1024
If size > intGB Then PrettyFileSize = Int(size / intGB) & " GB" ElseIf size > intMB Then PrettyFileSize = Int(size / intMB) & " MB" ElseIf size > intKB Then PrettyFileSize = Int(size / intKB) & " KB" Else PrettyFileSize = size & " B" End If Else PrettyFileSize = "Error / Unknown" End If
End Function 'PrettyFileSize
Function GetOSMajorVersion ' Returns the OS Major Version ' A different way to examine the OS instead of by name
Dim objWMIService,colItems,objItem Dim strVersion
Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\.\root\CIMV2") Set colItems = GetObject("WinMgmts:root/cimv2").ExecQuery("select Version from win32_operatingsystem") For Each objItem In colItems strVersion = objItem.Version ' like 6.2.9200 strVersion = Left(strVersion,Len(strVersion) - 5) Next
GetOSMajorVersion = strVersion
End Function 'GetOSMajorVersion

sensor.name: Defrag Needed
sensor.description: Indicates whether the machine's harddrive requires defragmentation Example: Yes

query.script:
'======================================== ' Defrag Needed '========================================
' will output whether a machine needs a defrag for a particular volume ' and some statistics about the volume. ' A defrag has no meaning to an SSD, but there is no way to link ' a volume object property to a disk_drive property ' Not cleanly, anyway. Perhaps in Windows 8 :) Option Explicit
Dim strComputer: strComputer = "." Dim strSep: strSep = "|"
Dim bRecommended, errResult Dim objWMIService, colVolumes, objVolume, objReport
' output looks like: Defrag Recommended|DriveLetter|Volume Size|% Fragmented
Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:" _ & "{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\" & strComputer & "\root\cimv2") Set colVolumes = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select * from Win32_Volume")
For Each objVolume In colVolumes errResult = objVolume.DefragAnalysis(bRecommended, objReport) If bRecommended = True Then WScript.Echo "Yes" & strSep & objVolume.DriveLetter & _ strSep & objReport.VolumeSize & strSep & _ objReport.TotalPercentFragmentation End If If bRecommended = False Then ' Do nothing. If you echo No, you get multiple results for each machine. End If Next
' cleanup Set objWMIService = Nothing Set colVolumes = Nothing Set objVolume = Nothing Set objReport = Nothing

sensor.name: User Details
sensor.description: Returns a list of local users to the Windows machine and the user's full name. Example:johndoe|John Doe

query.script:
'================================= ' User Details ' Don't try this on a domain controller because all domain users are local users on a DC! '=================================
sComputer = "." Function DomainRole(sNode) Set oWMI = GetObject("winmgmts:" & "{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\" & sNode & "\root\cimv2") Set colComputer = oWMI.ExecQuery("Select DomainRole from Win32_ComputerSystem") For Each oComputer in colComputer iDR = oComputer.DomainRole Next Select Case iDR Case 0 ' standalone workstation DomainRole = "SW" Case 1 ' member workstation DomainRole = "MW" Case 2 ' standalone server DomainRole = "SS" Case 3 ' member server DomainRole = "MS" Case 4 ' backup domain controller DomainRole = "BDC" Case 5 ' primary domain controller DomainRole = "PDC" Case Else '; unknown DomainRole = "UNK" End Select End Function
If DomainRole(sComputer) = "PDC" Or DomainRole(sComputer) = "BDC" Then WScript.Echo "Domain Controller, Can't Enumerate users" Else Set objNetwork = CreateObject("Wscript.Network") strComputer = objNetwork.ComputerName Set colAccounts = GetObject("WinNT://" & strComputer & "") colAccounts.Filter = Array("user") For Each objUser In colAccounts strFullName = objUser.FullName If strFullName = "" Then strFullName = objUser.Name End If WScript.Echo objUser.Name & "|" & strFullName Next End If
#!/bin/sh awk -F: '{print $1"|"$5}' /etc/passwd
#!/bin/sh awk -F: '{print $1"|"$5}' /etc/passwd

sensor.name: Video Driver Version
sensor.description: The version number of the video driver on the client machine. Example: 6.1.7600.16385

query.script: select DriverVersion from win32_VideoController

sensor.name: PST Information
sensor.description: Returns details of PST files that have been mounted by users on a system. Example: c:\psts\huge.pst 4088 MB

query.script:
'======================================== ' PST Information '========================================
' This sensor will return data about attached PST files in all profiles. ' This sensor should run in either 32-bit or 64-bit mode without issue ' And will work properly when run in system context of course. ' Times returned are local to the client.
Option Explicit 'On Error Resume Next Const HKEY_CURRENT_USER = &H80000001 Const HKEY_USERS = &H80000003 Const r_PSTGuidLocation = "01023d00" Const r_MasterConfig = "01023d0e" Const r_PSTCheckFile = "00033009" Const r_PSTFile = "001f6700" Const r_keyMaster = "9207f3e0a3b11019908b08002b2a56c2" Const r_ProfilesRoot = "Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Windows Messaging Subsystem\Profiles" Const r_DefaultOutlookProfile = "Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Windows Messaging Subsystem\Profiles" Const r_DefaultProfileString = "DefaultProfile" Dim oReg :Set oReg=GetObject("winmgmts:{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\.\root\default:StdRegProv") Dim arrSubKeys, subkey, strValue, i, pstFile, arrPSTs, DefaultProfileName, arrUserKeys, strUserKey Dim profileName Dim strSep: strSep = "|" ' This is a multi-column sensor
' This sensor uses dates and should have locale set SetLocale(GetTaniumLocale) ' Default is US/English
' first get all users from HKEY_USERS oReg.EnumKey HKEY_USERS,"",arrUserKeys
'And loop through those SIDs For Each strUserKey In arrUserKeys ' WScript.Echo userKey & " is current user SID key" ' return the keys under HKEY_USERS ' WScript.Echo "We're in " & strUserKey oReg.EnumKey HKEY_USERS,strUserKey & "\" & r_ProfilesRoot,arrSubKeys ' and loop through those looking for outlook profiles ' there may be multiple profiles per user. If Not IsNull(arrSubKeys) Then For Each profileName In arrSubKeys 'WScript.Echo profileName & " Is profilename" 'WScript.Echo "We're going to try to get PSTs for this profile: " & strUserKey & "\" & r_ProfilesRoot & "\" & profileName ShowPSTsForProfile strUserKey & "\" & r_ProfilesRoot, profileName Next ' end inner loop End If Next ' end outer loop
'' End Main Line
'_____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ Function ShowPSTsForProfile(profilePath, p_profileName) Dim strHexNumber, strPSTGuid Dim HexCount :HexCount = 0 Dim strPSTFile, arrBinValue
' WScript.Echo "ProfilePath is " & profilePath ' WScript.Echo "And we're fetching " & profilePath & "\" & p_profileName & "\" & r_keyMaster & "-" & r_MasterConfig oReg.GetBinaryValue HKEY_USERS,profilePath & "\" & p_profileName & "\" & r_keyMaster,r_MasterConfig,arrBinValue
For i = lBound(arrBinValue) to uBound(arrBinValue) If Len(Hex(arrBinValue(i))) = 1 Then strHexNumber = "0" & Hex(arrBinValue(i)) Else strHexNumber = Hex(arrBinValue(i)) End If strPSTGuid = strPSTGuid + strHexNumber HexCount = HexCount + 1 If HexCount = 16 Then If IsAPST(profilePath & "\" & p_profileName & "\" & strPSTGuid) Then ' WScript.Echo "It is a PST!!" & profilePath & "\" & p_profileName & "\" & strPSTGuid strPSTFile = PSTFileName(profilePath & "\" & p_profileName & "\" & PSTlocation(profilePath & "\" & p_profileName & "\" & strPSTGuid)) WScript.Echo GetFileInfo (strPSTFile, strSep) End If HexCount = 0 strPSTGuid = "" End If Next End Function '_____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ Function IsAPST(p_PSTGuid) Dim x, P_PSTGuidValue Dim P_PSTCheck:P_PSTCheck=0 IsAPST=False oReg.GetBinaryValue HKEY_USERS,p_PSTGuid,r_PSTCheckFile,P_PSTGuidValue For x = lBound(P_PSTGuidValue) to uBound(P_PSTGuidValue) P_PSTCheck = P_PSTCheck + Hex(P_PSTGuidValue(x)) Next If P_PSTCheck=20 Then IsAPST=True End If End Function '_____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ Function PSTlocation(p_PSTGuid) Dim y, P_PSTGuidValue, t_strHexNumber oReg.GetBinaryValue HKEY_USERS,p_PSTGuid,r_PSTGuidLocation,P_PSTGuidValue If Not IsNull(P_PSTGuidValue) Then For y = lBound(P_PSTGuidValue) to uBound(P_PSTGuidValue) If Len(Hex(P_PSTGuidValue(y))) = 1 Then PSTlocation = PSTlocation + "0" & Hex(P_PSTGuidValue(y)) Else PSTlocation = PSTlocation + Hex(P_PSTGuidValue(y)) End If Next End If End Function '_____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ Function PSTFileName(p_PSTGuid) Dim z, P_PSTName Dim strString:strString = "" ' WScript.Echo "In PSTFileName, p_PSTGUID is : " & p_PSTGuid oReg.GetBinaryValue HKEY_USERS,p_PSTGuid,r_PSTFile,P_PSTName For z = lBound(P_PSTName) to uBound(P_PSTName) If P_PSTName(z) > 0 Then strString = strString & Chr(P_PSTName(z)) End If Next PSTFileName = strString Set z = nothing Set P_PSTName = nothing End Function '_________________________________________________________________________________________________________ Function GetFileInfo(strFilePath, strSep) ' This will return the file name ' The file size
Dim objFSO Dim file
Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject") Set file = objFSO.GetFile(strFilePath) ' let's just return a separated string with all kinds of information in it 'GetFileInfo = strFilePath & strSep & file.DateCreated & strSep & _ ' file.DateLastAccessed & strSep & file.DateLastModified _ ' & strSep & file.Size & " bytes"
GetFileInfo = strFilePath & strSep & BytesConvert(file.Size)
'cleanup Set file = Nothing Set objFSO = Nothing
End Function 'GetFileInfo
Function GetTaniumLocale '' This function will retrieve the locale value ' previously set which governs Tanium content that ' is locale sensitive.
Dim objWshShell Dim intLocaleID
Set objWshShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell") On Error Resume Next intLocaleID = objWshShell.RegRead("HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client\LocaleID") If Err.Number <> 0 Then intLocaleID = objWshShell.RegRead("HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client\LocaleID") End If On Error Goto 0 If intLocaleID = "" Then GetTaniumLocale = 1033 ' default to us/English Else GetTaniumLocale = intLocaleID End If
' Cleanup Set objWshShell = Nothing
End Function 'GetTaniumLocale
Function BytesConvert(dblSize)
Dim strSuffix, intCommaSpot
Do While InStr(dblSize,",") 'Remove commas from dblSize intCommaSpot = InStr(dblSize,",") dblSize = Mid(dblSize,1,intCommaSpot - 1) & _ Mid(dblSize,intCommaSpot + 1,Len(dblSize) - intCommaSpot) Loop
On Error Resume Next dblSize = CDbl(dblSize) If Err.Number <> 0 Then BytesConvert = "Invalid input" Exit Function End If On Error Goto 0
strSuffix = " Bytes" If dblSize >= 1024 Then strSuffix = " KB" If dblSize >= 1048576 Then strSuffix = " MB" If dblSize >= 1073741824 Then strSuffix = " GB" If dblSize >= 1099511627776 Then strSuffix = " TB"
Select Case strSuffix Case " KB" dblSize = Round(dblSize / 1024, 1) Case " MB" dblSize = Round(dblSize / 1048576, 1) Case " GB" dblSize = Round(dblSize / 1073741824, 1) Case " TB" dblSize = Round(dblSize / 1099511627776, 1) End Select
BytesConvert = dblSize & strSuffix End Function 'BytesConvert

sensor.name: Shared Network Printer Details
sensor.description: Details on any shared printers available from the client machine. Details include printer name, print server, and share name. Example: \\PRINTSERVER1\PRINTER2 | netserver | \\PRINTSERVER1\PRINTER2

query.script:
'======================================== ' Shared Network Printer Details '========================================
' This is a multi-column sensor that returns details on ' printers that are served by a print server. ' The columns look like: ' Printer|Server|Share Name
strSep = "|"
strComputer ="."
Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\" & strComputer & "\root\CIMV2") Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("SELECT * FROM Win32_Printer")
For Each objItem In colItems If (objitem.Servername <> "") Then WScript.Echo objItem.name & strSep & objitem.ServerName _ & strSep & objitem.ShareName End If Next
Set objWMIService = Nothing Set colItems = Nothing

#!/bin/bash cat /proc/modules | while read line do set -- $line echo $1 done

sensor.name: Hyperthreading Enabled
sensor.description: Indicates whether hyperthreading is enabled on the client machine. This is not supported on all OS patch levels. Example: Yes

query.script:
'======================================== ' Hyperthreading Enabled '========================================
' checking if the number of logical processors is greater than ' the number of cores on each physical, socketed processor. On Error Resume Next
Set objWMIService = GetObject("Winmgmts:{impersonationlevel=impersonate}!\Root\Cimv2") Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("SELECT * FROM Win32_Processor") intNumCores = 0
For Each objItem in colItems intNumCores = intNumCores + CInt(objItem.NumberOfCores) 'decide whether to continue for unsupported OS patch levels If intNumCores = 0 Then ' machine does not support counting cores strOs = GetOS 'Windows 2000 isn't supported for core count, can't determine hyperthreading If InStr(strOs, "2000") > 0 Then WScript.Echo "Windows 2000 - Cannot determine" ElseIf InStr(strOs, "XP") > 0 Then WScript.Echo "XP SP3 Required to determine" ElseIf InStr(strOs, "2003") > 0 Then 'For Win Server 2003 SEE KB 932370 'http://support.microsoft.com/kb/932370/ WScript.Echo "KB932370 Required to determine" Else WScript.Echo "N/A" End If ElseIf intNumCores < objItem.NumberOfLogicalProcessors Then WScript.Echo "Yes" ElseIf intNumCores = objItem.NumberOfLogicalProcessors Then WScript.Echo "No" Else WScript.Echo "Unsure" End If WScript.Quit 'if reported once, it will be the same value across all CPUs Next
Function GetOS Set oWsh = WScript.CreateObject("WScript.Shell") Set oWshSysEnv = oWsh.Environment("PROCESS") Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\.\root\CIMV2") Set colItems = GetObject("WinMgmts:root/cimv2").ExecQuery("select Caption from win32_operatingsystem") For Each objItem In colItems strStrip1 = Right(ObjItem.Caption, (Len(objItem.Caption) - Instr(objItem.Caption, " "))) 'strStrip2 = Right(strStrip1, (Len(strStrip1) - Instr(strStrip1, " "))) if Instr(strStrip1,"Server" & Unescape("%AE")) <> 0 THEN strOS = Replace(strStrip1,"Server" & Unescape("%AE"),"Server") Else strOS = strStrip1 End IF GetOS = Trim(strOS) Next End Function

sensor.name: Network Printer Details
sensor.description: Returns the connected network printers. Example: printer_name | driver | port

query.script:
'======================================== ' Network Printer Details '========================================
On Error Resume Next strComputer = "." Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\" & strComputer & "\root\cimv2") Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select PortName,Caption,DriverName from Win32_Printer",,48)
strSep = "|"
For Each objItem in colItems If InStr(objItem.PortName, ".") Then
WScript.Echo objItem.Caption & strSep & _ objItem.DriverName & strSep & _ objItem.PortName End If Next

sensor.name: McAfee Endpoint Encryption Product Code
sensor.description: Returns the Product Code of a McAfee Endpoint Encryption install Example: Enterprise

query.script:
'======================================== ' McAfee Endpoint Encryption Product Code '========================================
' This sensor will return the Product Code of a ' McAfee Endpoint Encryption install ' This is a string value such as "Enterprise"
Option Explicit
Dim objRegistry,keyPath,key64Path,strSep strSep = "|" ' column delimiter
Set objRegistry = Getx64RegistryProvider()
Const HKLM = &H80000002
keyPath = "SOFTWARE\McAfee Endpoint Encryption\MfeEpePC\Status" key64Path = "SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\McAfee Endpoint Encryption\MfeEpePC\Status"
If Not RegKeyExists(HKLM, keyPath) Then keyPath = key64Path
If Not RegKeyExists(HKLM, keyPath) Then WScript.Echo "Not installed" WScript.Quit End If End If
If RegKeyExists(HKLM, keyPath) Then Dim strReturn strReturn = ReturnStringValueOrEchoError _ (objRegistry,HKLM,keyPath,"ProductCode","McAfee Endpoint Encryption Product Code Not Found") If VarType(strReturn) = 8 Then 'string value 8 indicates success, integer is error WScript.Echo strReturn Else WScript.Quit End If Else WScript.Echo "McAfee Endpoint Encryption Not Found" WScript.Quit End If
Function RegKeyExists(sHive, sRegKey) Dim aValueNames, aValueTypes If objRegistry.EnumValues(sHive, sRegKey, aValueNames, aValueTypes) = 0 Then RegKeyExists = True Else RegKeyExists = False End If End Function
Function ReturnStringValueOrEchoError(objRegistry,HIVE,strKeyName,strValueName,strErrorMessage) ' Return a value or fatal error message and error result Dim intReturn,strValueData intReturn = objRegistry.GetStringValue(HIVE, strKeyname, strValueName, strValueData) If intReturn = 0 Then ReturnStringValueOrEchoError = strValueData Else ReturnStringValueOrEchoError = -1 WScript.Echo strErrorMessage End If End Function
Function Getx64RegistryProvider ' Returns the best available registry provider: 32 bit on 32 bit systems, 64 bit on 64 bit systems Dim objWMIService, colItems, objItem, iArchType, objCtx, objLocator, objServices, objRegProv Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\.\root\CIMV2") Set colItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select SystemType from Win32_ComputerSystem") For Each objItem In colItems If InStr(LCase(objItem.SystemType), "x64") > 0 Then iArchType = 64 Else iArchType = 32 End If Next
Set objCtx = CreateObject("WbemScripting.SWbemNamedValueSet") objCtx.Add "__ProviderArchitecture", iArchType Set objLocator = CreateObject("Wbemscripting.SWbemLocator") Set objServices = objLocator.ConnectServer("","root\default","","",,,,objCtx) Set objRegProv = objServices.Get("StdRegProv")
Set Getx64RegistryProvider = objRegProv End Function ' Getx64RegistryProvider
