sensor.name: Tanium File Exists
sensor.parameter_definition: {"parameters":[{"restrict":null,"validationExpressions":[{"helpString":"Value can not be blank","flags":"","expression":"^\\S","parameterType":"com.tanium.models::ValidationExpression","model":"com.tanium.models::ValidationExpression"}],"helpString":"Starting from the Client installation directory, complete the file path to get contents for.","promptText":"e.g. uninst.exe or Tools\\Wsusscn2.cab","defaultValue":"","value":"","label":"Relative file path from <Tanium Client Installation Dir>","maxChars":0,"key":"file","parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::TextInputParameter","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::TextInputParameter"}],"parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray"}
sensor.description: Provided with a parameter indicating the path to a file in the Tanium current directory, returns True or False based on whether that file exists in the specified location. Example: True

query.script:
'======================================== ' Tanium File Exists '========================================
filePath = unescape("||file||") strTaniumDir = GetTaniumDir("")
Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject")
filePath = strTaniumDir & filePath
If fso.FileExists(filePath) Then 'WScript.Echo filePath WScript.Echo "True" Else WScript.Echo "File does not exist" End If
Function GetTaniumDir(strSubDir) 'GetTaniumDir with GeneratePath, works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 End If
If Not strPath = "" Then If strSubDir <> "" Then strSubDir = "\" & strSubDir End If
Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject") If fso.FolderExists(strPath) Then If Not fso.FolderExists(strPath & strSubDir) Then ''Need to loop through strSubDir and create all sub directories GeneratePath strPath & strSubDir, fso End If GetTaniumDir = strPath & strSubDir & "\" Else ' Specified Path doesn't exist on the filesystem WScript.Echo "Error: " & strPath & " does not exist on the filesystem" GetTaniumDir = False End If Else WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot find Tanium Client path in Registry" GetTaniumDir = False End If End Function 'GetTaniumDir
Function GeneratePath(pFolderPath, fso) GeneratePath = False
If Not fso.FolderExists(pFolderPath) Then If GeneratePath(fso.GetParentFolderName(pFolderPath), fso) Then GeneratePath = True Call fso.CreateFolder(pFolderPath) End If Else GeneratePath = True End If End Function 'GeneratePath
Function RegKeyExists(objRegistry, sHive, sRegKey) Dim aValueNames, aValueTypes If objRegistry.EnumValues(sHive, sRegKey, aValueNames, aValueTypes) = 0 Then RegKeyExists = True Else RegKeyExists = False End If End Function

sensor.name: Video/Graphics Card
sensor.description: Description of the video card in the client machine. Example: ATI Radeon HD 2400 Pro

query.script: select Name from Win32_VideoController
#!/bin/bash dmidecode | grep -A2 "Type: Video" | awk -F": " '$1 ~ "Description" {print $2}'

sensor.name: Security Patches Needed Above Threshold
sensor.description: Sensor which looks at the patch results file to determine how many security patches are necessary and if that number is above a threshold value (default 20). Can be edited to determine what severity counts as a security patch. Threshold can also be adjusted. Example:Yes

query.script:
'======================================== ' Security Patches Needed Above Threshold '========================================
' sensor - security patches needed above threshold ' This sensor will Yes or No if the count of security updates needed ' is above a threshold value.
Option Explicit
Dim strHighestSeverityThatCounts ' This sensor is modifiable ' customers can decide how to flag an update as countable in this sensor ' by default, we include all available patches
' This string value will determine what we count. The valid values here are: ' ALL,MS_SECURITY_BULLETINS,CRITICALS,IMPORTANTS,MODERATES,LOWS
strHighestSeverityThatCounts = "ALL"
Dim objFSO, fn, objReadFile, contents, path, strSep, hasOutput, intCriticalThreshold Dim intTotalThreshold strSep = "|" intCriticalThreshold = 5 intTotalThreshold = 20
Dim showSingleStatus showSingleStatus = True
path = GetTaniumDir("Tools\Scans") Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject") fn = path & "\patchresultsreadable.txt"
If objFSO.FileExists(fn) Then Set objReadFile = objFSO.OpenTextFile(fn, 1, False)
Dim strLine, words, strFilename, strPatchDir, arrFilenames, isComplete
hasOutput = False
'note: intNone refers to patches with severity=none Dim intCritical, intImportant, intModerate, intLow, intNone, intSecurityBulletin
intCritical = 0 intImportant = 0 intModerate = 0 intLow = 0 intNone = 0 intSecurityBulletin = 0
Do While Not objReadFile.AtEndOfStream strLine = objReadFile.ReadLine
'CHECK FOR MULTI-URL PATCHES words = Split(strLine, strSep)
'Ignore old Patch Results format without separator If UBound(words) < 4 Then If left(words(0), 4) = "Scan" Then hasOutput = True 'WScript.Echo words(0) Else 'WScript.Echo "Run upgraded Patch Scan" WScript.Quit End If Else arrFilenames = Split(words(5), ",") 'patch filename must be in Tools\Patch directory for queue Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject")
strPatchDir = GetTaniumDir("Tools\Patches")
isComplete = True For Each strFilename In arrFilenames If Not fso.FileExists(strPatchDir & "\" & strFilename) Then isComplete = False End If Next
' A previously defined string value will determine what we count. ' The valid values here are: ' ALL,MS_SECURITY_BULLETINS,CRITICALS,IMPORTANTS,MODERATES,LOWS
If Not isComplete Then If InStr(strLine, "Already Installed") Then 'Do not echo since we only want to output "Available" patches Else hasOutput = True Select Case words(1) Case "Critical" If strHighestSeverityThatCounts = "ALL" Or _ strHighestSeverityThatCounts = "CRITICALS" Or _ strHighestSeverityThatCounts = "IMPORTANTS" Or _ strHighestSeverityThatCounts = "MODERATES" Or _ strHighestSeverityThatCounts = "LOWS" Then intCritical = intCritical + 1 End If Case "Important" If strHighestSeverityThatCounts = "ALL" Or _ strHighestSeverityThatCounts = "IMPORTANTS" Or _ strHighestSeverityThatCounts = "MODERATES" Or _ strHighestSeverityThatCounts = "LOWS" Then intImportant = intImportant + 1 End If
Case "Moderate" If strHighestSeverityThatCounts = "ALL" Or _ strHighestSeverityThatCounts = "MODERATES" Or _ strHighestSeverityThatCounts = "LOWS" Then intModerate = intModerate + 1 End If Case "Low" If strHighestSeverityThatCounts = "ALL" Or _ strHighestSeverityThatCounts = "LOWS" Then intLow = intLow + 1 End If Case "None" If strHighestSeverityThatCounts = "ALL" Or _ strHighestSeverityThatCounts = "LOWS" Then intNone = intNone + 1 End If End Select If LCase(words(2)) <> "none" Then ' there is an MS Security Bulletin ID associated intSecurityBulletin = intSecurityBulletin + 1 End If End If Else 'If we're here, update has been queued 'Do not echo since we only want to output "Installed" patches 'If InStr(strLine, "Not Installed") Then ' strLine = Replace(strLine, "Not Installed", "Queued") ' WScript.Echo strLine 'End If End If End If Loop
objReadFile.close
If hasOutput Then ' output sum, ignoring the 'None' category If strHighestSeverityThatCounts = "MS_SECURITY_BULLETINS" Then WScript.Echo intSecurityBulletin Else If intCritical + intImportant + intModerate + intLow + intNone > intTotalThreshold Then WScript.Echo "Yes" Else WScript.Echo "No" End If End If Else WScript.Echo "No" End If
Else Wscript.echo "Patch results output not found" End If
Function GetTaniumPath Dim strComputer, key32path, key64path, keyPath, reg strComputer = "." Const HKLM = &h80000002
key32Path = "Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" key64Path = "Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
Set reg=GetObject("winmgmts:{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\" & strComputer & "\root\default:StdRegProv")
If RegKeyExists(reg, HKLM, key64Path) Then keyPath = key64Path ElseIf RegKeyExists(reg, HKLM, key32Path) Then keyPath = key32Path End If
reg.GetStringValue HKLM,keyPath,"Path",GetTaniumPath End Function
Function GetTaniumDir(strSubDir) 'GetTaniumDir with GeneratePath, works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 End If
If Not strPath = "" Then If strSubDir <> "" Then strSubDir = "\" & strSubDir End If
Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject") If fso.FolderExists(strPath) Then If Not fso.FolderExists(strPath & strSubDir) Then ''Need to loop through strSubDir and create all sub directories GeneratePath strPath & strSubDir, fso End If GetTaniumDir = strPath & strSubDir & "\" Else ' Specified Path doesn't exist on the filesystem WScript.Echo "Error: " & strPath & " does not exist on the filesystem" GetTaniumDir = False End If Else WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot find Tanium Client path in Registry" GetTaniumDir = False End If End Function 'GetTaniumDir
Function GeneratePath(pFolderPath, fso) GeneratePath = False
If Not fso.FolderExists(pFolderPath) Then If GeneratePath(fso.GetParentFolderName(pFolderPath), fso) Then GeneratePath = True Call fso.CreateFolder(pFolderPath) End If Else GeneratePath = True End If End Function 'GeneratePath

sensor.name: Tanium Action Log
sensor.parameter_definition: {"parameters":[{"restrict":null,"validationExpressions":[{"helpString":"","flags":"","expression":"[0-9]+","parameterType":"com.tanium.models::ValidationExpression","model":"com.tanium.models::ValidationExpression"}],"helpString":"Enter a valid Action ID Number from the Action History tab","promptText":"e.g. 1234","defaultValue":"","value":"","label":"Action ID Number","maxChars":0,"key":"actionNumber","parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::TextInputParameter","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::TextInputParameter"}],"parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray"}
sensor.description: Provided with an action number as a parameter, this sensor returns the log from the action from each client machine that executed the action. Example: 2012-11-02 03:30:17 +0000|Command Completed

query.script:
'======================================== ' Tanium Action Log '========================================
Option Explicit
Const MAX_LINES_TO_RETURN = 100
Dim strAction, strTaniumPath, strFilePath
strAction = "||actionNumber||" strTaniumPath = GetTaniumDir("Downloads")
strFilePath = strTaniumPath & "\Action_"&strAction&".log"
Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject")
If fso.FileExists(strFilePath) Then Dim objTextFile, strLine, intLineNumber Set objTextFile = fso.OpenTextFile(strFilePath, 1)
intLineNumber = 1 Do Until objTextFile.AtEndOfStream WScript.Echo zeroPad(intLineNumber,3) & "|" & objTextFile.ReadLine intLineNumber = intLineNumber + 1
If(intLineNumber > MAX_LINES_TO_RETURN) Then WScript.Echo zeroPad(intLineNumber,3) & "|Max number of lines reached in Action Log Sensor" WScript.Quit End If Loop
Else WScript.Echo "File does not exist" End If
Function zeroPad(m, t) zeroPad = String(t-Len(m),"0")&m End Function
Function GetTaniumDir(strSubDir) 'GetTaniumDir with GeneratePath, works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 End If
If Not strPath = "" Then If strSubDir <> "" Then strSubDir = "\" & strSubDir End If
Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject") If fso.FolderExists(strPath) Then If Not fso.FolderExists(strPath & strSubDir) Then ''Need to loop through strSubDir and create all sub directories GeneratePath strPath & strSubDir, fso End If GetTaniumDir = strPath & strSubDir & "\" Else ' Specified Path doesn't exist on the filesystem WScript.Echo "Error: " & strPath & " does not exist on the filesystem" GetTaniumDir = False End If Else WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot find Tanium Client path in Registry" GetTaniumDir = False End If End Function 'GetTaniumDir
Function GeneratePath(pFolderPath, fso) GeneratePath = False
If Not fso.FolderExists(pFolderPath) Then If GeneratePath(fso.GetParentFolderName(pFolderPath), fso) Then GeneratePath = True Call fso.CreateFolder(pFolderPath) End If Else GeneratePath = True End If End Function 'GeneratePath
Function RegKeyExists(objRegistry, sHive, sRegKey) Dim aValueNames, aValueTypes If objRegistry.EnumValues(sHive, sRegKey, aValueNames, aValueTypes) = 0 Then RegKeyExists = True Else RegKeyExists = False End If End Function

sensor.name: Boot Time
sensor.description: The amount of time, in seconds, that the last boot of this machine took. Example: 100

query.script:
'======================================== ' Boot Time in Minutes '======================================== '
Option Explicit
Dim strBootTimeInSec
If Left(GetOSMajorVersion(), 1) < 6 Then WScript.Echo "Not Available" Else strBootTimeInSec = GetBootTimeInSec WScript.Echo strBootTimeInSec End If
Function GetBootTimeInSec() Dim objShell, objShellExec, strCmd, strCmdOutput, strBootTime Dim xmlDoc, bLoadSuccess, objList, objNode Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
strCmd = "wevtutil.exe qe Microsoft-Windows-Diagnostics-Performance/Operational /rd:true /f:xml /c:1 /q:""*[System[(EventID = 100)]]"" /e:Events"
Set objShellExec = objShell.Exec(strCmd) strCmdOutput = objShellExec.StdOut.ReadAll
' the command gave us back XML -- put the XML into an xml object, then find what we are looking for.
Set xmlDoc = CreateObject("Msxml2.DOMDocument") bLoadSuccess = xmlDoc.loadXml(strCmdOutput)
If Not bLoadSuccess Then ' On Server machines, the above will report that the channel can not be found, ' and return nothing. (that log is only available on clients) The XML won't parse, ' so return Not Available WScript.Echo "Not Available" WScript.Quit End If
Set objList = xmlDoc.getElementsByTagName("Data") If objList.length > 0 Then For Each objNode In objList Dim strAttribute strAttribute = objNode.getAttribute("Name")
If strAttribute = "BootTime" Then strBootTime = objNode.text End If Next End If
GetBootTimeInSec = Round(strBootTime / 1000) End Function ' GetBootTimeInSec
Function GetOSMajorVersion ' Returns the OS Major Version ' A different way to examine the OS instead of by name
Dim objWMIService,colItems,objItem Dim strVersion
Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\.\root\CIMV2") Set colItems = GetObject("WinMgmts:root/cimv2").ExecQuery("select Version from win32_operatingsystem") For Each objItem In colItems strVersion = objItem.Version ' like 6.2.9200 strVersion = Left(strVersion,Len(strVersion) - 5) Next
GetOSMajorVersion = strVersion
End Function 'GetOSMajorVersion

sensor.name: Workgroup
sensor.description: The configured workgroup or computer domain for each client machine. Example: mycompanydomain

query.script:
'======================================== ' Workgroup '========================================
Set objWMISvc = GetObject( "winmgmts:\\.\root\cimv2" ) Set colItems = objWMISvc.ExecQuery("Select * From Win32_ComputerSystem") For Each objItem in colItems strComputerDomain = objItem.Domain If Not objItem.PartOfDomain Then ' If the machine is not part of a domain, then the "Domain" is the workgroup ' Don't print domain, only workgroup WScript.Echo strComputerDomain End If Next

sensor.name: FileVault Details
sensor.description: Returns information on the FileVault status of a machine Example: If Available | Fully Secure | Status

query.script:
#!/bin/sh # # Sensor that goes through the current status of the drives via diskutil, # and outputs the current FileVault status
CORESTORAGESTATUS="/private/tmp/corestorage.txt" ENCRYPTSTATUS="/private/tmp/encrypt_status.txt" ENCRYPTDIRECTION="/private/tmp/encrypt_direction.txt"
DEVICE_COUNT=`diskutil cs list | grep -E "^CoreStorage logical volume groups" | awk '{print $5}' | sed -e's/(//'`
EGREP_STRING="" if [ "$DEVICE_COUNT" != "1" ]; then EGREP_STRING="^\| *" fi
osversionlong=`sw_vers -productVersion` osvers=${osversionlong:3:1} CONTEXT=`diskutil cs list | grep -E "$EGREP_STRING\Encryption Context" | sed -e's/\|//' | awk '{print $3}'` ENCRYPTIONEXTENTS=`diskutil cs list | grep -E "$EGREP_STRING\Has Encrypted Extents" | sed -e's/\|//' | awk '{print $4}'` ENCRYPTION=`diskutil cs list | grep -E "$EGREP_STRING\Encryption Type" | sed -e's/\|//' | awk '{print $3}'` CONVERTED=`diskutil cs list | grep -E "$EGREP_STRING\Size \(Converted\)" | sed -e's/\|//' | awk '{print $5, $6}'` SIZE=`diskutil cs list | grep -E "$EGREP_STRING\Size \(Total\)" | sed -e's/\|//' | awk '{print $5, $6}'`
# Checks to see if the OS on the Mac is 10.7 or 10.8. # These older versions of mac OS do not have the ability to encrypt
if [[ ${osvers} -lt 7 ]]; then echo "Not Available|No|None" fi
if [[ ${osvers} -ge 7 ]]; then diskutil cs list >> $CORESTORAGESTATUS
# If the Mac is running 10.7 or 10.8, but not does not have # any CoreStorage volumes, the status is: # Not Enabled
if grep -iE 'No CoreStorage' $CORESTORAGESTATUS 1>/dev/null; then echo "Available|No|None" fi
if grep -iE 'Logical Volume Family' $CORESTORAGESTATUS 1>/dev/null; then
# This section does 10.7-specific checking of the Mac's # FileVault 2 status
if [ "$CONTEXT" = "Present" ]; then if [ "$ENCRYPTION" = "AES-XTS" ]; then diskutil cs list | grep -E "$EGREP_STRING\Conversion Status" | sed -e's/\|//' | awk '{print $3}' >> $ENCRYPTSTATUS if grep -iE 'Complete' $ENCRYPTSTATUS 1>/dev/null; then echo "Available|Yes|Encrypted" else if grep -iE 'Converting' $ENCRYPTSTATUS 1>/dev/null; then diskutil cs list | grep -E "$EGREP_STRING\Conversion Direction" | sed -e's/\|//' | awk '{print $3}' >> $ENCRYPTDIRECTION if grep -iE 'Forward' $ENCRYPTDIRECTION 1>/dev/null; then echo "Available|No|Encrypting $CONVERTED of $SIZE" else echo "Available|No|Unknown" fi fi fi else if [ "$ENCRYPTION" = "None" ]; then diskutil cs list | grep -E "$EGREP_STRING\Conversion Direction" | sed -e's/\|//' | awk '{print $3}' >> $ENCRYPTDIRECTION if grep -iE 'Backward' $ENCRYPTDIRECTION 1>/dev/null; then echo "Available|No|Decrypting $CONVERTED of $SIZE" elif grep -iE '-none-' $ENCRYPTDIRECTION 1>/dev/null; then echo "Available|No|Not Encrypted" fi fi fi fi fi fi # This section does 10.8-specific checking of the Mac's # FileVault 2 status
if [ "$ENCRYPTIONEXTENTS" = "Yes" ]; then if [ "$ENCRYPTION" = "AES-XTS" ]; then diskutil cs list | grep -E "$EGREP_STRING\Fully Secure" | sed -e's/\|//' | awk '{print $3}' >> $ENCRYPTSTATUS if grep -iE 'Yes' $ENCRYPTSTATUS 1>/dev/null; then echo "Available|Yes|Encrypted" else if grep -iE 'No' $ENCRYPTSTATUS 1>/dev/null; then diskutil cs list | grep -E "$EGREP_STRING\Conversion Direction" | sed -e's/\|//' | awk '{print $3}' >> $ENCRYPTDIRECTION if grep -iE 'forward' $ENCRYPTDIRECTION 1>/dev/null; then echo "Available|No|Encrypting $CONVERTED of $SIZE"
else if grep -iE 'backward' $ENCRYPTDIRECTION 1>/dev/null; then echo "Available|No|Decrypting $CONVERTED of $SIZE" elif grep -iE '-none-' $ENCRYPTDIRECTION 1>/dev/null; then echo "Available|No|Not Encrypted" fi fi fi fi fi fi
# Remove the temp files created during the script
if [ -f /private/tmp/corestorage.txt ]; then rm /private/tmp/corestorage.txt fi
if [ -f /private/tmp/encrypt_status.txt ]; then rm /private/tmp/encrypt_status.txt fi
if [ -f /private/tmp/encrypt_direction.txt ]; then rm /private/tmp/encrypt_direction.txt fi

sensor.name: Driver Details
sensor.description: Return details about loaded drivers Example: WIMMount|Stopped|C:\Windows\system32\drivers\wimmount.sys|6.3.9600.16384

query.script:
'======================================== ' Driver Details '======================================== ' this sensor will return specific data about all drivers in the driver store ' many columns are parsed, but only a few are output ' set hash type to something valid (md5 or sha1) in order to enable hash output ' which would change the column count
Option Explicit
On Error Resume Next Dim strHashType ' Either MD5 or SHA1. If neither, do not hash ' requires IR tools to hash 'strHashType = "MD5" 'strHashType = "SHA1" strHashType = "None"
Dim strCommand,objShell,objScriptExec,strDriverResults,results,line Dim arrFields,strMName,strDName,strDesc,strDType,strStartMode,strState,strStatus,strAccStop Dim strAccPause,strPP,strCode,strBSS,strLinkDate,strPath,strInit,strFixedPath Dim strFindChr,strReplaceChr,strSep,bHasOutput,dictOut,strOut,strSystem32Location,objFSO Dim dictFilesToHash,inputFile,bHashOutput,strHashOfDriver,strFileVersion
Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject") Set dictFilesToHash = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary")
' call the 64-bit driver query on a 64-bit machine when necessary strSystem32Location = FixFileSystemRedirectionForPath(objFSO.GetSpecialFolder(1))
strCommand = "cmd /c "&strSystem32Location&"\driverquery.exe /V /NH /FO CSV"
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell") Set objScriptExec = objShell.Exec (strCommand) strDriverResults = objScriptExec.StdOut.ReadAll
results = Split(strDriverResults, vbCrLf)
strFindChr = Chr(34) strReplaceChr = ""
strSep = "|"
Set dictOut = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary")
bHasOutput = False For Each line in results arrFields = Split(line, Chr(34)&Chr(44)) If UBound(arrFields) >= 14 Then strMName = Replace(Trim(arrFields(0)),strFindChr,strReplaceChr) strDName = Replace(Trim(arrFields(1)),strFindChr,strReplaceChr) strDesc = Replace(Trim(arrFields(2)),strFindChr,strReplaceChr) strDType = Replace(Trim(arrFields(3)),strFindChr,strReplaceChr) strStartMode = Replace(Trim(arrFields(4)),strFindChr,strReplaceChr) strState = Replace(Trim(arrFields(5)),strFindChr,strReplaceChr) strStatus = Replace(Trim(arrFields(6)),strFindChr,strReplaceChr) strAccStop = Replace(Trim(arrFields(7)),strFindChr,strReplaceChr) strAccPause = Replace(Trim(arrFields(8)),strFindChr,strReplaceChr) strPP = Replace(Trim(arrFields(9)),strFindChr,strReplaceChr) strCode = Replace(Trim(arrFields(10)),strFindChr,strReplaceChr) strBSS = Replace(Trim(arrFields(11)),strFindChr,strReplaceChr) strLinkDate = Replace(Trim(arrFields(12)),strFindChr,strReplaceChr) strPath = Replace(Trim(arrFields(13)),strFindChr,strReplaceChr) strPath = Replace(strPath,"\??\","") '' eliminate strange path chars strInit = Replace(Trim(arrFields(14)),strFindChr,strReplaceChr) strFixedPath = FixFileSystemRedirectionForPath(strPath) strFixedPath = LCase(strFixedPath) ' necessary for dict compare later strFileVersion = GetFileVersion(objFSO,strFixedPath) strOut = strDName & strSep & strState & strSep & strPath & strSep & strFileVersion If Not dictOut.Exists(strOut) Then dictOut.Add strOut,strFixedPath If Not dictFilesToHash.Exists(LCase(strFixedPath)) Then ' Default message is Cannot Hash if the IR tools are not installed properly or file cannot be hashed dictFilesToHash.Add LCase(strFixedPath),"cannot hash" End If bHasOutput = True End If End If Next
strHashType = LCase(strHashType) If strHashType = "md5" Or strHashType = "sha1" Then inputFile = GetTaniumDir("Tools\IR") & "driver-details-with-hash-"&strHashType&".xml" 'delete potential previous input file on entry On Error Resume Next If objFSO.FileExists(inputFile) Then objFSO.DeleteFile inputFile, True End If On Error Goto 0 CreateXmlInputFileByHashType dictFilesToHash,inputFile,strHashType ' add the hash of the files to the files to hash dictionary AddHashToHashesDictFromMD5Output inputFile,dictFilesToHash,strHashType On Error Resume Next 'delete potential previous input file on entry If objFSO.FileExists(inputFile) Then objFSO.DeleteFile inputFile, True End If On Error Goto 0 End If
If Not bHasOutput Then WScript.echo "Error: driver data cannot be interpreted" Else bHashOutput = False If strHashType = "md5" Or strHashType = "sha1" Then bHashOutput = True For Each strOut In dictOut.Keys If bHashOutput Then If dictFilesToHash.Exists(dictOut.Item(strOut)) Then strHashOfDriver = dictFilesToHash.Item(dictOut.Item(strOut)) Else strHashOfDriver = "unknown" End If WScript.Echo strOut & strSep & strHashOfDriver Else WScript.Echo strOut End If Next End If
Function GetFileVersion(ByRef fso, strPath) Dim strVersion If fso.FileExists(strPath) Then On Error Resume Next strVersion = fso.GetFileVersion(strPath) On Error Goto 0 If strVersion = "" Then strVersion = "Version not found" End If Else strVersion = "File not found" End If
GetFileVersion = strVersion End Function 'GetFileVersion
Function FixFileSystemRedirectionForPath(ByVal strFilePath) ' This function will fix a folder location so that ' a 32-bit program can be passed the windows\system32 directory ' as a parameter. ' Even if the sensor or action runs in 64-bit mode, a 32-bit ' program called in a 64-bit environment cannot access ' the system32 directory - it would be redirected to syswow64. ' you would not want to do this for 64-bit programs.
Dim objFSO, strSystem32Location,strWindowsLocation,objShell Dim strProgramFilesx86 Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject") Set objShell = CreateObject("Wscript.Shell")
strProgramFilesx86=objShell.ExpandEnvironmentStrings("%ProgramFiles%")
strFilePath = LCase(strFilePath) strWindowsLocation = LCase(objFSO.GetSpecialFolder(0)) strSystem32Location = LCase(objFSO.GetSpecialFolder(1)) strProgramFilesx86=objShell.ExpandEnvironmentStrings("%ProgramFiles(x86)%")
If objFSO.FolderExists(strProgramFilesx86) Then ' quick check for x64 If InStr(strFilePath,strSystem32Location) = 1 Then strFilePath = Replace(strFilePath,"system32","sysnative") End If End If FixFileSystemRedirectionForPath = strFilePath
'Cleanup Set objFSO = Nothing End Function 'FixFileSystemRedirectionForPath
Function UnFixFileSystemRedirectionForPath(strFilePath) ' This function will undo the changes made to a path by the ' FixFileSystemRedirectionForPath function ' if a path is passed in with the sysnative string in it ' it will simply change it to system32, regardless of whether ' the OS is 64-bit. A path will only be changed when it's ' necessary, so this has no effect when it's not changed.
Dim objFSO,strSystem32Location,strNewSystem32Location
Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject")
strFilePath = LCase(strFilePath) strSystem32Location = LCase(objFSO.GetSpecialFolder(1)) strNewSystem32Location = Replace(strSystem32Location,"system32","sysnative")
UnFixFileSystemRedirectionForPath = Replace(strFilePath,strNewSystem32Location,strSystem32Location)
'Cleanup Set objFSO = Nothing End Function 'UnFixFileSystemRedirectionForPath
Function CreateXmlInputFileByHashType(fileStrings, inputFileName, strHashType) If Not (strHashType = "md5" Or strHashType = "sha1") Then WScript.Echo "Invalid hash type: " & strHashType& ", Quitting" WScript.Quit End If Dim masterXmlDom Set masterXmlDom = CreateObject("Msxml2.DOMDocument") masterXmlDom.Async = false
Dim oFSO, oExistingTextFile, existingXML Set oFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject")
Dim pi Set pi = masterXmlDom.createProcessingInstruction("xml", "version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'") masterXmlDom.insertBefore pi, masterXmlDom.firstChild
Dim fcivElement Set fcivElement = masterXmlDom.createElement("FCIV") masterXmlDom.appendChild fcivElement
Dim fPath, fileEntryElement, nameElement, hashtypeElement For Each fPath In fileStrings fPath = FixFileSystemRedirectionForPath(fPath)
Set fileEntryElement = masterXmlDom.createElement("FILE_ENTRY") fcivElement.appendChild fileEntryElement
Set nameElement = masterXmlDom.createElement("name") nameElement.text = fPath fileEntryElement.appendChild nameElement
Set hashtypeElement = masterXmlDom.createElement(UCase(strHashType)) fileEntryElement.appendChild hashtypeElement Next 'WScript.Echo "Current XML: " & masterXmlDom.xml masterXmlDom.save(inputFileName)
End Function 'CreateXmlInputFileByHashType
Function AddHashToHashesDictFromMD5Output(inputFileName,ByRef dictFilesToHash,strHashType) ' takes a dictionary of files to hash, adds their hash to the file. Carefully consdier ' whether the path is fixed for file system redirection
Dim objShell, objExec, bErr Dim strLine,arrLine,strErrFile,intHashLength,strHasherPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
' Ensure file exists If Not objFSO.FileExists(inputFileName) Then WScript.Echo "Error: XML input file not written" 'Cleanup and exit Set objShell = Nothing Set objFSO = Nothing Exit Function End If
' Ensure utility exists strHasherPath = GetTaniumDir("Tools\IR") & "fciv.exe" If Not objFSO.FileExists(strHasherPath) Then WScript.Echo "Error: Could not locate hash utility, ensure machine has Tanium IR tools" 'Cleanup and exit Set objShell = Nothing Set objFSO = Nothing Exit Function End If
strHashType = LCase(strHashType) ' must be md5 or sha1 Select Case strHashType Case "md5" intHashLength = 32 Case "sha1" intHashLength = 40 Case Else WScript.Echo "Invalid hash type: " &strHashType&", quitting" WScript.Quit End Select
Set objExec = objShell.Exec(Chr(34)&strHasherPath&Chr(34)& " -v -"&strHashType&" -xml " & Chr(34)&inputFileName&Chr(34)) ' examine output Dim fName, fHex While objExec.StdOut.AtEndOfStream <> True strLine = LCase(Trim(objExec.StdOut.ReadLine))
If Len(strLine) > 2 Then strLine = Left(strLine, Len(strLine)-2) 'adjust for 2 invisible characters at end of line
'Start processesing on lines that are file names 'This is based on the second character being a :, such as C: or D: If Mid(strLine,2,1) = ":" Then fName = strLine objExec.StdOut.SkipLine strLine = LCase(Trim(objExec.StdOut.ReadLine)) If Len(strLine) > 0 Then strLine = Left(strLine, Len(strLine)-1) 'adjust for 1 invisible character at end of line fHex = Right(strLine,intHashLength) If dictFilesToHash.Exists(fName) Then dictFilesToHash.Item(fName) = fHex ' WScript.Echo fName&strSep&fHex End If End If Wend
strErrFile = GetTaniumDir("Tools\IR") & "fciv.err" If objFSO.FileExists(strErrFile) Then objFSO.DeleteFile strErrFile, True End If End Function 'AddHashToHashesDictFromMD5Output
Function GetTaniumDir(strSubDir) 'GetTaniumDir with GeneratePath, works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 End If
If Not strPath = "" Then If strSubDir <> "" Then strSubDir = "\" & strSubDir End If
Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject") If fso.FolderExists(strPath) Then If Not fso.FolderExists(strPath & strSubDir) Then ''Need to loop through strSubDir and create all sub directories GeneratePath strPath & strSubDir, fso End If GetTaniumDir = strPath & strSubDir & "\" Else ' Specified Path doesn't exist on the filesystem WScript.Echo "Error: " & strPath & " does not exist on the filesystem" GetTaniumDir = False End If Else WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot find Tanium Client path in Registry" GetTaniumDir = False End If End Function 'GetTaniumDir
Function GeneratePath(pFolderPath, fso) GeneratePath = False
If Not fso.FolderExists(pFolderPath) Then If GeneratePath(fso.GetParentFolderName(pFolderPath), fso) Then GeneratePath = True Call fso.CreateFolder(pFolderPath) End If Else GeneratePath = True End If End Function 'GeneratePath

sensor.name: Number of Application Crashes in Last X Days[5]
sensor.parameter_definition: {"parameters":[{"stepSize":1,"maximum":365,"helpString":"Enter the number of days to query for Application Crashes","snapInterval":1,"minimum":1,"defaultValue":"5","value":"5","label":"Number of Days","key":"days","parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::NumericParameter","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::NumericParameter"}],"parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray"}

query.script:
'======================================== ' Number of Application Crashes in Last X Days '========================================
Option Explicit Dim strSep Dim objWMIService, colEvents, objEvent Dim dtmStart
strSep = "|"
'Uses date math - set locale
SetLocale(1033)
dtmStart = GetTimeWrittenByDaysOld(5)
Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:" _ & "{impersonationLevel=impersonate,authenticationLevel=Pkt,(Security)}!\\.\root\cimv2")
Set colEvents = objWMIService.ExecQuery _ ("SELECT * FROM Win32_NTLogEvent WHERE Message like 'Faulting application %' AND Logfile = 'Application' AND " _ & "TimeWritten >= '" & dtmStart & "' AND " _ & "(EventCode = '1000')")
Dim numCrashes numCrashes = 0
For Each objEvent In colEvents Dim strMessage, arrLines, strLine, strApp, strModule, strTime
strMessage = objEvent.Message arrLines = Split(strMessage, vbCrLf)
Dim strIndex, strIndexXp
'just go through first line of log to grab app name strLine = arrLines(0)
'strIndex is for new OSes, strIndexXP for older... strIndex = "Faulting application name: " strIndexXp = "Faulting application " If Left(strLine, Len(strIndex)) = strIndex Then strApp = Mid(strLine, Len(strIndex) + 1, InStr(strLine, ",") - Len(strIndex) - 1) ElseIf Left(strLine, Len(strIndexXp)) = strIndexXp Then strApp = Mid(strLine, Len(strIndexXp) + 1, InStr(strLine, ",") - Len(strIndexXp) - 1) End If
strTime = DatetimeToDate(objEvent.TimeWritten)
If Not IsNull(strApp) And Not IsEmpty(strApp) Then numCrashes = numCrashes + 1 End If Next
WScript.Echo numCrashes
Function DatetimeToDate(strDate) DatetimeToDate = _ CDate(Mid(strDate, 5, 2) & _ "/" & _ Mid(strDate, 7, 2) & _ "/" & _ Left(strDate, 4) & _ " " & _ Mid (strDate, 9, 2) & _ ":" & _ Mid(strDate, 11, 2) & _ ":" & _ Mid(strDate, 13, 2)) End Function
Function GetTimeWrittenByDaysOld(days) 'subtract "days" days worth of seconds
Dim epoc, monthAgo epoc = date2epoch(Now()) - days*24*60*60 monthAgo = epoch2date(epoc)
Dim dateTime Set dateTime = CreateObject("WbemScripting.SWbemDateTime") dateTime.SetVarDate monthAgo, True
GetTimeWrittenByDaysOld = dateTime End Function
function date2epoch(myDate) date2epoch = DateDiff("s", "01/01/1970 00:00:00", myDate) end Function
function epoch2date(myEpoch) epoch2date = DateAdd("s", myEpoch, "01/01/1970 00:00:00") end Function

sensor.name: Linux:tempsensor_1
sensor.parameter_definition: {"parameters":[{"stepSize":1,"maximum":365,"helpString":"Enter the number of days to query for Application Crashes","snapInterval":1,"minimum":1,"defaultValue":"5","value":"5","label":"Number of Days","key":"days","parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::NumericParameter","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::NumericParameter"}],"parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray"}

sensor.name: Application Crashes in Last X Days[5]
sensor.parameter_definition: {"parameters":[{"stepSize":1,"maximum":365,"helpString":"Enter the number of days to query for Application Crashes","snapInterval":1,"minimum":1,"defaultValue":"5","value":"5","label":"Number of Days","key":"days","parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::NumericParameter","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::NumericParameter"}],"parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray"}

query.script:
'======================================== ' Application Crashes in Last X Days '======================================== '@INCLUDE=utils/SensorRandomization/SensorRandomizationFunctions.vbs Option Explicit Dim strSep Dim objWMIService, colEvents, objEvent, intCount Dim dtmStart
strSep = "|" intCount = 0
'Uses date math - set locale
SetLocale(1033)
dtmStart = GetTimeWrittenByDaysOld(5) 'dtmStart = GetTimeWrittenByDaysOld(7)
Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:" _ & "{impersonationLevel=impersonate,authenticationLevel=Pkt,(Security)}!\\.\root\cimv2")
Set colEvents = objWMIService.ExecQuery _ ("SELECT * FROM Win32_NTLogEvent WHERE Message like 'Faulting application %' AND Logfile = 'Application' AND " _ & "TimeWritten >= '" & dtmStart & "' AND " _ & "(EventCode = '1000')")
For Each objEvent In colEvents Dim strMessage, arrLines, strLine, strApp, strModule, strTime
strMessage = objEvent.Message arrLines = Split(strMessage, vbCrLf)
Dim strIndex, strIndexXp
'just go through first line of log to grab app name strLine = arrLines(0)
'strIndex is for new OSes, strIndexXP for older... strIndex = "Faulting application name: " strIndexXp = "Faulting application " If Left(strLine, Len(strIndex)) = strIndex Then strApp = Mid(strLine, Len(strIndex) + 1, InStr(strLine, ",") - Len(strIndex) - 1) ElseIf Left(strLine, Len(strIndexXp)) = strIndexXp Then strApp = Mid(strLine, Len(strIndexXp) + 1, InStr(strLine, ",") - Len(strIndexXp) - 1) End If
strTime = DatetimeToDate(objEvent.TimeWritten)
Dim strDate, arrTemp arrTemp = Split(strTime) strDate = arrTemp(0) WScript.Echo strApp & strSep & strDate intCount = intCount + 1 Next
If intCount = 0 Then WScript.Echo "No Application Crashes Found" & strSep End if
Function DatetimeToDate(strDate) DatetimeToDate = _ CDate(Mid(strDate, 5, 2) & _ "/" & _ Mid(strDate, 7, 2) & _ "/" & _ Left(strDate, 4) & _ " " & _ Mid (strDate, 9, 2) & _ ":" & _ Mid(strDate, 11, 2) & _ ":" & _ Mid(strDate, 13, 2)) End Function
Function GetTimeWrittenByDaysOld(days) 'subtract "days" days worth of seconds
Dim epoc, monthAgo epoc = date2epoch(Now()) - days*24*60*60 monthAgo = epoch2date(epoc)
Dim dateTime Set dateTime = CreateObject("WbemScripting.SWbemDateTime") dateTime.SetVarDate monthAgo, True
GetTimeWrittenByDaysOld = dateTime End Function
function date2epoch(myDate) date2epoch = DateDiff("s", "01/01/1970 00:00:00", myDate) end Function
function epoch2date(myEpoch) epoch2date = DateAdd("s", myEpoch, "01/01/1970 00:00:00") end Function '------------ INCLUDES after this line. Do not edit past this point ----- '- Begin file: utils/SensorRandomization/SensorRandomizationFunctions.vbs '' -- Begin Random Sleep Functions -- ''
Dim bSensorRandomizeDebugOutput : bSensorRandomizeDebugOutput = False
Function SensorRandomizeLow() Dim intSensorRandomizeWaitLow : intSensorRandomizeWaitLow = 10 SensorRandomizeRandomSleep(intSensorRandomizeWaitLow) End Function ' SensorRandomizeLow
Function SensorRandomize() Dim intSensorRandomizeWaitMed : intSensorRandomizeWaitMed = 20 SensorRandomizeRandomSleep(intSensorRandomizeWaitMed) End Function ' SensorRandomize
Function SensorRandomizeHigh() Dim intSensorRandomizeWaitHigh : intSensorRandomizeWaitHigh = 30 SensorRandomizeRandomSleep(intSensorRandomizeWaitHigh) End Function ' SensorRandomize
Function SensorRandomizeRandomSleep(intSleepTime) ' sleeps for a random period of time, intSleepTime is in seconds ' if the sensor randomize flag is on ' RandomizeScalingFactor is a multiplier on the values hardcoded in the sensor ' not typically set but can adjust timings per endpoint, optionally Dim intSensorRandomizeWaitTime Dim objShell,intRandomizeFlag,strRandomizeRegPath,intRandomizeScalingPercentage strRandomizeRegPath = SensorRandomizeGetTaniumRegistryPath&"\Sensor Data\Random Sleep"
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell") On Error Resume Next intRandomizeFlag = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&strRandomizeRegPath&"\SensorRandomizeFlag") intRandomizeScalingPercentage = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&strRandomizeRegPath&"\SensorRandomizeScalingPercentage") On Error Goto 0 If intRandomizeFlag > 0 Then If intRandomizeScalingPercentage > 0 Then intSleepTime = intRandomizeScalingPercentage * .01 * intSleepTime SensorRandomizeEcho "Randomize scaling percentage of " _ & intRandomizeScalingPercentage & " applied, new sleep time is " & intSleepTime End If intSensorRandomizeWaitTime = CLng(intSleepTime) * 1000 ' convert to milliseconds ' wait random interval between 0 and the max Randomize(SensorRandomizeTaniumRandomSeed) ' assign random value to wait time max value intSensorRandomizeWaitTime = Int( ( intSensorRandomizeWaitTime + 1 ) * Rnd ) SensorRandomizeEcho "Sleeping for " & intSensorRandomizeWaitTime & " milliseconds" WScript.Sleep(intSensorRandomizeWaitTime) SensorRandomizeEcho "Done sleeping, continuing ..." Else SensorRandomizeEcho "SensorRandomize Not Enabled - No Op" End If End Function 'SensorRandomizeRandomSleep
Function SensorRandomizeTaniumRandomSeed ' for randomizing sensor code, the default seed is not random enough Dim timerNum timerNum = Timer() If timerNum < 1 Then SensorRandomizeTaniumRandomSeed = (SensorRandomizeGetTaniumComputerID / Timer() * 10 ) Else SensorRandomizeTaniumRandomSeed = SensorRandomizeGetTaniumComputerID / Timer End If End Function 'SensorRandomizeTaniumRandomSeed
Function SensorRandomizeGetTaniumRegistryPath 'SensorRandomizeGetTaniumRegistryPath works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath, strFoundTaniumRegistryPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 strFoundTaniumRegistryPath = keyNativePath
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 strFoundTaniumRegistryPath = keyWoWPath End If
If Not strPath = "" Then SensorRandomizeGetTaniumRegistryPath = strFoundTaniumRegistryPath Else SensorRandomizeGetTaniumRegistryPath = False WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot locate Tanium Registry Path" End If End Function 'SensorRandomizeGetTaniumRegistryPath
Function SensorRandomizeGetTaniumComputerID '' This function gets the Tanium Computer ID Dim objShell Dim intClientID,strID,strKeyPath,strValueName
strKeyPath = SensorRandomizeGetTaniumRegistryPath strValueName = "ComputerID" Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell") On Error Resume Next intClientID = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&strKeyPath&"\"&strValueName) If Err.Number <> 0 Then SensorRandomizeGetTaniumComputerID = 0 Else SensorRandomizeGetTaniumComputerID = SensorRandomizeReinterpretSignedAsUnsigned(intClientID) End If On Error Goto 0 End Function 'SensorRandomizeGetTaniumComputerID
Function SensorRandomizeReinterpretSignedAsUnsigned(ByVal x) If x < 0 Then x = x + 2^32 SensorRandomizeReinterpretSignedAsUnsigned = x End Function 'SensorRandomizeReinterpretSignedAsUnsigned
Sub SensorRandomizeEcho(str) If bSensorRandomizeDebugOutput = true Then WScript.Echo str End Sub 'SensorRandomizeEcho ' -- End Random Sleep Functions --' '- End file: utils/SensorRandomization/SensorRandomizationFunctions.vbs

sensor.name: Linux:tempsensor_3
sensor.parameter_definition: {"parameters":[{"stepSize":1,"maximum":365,"helpString":"Enter the number of days to query for Application Crashes","snapInterval":1,"minimum":1,"defaultValue":"5","value":"5","label":"Number of Days","key":"days","parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::NumericParameter","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::NumericParameter"}],"parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray"}

sensor.name: Last System Crash in X Days[7]
sensor.parameter_definition: {"parameters":[{"stepSize":1,"maximum":365,"helpString":"Enter the number of days to query and return system crashes","snapInterval":1,"minimum":1,"defaultValue":"5","value":"5","label":"Number of Days","key":"dayThresh","parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::NumericParameter","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::NumericParameter"}],"parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray"}

query.script:
'======================================== ' Last System Crash in X Days '========================================
dayThresh = LCase(Trim(Unescape("7"))) 'dayThresh = LCase(Trim(Unescape("1"))) If Not IsNumeric(dayThresh) Then WScript.Echo "Parameter Not Number" WScript.Quit End If dayThresh = Cint(dayThresh)
Dim strValueName, strKey
strValueName = "DumpFile" strDumpsDirName = "MinidumpDir"
strKey = "SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\CrashControl"
Set objReg=GetObject("winmgmts:{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\.\root\default:StdRegProv") Const HKLM = &h80000002
'Uses date math - set locale
SetLocale(GetTaniumLocale)
Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject")
'Get main dump file Dim mainDumpDate If RegKeyExists(objReg, HKLM, strKey) Then objReg.GetExpandedStringValue HKLM, strKey, strValueName, strValue
If fso.FileExists(strValue) Then
Set objFile = fso.GetFile(strValue) mainDumpDate = objfile.DateLastModified End If Else WScript.Echo "Error, Dump key not found: HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\CrashControl" End If
'Examine minidump folder Dim newestMini
If RegKeyExists(objReg, HKLM, strKey) Then objReg.GetExpandedStringValue HKLM, strKey, strDumpsDirName, strDumpDir
If fso.FolderExists(strDumpDir) Then Set oFolder = fso.GetFolder(strDumpDir) For Each sFile In oFolder.Files If newestMini = "" Then Set newestMini = sFile Else If newestMini.DateLastModified < sFile.DateLastModified Then Set newestMini = sFile End If End If Next End If End If
If newestMini = "" And mainDumpDate = "" Then WScript.Echo "No system crashes found" WScript.Quit End If
Dim responseDate If newestMini = "" Then responseDate = mainDumpDate ElseIf mainDumpDate = "" Then responseDate = newestMini.DateLastModified Else If newestMini.DateLastModified < mainDumpDate Then responseDate = mainDumpDate Else responseDate = newestMini.DateLastModified End If End If
current = Now() dayDiff = DateDiff("d", responseDate, current)
Dim arrTemp If dayDiff <= dayThresh Then arrTemp = Split(responseDate) responseDate = arrTemp(0)
WScript.Echo responseDate Else WScript.Echo "No system crashes in day range" End If
Function RegKeyExists(objRegistry, sHive, sRegKey) Dim aValueNames, aValueTypes If objRegistry.EnumValues(sHive, sRegKey, aValueNames, aValueTypes) = 0 Then RegKeyExists = True Else RegKeyExists = False End If End Function
Function GetTaniumLocale '' This function will retrieve the locale value ' previously set which governs Tanium content that ' is locale sensitive.
Dim objWshShell Dim intLocaleID
Set objWshShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell") On Error Resume Next intLocaleID = objWshShell.RegRead("HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client\LocaleID") If Err.Number <> 0 Then intLocaleID = objWshShell.RegRead("HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client\LocaleID") End If On Error Goto 0 If intLocaleID = "" Then GetTaniumLocale = 1033 ' default to us/English Else GetTaniumLocale = intLocaleID End If
' Cleanup Set objWshShell = Nothing
End Function 'GetTaniumLocale

sensor.name: Linux:tempsensor_5
sensor.parameter_definition: {"parameters":[{"stepSize":1,"maximum":365,"helpString":"Enter the number of days to query and return system crashes","snapInterval":1,"minimum":1,"defaultValue":"5","value":"5","label":"Number of Days","key":"dayThresh","parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::NumericParameter","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::NumericParameter"}],"parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray"}

sensor.name: High Memory Processes[5]
sensor.parameter_definition: {"parameters":[{"stepSize":1,"maximum":50,"helpString":"Enter the number of processes to return","snapInterval":1,"minimum":1,"defaultValue":"5","value":"5","label":"Number of Processes","key":"numOutput","parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::NumericParameter","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::NumericParameter"}],"parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray"}

query.script:
'======================================== ' High Memory Processes '========================================
topNum = Trim(Unescape("5")) If Not IsNumeric(topNum) Then WScript.Echo "Parameter Not Number" WScript.Quit End If topNum = Cint(topNum)
printMemory = false
Dim objWMIService, objItem, colItems, query Dim strComputer, strList
strComputer = "." Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\" & strComputer& "\root\cimv2")
Const MaxCharacters = 255 Const adBSTR = 8 Const adDouble = 5 Set DataList = CreateObject("ADOR.Recordset") DataList.Fields.Append "ProcessName", adBSTR, MaxCharacters DataList.Fields.Append "ProcessMemory", adDouble
DataList.Open
Set colProcs = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select Name, WorkingSetSize From Win32_Process") For Each proc in colProcs DataList.AddNew DataList("ProcessName") = proc.Name DataList("ProcessMemory") = round(cdbl(proc.WorkingSetSize)/1024/1024, 0) DataList.Update Next DataList.Sort = "ProcessMemory DESC" DataList.MoveFirst i = 1 Do Until DataList.EOF Or i > topNum Set field = DataList.Fields strPrint = CleanString(DataList.Fields.Item("ProcessName")) If printMemory Then strPrint = strPrint & " (" & DataList.Fields.Item("ProcessMemory") & " Mb)" End if WScript.Echo strPrint DataList.MoveNext i = i + 1 Loop
WScript.Quit
'removes .exe and process number at end of process Function CleanString(str) words = Split(str, "#") str = words(0)
If Right(str, 4) = ".exe" Then str = Left(str, Len(str) - 4) End If CleanString = str End Function

sensor.name: Linux:tempsensor_7
sensor.parameter_definition: {"parameters":[{"stepSize":1,"maximum":50,"helpString":"Enter the number of processes to return","snapInterval":1,"minimum":1,"defaultValue":"5","value":"5","label":"Number of Processes","key":"numOutput","parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::NumericParameter","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::NumericParameter"}],"parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray"}

sensor.name: High CPU Processes[5]
sensor.parameter_definition: {"parameters":[{"stepSize":1,"maximum":50,"helpString":"Enter the number of processes to return","snapInterval":1,"minimum":1,"defaultValue":"5","value":"5","label":"Number of Processes","key":"numOutput","parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::NumericParameter","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::NumericParameter"}],"parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray"}

query.script:
'======================================== ' High CPU Processes '========================================
topNum = Trim(Unescape("5")) If Not IsNumeric(topNum) Then WScript.Echo "Parameter Not Number" WScript.Quit End If topNum = Cint(topNum)
printPercent = false Const HKLM = &H80000002 strComputer = "."
Set objWMIService = GetObject("Winmgmts:{impersonationlevel=impersonate}!\Root\Cimv2")
Const MaxCharacters = 255 Const adBSTR = 8 Const adDouble = 5
Set DataList = CreateObject("ADOR.Recordset") DataList.Fields.Append "ProcessName", adBSTR, MaxCharacters DataList.Fields.Append "ProcessCPU1", adDouble DataList.Fields.Append "ProcessCPU2", adDouble DataList.Fields.Append "ProcessCPUDiff", adDouble DataList.Open
Dim total1, total2, totalDiff
Set colProcItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select * from Win32_PerfRawData_PerfProc_Process") For Each objItem in colProcItems If objItem.Name <> "Idle" And objItem.Name <> "_Total" Then DataList.AddNew DataList("ProcessName") = objItem.Name DataList("ProcessCPU1") = objItem.PercentProcessorTime DataList.Update ElseIf objItem.Name = "_Total" Then total1 = CDbl(objItem.PercentProcessorTime) End If Next
sleep = 5 WScript.Sleep(sleep * 1000)
Set colProcItems = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select * from Win32_PerfRawData_PerfProc_Process") For Each objItem in colProcItems If objItem.Name <> "Idle" And objItem.Name <> "_Total" Then
DataList.MoveFirst DataList.Find("ProcessName = '"& objItem.Name&"'")
If DataList.EOF Then WScript.Echo "** Not Found **" Else DataList("ProcessCPU2") = objItem.PercentProcessorTime DataList("ProcessCPUDiff") = DataList("ProcessCPU2") - DataList("ProcessCPU1") DataList.Update 'WScript.Echo "name: " & DataList.Fields.Item("ProcessName") & ", cpu 1: " & DataList.Fields.Item("ProcessCPU1") & ", cpu 2: " & DataList.Fields.Item("ProcessCPU2") End if ElseIf objItem.Name = "_Total" Then total2 = CDbl(objItem.PercentProcessorTime) totalDiff = total2 - total1 End If Next
DataList.Sort = "ProcessCPUDiff DESC" DataList.MoveFirst i = 1 Do Until DataList.EOF Or i > topNum strPrint = CleanString(DataList.Fields.Item("ProcessName")) If printPercent Then strPrint = strPrint & " (" & Round(DataList.Fields.Item("ProcessCPUDiff") / totalDiff * 100, 0) & "%)" End if WScript.Echo strPrint DataList.MoveNext i = i + 1 Loop
WScript.Quit
'removes .exe and process number at end of Function CleanString(str) words = Split(str, "#") str = words(0) CleanString = str
If Right(str, 4) = ".exe" Then str = Left(str, Len(str) - 4) End If End Function

sensor.parameter_definition: {"parameters":[{"stepSize":1,"maximum":50,"helpString":"Enter the number of processes to return","snapInterval":1,"minimum":1,"defaultValue":"5","value":"5","label":"Number of Processes","key":"numOutput","parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::NumericParameter","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::NumericParameter"}],"parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray"}

sensor.name: Patch Failures[Yes]
sensor.parameter_definition: {"parameters":[{"values":["Yes","No"],"helpString":"Enter Yes, or No, to return failures for applicable patches only","requireSelection":true,"promptText":"Yes/No","defaultValue":"","value":"","label":"Show failures only for needed patches","key":"ShowOnlyIfApplicable","parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::DropDownParameter","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::DropDownParameter"}],"parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray"}

query.script:
'======================================== ' Patch Failures '========================================
' sensor: patch failures ' paramterized sensor which can show failures for all patches ' or only for patches which are failed but necessary
Option Explicit
Const FORREADING = 1
Dim objFSO,objTextFile Dim dictHistory Dim strScanDir Dim strHistoryTextReadableFilePath Dim strSep : strSep = "|" Dim strLine,arrLine,strGUID,strCVE Dim strTitle,strKB,strBulletin,strDate,strException,strSeverity Dim dictResults,bShowOnlyIfApplicable,strShowOnlyIfApplicable Dim strResultsReadableFilePath,strInstallStatus,strTaniumPatchID
' take parameter strShowOnlyIfApplicable=Trim(Unescape("Yes"))
Select Case LCase(strShowOnlyIfApplicable) Case "yes" bShowOnlyIfApplicable = True Case "true" bShowOnlyIfApplicable = True Case "no" bShowOnlyIfApplicable = False Case "false" bShowOnlyIfApplicable = False Case "" bShowOnlyIfApplicable = True Case Else WScript.Echo "Parameter must be Yes or No, Quitting" WScript.Quit End Select
Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject") strScanDir = GetTaniumDir("Tools\Scans")
strHistoryTextReadableFilePath = strScanDir&"patchhistoryreadable.txt" strResultsReadableFilePath = strScanDir&"patchresultsreadable.txt"
If Not objFSO.FileExists(strHistoryTextReadableFilePath) Then WScript.Echo "Cannot find History file" Set objFSO = Nothing WScript.Quit End If
'uses date math, may need locale set SetLocale(GetTaniumLocale)
Set dictHistory = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary")
' read History into dictionary Set objTextFile = objFSO.OpenTextFile(strHistoryTextReadableFilePath,FORREADING) While objTextFile.AtEndOfStream = False strLine = objTextFile.ReadLine arrLine = Split(strLine,strSep) If IsArray(arrLine) Then If UBound(arrLine) > 0 Then If Not dictHistory.Exists(strLine) Then dictHistory.Add strLine,1 End If Else ' WScript.Echo "Error parsing results file" End If Else ' WScript.Echo "Error parsing results file" End If Wend objTextFile.Close
Set dictResults = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary") If bShowOnlyIfApplicable Then ' We will tie the GUID in history to the GUID here - if it exists in patch results and if it says ' not installed, only then will we write it ' Read results into dictionary Set objTextFile = objFSO.OpenTextFile(strResultsReadableFilePath,FORREADING) While objTextFile.AtEndOfStream = False strLine = objTextFile.ReadLine ' WScript.Echo strLIne 'element 5 must be not installed arrLine = Split(strLine,strSep) If IsArray(arrLine) Then If UBound(arrLine) > 0 Then ' pull GUID to use as key strGUID = arrLine(7) If Not (UBound(arrLine) > 4 And dictResults.Exists(strGUID)) Then dictResults.Add strGUID,strLine End If Else ' WScript.Echo "Error parsing results file" End If Else ' WScript.Echo "Error parsing results file" End If Wend objTextFile.Close End If
Dim strkey
For Each strkey In dictHistory.Keys ' WScript.Echo dictHistory.Item(strkey) strLine = strkey ' 13 History Columns ' GUID|Operation|Result|Exception|Install Date|Publish Date|Title|FirstNeededDate|Severity|MS ID|KB|CVE ID|Size|PatchID arrLine = Split(strLine,strSep) If IsArray(arrLine) Then If UBound(arrLine) > 11 Then If LCase(arrLine(1)) = "installation" And LCase(arrLine(2)) = "failed" Then ' install failure ' report title, kb, bulletin, date, and exception strGUID = arrLine(0) strTitle=arrLine(6) strKB=arrLine(10) strBulletin=arrLine(9) strCVE = arrLine(11) On Error Resume Next ' Convert from UTC to Local and show only the date strDate = FormatDateTime(DateAdd("n",GetTZBias,CDate(arrLine(4))),vbShortDate) If Err.Number <> 0 Then strDate = "Unknown" Err.Clear End If On Error Goto 0 strException=arrLine(3) strSeverity=arrLine(8) If UBound(arrLine) > 12 Then strTaniumPatchID=arrLine(13) Else strTaniumPatchID="Unknown" End If If bShowOnlyIfApplicable Then If dictResults.Exists(strGUID) Then strInstallStatus = Split(dictResults.Item(strGUID),"|")(6) If LCase(strInstallStatus) = "not installed" Then WScript.Echo strTitle&strSep&strException&strSep&strDate _ &strSep&strKB&strSep&strBulletin&strSep&strSeverity&strSep&strCVE _ &strSep&strTaniumPatchID End If End If Else WScript.Echo strTitle&strSep&strException&strSep&strDate _ &strSep&strKB&strSep&strBulletin&strSep&strSeverity&strSep&strCVE _ &strSep&strTaniumPatchID End If End If Else ' WScript.Echo "History Line malformed - needs 11 fields" End If Else 'WScript.Echo "History Line Malformed" ' not pipe splittable End If Next
Function GetTaniumDir(strSubDir) 'GetTaniumDir with GeneratePath, works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 End If
If Not strPath = "" Then If strSubDir <> "" Then strSubDir = "\" & strSubDir End If
Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject") If fso.FolderExists(strPath) Then If Not fso.FolderExists(strPath & strSubDir) Then ''Need to loop through strSubDir and create all sub directories GeneratePath strPath & strSubDir, fso End If GetTaniumDir = strPath & strSubDir & "\" Else ' Specified Path doesn't exist on the filesystem WScript.Echo "Error: " & strPath & " does not exist on the filesystem" GetTaniumDir = False End If Else WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot find Tanium Client path in Registry" GetTaniumDir = False End If End Function 'GetTaniumDir
Function GeneratePath(pFolderPath, fso) GeneratePath = False
If Not fso.FolderExists(pFolderPath) Then If GeneratePath(fso.GetParentFolderName(pFolderPath), fso) Then GeneratePath = True Call fso.CreateFolder(pFolderPath) End If Else GeneratePath = True End If End Function 'GeneratePath
Function GetTaniumLocale '' This function will retrieve the locale value ' previously set which governs Tanium content that ' is locale sensitive.
Dim objWshShell Dim intLocaleID
Set objWshShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell") On Error Resume Next intLocaleID = objWshShell.RegRead("HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client\LocaleID") If Err.Number <> 0 Then intLocaleID = objWshShell.RegRead("HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client\LocaleID") End If On Error Goto 0 If intLocaleID = "" Then GetTaniumLocale = 1033 ' default to us/English Else GetTaniumLocale = intLocaleID End If
' Cleanup Set objWshShell = Nothing
End Function 'GetTaniumLocale
Function GetTZBias ' This functiong returns the number of minutes ' (positive or negative) to add to current time to get UTC ' considers daylight savings
Dim objLocalTimeZone, intTZBiasInMinutes
For Each objLocalTimeZone in GetObject("winmgmts:").InstancesOf("Win32_ComputerSystem") intTZBiasInMinutes = objLocalTimeZone.CurrentTimeZone Next
GetTZBias = intTZBiasInMinutes
End Function 'GetTZBias

' take parameter strShowOnlyIfApplicable=Trim(Unescape("Yes"))
Select Case LCase(strShowOnlyIfApplicable) Case "yes" bShowOnlyIfApplicable = True Case "true" bShowOnlyIfApplicable = True Case "no" bShowOnlyIfApplicable = False Case "false" bShowOnlyIfApplicable = False Case "" bShowOnlyIfApplicable = True Case Else WScript.Echo "Parameter must be Yes or No, Quitting" WScript.Quit End Select
Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject") strScanDir = GetTaniumDir("Tools\Scans")
strHistoryTextReadableFilePath = strScanDir&"patchhistoryreadable.txt" strResultsReadableFilePath = strScanDir&"patchresultsreadable.txt"
If Not objFSO.FileExists(strHistoryTextReadableFilePath) Then WScript.Echo "Cannot find History file" Set objFSO = Nothing WScript.Quit End If
'uses date math, may need locale set SetLocale(GetTaniumLocale)
Set dictHistory = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary")
' read History into dictionary Set objTextFile = objFSO.OpenTextFile(strHistoryTextReadableFilePath,FORREADING) While objTextFile.AtEndOfStream = False strLine = objTextFile.ReadLine arrLine = Split(strLine,strSep) If IsArray(arrLine) Then If UBound(arrLine) > 0 Then If Not dictHistory.Exists(strLine) Then dictHistory.Add strLine,1 End If Else ' WScript.Echo "Error parsing results file" End If Else ' WScript.Echo "Error parsing results file" End If Wend objTextFile.Close
Set dictResults = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary") If bShowOnlyIfApplicable Then ' We will tie the GUID in history to the GUID here - if it exists in patch results and if it says ' not installed, only then will we write it ' Read results into dictionary Set objTextFile = objFSO.OpenTextFile(strResultsReadableFilePath,FORREADING) While objTextFile.AtEndOfStream = False strLine = objTextFile.ReadLine ' WScript.Echo strLIne 'element 5 must be not installed arrLine = Split(strLine,strSep) If IsArray(arrLine) Then If UBound(arrLine) > 0 Then ' pull GUID to use as key strGUID = arrLine(7) If Not (UBound(arrLine) > 4 And dictResults.Exists(strGUID)) Then dictResults.Add strGUID,strLine End If Else ' WScript.Echo "Error parsing results file" End If Else ' WScript.Echo "Error parsing results file" End If Wend objTextFile.Close End If
Dim strkey
For Each strkey In dictHistory.Keys ' WScript.Echo dictHistory.Item(strkey) strLine = strkey ' 13 History Columns ' GUID|Operation|Result|Exception|Install Date|Publish Date|Title|FirstNeededDate|Severity|MS ID|KB|CVE ID|Size|PatchID arrLine = Split(strLine,strSep) If IsArray(arrLine) Then If UBound(arrLine) > 11 Then If LCase(arrLine(1)) = "installation" And LCase(arrLine(2)) = "failed" Then ' install failure ' report title, kb, bulletin, date, and exception strGUID = arrLine(0) strTitle=arrLine(6) strKB=arrLine(10) strBulletin=arrLine(9) strCVE = arrLine(11) On Error Resume Next ' Convert from UTC to Local and show only the date strDate = FormatDateTime(DateAdd("n",GetTZBias,CDate(arrLine(4))),vbShortDate) If Err.Number <> 0 Then strDate = "Unknown" Err.Clear End If On Error Goto 0 strException=arrLine(3) strSeverity=arrLine(8) If UBound(arrLine) > 12 Then strTaniumPatchID=arrLine(13) Else strTaniumPatchID="Unknown" End If If bShowOnlyIfApplicable Then If dictResults.Exists(strGUID) Then strInstallStatus = Split(dictResults.Item(strGUID),"|")(6) If LCase(strInstallStatus) = "not installed" Then WScript.Echo strTitle&strSep&strException&strSep&strDate _ &strSep&strKB&strSep&strBulletin&strSep&strSeverity&strSep&strCVE _ &strSep&strTaniumPatchID End If End If Else WScript.Echo strTitle&strSep&strException&strSep&strDate _ &strSep&strKB&strSep&strBulletin&strSep&strSeverity&strSep&strCVE _ &strSep&strTaniumPatchID End If End If Else ' WScript.Echo "History Line malformed - needs 11 fields" End If Else 'WScript.Echo "History Line Malformed" ' not pipe splittable End If Next
Function GetTaniumDir(strSubDir) 'GetTaniumDir with GeneratePath, works in x64 or x32 'looks for a valid Path value
Dim objShell Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath
Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
keyNativePath = "HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client" keyWoWPath = "HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode) On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyNativePath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0
If strPath = "" Then ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node On Error Resume Next strPath = objShell.RegRead(keyWoWPath&"\Path") On Error Goto 0 End If
If Not strPath = "" Then If strSubDir <> "" Then strSubDir = "\" & strSubDir End If
Dim fso Set fso = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject") If fso.FolderExists(strPath) Then If Not fso.FolderExists(strPath & strSubDir) Then ''Need to loop through strSubDir and create all sub directories GeneratePath strPath & strSubDir, fso End If GetTaniumDir = strPath & strSubDir & "\" Else ' Specified Path doesn't exist on the filesystem WScript.Echo "Error: " & strPath & " does not exist on the filesystem" GetTaniumDir = False End If Else WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot find Tanium Client path in Registry" GetTaniumDir = False End If End Function 'GetTaniumDir
Function GeneratePath(pFolderPath, fso) GeneratePath = False
If Not fso.FolderExists(pFolderPath) Then If GeneratePath(fso.GetParentFolderName(pFolderPath), fso) Then GeneratePath = True Call fso.CreateFolder(pFolderPath) End If Else GeneratePath = True End If End Function 'GeneratePath
Function GetTaniumLocale '' This function will retrieve the locale value ' previously set which governs Tanium content that ' is locale sensitive.
Dim objWshShell Dim intLocaleID
Set objWshShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell") On Error Resume Next intLocaleID = objWshShell.RegRead("HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client\LocaleID") If Err.Number <> 0 Then intLocaleID = objWshShell.RegRead("HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client\LocaleID") End If On Error Goto 0 If intLocaleID = "" Then GetTaniumLocale = 1033 ' default to us/English Else GetTaniumLocale = intLocaleID End If
' Cleanup Set objWshShell = Nothing
End Function 'GetTaniumLocale
Function GetTZBias ' This functiong returns the number of minutes ' (positive or negative) to add to current time to get UTC ' considers daylight savings
Dim objLocalTimeZone, intTZBiasInMinutes
For Each objLocalTimeZone in GetObject("winmgmts:").InstancesOf("Win32_ComputerSystem") intTZBiasInMinutes = objLocalTimeZone.CurrentTimeZone Next
GetTZBias = intTZBiasInMinutes
End Function 'GetTZBias

sensor.name: Linux:tempsensor_13
sensor.parameter_definition: {"parameters":[{"values":["Yes","No"],"helpString":"Enter Yes, or No, to return failures for applicable patches only","requireSelection":true,"promptText":"Yes/No","defaultValue":"","value":"","label":"Show failures only for needed patches","key":"ShowOnlyIfApplicable","parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::DropDownParameter","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::DropDownParameter"}],"parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray"}

sensor.name: Number of Application Crashes in Last X Days[7]
sensor.parameter_definition: {"parameters":[{"stepSize":1,"maximum":365,"helpString":"Enter the number of days to query for Application Crashes","snapInterval":1,"minimum":1,"defaultValue":"5","value":"5","label":"Number of Days","key":"days","parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::NumericParameter","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::NumericParameter"}],"parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray"}

query.script:
'======================================== ' Number of Application Crashes in Last X Days '========================================
Option Explicit Dim strSep Dim objWMIService, colEvents, objEvent Dim dtmStart
strSep = "|"
'Uses date math - set locale
SetLocale(1033)
dtmStart = GetTimeWrittenByDaysOld(7)
Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:" _ & "{impersonationLevel=impersonate,authenticationLevel=Pkt,(Security)}!\\.\root\cimv2")
Set colEvents = objWMIService.ExecQuery _ ("SELECT * FROM Win32_NTLogEvent WHERE Message like 'Faulting application %' AND Logfile = 'Application' AND " _ & "TimeWritten >= '" & dtmStart & "' AND " _ & "(EventCode = '1000')")
Dim numCrashes numCrashes = 0
For Each objEvent In colEvents Dim strMessage, arrLines, strLine, strApp, strModule, strTime
strMessage = objEvent.Message arrLines = Split(strMessage, vbCrLf)
Dim strIndex, strIndexXp
'just go through first line of log to grab app name strLine = arrLines(0)
'strIndex is for new OSes, strIndexXP for older... strIndex = "Faulting application name: " strIndexXp = "Faulting application " If Left(strLine, Len(strIndex)) = strIndex Then strApp = Mid(strLine, Len(strIndex) + 1, InStr(strLine, ",") - Len(strIndex) - 1) ElseIf Left(strLine, Len(strIndexXp)) = strIndexXp Then strApp = Mid(strLine, Len(strIndexXp) + 1, InStr(strLine, ",") - Len(strIndexXp) - 1) End If
strTime = DatetimeToDate(objEvent.TimeWritten)
If Not IsNull(strApp) And Not IsEmpty(strApp) Then numCrashes = numCrashes + 1 End If Next
WScript.Echo numCrashes
Function DatetimeToDate(strDate) DatetimeToDate = _ CDate(Mid(strDate, 5, 2) & _ "/" & _ Mid(strDate, 7, 2) & _ "/" & _ Left(strDate, 4) & _ " " & _ Mid (strDate, 9, 2) & _ ":" & _ Mid(strDate, 11, 2) & _ ":" & _ Mid(strDate, 13, 2)) End Function
Function GetTimeWrittenByDaysOld(days) 'subtract "days" days worth of seconds
Dim epoc, monthAgo epoc = date2epoch(Now()) - days*24*60*60 monthAgo = epoch2date(epoc)
Dim dateTime Set dateTime = CreateObject("WbemScripting.SWbemDateTime") dateTime.SetVarDate monthAgo, True
GetTimeWrittenByDaysOld = dateTime End Function
function date2epoch(myDate) date2epoch = DateDiff("s", "01/01/1970 00:00:00", myDate) end Function
function epoch2date(myEpoch) epoch2date = DateAdd("s", myEpoch, "01/01/1970 00:00:00") end Function
